translation.en: When it is done, it gets pulled over the ears and then Mr. Reinhardt, Mr. Bloc, and Mr. Hellinkx make gloves from it, which are then sent to all gentlemen’s countries.

translation.lb: Betschel nènnnt en och dé Leit, dé no dem Aussproch fun engem herühmte Gymnastiksprofèsser dem Berthold Schwarz am Erfanne fum Polfer kèng Concurrenz gemacht hun.
translation.en: Betschel is also the name given to the people who, according to the statement of a famous gymnastics professor, Berthold Schwarz, made no competition in the invention of gunpowder.

translation.lb: De Jongergesell. (Betrachtongen fun èngem âle Bettendorfer.)
translation.en: The Bachelor. (Reflections from an old man from Bettendorf.)

translation.lb: Ech sin nun haut én âlen Dapp, Dât weise' meng gro Hör um Kapp;
translation.en: I'm now an old fool today, as my gray hair on my head shows;

translation.lb: Siéchzég Jôr sin ech haut âl, An d'get an d'Grâf mat mir nu bâl.
translation.en: I'm sixty years old today, and soon I will go to the grave.

translation.lb: Haut setzen eoh eleng elei, An denken u' meng Dommerei;
translation.en: Today I sit here all alone, and think of my foolishness;

translation.lb: Hètt ech bestûod méch an der Zeit, Da' war ech haut nach net 'so weit,
translation.en: If I had settled down back in the day, I wouldn't be in this position today,

translation.lb: Meng Komeroten allegûoren, Mat hirer Frâ spazéere' fûoren;
translation.en: All my friends went walking with their wives,

translation.lb: Si nènne méch en âle Géck, Si hun eng Frâ, an éch en...
translation.en: They call me an old fool, they have a wife, and I have a...

translation.lb: Eeh hètt wûol dak e' Médche krit, Dir wesst éch war io kémol blid;
translation.en: Once, I could have had a girl, you know I was quite shy then;

translation.lb: Mais kémol, hun ech jo engt fond, Dem éch gerécht hètt d'Hand zum Bond.
translation.en: But once, I found someone to whom I could have pledged my hand.

translation.lb: Dât alleréscht dât ■ éch hât fond, Dât hât kén Zand mé an dem Mond;
translation.en: The very first one I found, she had no teeth in her mouth anymore;

translation.lb: Hètt éch em kâft en neit Gebess, Da' wir et gud gewiéscht, gewess.
translation.en: If I had bought her new dentures, it would surely have been good.

translation.lb: Dât zwét dât war eng empég Popp, Schûod, d'hât kén Hôr mé op der Kopp;
translation.en: The second one was a proud doll, alas, she had no hair left on her head;

translation.lb: Et hètt gebraucht nach eng Parék, Nu jé, éch hât och gûor ke Gléck!
translation.en: She needed a wig, oh well, I really had no luck!

translation.lb: 'So hat. éch iw'ral auszesetzen, Wât séch ganz gut hätt losst ersetzen;
translation.en: Wherever I thought of finding a fit, I found nothing to satisfy;

translation.lb: Duorfir sin éch nun haut elèng, Eng Frâ, dèr krè'n éch sei Liewe kèng.
translation.en: Therefore, I am alone today, a wife I'll never have in my life.

translation.lb: Am Çafé de la Place.
translation.en: At the Café de la Place.

translation.lb: Fir e' pûor Jo'r gdf e' Sous-chef aus ènger fun onsen Administrationen zum Chef ernannt.
translation.en: For a couple of years, a sous-chef from one of our administrations was promoted to chef.

translation.lb: Dûorop natirléch grosse' Gaudium, Boutèlle' Wein, Béer etc., a' wé mei gudden neie' Chef de Krèppgen foll hat, du' gdng et nach an de Café de la Place.
translation.en: Naturally, great joy followed, bottles of wine, beer etc., and as my good new chief filled his belly, he went to Café de la Place.

translation.lb: Hei sötz grâd de Minister, dén dem Här Chef séng Nomination ennerschriwen hât.
translation.en: The Minister, who had signed the chief's nomination, was sitting right there.

translation.lb: Natirléch, den avancéerten Ponctionnär gleich op den Här Minister lass, séch do bei em bedankt, an du en nach no Note' gesét.
translation.en: Naturally, the promoted official immediately approached the Minister, thanked him, and then sent him another note.

translation.lb: Mei gudden Minister lauschtert dem Zodé èng klèng Weilchen no; op émoi muss et em ower dach ze stark si gin, ewèll e stét op:
translation.en: My good Minister listened to the chatter for a little while; but at some point, it must have become too much for him because he stood up:

translation.lb: Dites donc, mon cher Monsieur, sot e' ganz rohéch zum avancéerten Fonctionnär, hier vous étiez Monsieur le sous-chef, aujourd'hui vous êtes Monsieur le Chef Soûl.
translation.en: 'Say then, my dear sir,' he said quite calmly to the promoted official, 'yesterday you were Mr. Sous-chef, today you are Mr. Drunk Chef.'

translation.lb: Zu Veianen om Telephon.
translation.en: In Vianden on the telephone.

translation.lb: de Mathi: Set dir do, Madame?
translation.en: de Mathi: Is that you, Madame?

translation.lb: Madame X.: Jo, wât ass iéch gefällig?
translation.en: Madame X.: Yes, what do you want?

translation.lb: de Mathi: Da laustert.
translation.en: de Mathi: Then listen.

translation.lb: Yuan heit uan bôtzen èch a mein Frâ, eire Mann net mi of, wann hèn an den Dréck fêlt.
translation.en: From today on, my wife and I won't clean up your husband anymore when he falls into the mud.

translation.lb: Dir krètt hén elo aile Kéhr mat dem Dréck hèm gescheckt.
translation.en: You'll now get him back every time with the dirt on him.

translation.lb: Op der Plessdarem.
translation.en: At the Place d'Armes.

translation.lb: Zwén Affekôten stin op der Plessdarem am Diskours, iwerdém kernt den Hèr Joris aus senger Rédaction eraus.
translation.en: Two lawyers stand at the Place d'Armes in conversation, when Mr. Joris comes out from his editorial office.

translation.lb: Den A (zum B): Kuck, do ass dé grosse Mann, dén secli em d'Letzeburger Litteratur esö gross Verdéngster erwürben hûot!
translation.en: A (to B): Look, there is the great man who has acquired such great merits for Luxembourg literature!

translation.lb: De B. (lacht): Ha, ha, ha! Ass dat well en „d'Gewessensbess" geschriven hûot?
translation.en: B (laughs): Ha, ha, ha! Is he the one who wrote 'the voice of conscience'?

translation.lb: Den A: Oh nén, au contraire, t'ass well en obgehâlen hûot mat letzeburger deitsch ze schrei wen.
translation.en: A: Oh no, on the contrary, he was prevented from writing in Luxembourgish German.

translation.lb: Firum Kerngut sénger Monter stét e klèngen Béfchen, an e bewonnert dât schént Assortiment fu' Fûosensgesichter;
translation.en: In the core of his mind, a small shop stands, and he admires the beautiful collection of masks;

translation.lb: am mêschte Spâs fent en un ènger Mask mat èngem stark ausgeprägten semitische Richert.
translation.en: he finds the most amusement in a mask with a strongly pronounced Semitic nose.

translation.lb: Hién sieht séng Dubbelen zesummen an gét an de Butik.
translation.en: He puts his pennies together and enters the shop.

translation.lb: 2öa§ roillft bu Meiner?
translation.en: "What do you want, my dear?"

translation.lb: frét de Prinzipal de Béfchen.
translation.en: asks the head of the shop.

translation.lb: will eine Sacfemaul.
translation.en: wants a shoddy mouth.

translation.lb: 3a welche bu bir bemt ausgewählt?
translation.en: And which one did you choose for yourself?

translation.lb: ëkbt mir als ela baljinnen bas fangige 3ubcngeficht mit ber grofjen
translation.en: Give me the captivating mask with the big nose,

translation.lb: Hién hât dât lèscht Wurt nach net aus dem Monn, du kont hié' schons op der âner Seit der Firma Heinrich hier schén Pneumatiquen bewonneren.
translation.en: He had not yet finished his last word, when he could already admire the beautiful pneumatic tires of the Heinrich company on the other side.

translation.lb: An der Post.
translation.en: At the Post Office.

translation.lb: An ons Post kernt d'ièscht e klènge Backfeschelchen a frét ganz ferlé'n de Commis um Guichet op ké Bréf poste restante AB 10 fir sie dowèr.
translation.en: At our post office, a young girl first comes in and shyly asks the clerk at the counter if there is a letter poste restante AB 10 for her there.

translation.lb: De Commis (dén Jöfferchen e wéneg opzée' wolt): Ass et e Geschäfts- oder e Liebes- bréf?
translation.en: The clerk (who wanted to tease the young lady a little): Is it a business or a love letter?

translation.lb: De Backfesch (get op émoi ganz rôt a stottert ferlé'n): En... e.. Geschäfts- bréf.
translation.en: The young girl (instantly turns very red and stutters shyly): A... a.. business letter.

translation.lb: De Commis kuckt, mais 't ass neischt do, an d'Jöfferchen gét ganz trauerég fort
translation.en: The clerk checks, but there is nothing there, and the young lady leaves quite sadly.

translation.lb: Iwer èng Weilche' kernt se erein a klappt lûos un d'Fenster fum Guichet:
translation.en: After a little while, she comes back and gently taps on the counter window:

translation.lb: Och, dét der wellen esö gut sin an der géft och emol enner de Liebesbréf nokucken?
translation.en: Oh, would you be so kind and also check among the love letters?

translation.lb: Eng Sitzung fum Ackerbau-Verein zu Bêtebourég.
translation.en: A meeting of the Agricultural Association in Bettembourg.

translation.lb: De Sali, wo soss de Schdlmeschter de klènge' Kanner d'A B C ântrîchtert an dêne reidége Schuf Pensumen a' Puten ausdêlt, ass haut ganz ferännert:
translation.en: The hall, where usually the schoolmaster teaches the small children the ABCs and distributes exercises and punishments to those rowdy schoolboys, is quite different today:

translation.lb: Um hége Pult, wo soss de Schôltyrann mat grimmégem Bléck séng ganz Hiérd iwerbléckt, setzt, stolz wé e Paschâ, e klènge Mènnchen, héch ewé e Siéschter Eschen, èng Peif am Monn ewé e Blummendéppen a mat èngem Roher drun ewé e Biésemstronk;
translation.en: At the high desk, where usually the school tyrant with a grim look surveys his whole flock, sits, proudly like a pasha, a small man, tall as a stack of firewood, a pipe in his mouth like a flowerpot and with a cane as thick as a broom handle;

translation.lb: niéwent him, op èngem Stull, de gèlleche Contraire fun dém um Pult, èng läng goerég Créatur dé leibhaftég un e Lantersteil erennert, en Hut hannen um Kapp wé èng Uowepeif, dé em de Réckstrank wârm hèlt, an am Monn e Glimmstèngel oder Havannah Mückenvertreiber genannt.
translation.en: next to him, on a chair, the cheerful opposite of the one at the desk, a long gaunt creature that vividly resembles a lamppost, a hat at the back of his head like a stove pipe, that keeps his neck warm, and in his mouth a glowing stick known as a Havana mosquito repeller.

translation.lb: Op do Schölbänken setzen 24 Mitglieder fum Ackerbauverein.
translation.en: On the school benches sit 24 members of the Agricultural Association.

translation.lb: Dé Klengen um Pult helt d'Kléngel an d'Hand a kléngelt wé rôsen.
translation.en: The small man at the desk holds the bell in his hand and rings it furiously.

translation.lb: De Grössen: Sakerlöt, hält dach mat dém Gekléngels op, d'get é jo dâf.
translation.en: The tall one: For heaven's sake, stop with that ringing, it makes one deaf.

translation.lb: De Klengen: Di... di... dir Hären, d'Si... d'Si... d (Sitzung ass eröffent! Wé steht et mat onsem Sou... Sou... Soubsid?
translation.en: The small one: Ge... ge... gentlemen, the me... me... meeting is opened! How stands it with our sub... sub... subsidy?

translation.lb: De Grössen: Mir krîte' deicht ên, wa mir mé Sachen hètten!
translation.en: The tall one: We would surely get one if we had more goods!

translation.lb: Den Haré: Mer hu' jo èng Treipemaschin, èng Piffmaschin pn en Hâkmesser.
translation.en: Mr. Haré: We have a threshing machine, a plowing machine, and a chopping knife.

translation.lb: De Grössen: Hâttè mir dé 1500 Frang dé mir gefrôt hun, mè éch mèngen mir krîten se net.
translation.en: The tall one: If we had the 1500 francs we asked for, but I reckon we won't get them.

translation.lb: Den Haré: Wa' mer se net kréen, da ka' jo jiderên fan ons 40 Faang beilê'n, da krée' mer dach èppes an de Verein.
translation.en: Mr. Haré: If we don't get them, then each of us could put in 40 francs, then at least we would have something for the association.

translation.lb: De Klengen: Ma... ma... maja, dât war net schlecht, é... é... éch wir zefriden, wa... wa... wann dé âner et och sin, da gêt et.
translation.en: The small one: We... we... well, that's not bad, I... I... I'd be satisfied if... if the others agree, then it goes.

translation.lb: Ailes ass d'accord- bis op de Jösep, dén ass dergént.
translation.en: All agree—except for Joseph, who is against it.

translation.lb: De Jang zum Haré: Wann dén och net wéllt, da bleift en ewèch, ewèll en hûot dach nemmen èng Föer.
translation.en: The young one to Mr. Haré: If he doesn't want it either, then he stays away, because he only owns one cow.

translation.lb: E pûor Mitglieder: T'ass genug fir haut, wéné komme' mer erem zesunnnen?
translation.en: A few members: That's enough for today, when do we come together again?

translation.lb: De Klengen: Mi... mi... mir schéken iéch et durch de Bu... Bu... Bûot sô'n.
translation.en: The small one: We... we... we'll send it to you through the ma... ma... mail.

translation.lb: Zwêt Setzong fum Ackerbâuverein zu Bêtebureg.
translation.en: Second meeting of the Agricultural Association in Bettembourg.

translation.lb: Se setzen nêss zesûomen: Fir an der éschter Bänk de lânge Jang, d'Hô'r zu Bîreg stô'n ewé Fixspén, firun him séng mödesch Käppchen:
translation.en: They gather again: In the first row, long Jang, the hair standing stiff, in front of him his fashionable cap:

translation.lb: an der zwêter Bank, niéwent e pûor âner Mitglieder dé guden, âlen Nik, e râcht grâd de Stomp fun ènger Zigâre dé en séch e Freidéch ugefâng hât, an e flucht wèll en séch beim Ufènken de Schnauz gesengt hûot.
translation.en: in the second row, next to a few other members, the good old Nik, just lighting the end of a cigar that he had started on Friday, and he curses because he singed his mustache when lighting it.

translation.lb: De Jang: Milljess, wé sollen mer et am Verein mächen?
translation.en: De Jang: Milljess, what should we do in the association?

translation.lb: Solle mer ânescht stemmen?
translation.en: Should we vote differently?

translation.lb: Milljess, mer gi' geschwenn am „Letzeburger" esö rôse gemâcht dass mer et net mé auhâle' kénnen.
translation.en: Milljess, we will soon be so loudly spoken about in the "Letzeburger" that we cannot hold it anymore.

translation.lb: Milljess, éch lâfe bei jiderén an esö gûr bei d'Paschtéer, dass se solle Mitglied fum Verein gin, milljess, éch ferléere meng Plâtz ower net gir wént ménge Kanner.
translation.en: Milljess, I run to everyone and even to the pastor, that they should become members of the association, milljess, but I won't lose my place for my children.

translation.lb: De Nik: Du h... h... hûos R... R... Rècht.
translation.en: De Nik: You h... h... have R... R... Right.

translation.lb: De Jang: Wa Streit ass, da musse mer ofstemmen, milljess, mais éch muss beibehâle' gin, éch ferléere' méng sché Plâtz net gir, milljess.
translation.en: De Jang: If there is a dispute, then we have to vote, milljess, but I must be maintained, I won't lose my nice position.

translation.lb: De Nik: E... e... et get net o... o... ofgestemmt, e... e... et bleift wé et a... a... ass.
translation.en: De Nik: I... i... it will not be v... v... voted, i... it remains as it i... i... is.

translation.lb: De Jang: Milljess, éch schaffe nemmen dass de Verein soll firu' kommen, dir hûot et jo op dè'r lèschter Sté gesin, wö éch dat schént Sték Land kâft hun, (dât bellég wor) fir e Park unzelên dass éch ka'- mat den Hénger drâ furen, milljess.
translation.en: De Jang: Milljess, I only work so that the association can move forward, you saw it on the last fair, where I bought that beautiful piece of land, (that was cheap) to build a park where I can drive with the carts, milljess.

translation.lb: De Nik: E... e... éch muss m... m... méng Plâtz behâlen w... w... wann éch och m... m... misst mei' b..•. b... bèschte Gaul drem gin.
translation.en: De Nik: I... i... I must m... m... maintain my position e... e... even if I w... w... had to give up my b... b... best horse for it.

translation.lb: De Jang: Dé âner si rôssen, dass sie dé Plâtz net hun, durfir komme mir enuner an de „Letzeburger" stô'n, milljess.
translation.en: De Jang: The others are mad that they don't have the position, that's why we get to stand out in the "Letzeburger", milljess.

translation.lb: De Nik: Dé 5 oder 6 Z... Z... Zeitungsschreiwer, op dé mer supçonnéeren, können ewèch bleiwen, e... e... et sin d... d... der dach e... e... elauter dé ké Flapp M... M... Mescht firun der D... D... Dir hun.
translation.en: De Nik: Those 5 or 6 j... j... journalists, who are suspicious, can stay away, i... i... it is d... d... all those who have no manure to show at the door.

translation.lb: De Jang: Milljess, lôss mer 'mol kucken, allegur dé fir de Verein hàlen milljess, strecken de Fanger an d'Lucht, milljess!
translation.en: De Jang: Milljess, let us see, all those who hold for the association, raise your fingers in the air, milljess!

translation.lb: Wé en hèllescht Wiéder fûren 6 bis 7 Fangeren ewé Liéwerwurschten an d'Lucht, den Hâré hîft séng Fauscht, de Néckel dé mat dém geschwollene Bauch séng Schnaufbéks, de Flédert de lélebon, de Klènsehert dé grâd séng Jik aus dem Monn geholl hât, streckt dé aus, de Weissen séng zwö Hann, de Lauschterégen, dé grâd e Klûof ufênke wollt séng 2 Knéen, an den Hô'rkenstler, den op der Bank söss a lu Schrècken d'iwergewîcht ferléert trellt d'ennescht d'iéwescht a streckt d'Niederland an d'Lûcht.
translation.en: Like a bright storm 6 to 7 fingers point sausages in the air, the hairy lifts his fist, the Nick with the swollen belly his Snuffbox, the bat the bun, the little heart that just took his jig from the mouth stretches it out, the white his two hands, the listener, who just wanted to start a clove his 2 knees, and the artist, who sitting on the bench suddenly loses balance and stretches the upside-down Netherlands into the air.

translation.lb: Ailes mat enên: T'sin der genuch.
translation.en: All together: There are enough.

translation.lb: De Nik: Di... di... dir Hären an dir Damen, ê... é... éch si ganz geréert, e... e... elo hûole mer och e pu... pu... pûor Flèschen Hunyadi op d'Gesondhêt fum Verein.
translation.en: De Nik: G... g... gentlemen and ladies, I... I... am very moved, n... n... now we will also take a f... f... few bottles of Hunyadi for the health of the association.

translation.lb: De Godart (lûos zum Mètt): Kémen se alt elo bei méch, da kent éch och èppes gewannen!
translation.en: De Godart (quietly to himself): If they came to me now, I could win something too!

translation.lb: De Pity fun Tandel an de Pier fu’ Bastendorff mat der geschannter Nûos.
translation.en: The Pity from Tandel and the Pier from Bastendorff with the injured nose.

translation.lb: De Pity: Ma so emol Pier, a wö der Deiwel hûos du déng Nûos esô geschannt, den Hennes mécht dir e Protecoll, et schéngt du wollt's him séng Stèng nomiéssen, an dû hûost du himm s'all ausernâner gestdss.
translation.en: The Pity: Tell me Pier, where in the world did you injure your nose like that, Hennes is making a record, it seems you wanted to measure his stones, and you smashed them all to pieces.

translation.lb: De Pier: A... a... ah Éfalt, é... é... éch si gefall, e... e... elo sét all Dabo, é... é... éch wir ara Steps gewést, a... a... an elo kann éch emol net op de Mârt gô'n.
translation.en: The Pier: A... a... ah Nonsense, I... I... I fell, now everything is messed up, I... I... I was amidst the steps, and now I can't even go to the market.

translation.lb: De Pity: Wat soll dât sin, èng Nûos e besehe geschannt, denk dach emol un dât grösst Onglék dât zu Tandel geschitt ass, durch dé Veianer Bunn, dé hûot ènger zwé Bên beim Leif ewèch gehollt.
translation.en: The Pity: What is that, for a nose slightly injured, just think about the great misfortune that happened in Tandel, through the Veianer railway, which took off someone's two legs.

translation.lb: De Pier: Ho, ho, ho, enger? Wiém sénger?
translation.en: The Pier: Ho, ho, ho, someone's? Whose?

translation.lb: De Pity: Majo Pier, dem Félix sénger rudder Schubkâr.
translation.en: The Pity: Well Pier, Félix's wheelbarrow.

translation.lb: De Pier: A... a... a wé ass dât da gângen, hâten se hier da' net gepaff.
translation.en: The Pier: A... a... and how did that happen, didn't they watch out there?

translation.lb: De Pity: Sie hâte' gepaff, awer sie hât gemènkt, sie krieg och nach èng Kârt fir op d'Seit ze gô'n.
translation.en: The Pity: They were watching out, but she thought she would also get a ticket to get out of the way.

translation.lb: De Pier: War hiren Här da nit dohèm?
translation.en: The Pier: Wasn't her husband at home?

translation.lb: De Pity: Ma nên, hié wâr op Fuhren bei de Charel op sein Handwiérk eraus.
translation.en: The Pity: Well no, he was on the road to Charel for his craft.

translation.lb: De Pier: A... a... a dât wâr nun en onglékléchen Dâg, wèll de sellwichten Dâg sollt éch op Lungsderef gô'n, an du hun éch d'Nûos esô kossola geschannt.
translation.en: The Pier: A... a... and that was an unfortunate day because on that very day I was supposed to go to Lungsderef, and then I injured my nose so badly.

translation.lb: A... a... a Pity, a recevoir!
translation.en: A... a... oh Pity, give me a receipt!

translation.lb: No Bettendorf.
translation.en: At Bettendorf.

translation.lb: Wé ass et „Miessen", hât éch déch emol ordentlich an- d'Feier gedriewen?
translation.en: How are you, 'Miessen'? Did I ever properly drive you into a fire?

translation.lb: Ech hât ongeféer grad d'Metteltemperatur vum Schmand geroden wu e grad gut get fer Botter ze machen.
translation.en: I had just about hit the middle temperature of the sour cream when it is just right for making butter.

translation.lb: Ma neischt dêt mer mé gut ewé dass de hannert de „Club", wés du sèlwer gesot hûos, gerode bass.
translation.en: But nothing does me better than that you ended up behind the 'Club', as you yourself have said.

translation.lb: Géwen dé der d'Aen och nach ordentléch opkràtzen, wât der fun Hiérzen wenscht dei beste Freud A'. Z.
translation.en: I would also wish to scratch your eyes properly, something your best friend A. Z. wishes for you from the heart.

translation.lb: Eingegangen.
translation.en: Received.

translation.lb: Dame (ju einem ißaffagier, ber ins Damen« coupec einfteigen tcilij Klein §err .fterr (bienftbeflijfcn): îßotnit îann idj bienen?
translation.en: Lady (to a passenger who is about to enter the ladies' compartment, a small gentleman, respectfully): How can I assist?

translation.lb: Dame: 2lc£> bitte, idj möchte nur bcit Goubuïtcur fprcdjcn!
translation.en: Lady: Excuse me, I just want to speak with the conductor!

translation.lb: .frerr: Sofort!
translation.en: Gentleman: At once!

translation.lb: (ßr eilt IjinauS unb ïommt mit bern herbeigeholten ©onbufteur jurinf.
translation.en: (He rushes out and comes back with the conductor.)

translation.lb: Dame: Sitte, £>err (Sonbufteur, roolleit ©ie bern.öerrn bebeuten baff bier ein Damen« coupce ift!
translation.en: Lady: Please, Mr. Conductor, would you inform the gentleman that this is a ladies' compartment!

translation.lb: Am Gârt.
translation.en: In the garden.

translation.lb: Dat klèngt Elis (liûot dem Papp sei Béer emgestösst an op sei Klêd): Oh, Papa, elo kriss du es nach fun der Mamma.
translation.en: The little Elis (after knocking over her father's beer and onto his clothes): Oh, Papa, now you will get it from Mama.

translation.lb: De Papp: Ech? Ma du hûos jo de Béer emgestösst.
translation.en: The father: Me? But you knocked over the beer.

translation.lb: D'Elis: Majo, wèlls du net besser op méch ûocht hûos gin.
translation.en: Elis: Well, you should have paid better attention to me.

translation.lb: Schlagfertig.
translation.en: Quick-witted.

translation.lb: Den décke Bäcker Jules klemt an den Tramway.
translation.en: The chubby baker Jules climbs onto the tram.

translation.lb: Setzt schons esô e dennen Huissier do, dén de Jules wêgent séngem soliden Corpus e besehe wéllt opzéhen.
translation.en: Already there is such a thin bailiff sitting there, who wants to make fun of Jules because of his solid body.

translation.lb: Den Huissier: T'ass iéwel gut, Jules, dass mer hei net op d'Gewîcht bezûolen, soss kéms du schlecht ewèg.
translation.en: The bailiff: It's really good, Jules, that we don't pay by weight here, otherwise you would be in trouble.

translation.lb: De Jules: Ma nên Huissier, du kanns dobei fu' Gléck schwètzen, dass dàt net de Fall ass, weil da géw de Conducteur déch jo dach net mé mathûolen.
translation.en: Jules: No, bailiff, you can consider yourself lucky that that's not the case, because then the conductor wouldn't take you along anymore either.

translation.lb: Zu Bêteburéch op der Holzstéh.
translation.en: In Bettembourg at the wood stack.

translation.lb: Wé en Af op èngem Schleifstên setzen de Colibri an de Milljéss op ènger emgehâener Bich.
translation.en: Like a monkey on a grindstone, the Colibri and the Milljéss sat on an overturned beech.

translation.lb: De Colibri maufelt un ènger weisser Késsschmîr esc! héch wé e preisescht Schöllerhaus,
translation.en: The Colibri munches on a slice of white cheese butter, wow! as high as a prized schoolhouse,

translation.lb: während déni de Milljéss fun ènger Rommel Bötz ewé Kannerkäpp erôf beisst.
translation.en: while the Milljéss bites down from a rattling clatter over children's heads.

translation.lb: Sie lêh'n allebéd hannert séch, ass wann dé sîwen hongrécher Jôh'r firun der Dir sténgen.
translation.en: They both lie behind, as if the seven hungry years stood before the door.

translation.lb: Pir kên Dûscht ze leiden a wèll "se séch fïrgeholl hâten fu' Fréd e' Pättchen iwer den Dûscht ze hûolen, hât de Colibri èng Dosse' Flaschen Huniady matbrûocht,
translation.en: To not suffer thirst and because "they had planned to fetch a bottle for pleasure over the thirst," the Colibri had brought along a dozen bottles of Huniady,

translation.lb: dén se séch dichtég schmâche lossen.
translation.en: which they let taste heartily.

translation.lb: Den Nick (vulgo Colibri): H... h... hûos de ge... gesin, den Dr. Ra... Ratus an éch, wa... wa... wât si mir gescheit Leit!
translation.en: Nick (alias Colibri): H... h... have you se... seen, Dr. Ra... Ratus and I, wh... wh... what clever people we are!

translation.lb: Ze... ze... zénter ass mer ons op d'Bê... Bên 'gesât hun, ke... kent neischt méh an de Le... Le... Letzeburger,
translation.en: Since then they have put us on the bench, I... I know nothing more in the Lu... Lux... Luxembourg,

translation.lb: dé... dém Schârzen hu mer och op d'Fi... d'Fi... d'Fiéschte' geklappt!
translation.en: we ha... we have also knocked on the bla... bla... blackout!

translation.lb: De Milljéss:
translation.en: The Milljéss:

translation.lb: Milljéss, dem Kirpachs Closs sei Nôper, dé muss milljéss och fort, a wann der Deiwel sollt...
translation.en: Milljéss, the Kirpachs Closs's neighbor, he too must go away, even if the devil should...

translation.lb: De Colibri (ennerbrécht en): Se mu... müssen allebéd fort, wa... wann éch och scho' muss dé dau... dausend Frang drenr gin dé éch fum Dr. Ra... Ra... Ratus krit hun, fi... fi... fïr ons z'ameséeren.
translation.en: The Colibri (interrupting him): They mu... must all go away, e... even if I also must give the th... thousand francs that I got from Dr. Ra... Ra... Ratus, for... for... for us to amuse ourselves.

translation.lb: De Milljéss: Du mat déngem Gesabbels a Gebraddels, milljéss, muss emmer d'Wûrt hun, milljéss, du häss besser milljéss, du géfs dohêm bleiwen, milljéss, wèll mer hun nach net fill errêcht,
translation.en: The Milljéss: You with your babbling and chattering, Milljéss, always have to have the last word, Milljéss, you'd better stay at home, Milljéss, because we haven't achieved much yet,

translation.lb: a wann nèss en elo onsen Discours gehéert hûot milljéss, da sti' mer milljéss nêss e Samschtég am „Letzeburger"!
translation.en: and if anyone now has heard our conversation, Milljéss, then we'll be in the "Letzeburger" this Saturday!

translation.lb: T'wär ower lir rôsen ze gin!
translation.en: But it would be quite delightful to become red!

translation.lb: Op der Héschderfer Bréck.
translation.en: On the Héschderfer Bridge.

translation.lb: Do Néekel: A, gude Mûorgen Wèlli, wé gét et, hûost de gester dén Artikel funi Bettendorfer Club net am „Letzeburger" geliést?
translation.en: There Néekel: Ah, good morning Wèlli, how are you, did you read the article about the Bettendorfer Club in the „Letzeburger" yesterday?

translation.lb: De Wèlli: Dach, wann éch nach wést fir wién et wär da' war éch zefrieden.
translation.en: Wèlli: Yes, I would be content if I knew who it was about.

translation.lb: Den Néckel: Mais t'ass tir dé Jungen wd mir eis ewèll esé oft an esô gut aine- séert htm.
translation.en: Néckel: But it's about the boys we've so often admired and praised.

translation.lb: De Wèlli: 0, t'wèrden der wûol sin dé Neid doun hun, wann dé Jungen esd gut mat enê' sin an séch och gént dé àner Leidt so ordentléch bedrôhen.
translation.en: Wèlli: Oh, there must be envy from those who don't like it when the boys get along well with each other and behave properly towards other people.

translation.lb: Den Néckel: Do hûos de Recht, fun déne Junge' wàr nach kés ê' hei ènger béser Geschieht an se sen och net donnn genng dofir.
translation.en: Néckel: You're right, there hasn't been a bad incident with those boys, and they certainly don't deserve any.

translation.lb: Fun dénen hèllt kén séch mat dénen Neidfigel op, wèll se wessen och ganz gut wàt ên den Drèck mé réhert wàt e mé sténkt.
translation.en: None of them bother with envious people, because they know well that when you stir dirt, it stinks.

translation.lb: De Wèlli: Jo, jo, awer éch muss führen soss kreien éch de Mûorgen neischt gemacht a wa' mer eîs nach emol bf>- génen da sôen éch der nach méh iwer dé Bettendorfer Neidfigel.
translation.en: Wèlli: Yes, yes, but I have to go, otherwise I'll get nothing done in the morning, and if we meet again, I'll tell you more about the Bettendorfer envious ones.

translation.lb: Beim Hilger.
translation.en: At Hilger's.

translation.lb: Piff Muller: Eppes neis!
translation.en: Piff Muller: Something new!

translation.lb: Elo soll den Docter jo och én Syndicat gründen fir d'Entreprise fura Corbillard.
translation.en: Now the Doctor should also establish a syndicate for the hearse business.

translation.lb: Den Tunn.
translation.en: The Tunn.

translation.lb: Dat ass dénger Erfindung eng.
translation.en: That's one of your inventions.

translation.lb: Den Docter ass é séher praktesche Mann, e wéss emmer de Fanger op d'Wonn ze setzen.
translation.en: The Doctor is certainly a practical man, he always knows how to put his finger on the sore spot.

translation.lb: Wann dir Piff-Entrepreneuren d'Birger net gestreppt hätt, hätten se net gejaut.
translation.en: If you Piff entrepreneurs hadn't tormented the citizens, they wouldn't have yelled.

translation.lb: Iwrégens schéngt den Syndicat, dén iéch de Schneppel schneit, scho gut ze fonctionéeren.
translation.en: By the way, the syndicate that cuts you off seems to be functioning well already.

translation.lb: Mai en Denschtég gi' mir dem Docter an denen Hären dé ons zu dem Syndicat verholef liun Satisfaction.
translation.en: But on Tuesday we will give the Doctor and the gentlemen who helped us with the syndicate our satisfaction.

translation.lb: Mai du kriss kèng 10 Dàler Gewonn mé!
translation.en: But you won't get 10 dollars profit anymore!

translation.lb: Alles lacht, an de Muller zêt mam Rentiersbèngel hém.
translation.en: Everyone laughs, and Muller pushes on with the pensioner's stick.

translation.lb: Am Café Hari zu Kehlen.
translation.en: At the Café Hari in Kehlen.

translation.lb: De Batti: Elo hätte mer d'Stemmung gut eriwer, hätte mer elo och nach Rén.
translation.en: Batti: Now we would have a good atmosphere if we also had some rain.

translation.lb: Den Hari: Wûor denkst du hi' Batti, Rén ass ké méh op der Welt, hätte mir émoi de richtige Wand derfir.
translation.en: Hari: What are you thinking, Batti, rain isn't around anymore, we just need the right wind for it.

translation.lb: De Batti: Du mat déngem Wand, dôu' ka' jo ké' liéwen, et misst grad esö èng àl Harmonika oder esö en Harmonium sin \vé mir én an eiser Kiréch hun, mais dén hält ké Wand a ké Wàsser méh, e rönt ass wé èng Seibécken, an èngem Wûort en ass krank wé en Hond.
translation.en: Batti: You with your wind, you can't live off that, it would actually need to be an old harmonica or a kind of harmonium like we have in our church, but it can't hold wind or water anymore, it leaks like a sieve, and in short, it's as sick as a dog.

translation.lb: Den Hari: Ech wêss nit, wé eisen âlen Orgelist nach op dém Hâckbriét spille kan, hié' war elo grad hei an e sot et géng nit lâng méh mat dèr Kescht, wann nit en neie Blosbaléch drâ kent.
translation.en: Hari: I don't know how our old organist can still play on that rickety board, he was just here and said it wouldn't last much longer with that box, if a new bellows doesn't come in.

translation.lb: De Batti: Ma soll ên dan nit können dén âlen nach flécken mat dénen Electionsbiller, wofir dass esd fill Zeit onnötzer Weis ferlûor ass gin?
translation.en: Batti: But can't you patch the old one up with those election posters for which so much unnecessary time was wasted?

translation.lb: Den Hari: Ne Batti, un déne Biller war de Leim ze schlècht, dât géf nit hâlen; mais éch wêss nach e Mettel, éch hûole fir e Sondég mei Schmetteballeg an da blôsen éch dem Orgelist an dé Miséréréskescht dass hié mèngt e sétz dermat op der Wandmillen oder op dem Tour Eifel (wö éch scho war an du nach nit), ewèll Musék muss sin, si kann hiérkomme fu wât fir èngem Wand ass se wölt.
translation.en: Hari: No Batti, the glue on those posters was too poor; it wouldn't hold. But I know another way, I'll take my battering ram for Sunday and blow into the organ box so that the organist thinks he's sitting on a windmill or the Eiffel Tower (where I've been and you haven't), because music must be, it can come from whatever wind it wishes.

translation.lb: De Batti: Dât ass èng gut Idi dé's do hûos, mais dé Arbéchtgeség ech ower gär.
translation.en: Batti: That's a good idea you've got there, but I would still like to see the work.

translation.lb: Dajé äddi Hari, bis e Sondég, mais mach ower dass de d'Kiréch net mat auz dem Dûorf bléss.
translation.en: Goodbye then, Hari, until Sunday, but make sure you don't blow the church away from the village.

translation.lb: Am Stoot.
translation.en: At the threshold.

translation.lb: D'Fra: Gehei déch eraus, géh bei der Deiwel!
translation.en: The woman: Get out, go to the devil!

translation.lb: De Mann (ganz rohég): J)ên dêt mer neischt ewèll ech si sei Schwör!
translation.en: The man (quite calmly): That doesn't bother me because I am his brother-in-law!

translation.lb: D'Fra: So, sei Schwör??
translation.en: The woman: Really, his brother-in-law??

translation.lb: De Mann: Natirlech, ech hu' jo séng Schwester als Frâ krit!
translation.en: The man: Of course, I married his sister!

translation.lb: Och kéng schlècht.
translation.en: Oh, not bad.

translation.lb: Et hûot schon Hallefnûocht geschloen.
translation.en: It has already struck midnight.

translation.lb: Op der PleSsdarrn kluddert e' Vollert un der schéner Auer dé an dem neien Heis'chen do ass, den- Hausschiessel am Grapp an e wellt par force d'Schlessellach fannen.
translation.en: On the square, a young man is fumbling with the beautiful clock in that new little house there, holding the house key and trying by force to find the keyhole.

translation.lb: Eng Police géht lanscht: Mein léwe' Mann, dir sit schwéer am Schwêss, dass èrt Haus jo net!
translation.en: A policeman walks by: My dear man, you are sweating heavily, this is not your house!

translation.lb: Wann dir et besser wesst, Här Polizei, mèngt dén âneren, da' sieht mer emol dé Dir dé bei den Hausschiessel elei pâssW
translation.en: If you know better, Mr. Policeman, says the other, then show me the door that fits this house key.

translation.lb: D ’ Râten.
translation.en: The Rats.

translation.lb: Den Hannes: Wêss der Deiwel wé dât sech hûot, dass dèn hollänesche Késs fun Dâg zu Dâg mé deier get.
translation.en: Hannes: Who knows how the devil keeps it, that the Dutch cheese gets more expensive day by day.

translation.lb: T'kann ê bâl kê mé kâfen, an éch iéssen en esd giér.
translation.en: Soon I won't be able to buy any more, and I will gladly eat it.

translation.lb: D'Bärbel: Mei Gott, Hannes, dât sollst du dach wessen.
translation.en: Bärbel: My God, Hannes, you should know that.

translation.lb: Dat sin dem Här Prüm séng Räten dé en all opnaschelen; du wêss jo, dé Hären fun de Conterbissen.
translation.en: They are Mr. Prüm's rats that eat everything up; you know, the gentlemen from Counter Bits.

translation.lb: Den Hannes: Ach soooü Wat ass de Comble fun der Gemitlichkêt bei èngem Baukondukter?
translation.en: Hannes: Oh really! What is the epitome of coziness for a construction conductor?

translation.lb: •uoqonui son] qos o ']§ s umz jap ioq ou[uire^Y
translation.en: •uoqonui son] qos o ']§ s umz jap ioq ou[uire^Y

translation.lb: Eng fun Miérsch.
translation.en: A news from Mersch.

translation.lb: Den Albert: Georg wèst du och schons wât neiss?
translation.en: Albert: Georg, do you already know something new?

translation.lb: De Georg: A wât dann?
translation.en: Georg: And what is it?

translation.lb: Den Albert: Mais da lauschter: Ech wôr elo grad elei ûowen an èngem Haus an du gbf et op êmol e Gediber, ecli hu misse fort lâfen.
translation.en: Albert: But then listen: I was just up there in a house and suddenly there was a tumult, everyone had to run away.

translation.lb: D'Frâleit woren do.
translation.en: The women were there.

translation.lb: Den Georg: Ma fir wât war dat dann?
translation.en: Georg: But what was that for?

translation.lb: Den Albert: Wêst du dât nach net?
translation.en: Albert: Do you not know yet?

translation.lb: D'Mêdercher hei fu Mersch hun èng Lescht gemächt, den Här hûot jo gesot et géwon der nit genug bestûot, an dé bestûot sin, mégen et wé dé Pareiser.
translation.en: The girls here from Mersch made a list because the gentlemen said there are not enough customs, and these customs are like those in Paris.

translation.lb: An elo müssen d'Jongen sech op hir Lescht ennerschreiwen; si sôhen dé grést hètten d'Wiél.
translation.en: And now the boys have to sign their list; they said they have the biggest choice.

translation.lb: De Georg: Mais da krit Joffer Dengeskirchen och é Mann, si hat elo welles sech ên an d'Grbssgass ehoiséeren ze golin.
translation.en: Georg: Well, then Miss Dengeskirchen will also get a man, she was planning to move into Grbssgass now.

translation.lb: Da jé, bis e Sondéch Albert.
translation.en: Well then, see you Sunday, Albert.

translation.lb: Aus Elsaß-Lothringen.
translation.en: From Alsace-Lorraine.

translation.lb: Kaufmann (gu einem Sieifenben): Je vous remercie, je n'ai besoin de rien.
translation.en: Merchant (to a peddler): Thank you, I need nothing.

translation.lb: Du reste, comme vous visitez aussi les maisons de détail.
translation.en: Besides, as you also visit retail establishments.

translation.lb: A eife n b e r (aufcci Sttljem): Oh Pardong, nong!
translation.en: A peddler (on the street): Oh, pardon, no!

translation.lb: Nous ne faisong qu'avec les „grossiers! "
translation.en: We only deal with wholesalers!

translation.lb: Beim Josi zu Rodange.
translation.en: At Josi's in Rodange.

translation.lb: De Jâki: So Josi, bestin dé Primen nach fun de Raubfulen ass wé fun den Harespelen.
translation.en: Jâki: Tell me Josi, are the bounties still better from bird nests than from rabbit traps?

translation.lb: De Josi: Jo aie Beschten, wé éch nach 'ob d'Jûogd se gangen, du hâte mer 12 Sous fun ènger Agas, a 6 Sous fun èngem Kola, a fun den Eer war och èppes.
translation.en: Josi: Yes, my dear, back when I used to hunt, we would get 12 Sous for a magpie and 6 Sous for a nest, and there was also something from the eggs.

translation.lb: De Jaki: Ma kann ên dé Eschter dann hûolen öne Gefohr?
translation.en: Jaki: Can one take those nests without danger?

translation.lb: De Josi: Hem! Hem! aie Beschten, gewess, wô ên se fent.
translation.en: Josi: Hmm! Hmm! my dear, of course, as long as you know where to find them.

translation.lb: De Jaki: Ma brauch ên dem Egenthömer, wô se stin, dann neischt fun dèr Prim ze gin?
translation.en: Jaki: But does one not need to give the owner where they are found anything from the bounty?

translation.lb: De Josi: Nên, âle Bèschten, da get d'ganz Prime fir dên, dên se bréngt.
translation.en: Josi: No, dear, the whole bounty goes to the one who brings them in.

translation.lb: De Jâki: Ma éch hun e' Kolâenascht fond.
translation.en: Jâki: I've found a nest.

translation.lb: De Josi: Nu jé Jâki, du wéls mer èng ophènken, Kolâen, dé baue jo net bis de Mê.
translation.en: Josi: Oh Jâki, you want to prank me, the nests are not built until May.

translation.lb: De Jâki: Ma wann éch der et jo sohn, éch wêss et, an éch kann der et weisen wan's du wéls.
translation.en: Jâki: But I'm telling you, I know it, and I can show you if you want.

translation.lb: Ower den àlen, dê setzt drop, an dann dêle mer d'Huhnen wé allzeit.
translation.en: But the old man, he sits on it, and then we'll split the spoils as usual.

translation.lb: De Josi: A wô soll dat da stohn?
translation.en: Josi: And where should that be?

translation.lb: De Jâki: Ma, du wêss et schon.
translation.en: Jâki: Well, you already know.

translation.lb: De Josi: 0 jo, wèl onst Mèri hûot mer gesot, hat hätt eppes gesingen erauskuken, den Ale' mat de Jongen.
translation.en: Josi: Oh yes, because our Mary told me she saw something peeking out, the old one with the youngsters.

translation.lb: De Jâki: Jong oder âl, a wat mé, wat léwer, wa mer nemmen neischt brauchen un d'Gemeng fun der Prim ze gin.
translation.en: Jâki: Young or old, what's more, that's the choice, so long as we don't need to give anything to the community from the bounty.

translation.lb: De Josi: Fèrt net, âle Bèschten, mer hu jo schon mé ûorger gepakt ass wé dé do!
translation.en: Josi: Don't worry, dear, we've handled worse cases than that one!

translation.lb: E Couragéerten.
translation.en: An Encouragement.

translation.lb: E Bedengter, dên èng hèllesch Angscht hat firun allen wât Dynamit a Ravachol a Vaillant hêscht, könnt mûrgens bei sein Här!
translation.en: A servant, who had a terrible fear of everything called dynamite and Ravachol and Vaillant, came in the morning to his master!

translation.lb: Här, et leit e' Bréf dobausse fir iéch.
translation.en: Sir, there is a letter outside for you.

translation.lb: Mè Jang, fir wât bréngst du en dann net erân?
translation.en: But Jang, why don't you bring it in?

translation.lb: Meija, ech réeren en net un, e' könnt lass gôn, ewèll en ass chargiert!
translation.en: Oh my, I won't touch it, it might go off, because it is loaded!

translation.lb: Kéhlen.
translation.en: Kehlen.

translation.lb: Wé et schéngt ass hei och ewèll èng Nötenschwänzmechergeschicht am Marsch, ass wé bei der Stàdt.
translation.en: It seems there is also a certain scandalous story here in the making, much like in the city.

translation.lb: Nu lauschtert gut:
translation.en: Now listen carefully:

translation.lb: Hei ass esö e klènge Beweis fun dêne pûor leschter Sonndécher.
translation.en: Here is a small piece of evidence from a few recent Sundays.

translation.lb: Gleich nom Mettegiéssen gêt et op êmol surn, sum, sum, an dann zit • dat sehént Gesehlècht séch no allen Gégenden hin, bal èng, oft och zwö Stonne weit ewèch dé âl Freieren opsichen.
translation.en: Right after lunch it goes all of a sudden ‘surn, sum, sum’, and then the pairs scatter in all directions, often seeking out old flames even one or two hours away.

translation.lb: Dàt sin esö Gêschter dé d'Schûoberfôer fun A bis Z dûrchgeklappt hun, an iéwer och all Kirmessen am Emkrêss.
translation.en: Those are the ghosts who have thoroughly participated in all festivities and every fair in the area.

translation.lb: Wé et schéngt féhlen si elo bei denen, dé sech op all dênen Fèstlechkêten mat hinen ameséert hun.
translation.en: It seems they are now missing those who enjoyed all those celebrations with them.

translation.lb: Ower bei wiém elo ufènken; t'kaseht emmer fill Kappbriéches.
translation.en: But where to start now is always a headache.

translation.lb: Wé et schéngt wellt elo kên mé èppes wessen fun der schéner Polka.
translation.en: It seems no one wants to know about the beautiful polka anymore.

translation.lb: Wann et esö firu gêt, sét de Franz, da get et och nach e wénég ze pintschen, soss trett kên an d'Fâl.
translation.en: If things continue this way, says Franz, there will still be a bit of pinching, otherwise no one will fall into the trap.

translation.lb: Zu Rèckeng op der Mess.
translation.en: Back at the fair in Rèckeng.

translation.lb: De Neckelchen: W d'och dat mer èppes durchgebrannte- iei hun?
translation.en: Neckelchen: Did we burn something here?

translation.lb: De Karlchen: Oho, a wô war dann dàt Feier?
translation.en: Karlchen: Oh, and where was that fire?

translation.lb: De Neckelchen: Un de ferwurelte Gedanken dé Fûossondég hei gebâck si gin, se waren ze dréchen.
translation.en: Neckelchen: At the confused thoughts that were baked here last Sunday, they were too dry.

translation.lb: De Karelchen: A wât ass du gemàcht gin?
translation.en: Karelchen: And what was done then?

translation.lb: De Neckelchen: Du ass don aie Bäcker gang a en hûot dêm jonge Ferwureltgedankekrémer den hftnneschte Bâkûowen esd lang mat pngebrannten Eschen agefeiert bis schliessléch alles durchgebrannt ass.
translation.en: Neckelchen: You went to a baker and celebrated in the young thought-tangler's very back oven with burnt ashes until finally everything burned through.

translation.lb: De Karelchen: Dé do ass net schlecht, wa fir e Sonndéch dé Durchbrennerei net gelöscht ass, dann dämpt et.
translation.en: Karelchen: That's not bad, if the burning isn't put out for a Sunday, then there's smoke.

translation.lb: Lampersbiérger Kûorblumen.
translation.en: Basket flowers from Lampertsberg.

translation.lb: Op d’Weis: „Fern im Süd das schöne Spanien.“
translation.en: To the tune of: 'Far in the south the beautiful Spain.'

translation.lb: Lampersbiérg, du loftéch Gégend,
translation.en: Lampertsberg, you breezy area,

translation.lb: Bàmbeschwé, sô gut gedêft:
translation.en: Bam brushwood, so well fragrant:

translation.lb: Wd de Meiler ganz fermégend,
translation.en: With the charcoal kiln quite fearless,

translation.lb: Mat dem Piff eremmer schlèft;
translation.en: With the whiff always sleeping;

translation.lb: Wö den Emil séng Karnéngcheu,
translation.en: Where Emil his little candles,

translation.lb: Dé him blhven an der Kränkt ::
translation.en: That bloom for him in the illness ::

translation.lb: A' sein armt, gestûorwent Sobwéngchen Zum Parâd un d'Bêtn opbiinkt::
translation.en: And his poor, deceased little swan brings to paradise to the beds ::

translation.lb: Batte, dat sin drôléch Kischteu,
translation.en: Box, those are funny boxes,

translation.lb: Hiren Doft zét gûor net un:
translation.en: Their scent does not appeal at all:

translation.lb: Wèll dé hu' jo Sehviinz a' Bischten,
translation.en: Because they have brooms and branches,

translation.lb: Gèlt, du frész och kèng derfun?
translation.en: Gold, you too eat none of them?

translation.lb: Lôss den Emil Farce' machen,
translation.en: Let Emil make farce,

translation.lb: Bleif beim Bàrt a' bei dem Kamp;
translation.en: Stay with the beard and with the camp;

translation.lb: :j: Lôss déeh. Dabo, net auslachen.
translation.en: :j: Let those. Dabo, do not laugh.

translation.lb: Wèll durch d'Feier get et Damp.::
translation.en: Because through the fire comes the smoke.::

translation.lb: K Fassop.
translation.en: K Fassop.

translation.lb: An der Priédégt. Den Här Paschtöer liât d'Gewunnégt beim Priédégen eramer kraftég mat der Fauscht op de Priédegtstull ze schlôn.
translation.en: During the sermon. The pastor had the habit of pounding the pulpit strongly with his fist during the sermon.

translation.lb: Fir em dât ofzegewinnen gong e Spassfull a schlét hémlech e pûor Nôlespetzten drân.
translation.en: To get him to stop this, a joker secretly placed a few sharp nails there.

translation.lb: Sonndes klemt mei gudden Här erem op de Priédegtstull, hellt en Auszock a' rift: 28er bat bic 2Öclt erraffen?
translation.en: On Sunday, my good sir again climbs onto the pulpit, takes a breath and shouts: Did you forget to gather at 28 before 2?

translation.lb: a gleich mat der Fau.scht niedergeschlon.
translation.en: and immediately struck down with his fist.

translation.lb: Zakerlöt, rift en op êmol an ènger Peng, dàt wäre gewess nêss dem Ivoschter séng Honn!
translation.en: Ouch, he suddenly shouts in pain, that must have been the foreman's dog's doing!

translation.lb: Ons Bauerefrömmégkêt.
translation.en: Our peasant piety.

translation.lb: De Mâtesbauer hûot séch un de Kniédele verfrippt.
translation.en: Farmer Mâtes has sprained his knee.

translation.lb: Blêch ewé en Duch leit hién am grosse Familiestull,
translation.en: Pale as a cloth, he lies in the big family chair,

translation.lb: a' wêss séch net mé ze réeren an ze kéeren.
translation.en: and he no longer knows how to move or turn.

translation.lb: D'ganz Familien ass wé ausser séch,
translation.en: The whole family is beside themselves,

translation.lb: nuren dé âl Giédel hûot de Kapp op der richtéger Platz:
translation.en: only the old Giédel has her head in the right place:

translation.lb: ~Kennercher! jeitzt se, Kennercher, biéd;
translation.en: ~Children! she says, Children, pray;

translation.lb: de Papp baschtl"
translation.en: the father is bad."

translation.lb: An Zobels. De Klengen: Ech hätt gier èng halef Schappen Esség!
translation.en: At Zobels. The Little One: I would like half a basket of vinegar!

translation.lb: D'Zobels: Deng Mamm hellt emmer eng Schappen, Klengen.
translation.en: The Zobels: Your mother always takes a full basket, Little One.

translation.lb: De Klengen: Nên, méng Mamm hûot gesot si hél es net mé esö fill beienên, soss géf en hir sauer.
translation.en: The Little One: No, my mother said she doesn't take so much anymore, otherwise it would go sour on her.

translation.lb: D'Zobels: Hei huos de e pûor Boxeknepp fir ère Butz!
translation.en: The Zobels: Here, you have a few pennies for your boy!

translation.lb: Am Caffée.
translation.en: In the café.

translation.lb: De Pép: Kanst du mir net son Jos, wàt Maulsperre ass?
translation.en: Pép: Can you not tell me, Jos, what a gag order is?

translation.lb: De Jos: Maulsperre? (bedenkt sech.)
translation.en: Jos: Gag order? (thinks for a moment.)

translation.lb: Am Deitscliland hêscht dât, Maul halten, de Letzeburger sêt „Neischt aus der Schöl geschwât", zö Esch sôn se „da femmste nit", an am Büreau denken se, lâft mer de Bockel erân.
translation.en: In Germany, it means to keep your mouth shut, the Luxembourger says "don't talk out of school", in Esch they say "you better not move", and in the office they think, hit me on the back.

translation.lb: De Pép (lacht): ha ha ha, iewel mat Schlappen—gelungen, wirkléch gelungen, dé elo ass gutt, ha ha ha!
translation.en: Pép (laughs): ha ha ha, really with slippers—clever, truly clever, this one is good indeed, ha ha ha!

translation.lb: Den Affekot a séng Clienten.
translation.en: The lawyer and his clients.

translation.lb: Et köm t'leschter e Bauer an d'Stàdt gefûor: fir um Wohn hât en en déckt, schwéert Perd, an hannen drun zwê rappécher goeréger.
translation.en: Last time a farmer came to the city: in front, he had a big, heavy horse, and behind it two thin, lean ones.

translation.lb: De Pol an de Louis kome lanscht:
translation.en: Pol and Louis come along:

translation.lb: So, kuck emol sét de Pol, wêsst de net wat dat do ze bedeiten hûot?
translation.en: Look, says Pol, don't you know what that is supposed to mean?

translation.lb: Ah mè nên, seet de Louis!
translation.en: Ah, no, says Louis!

translation.lb: Abé da kuck: dat déckt Perd dat ass den Affekôt, an dé zwê aner môr a göereger, dat sin séng Clienten.
translation.en: Well then look: the big horse is the lawyer, and the two other thin and lean ones are his clients.

translation.lb: Eng nei Oper.
translation.en: A new opera.

translation.lb: D'Madame X. setzt op dem Kanapé a kreischt, am Eck setzt hire klènge Böf.
translation.en: Madame X sits on the sofa and screams, in the corner sits her little boy.

translation.lb: D'Madame Z. klappt un der Dier.
translation.en: Madame Z knocks on the door.

translation.lb: D'Madame X. herein!
translation.en: Madame X: Come in!

translation.lb: Bonjour Mad. X.
translation.en: Good morning, Mad. X.

translation.lb: Bonjour Mad. Z.
translation.en: Good morning, Mad. Z.

translation.lb: D'Madame Z.: Mais, wofir kreischt d'Madame X.?
translation.en: Madame Z: But, why is Madame X screaming?

translation.lb: JJ'Madame X.: Oh, ech hun èng Peng an de Kréenân dat ech et bâl net aus- hàle kann.
translation.en: Madame X: Oh, I have a pain in my legs that I can hardly endure it.

translation.lb: jy Madame Z.: Mais, dat ass jo grad d'Affaire; da git der haut den Owend mat an d'Bad-Anstalt do ass en ausgezêchenten Opérateur; hié kennt seng Sâch aus dem ff.
translation.en: Madame Z: But that's exactly the matter; then you should go with us this evening to the bath establishment, there is an excellent operator; he knows his trade thoroughly.

translation.lb: De Jéngelche schlecht zu der Dier eraus a lêft bei sei Papp an dé ai.er Zemmer a rift:
translation.en: The little boy sneaks out the door and runs to his father in the other room and shouts:

translation.lb: Pappa, loss méch den Owend mat op den Théâter gôn!
translation.en: Papa, let me go to the theater tonight!

translation.lb: Mais, mei léwe Jèmpi, den Owend ass jo kên Théâter!
translation.en: But, my dear Jempi, there is no theater tonight!

translation.lb: Dach Pappa, t'ass haut den Owend; meng Matant ass dobannen, an se sôt zu ménger Mamm, se soll den Owend mat gôn, se spillen se spillen se spillen d'Kréenasoper; den Hèr Déngen wär esö èn ausgezêchenten Operateur, e géf séng Sâch aus dem ff kènnen.
translation.en: Yes Papa, it is tonight; my aunt is inside, and she told my mother, she should go tonight, they are playing, they are playing, they are playing the leg opera; Mr. So-and-so was said to be such an excellent operator, he knows his business thoroughly.

translation.lb: Mei léwe Jèmpi, du hâs d'Sâch net gut verstânen, gé schén erem an! (Pir sèch): Wàt dach dé klèng Kessele gross Oeren hun!
translation.en: My dear Jempi, you have misunderstood the matter, go nicely in again! (To himself): How big ears those little pots have!

translation.lb: An der Wiérkstâdt.
translation.en: In the workshop.

translation.lb: De Mêschter (zumLéerbôf: Elo gesin éch ewèll wé lâng, dass du Bqf Cigârrestôrap föraras.
translation.en: The master (to the apprentice): Now I see clearly for a while that you forage for cigar stubs.

translation.lb: Schûoms du déch net esô èng Knaschterei an de Mond ze hùolen.
translation.en: Don't you feel ashamed to put such filth in your mouth.

translation.lb: T'wêss ê jo net wât fir e Schwein ass se scho firdrun ara Mond hât.
translation.en: You don't even know what kind of swine had it in their mouth before.

translation.lb: De Lèerbôf: Oh Mèschter, éch rächen nemmen dé Stomp dé dîr ewèg wèrft!
translation.en: The apprentice: Oh master, I only take the stubs that you throw away!

translation.lb: Am Kaffé zur „Avenue de la Gare.“
translation.en: In the café on 'Avenue de la Gare.'

translation.lb: En opgelauschterten Diskur.
translation.en: An overheard conversation.

translation.lb: De Jang (zu èngera Deitschen, dén niéwent him beim Désch setzt):
translation.en: Jang (to a German sitting next to him at the table):

translation.lb: Nu schwätzt dir schons esô lang iwert onst neit Klackespîl, ma si dir dann och musikalesch genug gebild, fir. èrt Uortel driwer ze spriéchen?
translation.en: You've been talking for so long about our new carillon, but are you musically educated enough to give your opinion on it?

translation.lb: Den Deitschen: 9îa nu! idjj beit muftfolifd) bc§ in bct §intergebâube Çinetn, über ber ©ibet titog begreifen, toat bat bo for c ©c= bummelê un ©ebammel ift.
translation.en: The German: Yes, indeed! However, I must admit being somewhat confused, as it involves things that seem to jumble and dangle.

translation.lb: Den Haré (e besschen u'gerâcht): Wa-wât soll da-dann den Auslänner do fun o-onsem Kla-Klakespîll fe-ferstô'n?
translation.en: Hare (a bit annoyed): Wh-what should the foreigner understand about our carillon?

translation.lb: Eya, wa-wann en nach déng Ta-Talènten an och déng Stremè-mènter hätt, ge-gelt Jang?
translation.en: Well, if he also had your talents and your peculiarities, right Jang?

translation.lb: De Jang: An emol den Napoleonsbârt erof még, dass mer séng Nationalitét un him erkennen dét.
translation.en: And maybe shave off the Napoleon beard so we can recognize his nationality.

translation.lb: Den Deitschen: ©ir fperren, nia Statioualitat ifd) ma Sîationalitât u mo 23art ifdj mo 23art
translation.en: The German: I protest, my nationality is my nationality and my beard is my beard.

translation.en: Hare: Of course, Jang, and our carillon is our carillon?

translation.lb: De Jang: Perstêt séch, Haré! ma dé Deitsch hun ower och d'Rècht ze lausch tere wât et geit!
translation.en: Jang: Certainly, Hare! But the Germans also have the right to listen to what is going on!

translation.en: The German: But when the carillon plays, even the most skilled observer may seem to misunderstand its significance because it is profoundly complex.

translation.en: Schaal (who read in the 'Letzeburger,' to the German): Listen, sir, if you want to understand our carillon, you must first learn our dialect; as long as you don't know it, you won't comprehend what it plays, because its music is entirely Luxembourgish.

translation.en: The German: Yes, indeed, but it will take considerable time until I can spontaneously understand the carillon.

translation.en: Hare: Jang, I have also thought the same.

translation.lb: Um Margrétches Café zu Réden.
translation.en: At Margrétchen's Café in Réden.

translation.lb: D'Lusel.
translation.en: Lusel.

translation.lb: Ass et wôer, Margrétchen, d'Leit sôn du h;iss nêss èppes en vue?
translation.en: Is it true, Margrétchen, that people say you have something in view?

translation.lb: D'Marg.
translation.en: Margretchen.

translation.lb: Ma, ass et migeléch, a wat dann?
translation.en: Well, is it possible, and what then?

translation.lb: D'L.
translation.en: L.

translation.lb: Bâl dest, bâl dât; bal de Mâtes, bal de Klos; a se sôn nach ewèll mé.
translation.en: Sometimes this, sometimes that; sometimes Mathes, sometimes Klos; and they say even more.

translation.lb: D'M.
translation.en: M.

translation.lb: Oh?
translation.en: Oh?

translation.lb: D'L.
translation.en: L.

translation.lb: Mir zwê wären allwissend, zemol wät dé âner Leit ugêt.
translation.en: We two would be all-knowing, especially concerning what other people say.

translation.lb: D'G.
translation.en: G.

translation.lb: 0 hélégen Sankt, Mathes, Leitsgeschwätz.
translation.en: Oh holy Saint, Mathes, people's gossip.

translation.lb: Ech dûocht se déton eschter son éch wir esö katölesch a fromm, éch géng all Mûorges fré an d'Kiréch wann éeh net ze mitt wèr, an elauter esö schén Sachen.
translation.en: I thought they would rather say I was so Catholic and devout; I would go to church every morning early if I were not too tired, and other such nice things.

translation.lb: D'D.
translation.en: D.

translation.lb: Jo, jo, dât ass emol de Leit Sand an d'Aa gestrét, mais se brauchen net alles ze wessen, soss könnt et nach an de Letzeburger.
translation.en: Yes, yes, that is just to throw sand in people's eyes, but they don’t need to know everything, otherwise it could end up in the Luxembourg paper.

translation.lb: D'G.
translation.en: G.

translation.lb: Wêss de, d'Leit si mir all êndun.
translation.en: You know, people are all done with me.

translation.lb: Um Dûorf.

translation.lb: Den Här Pascbtôer (zum Klos, dê besolfen iwer d'Gâss stîrkelt).
translation.en: The pastor (to Klaus, who drunkenly staggers across the street).

translation.lb: „Ower Klos, allt rem am Tubak! wéné hùos de dann am welles fir déch ze bekéeren?"
translation.en: "Oh Klaus, always back to the tobacco! When do you plan to reform yourself?"

translation.lb: De Klos. „Här Pa-pasehtöer, fi-fir méch ze bekéeren a-ass et nu-nun ze spét!"
translation.en: Klaus. "Mr. Pastor, for me to reform, it's now too late!"

translation.lb: Den Här Paschtôer. ~Nê, Klos, düofir ass et kêmol ze spét, de léwe Gott ferzeit emraer."
translation.en: The pastor. "No, Klaus, it is never too late for that, the dear God always forgives."

translation.lb: De Klos. „Wann dât de Fall ass, Här Pascbtôer, dann hun éch jo och na-nach Zeit ze wa-warden."
translation.en: Klaus. "If that is the case, Mr. Pastor, then I still have time to wait."

translation.lb: Zwe’ jong Stodenten.
translation.en: Two young students.

translation.lb: De Charles: So emol Néckel, ass déng Schwester schons fiancéert?
translation.en: Charles: Tell me, Néckel, is your sister already engaged?

translation.lb: De Néckel: Nén, raè éch mèngen se géf et iéwel geschwenn.
translation.en: Néckel: No, but I think she will be soon.

translation.lb: De Charles: A fir wât mèngst de dât dann?
translation.en: Charles: And why do you think that then?

translation.lb: De Néckel: Ah, mè se get mer all Owes fennef Sous fir dass éch net am Sällche bleiwe soll.
translation.en: Néckel: Ah, because she gives me five sous every evening so that I won't stay in the parlor.

translation.lb: Une jeune veuve se lamente sur le mausolée de son infidèle époux récemment décédé: Il me reste du moins une consolation, faitelle, je sais maintenant où il passe ses nuits.
translation.en: A young widow laments at the mausoleum of her recently deceased unfaithful husband: At least I have one consolation, she says, now I know where he spends his nights.

translation.lb: On causait hier devant Rapineau des nombreuses lettres de quête que l'on reçoit surtout depuis les premier froids.
translation.en: Yesterday, in front of Rapineau, people were talking about the numerous begging letters that are especially received since the first cold weathers.

translation.lb: Oui, répondit le baron avec un soupir, l'hiver s'annonce bien dur... pour les riches.
translation.en: Yes, replied the baron with a sigh, winter looks to be very harsh... for the rich.

translation.lb: A un cours de jeunes filles: Le professeur. Le grand art, mes demoiselles, c'est d'écrire comme on parle.
translation.en: At a girl's class: The professor. The great art, my young ladies, is to write as one speaks.

translation.lb: Une élève. Alors, monsieur, quand on parle du nez?
translation.en: A student. So, sir, what about when one speaks through the nose?

translation.lb: Hier, Z.. trouve cet excellent Calino en train de faire sa valise et d'y enfouir un revolver.
translation.en: Yesterday, Z.. found this excellent Calino packing his suitcase and stuffing a revolver in it.

translation.lb: —Un revolver dans ta valise! fait Z.., pourquoi faire?
translation.en: —A revolver in your suitcase! said Z.., what for?

translation.lb: Oh! ne crois pas que ce soit par peur... Je mets ma valise aux bagages!
translation.en: Oh! don't think it's out of fear... I’m putting my suitcase with the luggage!

translation.en: Jang: I'll give you 24 Francs.

translation.en: A Pafendall fencing brother (to Mr. Emil): Mr. Emil, give me a little favor!

translation.lb: Den Emil: Ferstin net'
translation.en: Emil: I don't understand you.

translation.lb: De Fèchtbruder (hallt d'Hand dûor): Schenkt mir e' weneg Gehéer!!!
translation.en: The fencing brother (holding out his hand): Give me a little favor!!!

translation.lb: Den Einil: Eçh ferstin déch nach net.
translation.en: Emil: I still don't understand you.

translation.lb: De Fechtbruder (jeitzt wât e' jeitze kann): Schhnkt mir e' wéneg Gehéer!!!
translation.en: The fencing brother (yelling as loud as he can): Give me a little favor!!!

translation.en: Emil: Oh, go to the devil! I know it myself!

translation.lb: (e schrékt d'Kûolegàss op.)
translation.en: (he startles the whole alley.)

translation.en: The fencing brother (to himself): With all these people, I'm not making any progress this week!

translation.lb: Dé ass gutt!
translation.en: That's good!

translation.lb: Eng Baneremadam kom des Dêg au d'Stâdt fir séeh hire' Brautrenk, den iwer der graffer Arbécht mat der Zeit duréch gânge' wor, erem fléeken ze lôssen.
translation.en: A lady from the countryside came to the city today to have her engagement ring, which had worn out over time due to rough work, repaired.

translation.lb: Si drét en an de' Goldbuték, wö si e' kâft hât; mè wât musst se do héeren!
translation.en: She takes it to the jewelry store where she bought it; but what must she hear there!

translation.lb: D'Madaine sôt dé Rénk wêr net mé ze flécken.
translation.en: The lady says the ring can no longer be repaired.

translation.lb: Mè wé dât dann!
translation.en: But how can that be!

translation.lb: mèngt méng gut Frèchen, dât kann dach wûol net sin?
translation.en: thinks my dear friend, that surely cannot be?

translation.lb: Ower da' kuckt dach nemmen hei, sôt d'Madame, do bannen dran ass jo nemmen Metall, dât ass jo kê purt Gold.
translation.en: But just look here, says the woman, inside there is only metal, that's not pure gold.

translation.lb: Mè merci dann, éch hun e' jo bei iéch kâft, a' fir gut Gold bezûolt, dât ass ower e wéneg stârk.
translation.en: But thank you then, I bought it from you and paid for good gold, that's rather a bit much.

translation.lb: Bei ons, dir îrt iéch, méng Bèscht, esô Wûor hu' mir net am Buték!
translation.en: With us, you are wrong, my dear, we do not have such goods in the store!

translation.lb: An éch son iéch, éch hun de Rénk hei kâft, an éch hâle' méoh un iéch.
translation.en: And I tell you, I bought the ring here, and I hold you to it.

translation.lb: Dât kann éch net fertôn, mèngt èndléch d'Madame et mîsst da' grad sin dat et firum Krich gewiéscht wiér!
translation.en: That I cannot understand, says the woman finally, it must have been from before the war!

translation.lb: Zó Echternoach an der Ampel.
translation.en: At Echternach by the traffic light.

translation.lb: Den N. (zum berühmte Candidatus, dé ganz brêt bei sénger Flèsch setzt): So, gêss de no Bollendorf op d'Höchzeit?
translation.en: Mr. N. (to the famous candidate, who sits broadly with his meat): So, are you going to Bollendorf for the wedding?

translation.lb: De Candidatus: Ecli lioan kên Zéit lîr méich ze derangé'ren, sonst géng é'ich nowell hin; ower elo mat mé'in Examen!
translation.en: The Candidate: I really don't have time to disturb myself, otherwise I would surely go; but now with my exam!

translation.lb: No jé, éch géng awer nawell gé'ir!
translation.en: Oh well, I would still go!

translation.lb: Den dréchene W. (dén dem Gespréch 11 ogelauschtert liûot): Ech gin foan dém Standponkt aus, dé ongerofe Gèsclit gi' haussent d'Dir gesät; da' wêss 't et ait.
translation.en: The dry W. (who had overheard the conversation quite a bit): I assume the uninvited guests are sitting outside the door; then you know there's something.

translation.lb: Om Jaagd-Iwergangk zu Welwerdang.
translation.en: On the hunting transition in Welverding.

translation.lb: Grève Méchel.
translation.en: Grève Méchel.

translation.lb: Ech leckden et net, (lass den Erdrag fan der Jaagd an de Budget fun der Gemeng gesät get, fir Freniers derfan ze bezahlen, soss get gar net fan mer ennerschruf't.
translation.en: I don't like it, if the proceeds from the hunting are added to the municipal budget to pay strangers from it, otherwise I won't sign it.

translation.lb: Henge Méchel.
translation.en: Henke Méchel.

translation.lb: Mein Petter hoat Recht, dàt war dann schling, wann dé Beaniteren, dé glât néist hoan, och nach derfoan profitéere giéwea, mer Baueren dèlen d'Geld.
translation.en: My godfather is right, it would be a disaster if those officials, who have nothing at all, would also profit from it, while we farmers share the money.

translation.lb: Chantges Hanspéter.
translation.en: Chantges Hanspéter.

translation.lb: Oa Efalt do, dann hoast du o nach néist, mat dénger Deel, dé ass net grûss.
translation.en: Oh nonsense, then you have nothing from your share as well, it's not big.

translation.lb: Henkels Fraçois.
translation.en: Henkels François.

translation.lb: Ja, an der Saach sin éch och nach emmer net ganz grén; wann dé Huren och emol höllefe genésse géwen, sie hau och ewell bezahlen helfen, wôrfan sie och net alles hâten.
translation.en: Yes, I am also not entirely convinced on this matter; if those folks also need to benefit from help, they surely also helped pay for things, otherwise they would not have had all of it either.

translation.lb: Chantges Hanspéter.
translation.en: Chantges Hanspéter.

translation.lb: Mèngs du fleicht dé ésclit Réngelwalz dé de Lokalverein krett liât a fan dem Gemenge-Budget bezahlt ass gien; du weist de Fonctionnären ue Mont e bess'che längen.
translation.en: Do you perhaps think it is the engagement party that the local club holds and gets paid for from the municipal budget; you want to give the officials a little extra? '

translation.lb: Dâss déng Ménong net, ech glèwen du häst neist dergent wa mer op dé nemlecht Manéer nach eng Wiegenäth hätten.
translation.en: That's not your opinion, I believe you would not mind if we had another cradle ceremony in the same manner.'

translation.lb: Jaans Franz.
translation.en: Jaans Franz.

translation.lb: Wat get dût, wann dé Beamten dofoan gewahr gien?
translation.en: What happens if the officials become aware of it?

translation.lb: Chantges Hanspéter.
translation.en: Chantges Hanspéter.

translation.lb: Oo Efalt do, dann hoan dé alt no néist derfoan erem, der Jonge si mir kèng.
translation.en: Oh nonsense, then they have nothing again, the young ones are nothing to me.

translation.lb: Maja, Quetschen och!
translation.en: Oh well, Quetschen too!

translation.lb: Den Hàr K. Nu sot mir emol, Joffer, wé ass dât, dass dât schént Gesohlecht, wann et iwer drességer Johr kömmt, uné enner d'Hauff ze kommen, op émoi esö fromm get an net mé aus der Kiréoh a fun de Pressessionen ze ferdreiwen ass?
translation.en: Mr. K. Now tell me, miss, why is it that the fair sex, when it reaches over thirty years, suddenly becomes so pious and is no longer to be driven out of church and processions?

translation.lb: D'Joffer X. Dât wöll éch iéch son, Här K. Wa mir dén Alter errêcht hun, da gi mir esö fromm, fir onsem Herrgott ze danken, dass en ons firum Deiwel a Miinnergestalt bewahrt hûot.
translation.en: Miss X. I will tell you that, Mr. K. When we reach that age, we become so pious to thank our Lord for having preserved us from the devil in men's form.

translation.lb: Op der Pompel.

translation.en: Mine hasn't come for a few days now!

translation.en: Mary: Then he doesn't desire you either.

translation.lb: Ech si kên Owend elèng, a wann liién net komme kann, weil en dem Kapellmêschter Note schreiwen muss, da schéckt en en ânere fun. der Musik.
translation.en: I am never alone in the evening, and if he can't come because he has to write notes for the choir master, he sends another from the band.

translation.en: "Mechel, you truly are a complete fool and not even worth a bean anymore!"

translation.en: "Yes, old comfort, I already can taste that here on my whisky!"

translation.en: Just think, Madame, the rest of the bread from yesterday was probably taken by the cat, it's no longer in the cupboard!

translation.en: Mr. Flénk. Those are your calculations!

translation.en: You have already brought so many farces in your paper that have really made me laugh,

translation.en: now I, as an old subscriber, have also had the courage to write a story in your paper, one that caused much laughter here on Kirchberg.

translation.lb: Zwén deitscher Fèchtbrider hâte' séch emol bis erop bei ôns feriert a se hâten och schons bal Haus fir Haus durch gefècht, bis se schlésléch ûowen un d'Enn a Krôneméchels hiren Haff era si kommt.
translation.en: Two German fencing brothers once came up to us and had almost fought house to house until they finally reached the end and arrived at Krôneméchels' yard.

translation.lb: Den Hond, a séngem Heischen ugestréckt huet wuol gént se gebaubst, ma ons zwê Straubénger wäre schons dèr Komplimènte' gewinnt a sin och gléekléch bis an d'Kiche' komt,
translation.en: The dog, tied up in its kennel, barked at them, but our two rascals were already used to such compliments and happily made it into the kitchen,

translation.lb: wo wuol kèng liéwég Sél ze gesi war, ma do um Kichendösch gesögen s'ower e gröst Döppe foll déck Brach stôn an en halwe' Rûocht Bröd derniéwend leien.
translation.en: where not a single living soul was to be seen, but on the kitchen table, they saw a large pot full of thick porridge and a half loaf of smoked bread beside it.

translation.lb: Et war d'Féerauerbrôd fir d'Gésenn, dât ûowent dem Haiï am Kàrschnatz war.
translation.en: It was the supper for the servants who were working in the barn that evening.

translation.lb: Ons zwê Pèchtlappen hu sech mat den A'n telegraphéert a gleich ferstanen; dên ên hûot d'Brachdöppen erwöscht, dên aner de Rûocht Brôd a wé de Bletz waren se zur Dir aus a fort mat der Schlabeitzchen.
translation.en: Our two rascals signaled each other with their eyes and immediately understood; one grabbed the porridge pot, the other the smoked bread, and like lightning, they were out the door and off with the supplies.

translation.lb: D'Hausméschtesch war fort fir d'Gesenn zum Owebrôd ze ruffen an den arme Pilax huot séch ail Mé ugedo'n fir d'Ausrösser ze arettéeren, ower bernique!
translation.en: The housemistress had gone to call the servants for supper and the poor overseer made every effort to catch the rogues, but to no avail!

translation.lb: il a ch'ànté avec la corde au cou!
translation.en: He sang with the rope around his neck!

translation.lb: En ètléch honnert Meter weit fum Haff ower hâten ons zwê Dâchdéf séch hannert èng deck Heek gedréckt an hun séch d'Brach gut sch mache gelost;
translation.en: A few hundred meters away from the yard, however, our two roof thieves had pressed themselves behind a thick hedge and allowed themselves to enjoy the porridge;

translation.lb: èngem deitsche Fechtbruder sei Mo ass onferbesserléch.
translation.en: one of the German fencing brothers has an irreparable stomach.

translation.lb: Iwerdem passéert de Schankejud aus der Stâdt un hinne ferbei; e war dûscht'rég an dûofir hûot en dé zwê gebiéden, se sollten him e Mont foll Brach matgin.
translation.en: In the meantime, the tavern Jew from the city passed by them; he was dying of thirst and therefore asked the two to give him a mouthful of porridge.

translation.lb: De Jud war es zefriden, drénkt de Rèscht aus, bedankt séch a schreckt mam Brachdöppen op den Haff zô;
translation.en: The Jew was satisfied, drank the rest, thanked them and hurried back to the yard with the porridge pot;

translation.lb: ons zwè Straubénger hn gleich Pêschtegèld gin, a sin durch de Märtesgrond ferduft.
translation.en: our two rascals gave themselves spending money and vanished through the Märtesgrond.

translation.lb: Iwerdèm war d'Mêsehtesch mat Kniécht a Méd an d'Kiche' komt, ower d'Gesîchter, dé do gèschnide' se gin, wé d'Brach a Brôd fort waren, dé ka jiderên séch firstellen
translation.en: In the meantime, the mistress, with the servants and maids, came into the kitchen, but the expressions on their faces when the porridge and bread were gone, anyone can imagine,

translation.lb: an onglécklécher Weis trött den arme Schankejud och gcad dén Amènt mat dem eidlen Döppen ân.
translation.en: and unfortunately, the poor tavern Jew also returned that evening with the empty pot.

translation.lb: Ma iwer dât Drénkgèld, wât hién do fit séng Guthèt erwéscht hûot, bari'tßer beê Säugers Grösz an Handschlag, Här Letzeburger, fun èrem Abonnent, dem Schandeis Miitt,
translation.en: But regarding that drink money, which he received for his goodness, receive both my kind regards and handshake, Mr. Luxembourger, from your subscriber, Schandeis Miitt,

translation.lb: Am Cercle.
translation.en: In the Circle.

translation.lb: Eng Geschichtgen zum Erbârmen.
translation.en: A story to make one sorry.

translation.lb: Et war gént drei Auer mûorgens, also op desen Nofûossondég, an d'Lcit hun ugefàngen séch fum Bâl ze verlâfen;
translation.en: It was around three o'clock in the morning, on this Sunday night, and the people began to leave the ball;

translation.lb: de Mûorgen hûot se no'm Sangen a Sprangen an d'Duckel gedriwen, weil all Eerléchkêt kritt en Enn.
translation.en: the morning has driven them into darkness after singing and dancing, because all pleasures come to an end.

translation.lb: All Portemonnaie kritt schléssléch d'Flemm a refuséert den Déngseht, wann d'Bên séch och net wolle gin; dâss d'Schicksâl der Wèlt!
translation.en: Every wallet eventually tires out and refuses service, even if the legs won't want to go; that's the fate of the world!

translation.lb: Mûoncher ên hûot wûol do iwer dem op hêm Stiérkle fir séch hi' genûrelt: „Oh du lieber Augustin, Alles ist hin!"
translation.en: Many a person might have mumbled to themselves on the way home: "Oh dear Augustin, all is lost!"

translation.lb: Mais enfin, t'inuss nun êmol Fûosend ; gemacht gin, weil Wann d'Plaumebett Och flête gêt, Dât dêt haut kèngem wé;
translation.en: But finally, there is a big thousand; made indeed, because when the plum bed floats away, that doesn't hurt anyone today;

translation.lb: Sin d'Oscht'ren do, Da brauch é jo Dât wârmt Gedècks net mé.
translation.en: When Easter is here, then one doesn't need a warm cover anymore.

translation.lb: Enne' bei der Ausgangsdir zur Paschtôeschgâss stong em dé Zeit also gént drei Auer Mûorgens e Böf fu 5 bis 6 Johr ze möfferen.
translation.en: Down by the exit to Paschtôeschgâss stood at that time around three in the morning, a little boy of 5 to 6 years.

translation.lb: Fun de Passante' gefrot wât en do géf machen, oder op wién en dét wârden, göf den arme Krîpi zur Entwert: ~Ech wârden op méng Mamm, se hûot séch ferklet."
translation.en: Asked by passers-by what he was doing there, or whom he was waiting for, the poor lad answered: ~I am waiting for my mother, she got lost."

translation.lb: E Bravo fir esö èng Mamm, oder: hat der Deiwel s'och fleicht gehollt?
translation.en: A cheer for such a mother, or: did the devil perhaps take her?
