translation.lb: Porzelein, Porzelein an Ierdegeschir.
translation.en: Porcelain, porcelain and earthenware.

translation.lb: Op ènger Soirée hâte' fir Kûorzem zwô Damen aus onser Aristokratie en Diskur iwer hiren, de Birger-, an de Stand fun de klènge Leiden an den Ennerschèd fun dênen.
translation.en: At a recent evening gathering, two ladies from our aristocracy had a discussion about their, the bourgeois, and the social standing of the little people, and the differences thereof.

translation.lb: Wösst dir, Madame sot du dé èng onse Stand, dàt hêscht, de Stand fun der haute volée, ass gént dê vun onse Bierger hirem ze fergleichen, wé feine Porzelein gént gewenekléche Porzelein; an dê fun de Bierger gént dê fun onse klènge' Leiden wé Porzelein gént lerdegeschir.
translation.en: You know, Madame, said one of them, our social standing, that is, the position of the high society, is comparable to that of our citizens like fine porcelain against usual porcelain; and that of the citizens against that of our little people like porcelain against earthenware.

translation.lb: Net anneschter kann éch mer dé Sach betrûochten.
translation.en: I cannot view the matter any differently.

translation.lb: De Jang, hire Bedéngter, hûot dêm Diskur nogelauschtert a seint derbei geduocht, a wé d'Madame dé e klènge Bibi hât den aner Dàg zu him gesot huot,
translation.en: Jang, her servant, overheard this discussion and thought to himself, and when Madame told him the next day to bring a small baby,

translation.lb: „Jang, gé ruf d'Nourrice mam Könnchen erop!"
translation.en: "Jang, go call the nurse with the little pot up!"

translation.lb: dû lêft e bis an d'Trâp a rift: Hê, ierdent Môlléchgeschir, bréngt dât klèng Stéck Porzelein erop bei d'Madame!
translation.en: he ran to the stairs and shouted: Hey, any earthen milk pot, bring that small piece of porcelain up to Madame!

translation.lb: Onmanéerléch.
translation.en: Rude.

translation.lb: Den Zug hat schon ofgepaff, e wor es 6 guor schon am Gang, du kömmt e jugendléchen Hèr iwer den Trottoir lânscht Post gelâf wat gess a wat huos de.
translation.en: The train had already departed, it was already underway by 6, when a young gentleman ran along the sidewalk past the post office, all flustered.

translation.lb: Mei guden Zugführer Max, galant wé emmer, peift halt.
translation.en: My good train conductor Max, gallant as always, whistles for a stop.

translation.lb: Hu der e Billet, rift en dem Hèr entgént.
translation.en: Do you have a ticket, he calls out to the gentleman.

translation.lb: Nên, rift dên ausser Otem.
translation.en: No, he replies, out of breath.

translation.lb: Wuor gi der dann? sot de Max weider.
translation.en: Where are you going then? Max continues.

translation.lb: Dàt gêt iéch neischt un, wor d'Entwert.
translation.en: That's none of your business, was the answer.

translation.lb: Wéné ass Kirmessondég zu Letzeburg?
translation.en: When is Kirmes Sunday in Luxembourg?

translation.lb: Jo, wéné ass da Kirmessondeg zu Letzeburg? esd fret jiderê séch.
translation.en: Yes, when is Kirmes Sunday in Luxembourg? everyone is asking themselves.

translation.lb: Dé eng son t'wär de 29. August, dé âner de 5. September;
translation.en: Some say it would be the 29th of August, others the 5th of September;

translation.lb: t'sin esô gùor Kalènnern, dé den 5. September tir Kirmessondeg an de grosse Véhmàrt dèn emmer Kirmesméndeg gehàle get, fir de 30. August ugin.
translation.en: there are calendars that list the 5th of September as Kirmes Sunday and the large market that is always held on Kirmes Monday starting from August 30.

translation.lb: Wéné bâcke mer nun de Kuch, dir Damen?
translation.en: When do we bake the cake, ladies?

translation.lb: gelt, t'wèss kê Mensch et.
translation.en: Really, no one knows.

translation.lb: Abê, da lauschtert: de 5. September ass Kirmessondeg: a wuofir?
translation.en: But listen: the 5th of September is Kirmes Sunday: and why?

translation.lb: desen Tàg ass den éschte Sondeg am Mond, a fällt grad no Monaco-Empfàngniss, an dût ass de wichtesten a schénsten Dàg fir all Beamten an en général fir jidderèn.
translation.en: This day is the first Sunday of the month, and falls right after Monaco's reception, and that is the most important and beautiful day for all officials and generally for everyone.

translation.lb: wàt mèngt dir duorzd l lär Letzeburger?
translation.en: What do you think about that, dear Luxembourgers?

translation.lb: An der Zeit, wé den deitschen „Hassefluch" nach Gouverneur hei zu Letzeburg war e Spréchwûort gêt nach haut hei em „Hassenfluch unb Stiift, (sei Sekretär) fyaben baâ ijauje Banb rcrgift du ass dên op èngem Ausflucht bis no léchternach geroden, wo e fun den Häre fum Conseil op d'Bèscht empfangen ass gin, weil alles lniot e gefûorcht.
translation.en: At the time when the German 'Hassefluch' was still governor here in Luxembourg, there is still a saying today about 'Hassenfluch and his Secretary Stiift', that they got lost on an excursion all the way to Echternach, where he was received by the gentlemen from the council in the best way because everyone feared him.

translation.lb: Owends gdf den Här Burgermêschter him zur Eer en dichteche Bankett, bei dêm ass onsen Hassefluch och zweschent dên an den Här Paschtöer sötze körn.
translation.en: In the evening, the mayor held a sumptuous banquet in his honor, during which our Hassefluch was also able to sit between them and the pastor.

translation.lb: Bei dèr Gelegenhêt liûot en sech dann och lassgelôsst, séng Farcen hun alles zum Lâche brûocht, wât séch um Bankett bedêlégt hât.
translation.en: On this occasion, he let himself loose, his farces brought everyone at the banquet to laughter.

translation.lb: De sèlwegten Owend hûot èng fransésech Théatertrupp èng Firstellonk zu léchternach opgeféert an t'gof du och beschloss, dass no'm léssen d'ganz Gesellschaft hîr beiwûonen dét.
translation.en: That same evening, a French theater troupe performed a play in Echternach and it was also decided that after reading it, the whole company would attend.

translation.lb: Alles war mat dem Firschlâg âferstânen, bis op den Här Paschtöer, dê Haute gewénkt huot, wèll d'Régle fun der Kiréch him den Theaterbesuch déte ferbiden.
translation.en: Everyone agreed with the proposal, except for the pastor who objected because the rules of the church forbade him from attending the theater.

translation.lb: Onsen Hassefluch hûot all sei Latein opgesicht, fir den Här zum Matgôn ze beriéden, weil dât, wât d'Théatertrupp géf spillen, „Les Mémoires du Diable" e wonnerschént Stéck wir; ma onse guden Här liûot de Kapp gerösselt a schléssléch zur Entwert gin: „Wesst dir wât, Här Gouverneur, mei Firschlâg ass, kommt dir léwer bei méch beichten, da kréen éch wahrscheinlech e Begrefï'fun dêm schéne Stéck!"
translation.en: Our Hassefluch mustered all his persuasion to convince the pastor to go along because what the theater troupe would play, 'Les Mémoires du Diable,' was a wonderful piece; but our good pastor shook his head and finally replied: 'You know what, Governor, my suggestion is, you'd better come confess to me, then I'll probably get an understanding of that wonderful piece!'

translation.lb: Zu dêm Firschlâg ower hûot den Henker fu Letzeburg och Raute gewénkt.
translation.en: However, the hangman from Luxembourg also refused this suggestion.

translation.lb: Ma en hûot e Gesicht geschniden, wé en Döppe foll Deiw'len.
translation.en: But he made a face as if he had swallowed a pot full of devils.

translation.lb: Schóschter, bleif bei déngem Lêscht.
translation.en: Shoemaker, stick to your last.

translation.lb: Eng âl, krankléch J offer fu Letzeburg, dé an hirem Liéwen neischt weider gesin hàt, wé d'Gâsse fun der Stâdt, d'Kiérchen an hir Kâtzen an Honn, un dé s'och wierklech bis zum Stierwe' fergaddert war, hûot sech op de Kot fun den Dokt'ren èndlech entschloss, fir no Mondorf an de Bâd ze rêsen.
translation.en: An old, sickly lady from Luxembourg, who in her life had seen nothing beyond the streets of the city, the churches, and her cats and dogs, to which she was truly attached till death, finally decided, at the urging of doctors, to travel to Mondorf for a bath.

translation.lb: Hir Honn, hir Kâtzen an hirt Kuomermt:dchen, si waren an hirer Beglêtonk dohin, weil oné dât feerbängecht (iedêssems könnt se guor net liéwen.
translation.en: Her dogs, her cats, and her maid accompanied her because without them she could not live at all.

translation.lb: Zu Mondorf nkommt, huot s'och all Dâg, wann nemmen d'Wiédér et zö huot gelost en Ausflucht gemacht a bei dèr G-elênhêt ass s'et du och gewûor gin, dass d'Groinp'ren an d'Frucht um lerdbuoden an net op de Bêm gezilt géwen, èppes.
translation.en: Upon arriving in Mondorf, she went on an excursion every day when the weather allowed, and on such an occasion, she also came to realize that grains and fruit grow on the ground and not on trees, something she could not marvel at enough.

translation.lb: wo 'riwer se séch net genug könnt ferwonneren.
translation.en: which she could not marvel at enough.

translation.lb: Op èngem Haff hûot s'ên Dàg, a fir d'éscht an hirem Liéwen. éng Kluck mat Hénckele gesin, an dàt Schlaufe f'un dé Klengen enger der Aler hir Flékenken hûot hier sd gut gefallt, dass se der Hûoffrâ fir den dûob'le Wiértk d'Kluck mat den Henkelen ofkâft hûot.
translation.en: One day, at a farm, and for the first time in her life, she saw a hen with chicks, and she liked the snuggling of the small ones against the older one's wings so much that she bought the hen with the chicks from the farm lady for double the value.

translation.lb: Dé gôf der Joffer dann och Beschêd iwer d'Héngerfuder, wobei ass d'Wèlschkûor d'Haproll géf spillen an hûot er nach eng gut Portion derfun zum Geschenk gemächt.
translation.en: The lady then informed her about the chicken feed, with corn playing the main role, and she also gifted her a good portion of it.

translation.lb: Ons âl Flitt war esö fun hirer neier Zucht âgehollt, dass kên âner wé sî se dûorft tideren, a se könnt sech bàl zu Dbd lachen, wa se gesin liuot, wé hir klèng Hénkelcher sech un dé deckecli Kiéren gewot hun.
translation.en: Our old lady was so taken by her new brood that only she was allowed to care for them, and she almost collapsed with laughter when she saw how her little chicks dared to tackle the thick kernels.

translation.lb: ma 6ne se ze friéssen.
translation.en: but started to eat them.

translation.lb: Ower den zwêten Dàg dûorno. wé se hir gefligelt Zucht mûorgens wollt fideren, du löge meng arem Hcnkelclier do an hun d'Flélenken an d'Bên ewèch gestreckt; si waren all steif an död.
translation.en: But the second day thereafter, when she wanted to feed her feathered brood in the morning, my poor chicks were lying there with their wings and legs stretched out; they were all stiff and dead.

translation.lb: Hiren Eifer liât kèng Grenzen; gleich scheckt se hirt Kûomermédche bei d'Hûoffrâ a lest se bei sech rufen..
translation.en: Her zeal knew no bounds; she immediately sent her maid to the farm lady and summoned her.

translation.lb: Dé krut du och de Kapitel laut Nöte fun ouser Joffer geliést, sî liätt se mat hiren Hénkelcher op de Leim geféert.wêll dé hätten all d'Kripp gehuot.
translation.en: She read her the riot act according to the notes from our lady, accusing her of having led her chicks to ruin because they had all caught the cramp.

translation.lb: v D'gut Huoffrâ hûot d'Hänn um Kapp zesûome geschlo'n a gefrot, wömat se dé da gefidert hätt?
translation.en: The good farm lady clasped her hands on her head and asked what she had fed them with?

translation.lb: „"We! wômat gefidert?" hûot ons AI gejaut, „wbmat hätt éch dé da solle hderen?
translation.en: "What! fed them with what?" our old lady shouted, "What was I supposed to feed them with?

translation.lb: dûolir war jo d'Kluck do, un dèr ass si séch sàt hätte können drénken!"
translation.en: After all, the hen was there, and they could have sated themselves on her!"

translation.lb: An der Schól. E Schôlmêschter an der Arithmétiksstonn:
translation.en: In the school. A schoolmaster in the arithmetic lesson:

translation.lb: T'kann ên nomme Sachen fun ènger Natur zesuomen addéeren:
translation.en: One can only add together things of the same nature:

translation.lb: kê Schof mat ènger Kôh, kê Kallef mat èngem Ox;
translation.en: no sheep with a cow, no calf with an ox;

translation.lb: dât génge wéder zwë Schof nach zwö Kéh; wéder zwê Kälwer. nach zwê Oxe gin.
translation.en: that would neither become two sheep nor two cows; neither two calves nor two oxen.

translation.en: that's always correct, because when my mother pours a liter of water into a liter of milk, then she always gets two liters of milk!

translation.lb: En Affekotekniff.
translation.en: A Lawyer's Trick.

translation.lb: Zu Dikreoh stöng eil deitsche Straubenger am Tribenal; e war ugeklot, èngem éslenker Bauer èng Harn geföscht ze liun.
translation.en: A German vagabond stood before the tribunal in Dikreoh, accused of having stolen a horse from a poor farmer.

translation.lb: Wèll en ower d'Möttlen net hât, fir sech en Affekot ze stellen, dû göf ê fun de jéngste fun do ugewisen. fir dem Ugeklote mat sengem bèschte Rot beizesprangen.
translation.en: Since he didn't have the means to hire a lawyer, one of the youngest there was assigned to assist the accused with his best advice.

translation.lb: Dé zwê hu sech dûorop an en Niéwenzömmer fum Cferîchtsgebei zreckgezun an hun zwo Stonne lang neischt mé fu sech héere gelost.
translation.en: The two then retreated to a side room of the courthouse and for two hours nothing more was heard from them.

translation.lb: D'Rîchteren, dé des Wardens mitt, schéken en Huissier an hu lost frôen ûor hir Ennerriédeng net bâl zu Enn wir?
translation.en: The judges, tired of waiting, sent a bailiff to ask if their consultation was not almost finished?

translation.lb: Ma dé war schons lang ferbei; den Affekot trött kürz drop oné sei Straubenger ân a gôf hinnen de Beschêd:
translation.en: But it was already long over; shortly thereafter the lawyer emerged without his client and informed them:

translation.lb: „Dir Hären hât mir übefûol ech sollt dem Ugeklote mat mengem bèschte Rot beisprangen, a weil e mer seng Schold agestânen hûot, du könnt ech him kê bessere gin, wé sech durch d'Reiser ze machen, wât en och wierklech fir zwo Stonnen zur Fenster aus gedo'n hûot!"
translation.en: "You gentlemen instructed me to assist the accused with my best advice, and since he admitted his guilt to me, I could do no better than to advise him to make an escape, which he indeed did, through the window, two hours ago!"

translation.lb: De Klautchen als Hèxenthommes.
translation.en: The Thief as a Witchmaster.

translation.lb: Motto: Bei Schwéerleiden Eclem sin, Dat uss net emmer schén;
translation.en: Motto: When in great suffering, to be discreet is indeed not always nice;

translation.lb: Dé Aal beim (ieldschâf WÛooht iéch stin, T'get Sondes wéneg Spén.
translation.en: The old people with the sheep do I stand, on Sundays there are few woes.

translation.lb: Wûol dènkt don Edem da fir seoh: -D'Gelênhet uiuss du notzen, Wanna du en d'Bourse kauns bofczen, Sie denken net un decb.
translation.en: Whereupon, however, someone thinks for themselves: -You must use the opportunity, when you can pocket something in the purse, they don't think of you.

translation.lb: Ech köm emol op èngem Focktûr bis a i e bekannt Baurenhaus zu Dippech a kaum bannen der Dir stöngen do dé âl, Männchen a Präclien an hu Gesichter gcs hniden ~wé Beck, dé Holzappel gebafft hun.
translation.en: I once came on business as far as a certain farmhouse in Dippech and had barely crossed the threshold when there stood the old folks, men and women, their faces carved ~ like beech trees, chiseled by the wooden apple.

translation.lb: D'Sâch ower war dé hei: onsen Ale waren 20 Mark aus hirem Stromp geluxt gin, ma wider Junge, wider Kniécht, Med nach Edem wollten eppes fun dêm Défstàll wössen.
translation.en: The matter, however, was this: our elders had been swindled out of 20 marks from their sock, but each young one, each servant didn't want to know anything about the theft.

translation.lb: Wé du ons Al mir hirt Lèd geklogt hâten, du dûocht ech bei mir, „du bass net op deng pékeg Nùos gefällt a wo Golt wollt, kanns du hei e pûor Mark Schinu machen.
translation.en: When the old ones complained their sorrow to me, I thought to myself, "you haven't lived in vain and where gold is concerned, you can earn a few marks here.

translation.lb: Op mei Wunsch hun ons Al ailes, wàt fun Zwêbânger Leif a Liéwen ain Haus liât, an d'Stutf gerufft;
translation.en: At my request, our old folks gathered everything, with trembling body and soul, into the room;

translation.lb: andêms ower hun ech mech dran emgekukt ur ech kên Enstremènt geség, fir menger Hexérei Fdsz ze ferschâfen, a rîchteg, do beim Takesschâf hong e Flönt fun Anno Tubak.
translation.en: meanwhile, however, I peered around among all, as I didn't see any instrument for my witchcraft to embellish, and sure enough, there by the kitchen cabinet hung an old pipe from ages past.

translation.lb: Dât hun ech mer erof gelicht a wé ech ailes zesûomen liât, du sot ech: „T'sin 20 Mark aus dem Schâf a Strômp fersch Wonnen an ê fun iéch ass den Déf.
translation.en: I took it down and when I'd gathered everything together, I said, "It's 20 marks stolen from the drawer and sock, and one of you is the thief.

translation.lb: Elo blést en nbm aner fun iéch hei an dê Flönteröer: wién onschölleg ass, kann dât frei din, ma Wéh déni Schöllegen, wêll no'm Blose krâcht dêm e Schotz draus an de Kapp an e rnuss stierwen.
translation.en: Now each of you blow into this old pipe one by one: whoever is innocent can do it freely, but woe to the guilty, for after blowing, a bullet will shoot out into his head and he will die.

translation.lb: Wé de Wand köm en no'm aneren erbei an hûot goblosen, dass em d'Bâken opgelàft sin,
translation.en: Like the wind, they came one after another and blew until their cheeks swelled,

translation.lb: blés den Edem ass emmer mé op d'Dir zö retiréert a wé et u sein Tour körn, du hûot en op Armen a Bên gezidert.
translation.en: blowing, while one always retreated more towards the door and when it was his turn, he trembled on arms and legs.

translation.lb: Wé ech em du zögerufft hun, t'wir u sengem Tûr fir ze blosen, du fängt en un ze inöfferen a sot, sei Liéwe wir em dach léwer wé dé arm 20 Mark, dé en hêmlech gestebitzt hätt,
translation.en: When I called to him that it was his turn to blow, he began to hesitate and said, his life was indeed dearer to him than the poor 20 marks that he had secretly pocketed,

translation.lb: greift a seng Täsch an èskamotéert s'am Ale seng.
translation.en: he reached into his pocket and conjured it into the old folks' hands.

translation.lb: Ur e fun dêm séng Absolution, a wàt fir eng Boss e krit hûot, dùorno hun ech net gefrot a war mat denen zwo Mark zefriden, dé ech fir mei Kônschtsteck fun onsem Alen ergaddert hât.
translation.en: What kind of absolution or scolding he received afterward, I did not ask and was content with the two marks I garnered for my little art piece from our old folks.

translation.en: Doctor X. was urgently summoned to a rich lady who had injured herself with the breadknife on the hand.

translation.en: After examining the wound, he instructed the servant to run to the pharmacy and get a certain plaster.

translation.lb: ®ie grau erfdjracf hierüber unb fragte gang beftürjt: Oh, Här Dokter, t'wärt dach keng Gefohr sin?
translation.en: The lady was shocked and asked anxiously: Oh, Doctor, there is no danger, is there?

translation.lb: Oh dach, Madame, antiuortete ritljig ber Strjt, well wann d'Meedchen net ganz hurteg leeft, dann ass d'Wonn gehêlt, ier et erem ass.
translation.en: Oh yes, Madam, the doctor replied calmly, because if the girl doesn't run very quickly, then the wound will be healed before she returns.

translation.lb: Beim Möttegiéssen.
translation.en: At the breakfast table.

translation.lb: De Papp (zum Böf): Gêss de wuöl mat de Fangeren aus der Nuos, ass dât eng Manéer!
translation.en: The father (to the boy): Are you picking your nose with your fingers, is that proper behavior!

translation.lb: D'Mamm. Lôss en dach gewiérde, Pappa, den arme Jong huot Wîrem.
translation.en: The mother: Let him be, Papa, the poor boy has worms.

translation.lb: De Papp. Ass dat woer Emil, du häss Wîrem? duorfir géfs du an der Nuos kriwelen?
translation.en: The father: Is that true, Emil, you have worms? Is that why you're picking your nose?

translation.lb: Den Emil. Nê, Pappa d'Mamma kêft ons emmer Wiremkichelcher, wa raer an der Nuos wullen, an elo si keng nié do;
translation.en: Emil: No, Papa, Mama always buys us worm biscuits when there's a tickling in the nose, and now there are none;

translation.lb: dn huot onse Léon gesot, ech soll dess Woch an der Nuos kriwele fir der erern ze kréen, dé fireg Woch hätt hien dra gewullt.
translation.en: then our Leon said I should pick my nose this week to get some, because he had wanted to last week.

translation.lb: Klor oder deïschter.
translation.en: Clear or dark.

translation.lb: En Här, dê muorges fréh sollt opstôn fir ze ferrèsen, an dê gefuorcht huot, sech ze verschlofen, rift an der Nuocht sei Bedéngter:
translation.en: A gentleman, who was supposed to get up early in the morning to travel, and who feared oversleeping, calls his servant in the night:

translation.lb: Jang, gé emol kucken, op et nach deischter ass!
translation.en: Jang, go and see if it is still dark!

translation.lb: De Jang kuckt aus: Här, t'ass nach alles deischter!
translation.en: Jang looks out: Sir, it's still all dark!

translation.lb: Dabo, rift den Här an engem lerger, wé kanns de dàt da wössen!
translation.en: Then, the gentleman shouts angrily, how can you know that!

translation.lb: Fänk der eng Lûcht un an da gehs de domat kucken, op et klor oder nach deischter ass.
translation.en: Light a lamp and then go see if it's clear or still dark.

translation.lb: Enfant terrible.
translation.en: Terrible child.

translation.lb: D'Mamma: Ons neit Meedchen hêscht mat sengem Familienuom „Engel"'.
translation.en: The mother: Our new girl is called "Angel" with her family name.

translation.lb: De klenge Jämpi. Ma esö huot dât firdrun och gehêscht.
translation.en: The little Jämpi: But that's what it was called before.

translation.lb: D'Mamma. Ma nên.
translation.en: The mother: But no.

translation.lb: De Jäinpi. Ma têt, Mamma, éch hun emmer gehéert, dass mei Pappa zu em sot: Mein Engel.
translation.en: Jämpi: But yes, Mama, I always heard that my Dad called her: My angel.

translation.lb: Ah, duorfir.
translation.en: Ah, therefore.

translation.lb: Den Dokter Y. (am Park, zu séngem Frend): Jesses, do könnt den Här F., kuck, emol wàt e meoh esö elle fixéert!
translation.en: Doctor Y. (in the park, to his friend): Goodness, there comes Mr. F., look, how he is strangely staring at me!

translation.lb: Lôss mer ons hei d'Seit ausmachen.
translation.en: Let's decide the time here.

translation.lb: Ech hu jo dêm séng Schwéermamm zwê Mént lang behandelt.
translation.en: I have treated his mother-in-law for two months.

translation.lb: De Frend (schmotzlàchelt): Aha, ech ferstin; do huos de nêss èng geliwert, dass se ofgekrâtzt ass!
translation.en: The friend (smiling slyly): Aha, I understand; you must have done such a job that she passed away!

translation.lb: Den Dokter (traureg): Au contraire, ech hun er erern op d'Bê gehollef.
translation.en: The doctor (sadly): On the contrary, I actually helped her get back on her feet.

translation.lb: Och èng Expéditión.
translation.en: Yet another expedition.

translation.lb: Den Dokter X. kömmt em Hallefnuocht bei e Kutscheverlönert.
translation.en: Doctor X. arrives at midnight at a carriage rental place.

translation.lb: a freet wât et kém fir e mat ènger Kutsch bis no Kopplescht ze expédiéeren.
translation.en: and asks how much it would cost to dispatch him with a carriage to Kopplescht.

translation.lb: Drösseg Prang, Här Dokter.
translation.en: Thirty francs, Doctor.

translation.lb: Zappristi, dât ass deier!
translation.en: Zounds, that's expensive!

translation.lb: Ja Här Dokter, drönner kann ech et ower net mächen;
translation.en: Yes, Doctor, I really can't do it for less;

translation.lb: iwregens, wann dier ên expédiéert, dât könnt nach fill rné deier.
translation.en: besides, if someone sends you, it might end up being even more expensive.

translation.lb: Fun der Ennerpietres.
translation.en: From the Ennerpietres.

translation.lb: Den aie Chasseur (zuui Posteljong).
translation.en: The old hunter (to the postilion).

translation.lb: Kuck, do gêt den Thills Haré mat sengem Spitz; du kanns net gl êwe' wit dât fir e klugen Hônd ass; eck kann deck fersécheren.
translation.en: Look, there goes Thills Hare with his Spitz dog; you cannot believe how clever that dog is; I can assure you.

translation.lb: en ass mé gescheit wé sein Idar.
translation.en: He is more intelligent than his master.

translation.lb: De Posteljong.
translation.en: The postilion.

translation.lb: Erenner meck net drun, mei léwe Chasseur, weil eck hat freer grad esô ên.
translation.en: Don't remind me, my dear hunter, because I used to have just such a one.

translation.lb: Beim Exerzice. Den Haplmànn (rift e Kaprol. dên en etlech falsch Schwènkonge gemacht liât, firun d'Front ail donnert dêm z 6).
translation.en: During the exercise. The captain calls a corporal who made several false marches and thunders at him in front of the company.

translation.lb: Kaprol ïtikes. nènnt mech sofort en lésel!
translation.en: Corporal Itikes, immediately call me a donkey!

translation.lb: Kaprol Rikes (erschreckt.) Här Haptmânn. Em Grotteswöllen?
translation.en: Corporal Rikes (shocked.) Captain. For heaven's sake?

translation.lb: Den Haptmânn (eifreg). Ech befielen iech, mech klor an deitlech en lésel ze nènnen!
translation.en: The captain (eagerly). I order you to clearly and distinctly call me a donkey!

translation.lb: De Kaprol (gepliifft.) Ower ech biéden iéch, Här Haptmânn, ech
translation.en: The corporal (flustered.) But I beg you, Captain, I

translation.lb: Den Haptmânn (an der Boserei.)..Här Kaprol, ech befielen iéch nu fir d'ièseht, mech en lésel ze nènnen!''
translation.en: The captain (in anger.)..Corporal, I now order you for the last time to call me a donkey!''

translation.lb: De Kaprol (mat Zidderen). Här Haptmânn, dir sit, wêll dir et sèlwer befielt en lésel.
translation.en: The corporal (trembling). Captain, you are, because you yourself command it, a donkey.

translation.lb: Den. Haptmânn (zefriden.) So ass et Recht, ower, wösst dir och fir wât?
translation.en: The captain (satisfied.) That's right, but do you know why?

translation.lb: Wèll ech iéch zum Ivaprol gemacht hun! Marsch erem a Rei a Glid!
translation.en: Because I have promoted you to sergeant! March back in line!

translation.lb: Falsch ferstsân.

translation.en: A guide (shows a German tourist the footbridge): Just take a look there where the red mark is, someone already jumped from there.

translation.en: The tourist: Oh? Out of melancholy?

translation.en: The guide: No sir, for fun!

translation.lb: Um Gericht.
translation.en: In court.

translation.lb: De Richter (zum Jämpi).
translation.en: The judge (to Jämpi).

translation.lb: Dir sit ugeklot d'Fra Dussel èng al Schlapp, en alen Dräch, en alt Briéchmôttel etc., etc. fernannt ze hun, gestit dir ère AViérder?
translation.en: You are accused of calling Mrs. Dussel an old rag, an old nag, an old beggar, etc., etc. Do you admit to these statements?

translation.lb: De Jämpi. Här Richter, dé Xiém do passe ganz gut op d'Fra Dussel, ower gesot hun ech se net.
translation.en: Jämpi. Mr. Judge, those terms do fit Mrs. Dussel quite well, but I have not said them.

translation.lb: An der Schól.
translation.en: In the school.

translation.lb: De ScholmAschter (iwerdêm en d'Scholdier opreîst).
translation.en: The schoolmaster (stands up and addresses the student).

translation.lb: Wât der Schönneker ass dât fir e greilecht Gedibber beibannen?
translation.en: What on earth is that awful mumbling going on?

translation.lb: De Mechelé.
translation.en: The Michael.

translation.lb: Här Scholmêschter. t'war mir e Steck Klùmpepobeier fuin Descb gefallt.
translation.en: Mr. Schoolmaster. A piece of crumpled paper fell off my desk.

translation.lb: Wié’ kóm?
translation.en: How come?

translation.lb: „Arn Fréjohr," esö huot ons lèschtlech onse Freud Josep erziélt, „hun ech mer a Messerichs an der Fläschiergass eng prachtvoll Collektion Blumenzwiebele' kâft.
translation.en: "In spring," as our friend Josep recently told us, "I bought myself a magnificent collection of flower bulbs in Messerichs on Flaeschier Street.

translation.lb: Ech hu mer dû beim Schreiner eng sché Ivöscht mâche lôsst, dé hun éch mat Buodem gefüllt, meng Zwiebelen dra gesét an se dû firaus op ons Fenster gestallt.
translation.en: I then had a nice wooden box made by the carpenter, filled it with soil, planted my bulbs in it and placed it out on our window ledge.

translation.lb: A wösst der wât du köm?
translation.en: And do you know what happened then?

translation.lb: „Natirlech sché Blumen."
translation.en: "Of course, beautiful flowers."

translation.lb: „Eng âl Möl, d'Poliss ass kommt, an se huot gesot éch sollt mân.
translation.en: "An old misunderstanding, the police came and said I should move it.

translation.lb: Dass dé Köscht vif erem ewèch kém, sonst krît ech e formen opgeschmiert.
translation.en: That the box must be removed again, otherwise I'd get a formal fine.

translation.lb: Gut Kanner.
translation.en: Good children.

translation.lb: D'Mamma.
translation.en: The mother.

translation.lb: Könnercher, dir hut dach hoffentlech dé Aeppel geschiélt, ier der se g'iéss hut?
translation.en: Children, you surely peeled the apples before you ate them?

translation.lb: D'Kanner.
translation.en: The children.

translation.lb: Oh gewess, Mamma!
translation.en: Oh certainly, Mother!

translation.lb: D'Mamma.
translation.en: The mother.

translation.lb: A wat hut der da mat de Schiéle gemacht?
translation.en: And what did you do with the peels?

translation.lb: D'Kanner.
translation.en: The children.

translation.lb: Dé hu mer durr.o g'iésst.
translation.en: We ate them around.

translation.lb: Verbabbelt.
translation.en: Confused.

translation.lb: Hién (muorges fréh).
translation.en: He (early in the morning).

translation.lb: Wât fehlt der da, mei Kand?
translation.en: What's wrong with you, my child?

translation.lb: Sie.
translation.en: She.

translation.lb: Jé, jé, géh!
translation.en: Yes, yes, go on!

translation.lb: Du wêss ganz gut, dass de geschter Owend nêss ugerachterêin kôms.
translation.en: You know quite well that you came home yesterday evening all wet.

translation.lb: Hién.
translation.en: He.

translation.lb: Wât? Ech? Ugerâcht?
translation.en: What? Me? Soaked?

translation.lb: Ech hâlen du drêras!
translation.en: I remember nothing of it!

translation.lb: Sie.
translation.en: She.

translation.lb: Vermach deoh elo net esö.
translation.en: Don't make excuses now.

translation.lb: Du huos mer et geschten Owend jo sèhver agestàn.
translation.en: You admitted it to me yourself last night.

translation.lb: Hién.
translation.en: He.

translation.lb: Wàt, sèhver agestân!
translation.en: What, admitted it myself!

translation.lb: Zapperlö.t, da muss éch ower kräi'teg am Damp gewitscht sin!
translation.en: Goodness, I must have been really in a fog then!

translation.lb: E Réthsel.
translation.en: A riddle.

translation.lb: Dobaûssen an der Gâss'Sti' Pél, t'si kromm a' rîchter,
translation.en: Outside on the street, a pole, it is crooked and tall,

translation.lb: Op zwê an zwê e Fâss An iwer déni en Trichter.
translation.en: On two by two, a barrel, and above it a funnel.

translation.lb: Eng Flächt an dann e Pöl.
translation.en: A plait and then a pole.

translation.lb: Zwo Lichten uôwen driwer An drop èng Planzeschôl,
translation.en: Two lights above it and on top a plant bowl,

translation.lb: Fleicht foll fun Ongeziwer.
translation.en: Perhaps full of vermin.

translation.lb: Wanns du e rèchte' Kluge' bass,
translation.en: If you are truly clever,

translation.lb: Da rot och êmol, wât dât ass.
translation.en: Then guess once what that is.

translation.lb: E. Mensch
translation.en: E. Mensch

translation.lb: En Certificat.
translation.en: A Certificate.

translation.lb: D'Madame.
translation.en: The Madam.

translation.lb: Also, dir hält gier en Certificat.
translation.en: So, you want to write a certificate here.

translation.lb: Ech wösst ower net wé ech dât ufänke soll, dass e gut géf.
translation.en: But I do not know how I should begin it so that it turns out well.

translation.lb: D'Mêdchen.
translation.en: The Girl.

translation.lb: Oh Madame, schreift nömmen drân dass ech et sechs Mént bei iéch ausgehàlen hun, dât ass Certificat genuch.
translation.en: Oh Madam, just write that I lasted six months with you, that is certificate enough.

translation.lb: Opschneidereien.
translation.en: Boasting.

translation.lb: (Fu méngem Mononk Haré Tlescht wor éch an engem Haus op e Familieconcert invitéert, dê schrecklech langweilech war.
translation.en: (For the last time in my uncle Harry’s, I was invited to a house concert that was dreadfully boring.)

translation.lb: Wé alles zu Enn war, fonnte mer op engem Fotell d'Gezei fun engem Här, den och invitéert war; fum Här sèlwer ower kèng Spur.
translation.en: When everything was over, we found the clothes of a gentleman who was also invited, on an armchair; but there was no trace of the gentleman himself.

translation.lb: Wât war mat em geschit?.... D'Langweil hât en opgefriéss!
translation.en: What happened to him?... Boredom had devoured him!

translation.lb: Do hun ech jo e Fransös kannt, dê war esö fertujjelt am Kapp, dass en èng Kéer Owes sei Gezei an d'Bett geluocht, sech sèlwer ower iwer d'Lién fum Stall gehang huot,, wo en och ganz rohég bis Muorges fréh, wö en erwacht ass, leie blof.
translation.en: There I knew a Frenchman who was so muddled in the head that one evening he put his clothes in bed and hung himself over the stable's railing, where he stayed quite calmly until early in the morning when he woke up and lay there naked.

translation.lb: Mä dat wor nach neischt gént mei Frend Toné; den huot eng Kéer d'brennend Bougie an d'Bett geluocht an séch sèlwer ausgeblosen.
translation.en: But that was nothing compared to my friend Toni; once he put the burning candle in bed and blew himself out.

translation.lb: Do hât ech och emol e Mononk, Gott tréscht en an der Ewegkêt, dê war lange Johre krank; kên Deiwel wosst wat em fehle géng.
translation.en: I also had an uncle, God rest him in eternity, who was ill for many years; no devil knew what was wrong with him.

translation.lb: kên Dokter könnt em hèllefen.
translation.en: No doctor could help him.

translation.lb: En ass alt bei de Schönner 110 Mainer gâng, e gong op Schönnerbeieren, bei de Paschtôer no Battincourt, bei de Kneip no Wörrishofen sein halleft Vermégen huot e ferdoktert, ower neischt huot gegraff.
translation.en: He often went to the Schönner 110 men, he went to Schönnerbeier, to the priests in Battincourt, to the tavern in Wörrishofen, he spent half his fortune trying treatments, but nothing worked.

translation.lb: Wé nun alles neischt gedéngt huot, du ass en dann dû och endlech gestuorwen.
translation.en: When nothing finally worked, he then eventually died.

translation.lb: En liât sech ower ausgehâlen, no séngein Dot mîsst en opgeschnidde gin, wèll e wier dach êmol ze firwötzeg, fir ze wösse wôun dass e gestuorwe wier.
translation.en: He insisted, however, that after his death he must be cut open because he was too curious to know from what he had died.

translation.lb: Wé gesot also, wé en dot war, losse mer gleich den Dokter rufen, dê schneit en op a wât fönt en? mein arme Mononk hât de g<mze Mô folier Sand!
translation.en: So as he said, when he was dead, we immediately called the doctor, who cut him open and what did he find? My poor uncle had his whole stomach full of sand!

translation.lb: A wösst der, wo dât hiér kôm? Mei Mononk huot a séngem ganze Liéwen neischt anescht gedronkt ewé elauter Versand béer!
translation.en: And do you know where that came from? My uncle had drunk nothing else all his life than diluted Versand beer!

translation.lb: Gut verdêlt.
translation.en: Well divided.

translation.lb: Den Haré.
translation.en: The gentleman.

translation.lb: Ja, wé ower d'Zeit vergêt!
translation.en: Yes, how time flies!

translation.lb: Ewell ass ê bâl zeng Johr bestûot!
translation.en: It's almost been ten years now!

translation.lb: Meng Fra an ech hun elo zesumme 70 Johr.
translation.en: My wife and I have now accumulated 70 years together.

translation.lb: Nu roth emol, Pier, wé mer ons an dé 70 dêlen.
translation.en: Now guess, Pierre, how we divide ourselves in those 70.

translation.lb: De Pier.
translation.en: Pierre.

translation.lb: Deng Fra ass de siewenter an du bass d'Null.
translation.en: Your wife is the seven and you are the zero.

translation.en: Oh, how did that happen?

translation.lb: D'Koffer Nuos.

translation.lb: Ma du wêss jo: wé en t'ièscht d'Poliss ferwixt huot, du krût e seöhs Wochen, an dé huot en de Muorgen ugetratt.
translation.en: But you know: when he first confused the police, he got six weeks, and he started today.

translation.en: Show mercy to a poor man who doesn't even have a room to live in.

translation.en: The person named Jampir.

translation.en: Then thank God, you also don't have any rent to pay!

translation.lb: Beim Exerzé’ren um Glacis.
translation.en: During the exercises on the Glacis.

translation.lb: De Leitnant (iwerdêm e sein Dêgen an d'Schêd stésst).
translation.en: The lieutenant (while striking his sword into the sheath).

translation.lb: „Dir éslenker Brattfär sit net wert, dass iéch e brafe' Leitnant kommedéert;
translation.en: "You clumsy oafs are not worthy of having a brave lieutenant command you;

translation.en: for such hard-headed flatfoots, the dumbest patrol is good enough!"

translation.en: (To the sergeant.) "Repeat the command!"

translation.lb: Wât war den hêlege’ Pétrus?
translation.en: Who was Saint Peter?

translation.lb: T'war op Péteschdâg.
translation.en: It was on Peter's Day.

translation.lb: Zwê Buchsetzer, e letzeburger an ê fun Arel sötze' beim Karlé ze diskutéren, a wiém de Brändi êmol an d'Hierschûol geklommen, dê lést sech net giere' mé èppes ofstreiden.
translation.en: Two typesetters, a Luxembourger and one from Arlon, sat at Karlé's discussing, and as the brandy once again climbed into the students, the latter wouldn't listen but disputed something.

translation.lb: „"Wess du och, wât den hêlege' Pétrus fir e Landsmann war?" frot onse Letzeburger den Areler.
translation.en: "Do you also know what nationality Saint Peter was?" our Luxembourger asked the Arloner.

translation.lb: „Pardieu!" göf den zur Entwert, „et war e Landsmann fu mir, e gebûrenen Antwèrbener, den do schons de Feschfank gedriwen hûot ir e Jesus Christus geléert hat kennen.
translation.en: "Pardieu!" he replied, "he was a fellow countryman of mine, a native of Antwerp, who had already driven the fish market before he met Jesus Christ.

translation.lb: Nodêm eréscht ass hién den éschte' Pobst gin."
translation.en: After that, he first became the first Pope."

translation.lb: „Wat!" jaut do onse Letzeburger, „de Pétrus soll e Bèlgikaner gewiéscht sin?
translation.en: "What!" exclaimed our Luxembourger, "Peter was supposed to be Belgian?

translation.lb: Botz der d'Nûos, mei' Besch ten, dat war e letzeburger Kand, grad wé den éschte' Mensch, den Adam; an dass dât séng Richtegkêt hûot, ass de Beweis, dass dem Här Praum sei' „Letzeburger" et Schwarz op Weiss gedreckt â bewisen hûot, an den hêlege' Pétrus hàt séng éscht Fösch an der Uolzecht gefangen!"
translation.en: Wipe your nose, my dear, he was a Luxembourg child, just like the first man, Adam; and the proof of that truth is that Mr. Praum's 'Luxembourger' has printed it in black and white, and Saint Peter caught his first fish in the Ulz!

translation.lb: Net fil hätt mé gefehlt, da' wiren ons zwê Schwärzkönschtler seeh dobei an d'Hohr geroden.
translation.en: Not much more was missing, and our two printers could have come to blows.

translation.lb: Ma glecklecherweis trett an den Amènt en dretten Typo, e gewessene,, Möller-'fun Arel an d'Lokal an dê göf nu' fjn onsen zwê Heide' fum hêlege' Pétrus »um Schidsrichter an der Affaire opgefûordert.
translation.en: But fortunately, a third typesetter, a certain Mr. Möller from Arlon, entered the venue and was now called upon as a referee in the affair by our two heathens regarding Saint Peter.

translation.lb: Onse' gude' Möller hûot nodem e sech en Ableck d'Sâch iwerlûogt hât sein Uortel gespracht a' gesot: De Pétrus war e „Belschen!-'~Wât!" jaut do de Letzeburger, ~ass et. och weil so weit mat dir komt, dass du d'Rècht fun de Letzeburger hèllefs enner d'Féss triéden?-'
translation.en: Our good Möller, after taking a moment to contemplate the matter, gave his judgment and said: Peter was Belgian! "What!" then exclaimed the Luxembourger, "has it come so far with you, that you trample Luxembourg rights underfoot?

translation.lb: Ower onse' Möller göf him ganz drechen zur n,ntwert: ~R<sech mat du Bên! den hêlege' Pétrus muss schons aus der Ursâch e Belsehe gewiéscht sin, weil e Letzeburger hält a' sengem Liéwen net sein ârmen Härgott ferlêehent."
translation.en: But our Möller responded to him very dryly: Get yourself together! Saint Peter must have been Belgian, because a Luxembourger would never in his life deny his poor God.

translation.lb: Ungleicher Kampf.
translation.en: Unequal fight.

translation.lb: (pm Sepp, bev fein Sßeib ijeprü= gelt'Çat):
translation.en: (Sepp, after his wife reprimanded him):

translation.lb: Slbcr Sepp, nric fonntet bcnn @uer 2öeib jo mifjfjanbeln?
translation.en: But Sepp, how could your wife treat you so harshly?

translation.lb: Söenn burcfiauê ge= fdjlagen fein muß, fo fdilagt ©ucf) bod) roenig= ftenê nur mit 28ortcn!

translation.lb: Am Bambösch.
translation.en: In the Bambesch forest.

translation.lb: Den Här Paschtöer (zu zwê klènger Böwen).
translation.en: The pastor (to two small boys).

translation.lb: A wo wollt der dann hin, Jengercher?
translation.en: And where are you going then, little ones?

translation.lb: D'Kanner.
translation.en: The children.

translation.lb: Holz huolen, Här Paschtöer.
translation.en: To fetch wood, Pastor.

translation.lb: De Paschtöer.
translation.en: The Pastor.

translation.lb: Der briécht dach keng Reiser fun de Beem?!
translation.en: You won't break any branches from the trees, will you?!

translation.lb: D'Kanner.
translation.en: The children.

translation.lb: Oh nên, Här Paschtöer, mer hun eng kleng See mat, domat gêt et fill besser.
translation.en: Oh no, Pastor, we have a small saw with us, that makes it much better.

translation.lb: De Franzós a sei Pärd.
translation.en: The Frenchman and his horse.

translation.lb: E Französ, dên eng Rees durch onst Land gemächt huot an dên nuren e puor deitsch Wiérder wosst, köm eng Kéer owes mat séngem Pärd an èng Wiérthschaft um Bauerenduref.
translation.en: A Frenchman, who made a journey through our country and only knew a few German words, once came in the evening with his horse to an inn in Bauerenduref.

translation.lb: Sei Gaul war em ennerwê krank gin, a kaum war en ofgestiegen, seet en zum Hauskniécht:
translation.en: His horse had become very sick, and hardly had he dismounted when he said to the stable boy:

translation.lb: „Sluêfnedjt, ba ineine gerbe ift feroorben fanj Iranf, feb fie mir ©abinet cor bte gerbe fanj allein, ör fie mit, fang allein!"
translation.en: "Stable boy, my horse is sick as of Iranf, please take it to a stable or tie it up, but take it alone!"

translation.lb: Den Hauskniécht dê gleich ferstân huot, féert d'Pärd an e schéne Stall eleng an huot et gut ferfleecht.
translation.en: The stable boy immediately understood and led the horse alone into a nice stall and cared for it well.

translation.lb: Dem ârme Gaul huot ower neischt anescht gefehlt, wé dass et op engem aner Stand war, en Emstand dên sein liär, dên et erischt grad kâft hat fir op d'Eees ze gohn, an den iwregens net tili fun de Pärd kannt huot, net gut wösse könnt.
translation.en: However, the poor horse had nothing else wrong, except that it was in a different state, a circumstance its owner, who had just bought it to go on the journey, and who otherwise was not very knowledgeable about horses, could not really understand.

translation.lb: An der nämlechter Nuocht krût mei gut Pärd och e jongt Fillen, dat ganz röheg a monter niéwent sénger Mamm log, wé den Här Muorges fréh an de Stall kdm.
translation.en: That same night, my good horse also birthed a young foal, which lay peacefully and lively next to its mother, when the gentleman came to the stable early in the morning.

translation.lb: An enger Eoserei rift en den Hauskniécht:
translation.en: In bewilderment he called to the stable boy:

translation.lb: „2tuêtned)t, roaë mat fit ber Keine fßerfon (;ier bei meinem tränten fyerbe? 2to it nit befohlen fanj allein!"
translation.en: "Stable boy, how is it with the little horse person here by my sick horse? Didn’t I order it to be alone!"

translation.lb: „2)iä, iQÖr", entwert den Hauskniécht, „gefeit 3f) r bentt baë (Suer fpferb trächtig geroefi ift utib baff eö biefe 3{ad)t gefolgt Ijat?"
translation.en: "Yes, sir", answered the stable boy, "don’t you know that your horse was pregnant and that it delivered this night?"

translation.lb: „Si roaë, fefotjten, fefoblen", jeitzt de Fransös, „meine gerbe fl ber nie fu befehlen, if' ab fu bc= festen!"
translation.en: "What nonsense, crazy, mad", yelled the Frenchman, "my horse has never commanded, it is only to be fastened!"

translation.lb: „SSer faßt beim cppes uorn ïlefefden?" entwert den Hauskniécht nêss, „oerfteit mid) bod) red)t, baâ fleinio ba ift baö gotjlen non bem großen!"
translation.en: "Who fastens the child by itself?" replied the stable boy again, "understand me correctly, that little one is the foal from the big one!"

translation.lb: De Fransös liuot nach emmer net kapéert:
translation.en: The Frenchman still didn’t get it:

translation.lb: „3tuf fleine Çperfon oben nir fu befehlen!"
translation.en: "I ordered the little horse person above not to be commanded!"

translation.lb: Den Hauskniécht war a grösser Verlêenhêt, wé en dem Fransôs dât sollt beibréngen.
translation.en: The stable boy was in greater embarrassment, how to explain that to the Frenchman.

translation.lb: Endlech sot en:
translation.en: Finally he said:

translation.lb: „fècir, baô tleine îflârb ba ift baô &iitb non bem grofjen!"
translation.en: "Sir, the little one there is the child of the big one!"

translation.lb: Op eng kéer göng dem Französ èng Speicherlicht op:
translation.en: Suddenly the Frenchman had an epiphany:

translation.lb: rift en an ènger Gèllecht aus, „ab if mif feroufct, baff meine gerbe iê eine Diabame.
translation.en: he burst out in laughter, "I am relieved, that my horse is a lady.

translation.lb: ®a, Sluêfnedjt, abeit bu adt ©rofd), trinf Sie baoor ftefuubfyeit nor bie SDlabame uub bie flcine itiub!"
translation.en: Yes, stable boy, you did well, bring oats and hay for the lady and the little horse!"

translation.lb: De fiffechen Noper.
translation.en: The clever neighbor.

translation.lb: Zwê guder Noper, wé s'an deser Zeit wéneg mé ze tanne sin, waren de Péter an de Pir tun Hamm.
translation.en: Two good neighbors, as you find fewer and fewer these days, were Peter and Paul from Hamm.

translation.lb: Jiderê fun hinen war Egenthömer fun en èttlech Köppe Land, ower weil kên e Perd liât, tir dé ze pléen an ze bearbechten, do huot et muonchmol bei hinne' gelappt, weil si krûte' fir Gèld a gut Wuort wuol hir Arbecht fun desein oder dêm Bauer gemâcht, ower net éschter, bis dê' sein êgent fierdeg hât an da gewénlech hir Grompere' geplantzt gôwen, wann dé aner hir gehèft hâten.
translation.en: Each of them owned a few heads of land, but since there was no horse to plough and work it, sometimes they would wait until they got money or a good word and had their work done by someone else or another farmer, but not before he had finished his own and usually after he had planted his potatoes, whenever the others had harvested theirs.

translation.lb: „Wêss du wât?" sot e guden Dâg de Pir zum Péter, ech wêss e gudde Möttel, fir ôns zwê aus der Nôt ze hèllefen!"
translation.en: "Do you know what?" said Paul to Peter one fine day, "I know a good way for us both to help ourselves out of this trouble!"

translation.lb: „An dât wir?-'frot de Péter.
translation.en: "And what would that be?" asked Peter.

translation.lb: „Mir kâfen ons e Perd zesumme a bebaue' mat dêm sèlwer onst Land."
translation.en: "We buy a horse together and cultivate our land with it ourselves."

translation.lb: „Dei Rôt ass net schlècht!" sot de Péter, ma e Perd ass en rJgentom, dât ons am Enn opfriésse' könnt."
translation.en: "That advice isn't bad!" said Peter, "but a horse is a possession that could end up eating us out of house and home."

translation.lb: „Och watt!" sot du de Pir, dât wèrd nach net Hais a' Bê' kaschten.
translation.en: "Oh, come on!" said Paul, "that won't cost as much as a house and a barn.

translation.lb: Mir dehlen ôns drân; du suorgs fir d'Fuder an ech tir den Dronk.
translation.en: We share it; you take care of the feed and I take care of the drink.

translation.lb: Wé mèngs de?"
translation.en: What do you think?"

translation.lb: Dem Péter niuss dem Pir sei' Firschlâg dach net a' sei Krom gepasst hun, wèll en huot de Kapp gorösselt a gesot:
translation.en: Peter must not have liked Paul's suggestion, because he shook his head and said:

translation.lb: Wann d'Pèrd net mé Duscht hätt wés du, da' kéms du gut ewèch, wèll an dengem Liéwen huos du nach kê Patt gedronkt."
translation.en: "If only the horse didn't get thirsty, you would manage well, because in your life, you've never even drunk a pint."

translation.lb: Haut sin dé zwê allbekannt Kébaueren zu Hamm.
translation.en: Today, the two are well-known cheese farmers in Hamm.

translation.lb: Op der Soirée.
translation.en: At the soirée.

translation.lb: Zwê jonger Fakengen, dé en Aa op dé sèlwegt Jotfer geworft hâten, wäre' sech um Bal hannert de Pelz geroden.
translation.en: Two young lads who had set their eyes on the same maiden got into a skirmish at the ball.

translation.lb: Wât wölls du dech dann hei nach opblosen?
translation.en: "What do you want to puff yourself up for here?"

translation.lb: sot den Toni zum Jämpi,
translation.en: said Toni to Jämpi,

translation.lb: „dei Papp ass joblös en einfache' Mètzlermêschter!
translation.en: "Your dad is just a simple unemployed meat cutter!

translation.lb: a Dût klappt,
translation.en: and that fits,

translation.lb: göf de Jämpi zur Entwert.
translation.en: answered Jämpi.

translation.lb: Mei' Papp schluôcht Kalwer, an dein huot der blös opgezillt.
translation.en: My dad slaughters calves, and yours just feeds them."

translation.lb: De Letzeburger zu Antwerben.
translation.en: The Luxembourger in Antwerp.

translation.lb: Den Här Fhill war zur Exposition gerbst a' wé huot d'A'an opgesteipt, wé en zu Antwerben ukomt ass, do op êmol dût grôst Wässer erblext huot, weil d'Musel war nach bis haut dât grést gewiéscht, wât en a sengem Liéwe gesin hât.
translation.en: Mr. Thill traveled to the exposition in autumn and was wide-eyed when he arrived in Antwerp and suddenly saw the vast waters, as the Moselle had been the largest he had ever seen in his life until then.

translation.lb: Den Dâg drop gong en op den Hàfe' flanéeren, a' wé huot en do dé allmächteg gross Schöffer ugestaunt, denen hir Mastbêm him wé e Bosch am Wasser fir si kommt.
translation.en: The next day he went strolling at the harbor and was amazed by the mighty large ships, whose masts appeared to him like a forest emerging from the water.

translation.lb: Niéwend him stông e Matrôs, berêt, fir sech op e Schöff iwerhuolen ze lôssen, dàt, fir Ostindie bestömmt, haut nach seng weit Rês sollt untriéden.
translation.en: Beside him stood a sailor, ready to board a ship destined for East Indies, about to embark on its long journey today.

translation.lb: „Gude' Frend," riéd den Här Thill en un, „dir musst e ferflixte' Kurâg hu 1 fir so eng weit Rês mat ze man, weil um Miér ass et liéwensgeféerlech."
translation.en: "Good friend," Mr. Thill addressed him, "you must have a devil's own courage to undertake such a long journey, because the sea is dangerous to life."

translation.lb: „Bah!" gôf de Matrös zur Entwert, „et stierwe' mé Menschen um Land wé um Mier an iwerhapt, mei Papp, mei' Grössan Urgrösspapp hun hiert Liewen drop gelost. fir wät dann ech net?"
translation.en: "Bah!" replied the sailor, "more people die on land than at sea and anyway, my father, my grandfather, and great-grandfather lived their lives at sea, so why shouldn't I?"

translation.lb: „Jeses, Marja! jeitzt du den Här Thill, da' bléf ech an èrer Platz dach léwer dohôm."
translation.en: "Jesus, Mary!" exclaimed Mr. Thill, "then I'd rather stay home in my place."

translation.lb: De Matros huot de Kapp gerösselt a gelacht: „Sot emol, dir klugen Här,« frot en du, wô ass wuol ère' Grösspapp gestuorwen?"
translation.en: The sailor shook his head and laughed: "Tell me, wise sir," he asked, "where did your grandfather die?"

translation.lb: „Ganz rôheg op sèngem Bètt.« »An ère Papp? « »D'sèlwecht."
translation.en: "Very peacefully in his bed." "And your father? " "The same."

translation.lb: „Ma wo könnt dir dann nach de Kiiràg hun (ir op e Bètt leien ze gohn?" A' lachens Monn huot e sech fir Ostindien ageschöfft.
translation.en: "But then how can you muster the courage to lie down in a bed?" Laughing, he boarded for East Indies.

translation.lb: E Gescheiten.
translation.en: A clever one.

translation.lb: E neien Jandarm begént, op der Landstrôss èngem Fechtlappert:
translation.en: A new gendarme encounters, on the country road, a sluggish loafer:

translation.lb: Hé, Borsht, wo sin déng Pobeieren!
translation.en: Hey, buddy, where are your papers?

translation.lb: Ick han keene.
translation.en: I have none.

translation.lb: Dàss der dein dausend Gléck, verfluchte Kamessröher, weil wanns du mat déngem Prisongsgesîcht och nach Pobeiere gehât häss, dé net an Uordnong gewiéscht wären, da wär et elo vif an d'Speckheis'che gang.
translation.en: That's your damn luck, damn skulker, because if you had even had papers with your prison face that weren't in order, you would have gone straight to jail now.

translation.lb: An nu mäch ass de dech hell durch d'Latte mechs!
translation.en: And now get yourself quickly through the hoops!

translation.lb: Op der Burgermêschterei.
translation.en: At the mayor's office.

translation.lb: De Burgermêschter.
translation.en: The Mayor.

translation.lb: Also haut féerzeng Deech halt der Hochzeit-mais, sot emol, wât mächt dei mat der Mass lésswuor dé der do bei iéch huot?
translation.en: So today is the fourteenth day of the wedding feast, but tell me, what about the leftover food you have there with you?

translation.lb: De Breitgemânn.
translation.en: The Town Councilman.

translation.lb: Ma, Här Burgerraêschter, et ass eis gesot gin, mer mîssten elo zeng Deech an der Kösch't hänken, an da könne mer jo net gut erhengeren.
translation.en: Well, Mr. Mayor, we were told we must stay in the kitchen for ten days, and then we surely cannot go hungry.

translation.lb: Aus dem Éslênk. Här Letzeburger. E Sprechwnort sêt:..De Mensch soll net stolz sin,"
translation.en: From the Éslênk. Mr. Letzeburger. A saying goes: "A person should not be proud,"

translation.lb: a' richteg, dat hiiot hei bei ons zögetrefft.
translation.en: and right, that has been proven true here among us.

translation.lb: Wé dàt kommt ass. wöll ech iéch hei ferziélen.
translation.en: How that came to be, I would like to tell you here.

translation.lb: Ons Kierch hu<>t fir Knôrzem eng nei Uorgel krit,
translation.en: Our church recently received a new organ,

translation.lb: dé wé d'Klierfer Klöppelgestell fu' gude', brafe' Leiden h ire' geschenkte' Soue' kâft ass gin.
translation.en: which, like the Klierfer bell frame, was bought with money donated by good, honest people.

translation.lb: Den Här Dirigent fim onser Gesellschaft hei, an ennert ons gesot en dichteche' Museker, huot d'Eer krit, fir den éschte' Messegesank drop ze beglèden
translation.en: The conductor of our society here, and, among us, a respectable musician, had the honor to accompany the first mass song on it.

translation.lb: an hat seng Sàch esô perfekt gemächt, dass him fnn all onsen Andächtegen frendlech zö gewénkt ass gin.
translation.en: and did his job so perfectly that all our worshippers nodded at him kindly.

translation.lb: An dem Amènt trett sei' Ballegtriéder zu him a' sot: „Gelt, mir zwè hun ons gut aus der Affaire gezun!"
translation.en: At that moment, his assistant came up to him and said: "See, we both did well out of the affair!"

translation.lb: „Mir zwè, rift önse' Museker stôlz. Ech glêwen, dass ech elèng hei gespült hun!"
translation.en: "We both," called our musician proudly. "I believe I played here alone!"

translation.lb: „Ah sö!" sot du den ugeranzte' Ballegtriéder, „ech liât geduôcht. —"
translation.en: "Oh really!" said the disgruntled assistant. "I thought. —"

translation.lb: „Dir hut dobei neischt ze dènke'," krût en zur Entwert, an de gude' Jong gong rem u' sei' Baileg.
translation.en: "You have nothing to think about in this," came the reply, and the good lad went back to his task.

translation.lb: De Tantum ergo war am Gâng.
translation.en: The Tantum ergo was underway.

translation.lb: D'Uuorgel huot hirt Bèscht gebrommt,
translation.en: The organ droned its best,

translation.lb: do', op êmol hun all hir Peifen den Dengscht geköndegt a' kèn Ton rué gin.

translation.lb: Sie hun seoh ufangs gut verstâng, T'göng alles flott vun Hand.
translation.en: They got along well at first, everything went smoothly.

translation.lb: Mè wë den lésel Honger krit, Dö bleift e röheg stôn,
translation.en: But when the donkey became hungry, he stood still calmly,

translation.lb: Nom Hond do kuckt e weider nit, A lësst en hongrech gôn.
translation.en: He paid no more attention to the dog and let him go hungry.

translation.lb: Op enger Wies do hält e stall A fèngt ze wéden un,
translation.en: On a meadow he stopped and began to graze,

translation.lb: Den Hond lêft em hien iwerall Mè hirn leit neischt dorun.
translation.en: The dog ran around him everywhere but found nothing there.

translation.lb: Op sengem Réck an engem Kurf Den lésel d'Fudder bât,
translation.en: On his back in a basket the donkey had fodder,

translation.lb: Den Hond de frét, ob hien net durf Sech friessen draus ganz sât.
translation.en: The dog asked if he might not eat from it to get full.

translation.lb: Den lésel sét: „Hief du Gedold, „Bis ech gesiedegt sin;
translation.en: The donkey said, "Have patience until I am satisfied;

translation.lb: „Weil ech si ganz a guor net schold, „Dir z'iessen 'lo ze gin.
translation.en: Because I am not at all to blame to give you food now.

translation.lb: Dorop hic' röheg weider frösst Bis dat en ass ganz rond,
translation.en: Thereupon he quietly kept grazing until he was completely full,

translation.lb: An iwerdém en nêss vergösst Den hongreg armen Hond.
translation.en: Meanwhile, he forgot about the hungry poor dog.

translation.lb: An aus dem Bosch körn iwerdém E Wollef op hien zö,
translation.en: And from the forest came a wolf toward him,

translation.lb: Dè kuckt fu weit schon ennerwee Ganz glöschterlech a fröh.
translation.en: Who looked from afar already thirsting and happy.

translation.lb: A wë den lésel dê geséit, Do get et hitu ganz bâng,
translation.en: And when the donkey saw him, he became quite anxious soon,

translation.en: No help was near and wide, his hunger disappeared.

translation.lb: E kuckt rondem a rifft den Hond, Mè dén'ass fort soho lâng
translation.en: He looked around and called for the dog, but he was long gone

translation.lb: Gelt Männchen, haut huot d'lésseu dir ower geschmâcht?
translation.en: Golden little fellow, today the stew really tasted good, huh?

translation.lb: Ech hun et ower och mat Lëft gekacht.
translation.en: I also cooked it with love, you know.

translation.lb: HiVn.
translation.en: Aha.

translation.lb: Aha, ech hu mer och gleich geduocht, et wär eppes dran, wât net dra gehëere gëf.
translation.en: Aha, I also thought right away, there was something in it that didn't belong.

translation.lb: De Clausener Halt. „Eng Halt a Clausen war net sohlècht," Dât muss dé friémste Mönsch gestôen, Dén d'Lag sech hei ukukt.
translation.en: The Clausener Stop. 'A stop in Clausen was not bad,' even the most foreign person must admit, who looks at the situation here.

translation.lb: „A Rècht Dorîwer hun dé Leit ze klôen."
translation.en: 'And the people had a right to complain about it.'

translation.lb: Wèll wié' gêt op den Zuch giér weit, Wa bei der Dîr him d'Bunn bal leit?
translation.en: Because how far must one travel to the train, when the tracks lie almost at the door?

translation.lb: Mir Claus'ner hun dât oft gedun, A läng firun ons, schon ons Pappen
translation.en: We people of Clausen have often done that, and long before us, our fathers already did.

translation.lb: Wollt haut nach en mam Zuch, der Bunn, Op d'Gâr, op HolFrech muss hién trappen;
translation.en: If one wants to take the train today, to the station, to Hollerich they must travel.

translation.lb: Op Dommeldeng gêt et vielleicht, Wann ên de Biérg net giér auskreicht.
translation.en: To Dommeldingen, perhaps, if one does not climb the mountain first.

translation.lb: Wéfill schën Zeit gêt ons verluor, Wa' mir de grossen Tour do mächen;
translation.en: How much precious time is lost to us when we make the big tour there;

translation.lb: Wién sech verspét, dé get gewuor: Wât dât hei hêscht.
translation.en: Whoever is late becomes aware: what it means here.

translation.lb: Hie' wärt net lâchen
translation.en: He will not laugh here

translation.lb: Dât breicht jo all net hei ze sin, Wann sie èng Halt ons wollte gin.
translation.en: One would not need to be here if they wanted to give us a stop.

translation.lb: Könnt aus dem Eésleck ên erôf A Clausen hier, seng Frönn besichen:
translation.en: If someone comes down from the Eisleck to visit their friends in Clausen:

translation.lb: Da kann hidn hei nu flr seng Strof Den Hut, och d'Kâp ons héschstens liehen..
translation.en: Then he can take off his hat here for his punishment, maybe just lend us the cap.

translation.lb: Weil mat dem Zuch gét hién derdurch
translation.en: Because he passes through with the train

translation.lb: Bis op d'grösst Gär no Letzeburg.
translation.en: Until the largest station near Luxembourg.

translation.lb: Eng Halt, wât èng sehe Sâch war dât Fir dé di ronderemer leien:
translation.en: A stop, what a rare thing that was for those who lie around everywhere:

translation.lb: A.ll Birger aus der âler Stâdt, Dé géfen t'sicher net bereien:
translation.en: All citizens from the old city would certainly not regret it:

translation.lb: Wann dodurch geng d'Geschäft mé llott; T'wär och net sehlecht fir ken, bei Gott!
translation.en: If thereby the business would go better; it would not be bad for anyone, by God!

translation.lb: Kém a Geschäften en an d'Stâdt, Dé scho fu weit mam Zuch rauss kommen;
translation.en: If someone came for business to the city, who already came out far with the train;

translation.lb: Wé gutt, wann hién hei ausgesät Scho géf.
translation.en: How good it would be if he could already disembark here.

translation.lb: Hié' méch sech net den Dommen:
translation.en: He would not make a fool of himself here:

translation.lb: Wa „Clausen" géf geruff nach kaum,
translation.en: If 'Clausen' was barely called out,

translation.lb: Méch hién dén âner giére Raum.
translation.en: He would explore the other place.

translation.lb: Hätt e Prozèss ên um Gericht, Dén och mat deser Bunn muss rêsen,
translation.en: If someone had a trial in court, who must also travel with this train,

translation.lb: Wé froh, wann hién de Bock könnt rieht Aus gôn.
translation.en: How glad he would be if he could go there directly.

translation.lb: Hié géf gewöss nach spésen.
translation.en: He would certainly still be in time.

translation.lb: Hién hätt mam Alïekôt geschwât,
translation.en: He would have discussed with the lawyer,

translation.lb: Wo soss hié kaum war an der Stâdt.
translation.en: Where otherwise he was hardly in the city.

translation.lb: Ons all, wé mir a Clause' sin, Dé Halt géf grossen Notze' machen;
translation.en: To all of us, as we are in Clausen, the stop would be of great advantage;

translation.lb: An ass sie do Dir wärt gesinn: Dann hirer lill nach mat ons lâchen.
translation.en: And if she sees you there: then her smile will be with us.

translation.lb: Getons eng Halt hei op der Bunn, Wât éschter, wât mer t'iéwer hun.
translation.en: Give us a stop here on the line, the sooner, the more we will owe it.

translation.lb: Pir d'Halt si mir behandelt gin, Scho lâng bâl iérger we Stéfkanner;
translation.en: In regards to the stop, we have been treated long almost like stepchildren;

translation.lb: Wann Stei'ren ze bezuole sin, Si' wé dé âner mir net mariner.
translation.en: When taxes have to be paid, they are no less a bother to us than to others.

translation.lb: Mir frôn un der Regirong frei Ze stôen an der Sâch ons bei.
