translation.en: Among us.

translation.lb: D'Kätt.
translation.en: Kätt.

translation.lb: Nu, wë bass de mat dénger neier Härschaft zefriden.
translation.en: So, how are you satisfied with your new master?

translation.lb: D'Märi.
translation.en: Märi.

translation.lb: Oh, alt zimlech, Blös eppes schwäch Nerven hun dë Leit: sie fällt schwäch, wann s'e neit Klêd brauch, an hien, wann en d'Rechnong krit.
translation.en: Oh, quite well, just these people have weak nerves: she feels weak when she needs a new dress, and he when he gets the bill.

translation.lb: Am Hîerscht.
translation.en: In the Autumn.

translation.lb: D'Blume si ferblët.
translation.en: The flowers are withered.

translation.lb: An den Hierchtwant zët Iwer d'Stoppelstéck mat Rôsen.
translation.en: The autumn wind sweeps over the stubble field with roses.

translation.lb: D'Schmuolmesch ass ferzun,
translation.en: The comfort is gone,

translation.lb: All Gesank ferflun,
translation.en: All songs have vanished,

translation.lb: D'Fréd ewèch, wë fortgeblosen.
translation.en: The joy is away, like blown away.

translation.lb: Traurég stêt de Bàm,
translation.en: The tree stands sadly,

translation.lb: 'Tschéngt him wê en Drâm,
translation.en: It feels to him like a dream,

translation.lb: Brong an donkel sin seng Bheder;
translation.en: Brown and dark are its branches;

translation.lb: Kênt um Aascht seeh hält,
translation.en: No leaf clings to the branch,

translation.lb: Ent nom âner fällt,
translation.en: One after another falls,

translation.lb: Döt tir sie ass d'Frëerwieder.
translation.en: The cold weather causes this.

translation.lb: D'Firmamènt ass gro,
translation.en: The firmament is gray,

translation.lb: D'Wolken hènken do Fielze gleich fum Want gedrîwen.
translation.en: The clouds hang there like rocks driven by the wind.

translation.lb: Wö ass d'Sonn dach hin?
translation.en: Where has the sun gone to?

translation.lb: Kê kann se gesin,
translation.en: No one can see it,

translation.lb: War sie dach göscht stôe bliwen!
translation.en: Wasn't it still standing yesterday!

translation.lb: Jo, èng traureg Zeit Ass nun net më weit,
translation.en: Yes, a sad time is now not far away,

translation.lb: Eis wèrd gleich a Sehne ons plôen.
translation.en: We will soon yearn with longing.

translation.lb: Eppes dach get Tröscht:
translation.en: Yet something gives comfort:

translation.lb: Wanterkélt a Wöscht Müssen och êmol fergôen!
translation.en: Winter cold and desolation must also eventually pass!

translation.lb: No de Wâhlen!
translation.en: After the elections!

translation.lb: Nu sit dir dran,
translation.en: Now you are in,

translation.lb: nû get iéch drun A schafft,
translation.en: now it's your turn to work,

translation.lb: dass d'Boxe krâchen,
translation.en: so that the boxes crash,

translation.lb: Dass d'Leit, wann et am Hiérscht 'rem' un,
translation.en: That the people, when it starts again in autumn,

translation.lb: Net brüllen sech fu Lâchen!
translation.en: don't scream from laughter!

translation.lb: Dir hut èrt Méscht a Beseht fersprach,
translation.en: You promised your most and best,

translation.lb: Nu gitt och fèrm an d'Liéder,
translation.en: Now also be firm in the songs,

translation.lb: Soss huot um Bnn d'Affair e Lach,
translation.en: Otherwise, the affair has a gap in the Bundesrat,

translation.lb: An 't könnt en Donnerwiéder 1
translation.en: And it could cause a thunderstorm!

translation.lb: Fir Leit fu Wûrt hun ugesin léch d'Wiéler bei de Wahlen;
translation.en: For people of the word observed the voters at the elections;

translation.lb: Wé hoffnonksfrd sie nun do stin,
translation.en: How hopeful they now stand there,

translation.lb: Gespânt an onggehâlen 1
translation.en: Tense and restrained!

translation.lb: Op sie hir Sâch perfekt gemâcht?
translation.en: Did they do their thing perfectly?

translation.lb: 'T ka kên et prophezeien!
translation.en: No one can predict it!

translation.lb: Wât sehen ons schéngt, dach dack neischt dâcht,
translation.en: What seems to us visible, often thinks nothing,

translation.lb: Dât wêss On dné Zeien!
translation.en: This the unseen witnesses know!

translation.lb: E grössecht Feld firun iéch leit,
translation.en: A vast field lies before you,

translation.lb: Do könt dir iéch ergètzen!
translation.en: There you can enjoy yourselves!

translation.lb: Fill Arbécht wenkt fu.jidder Seit,
translation.en: Much work beckons from every side,

translation.lb: De Schwêss wërd d'Stîr iéch nètzen!
translation.en: Sweat will moisten your brows!

translation.lb: Dir ■ huot am Plang, mat grossem Fleiss
translation.en: You have planned, with great diligence

translation.lb: Ze Seen an ze plden,
translation.en: to sow and to cultivate,

translation.lb: An 't bleiwt, sit secher, op dé Weis
translation.en: And it remains, be sure, in that way

translation.lb: Fill Zeit net, fir ze röhen!
translation.en: Not a lot of time to rest!

translation.lb: Zur Wählzeit gêt et gént enên,
translation.en: At election time, it goes against each,

translation.lb: Do spillen d'Dilferenzen;
translation.en: There the differences play;

translation.lb: Gént jidderên fönnt sech e Stên,
translation.en: Against each finds a stone,

translation.lb: An 't gét dack iwer d'Grènzen!
translation.en: And it often goes over the borders!

translation.lb: Nu mat der Kriohstrompett op d'Seit 1 Recht d'Hand iéch haut wé Bridder I
translation.en: Now with the war trumpet aside, extend your right hand as brothers!

translation.lb: Fill Gutts könnt kês eraus beim Streit,
translation.en: Nothing good comes out of quarrel,

translation.lb: D'Glécksblummen dre'ckt hién nidder.
translation.en: Fortune's flowers press him down.

translation.lb: Seit Joer reift de Budget op D'mêscht Krâft fun onser Chamber;
translation.en: For years the budget calls for the most strength from our chamber;

translation.lb: Wann et och Blèch, sie maulen drop,
translation.en: Even if it's tin, they complain about it,

translation.lb: D'Record sieht sech all Member!
translation.en: The record applies to every member!

translation.lb: All Klèngegkêt get opgespuort,
translation.en: Every little thing gets noted,

translation.lb: Am Plenum muss ê glänzen,
translation.en: In the plenary, they must shine,

translation.lb: Als Riédner wollen alleguort Mat Lorber sech bekränzen 1
translation.en: As speakers, they all want to crown themselves with laurel!

translation.lb: Mir wollen èppes wât sech greift,
translation.en: We want something that grips,

translation.lb: 'T wèrd Stoff genoch do leien!
translation.en: There will be enough material lying there!

translation.lb: Wien hiérzhaft an de Plonner greift
translation.en: Whoever courageously grabs into the chaos

translation.lb: Brauch d'Wirder net ze weien!
translation.en: Need not weigh words!

translation.lb: Get uocht, nu sètzt de Föss bei Mol,
translation.en: Beware, now set your feet to the mold,

translation.lb: Mir huolen ons Notiz;
translation.en: We are taking note;

translation.lb: Schafft dichteg, oder d'ânert Mol Lanscht d'Nuos gêt et da Schitz!
translation.en: Work diligently, or next time it will be a shot past your nose!

translation.lb: Fun Hierzen.
translation.en: From the heart.

translation.lb: Den Här: Meng sincère Felicitatiöne', Joffer.
translation.en: The gentleman: My sincere congratulations, miss.

translation.lb: Ech hu gehëert.
translation.en: I have heard.

translation.lb: Dass der Tech mat dem Här X. fiancéert hätt.
translation.en: That you are engaged to Mr. X.

translation.lb: D'Joffer: Dât sin éch net, dâss eng weitlêfeg Verwandt fu mir.
translation.en: The miss: That's not me, that's a distant relative of mine.

translation.lb: Den Här: Oh, dàt dêt mer lëd.
translation.en: The gentleman: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.

translation.lb: Mais nun, enner ons gesot, sit frö dass dir dè fersoffenen Hond net krit hut.
translation.en: But now, between us, be happy that you didn't get that drunkard.

translation.lb: E klènge Schlauberger.
translation.en: A little smart aleck.

translation.lb: E Böf (aus der Primärschöl zuin Apdikterf: Fir zwë Sou Chloroform, wann'ch gelift.
translation.en: A boy (from primary school at the pharmacy: For two Sou of chloroform, please.

translation.lb: Den Apdikter: Chloroform? A fir wat dann?
translation.en: The pharmacist: Chloroform? And what for?

translation.lb: De Böf: Oh wösst der. Här, ech hun haut esö èng schlecht Censur krit, do get et jiddefalls Klapp; an durfir wöll ech mech firdru' chlorolormëeren.
translation.en: The boy: Oh you know, sir, I got such a bad report today, so there will certainly be a spanking; that's why I want to chloroform myself beforehand.

translation.lb: 10. Optrett. De Firéch, une d'Kèttë. De Knëip. Warden!
translation.en: 10. Entry. The Fire Chief, and the Chain. The Pub. Wait!

translation.lb: nên! éch hu' deicht schon ze läng ge wart-
translation.en: no! I think I've waited too long-

translation.lb: Eeh muss machen, dass dât Spilchen elei en Enn krit.
translation.en: I must ensure this little game comes to an end.

translation.lb: 'T as hëg Zeit! {tort).
translation.en: It is high time! {tort).

translation.lb: D'Mad. Pips (zum tranz). Sit rôéch! sit rôéch, Hèr Frenzelë!
translation.en: Miss Pips (to the translator). Calm down! calm down, Mr. Frenzel!

translation.lb: onst Kéttë leit net, dass den Her Knëip fech an de Prisong wërfe lëst, an éch och net.
translation.en: Our chain does not allow Mr. Kneip to be thrown into prison, and I don't either.

translation.lb: De Pips. Ma foi! wât wel der da' machen, dir zwê, wann de Knëip net më ferstennéch weit sin?
translation.en: Mr. Pips. My word! What do you two want to do if Kneip can't be sensible?

translation.lb: Dât elo hèt éch mëi' Lfewen net fun em geduocht.
translation.en: I never thought that of him in my life.

translation.lb: léwel en huot déer Baneren ewell esö lii gestrept, dass em d'Streppen zur zwêter Natur as gin.
translation.en: However, he has already been so reprimanded by the flags that climbing the steps has become second nature to him.

translation.lb: Dât as et.
translation.en: That's it.

translation.lb: 15. Optrett. D'Mêschtesch. Dé Firécht.
translation.en: 15. Appearance. The Mistress. The First.

translation.lb: D'Môschtesch (kernt eran a lâcht). Lèx! du hâs Recht!
translation.en: The Mistress (comes in laughing). Lex! you are right!

translation.lb: Onsen dât hêscht, dé friemen Hër huot wirkeléch onsem Marré Lexiön gi', wé éch kom sin.
translation.en: Our place is said to be such that even the foreign gentlemen have indeed given our landlord praise, it seems.

translation.lb: De Mêschter. Bas de gescheit, Fra?
translation.en: The Master. Are you wise, woman?

translation.lb: Mè do muss ên îewel èppes op dë Sprôch hâlen, wann ên séch esöguor op Xirmesdâch Léxiôn dra' lest gin.
translation.en: But one always has to consider this proverb, if one even reads such praise on church fair days.

translation.lb: De Lèx. D'Médercber sin haut îewel nun êmol net anescht me, wât weit ê' mâche', Pap?
translation.en: The Lex. The customers are now just no different today, what can you do, Dad?

translation.lb: Fir esö èng Léxiôn schössen s'alles an d'Schanz!
translation.en: For such praise, they'd bet everything at once!

translation.lb: De Mêschter. 'T muss wuol esô si', Lèx! Wât mèngs du, Ef?
translation.en: The Master. It must well be so, Lex! What do you think, Ef?

translation.lb: Dât ka gut gin.
translation.en: That could be good.

translation.lb: De jonge Marié.
translation.en: The young Marie.

translation.lb: El ass dénger Mam alsö wirklech êscht, fir ons op der Hochzeitsrés ze begléden.
translation.en: She is really serious about accompanying us on the wedding trip.

translation.lb: Sié.
translation.en: She.

translation.lb: Ei, natirlech.
translation.en: Oh, naturally.

translation.lb: Hien.
translation.en: He.

translation.lb: Dât passt tnir cver net an de Krom.
translation.en: That doesn't quite fit the bill.

translation.lb: Ech wöll émoi ne:.
translation.en: I just want once.

translation.lb: Ech wöll mat dir eleng sin.
translation.en: I want to be alone with you.

translation.lb: Sié.
translation.en: She.

translation.lb: Dâbo do!
translation.en: Oh come on!

translation.lb: Siéf froh, dass du iwerhâpt kanns matgôn.
translation.en: Be glad that you can come along at all.

translation.lb: Virgebaut.
translation.en: Pre-built.

translation.lb: De Richter: Ma sot emol. wë kömt dir derzo, fir dé Mann hei ze schlôn?
translation.en: The Judge: Well tell me, how did you come to hit this man here?

translation.lb: Den Ugekloten: Mä, mer sötzen zesummen am Wirtshaus.
translation.en: The Accused: We were sitting together in the tavern.

translation.lb: Op êmol fängt dén do un ze fernènnen an e jëitzt:
translation.en: Suddenly, that one there starts raving and shouts:

translation.lb: Dé Peter do; dât ass dé grësten mais feren nach Spötzböf kont son,
translation.en: That Peter there; he's the biggest braggart, as sure as Spötzböf is true,

translation.lb: hat ech eni der e puor kräfteger gekropt.
translation.en: I gave him a few solid punches.

translation.lb: Eddě fun den Dûrchgeplompsten.
translation.en: Ode to the Overwhelmed.

translation.lb: Op d'Weis: Das ist im Lehen hfisslich eingerichtet.
translation.en: To the tune: It is poorly arranged in life.

translation.lb: 'T soll ên am Liewen sech dach kêmols prahlen,
translation.en: One should never boast in life,

translation.lb: Weil 't wêss ên net, wât èngem muor begënt!
translation.en: Because one does not know what may happen tomorrow!

translation.lb: Mir stönge fest, 't duocht kê fun ons ze fâlen,
translation.en: We stood firm, it seemed none of us would fall,

translation.lb: An dach kên Hun haut më no èngem krënt!
translation.en: And yet no rooster crows for us today!

translation.lb: 'Tass neischt zeginopd'Leit an op hir ßieden,
translation.en: There's nothing to say against people and their customs,

translation.lb: Weil iwer d'Hallschecht hàt ons ferm versprach jßefrain.
translation.en: Because a solid half had promised us blessings.

translation.lb: Behitt îech Gott! 't dêt wëh, hannen ze frieden!
translation.en: God protect you! It hurts to forget the past!

translation.lb: Mir danke Gott, dass kên den Hals gebrach!
translation.en: We thank God that no necks were broken!

translation.lb: E schönen Drâm, dên d'Candidaten drêmen!
translation.en: A beautiful dream that the candidates dream!

translation.lb: E Paradeis sech hirem Bléck erschlësst,
translation.en: A paradise unfolds before their eyes,

translation.lb: EnggöldeSonn schéngtd'Liewen zeemsêmen
translation.en: A golden sun seems to unite life,

translation.lb: An Dâg fir Dâg dûrch Rôseblée flësst!
translation.en: And day by day flows through rose petals!

translation.lb: Mais d'Wïeter op dem Land wë an de Stieden
translation.en: But the weather in the countryside and cities

translation.lb: Erwèchen ên mir kenne kê Ferglach!
translation.en: Awakens one we cannot compare!

translation.lb: (Refrain.)
translation.en: (Refrain.)

translation.lb: Mir ruften iech en Eddë zö fir emer!
translation.en: We call an ode for you forever!

translation.lb: Mir hu genoch mat desem ènge Fall;
translation.en: We have enough with this one case;

translation.lb: Wr mir der sin, dir faut am.Liewen neiner
translation.en: Where there are us, none are needed in life

translation.lb: 'Sö dichteg Leit, a sieht dir iwerall!
translation.en: Such good people, and you see them everywhere!

translation.lb: A loszt amHierscht sie 'mol zesummentneden,

translation.en: and write in your certificate that it is due to uncleanliness.

translation.lb: D'Médchen.
translation.en: The girl.

translation.lb: Och Här Dokter, könnt der dann net wënegstens e latengescht Wûrt duortir setzen?
translation.en: Oh Doctor, can you not at least use a Latin word for it?

translation.lb: Dě Feianer Postkollěen.
translation.en: The postal colleagues of Veianen.

translation.lb: Den Här Hess: 't ass ower èng Schân!
translation.en: Mr. Hess: 'It's a disgrace!'.

translation.lb: Vëer Dég fir esö èng Köscht Cigâren fun jiittelbréck op Feianen ze krëen!
translation.en: Four days to get such a box of cigars from Ettelbruck to Veianen!

translation.lb: Den Hôtelier Picard: Da beklot dir iech net!
translation.en: Hotelier Picard: Then don't complain!

translation.lb: Ech hu Kröschtdag Sardinen fir d'Fâschte bestallt, dë sin nach net ûkommt!
translation.en: I ordered sardines for Christmas for Lent, and they still haven't arrived!

translation.lb: De Fridensstěrer Den Auermécher.
translation.en: The disturber of peace, the clockmaker.

translation.lb: Wë sit der mat dém Wecker zefridden, dén ech iech verkaft hun.
translation.en: Are you satisfied with the alarm clock I sold you?

translation.lb: Den Här.
translation.en: The gentleman.

translation.lb: Dén hun ech ewèll lang an dausent Stecker geschlôn.
translation.en: I have long since smashed it into a thousand pieces.

translation.lb: Den Auermécher.
translation.en: The clockmaker.

translation.lb: Oh, a wë dât?
translation.en: Oh, and why is that?

translation.lb: Den Här.
translation.en: The gentleman.

translation.lb: Ma eramer huot dë Kanalje' mech am bèschte Schlof gestëert.
translation.en: Well, because this rascal disturbed me during my best sleep.

translation.lb: D’Mammenhiêrz.
translation.en: The Mother's Heart.

translation.lb: Ech froen dech: Wât ass dat Schönst, Dat op der Wèlt. ê fent?
translation.en: I ask you: What is the most beautiful thing found in the world?

translation.lb: Ass et de Reichtoni an sei Glanz, Dén ons 'sö dack ferblent?
translation.en: Is it the wealth and its splendor that so often blinds us?

translation.lb: Och nên! All Pracht der Wèlt fergêt, Dât Schönst sich ânerwierz!
translation.en: Oh no! All the splendor of the world fades, the most beautiful is elsewhere!

translation.lb: Dât Schönst op Gottes weiter lérd, Dât ass e Mammenhierz!
translation.en: The most beautiful on God's wide earth, that is a mother's heart!

translation.lb: Ech froen dech: Wàt ass dât Bèscht Rondrem am lérdendall?
translation.en: I ask you: What is the best around in the valley of life?

translation.lb: Ass et am Liewen d'Gléck an d'Frét Mat hirem Glanz a Schall?
translation.en: Is it in life the happiness and joy with their shine and sound?

translation.lb: Och nên! Wär d'Frét och nach 'sö gröss, Dât Bèscht sich ânerwierz!
translation.en: Oh no! Even if joy were so great, the best is elsewhere!

translation.lb: Dât bèscht an onsem lérdendall, Dàt ass e Mammenhièrz!
translation.en: The best in our valley of life, that is a mother's heart!

translation.lb: Ech froen dech; wö ass dât Treitst Ze fannen op der "Welt;
translation.en: I ask you; where is the most faithful to be found in the world;

translation.lb: Dât dech a kènger Sâch ferrët An emmer zö dir hält?
translation.en: That never abandons you in anything and always supports you?

translation.lb: Dén treiste Frend drët dir de Réck Am Onggléck dack a Schmierz
translation.en: The most faithful friend often turns his back on you in misfortune and pain

translation.lb: Wö fens du nun dë richteg Trei?
translation.en: Where do you now find true loyalty?

translation.lb: Sich sie beim Mammenhierz!
translation.en: Look for it in a mother's heart!

translation.lb: Graff. Sie. Elo gesin ech dach àn, dass de mech nure' fir meng Sûe' geholl huos.
translation.en: Count. She. Now I see clearly that you only took me for my money.

translation.lb: Hien. Dat soll der dach en Tröscht sin.
translation.en: He. That should be a comfort to you.

translation.lb: Sie. En Tröscht?
translation.en: She. A comfort?

translation.lb: Hien. Natirlech; do geseis de dach, dass ech net esö domm sin, wës du emraer mèngs.
translation.en: He. Of course; there you can see that I am not as foolish as you always think.

translation.lb: Dê lange Brômônd.
translation.en: The long Brômônd.

translation.lb: De Bauer X. fa Woltz hât èngt fett Schwéiu geschloâcht, dât gès war bis op èng hennescht Hamm.
translation.en: The farmer X. from Woltz had slaughtered a fat pig, only a back leg was left.

translation.lb: Dë losse mer hènken, bis de lange Brômônd (Erntezeit! ként", sot de Bauer zu sénger Fra.
translation.en: "We'll let it hang until the long Brômônd (harvest time!) comes," said the farmer to his wife.

translation.lb: ~Mir ass et égal", sot d'Fra, „da bleift se hènke bis e kéut."
translation.en: "I don't mind," said the wife, "then it will stay hanging until he comes."

translation.lb: No enger klenger Zeit ként e schrecklich grösse Mân eran, a grâd ewë de Bauer om Feld war.
translation.en: After a short time, a terribly large man came in, just as the farmer was in the field.

translation.lb: Bei dér guder Mèngichen sét d'Fra: „Sit dir flèicht dè lange Brômônd?
translation.en: With good intentions, the wife said: "Might you be the long Brômônd?

translation.lb: Eise Man sot, dir krit eng Hamm bei èis, hôl der se elo fléicht mat?"
translation.en: Our husband said you would get a leg from us, maybe you can take it now?"

translation.lb: ~Mè gewass," sot de Frémen, „da get mer se glèich mat."
translation.en: "Certainly," said the stranger, "then I'll take it right away."

translation.lb: Hè kritt d'Hamm a gung schmunzelnd sènger Wé.
translation.en: He took the leg and went on his way smiling.

translation.lb: Owes wë de Bauer hèm ként, sét d'Frâ: „De lange Brômônd war hei, an èch hoân em d'Hamm mat fort gin."
translation.en: In the evening when the farmer came home, the wife said: "The long Brômônd was here, and I gave him the leg."

translation.lb: De Bauer stèt wë ferstèngert dô.
translation.en: The farmer stood there as if petrified.

translation.lb: Op èmol gèt em èngt Licht op, mè du hoât et gerabbelt am Brôtschàf fir d'Fra.
translation.en: Suddenly, a light went on for him, but then there was a commotion in the bread box for the wife.

translation.lb: Dâss èppes anescht.
translation.en: That's something different.

translation.lb: Den Hèr (rift an ènger Roserei an d'Kichen): Ass dât nêss en léssen.
translation.en: The gentleman (shouting in anger into the kitchen): Is that edible or not?

translation.lb: Dass jo kê Mensch, dén dat verquösse kann!
translation.en: No person could eat that!

translation.lb: D'Mod. Sot emol, Här, esö eng Behandlong lôssen ech mer êmol net gefalen.
translation.en: The maid: Sir, let me tell you, I won't tolerate being treated like that.

translation.lb: Den Här.
translation.en: The gentleman.

translation.lb: Oh, exkusëert, Marie, ech hu gemênt, et wär d'Madam.
translation.en: Oh, excuse me, Marie, I thought it was the lady of the house.

translation.lb: Seine Ruhe. Sept}: Sag' 'mal, 2lron, trenn Ijalt'ft ®u benn eigentlich immer "Seine iDîittagëruh'?
translation.en: His Rest. Sept: Tell me, Iron, do you actually always keep your midday rest?

translation.lb: stron: 28enn nter gegeffen bab'n, bann fdjilaft fe getröhnlich e Stunb'.
translation.en: Iron: When we have eaten, she usually sleeps for an hour.

translation.lb: Sert): ÏBer benn?
translation.en: Sert: Who then?

translation.lb: 3trm: 9îu, mei' grau.
translation.en: Iron: You know, my wife.

translation.lb: Sert): geh frag' aber, trenn Su Sein' 3[Rittagä= ruh' haKen thufi?
translation.en: Sert: But tell me, when do you take your midday rest?

translation.lb: ïïron: 9îu, trenn fie fchlaft, bann hab' ich mein' Dtuh'!
translation.en: Iron: You know, when she sleeps, then I have my peace!

translation.lb: D’Chamber.
translation.en: The Chamber.

translation.lb: I. Ons Chamber ass en Institut Fir d'Kreischen a fir d'Lâchen, Well do ass et erlâbt ze son Dé onggeheierst Sâchen.
translation.en: I. Our Chamber is an institution for screaming and laughing, because there it is allowed to say the most outrageous things.

translation.lb: Dé gi gedréckt an ausgedélt An da ka jidrê liésen, Wât dât doan en Zodi ass An en Trublewiésen.
translation.en: They are printed and distributed and then everyone can read what nonsense that is and how disturbing it can be.

translation.lb: Refrain.
translation.en: Chorus.

translation.lb: Wât s'an der Chamber Och dun a sôn, Dat mécht jo haut dach Kengem Mensch mé bâng,
translation.en: Whatever is done and said in the Chamber, nowadays it doesn't scare anyone anymore,

translation.lb: Dé ganze Krepeng Ass ons wé Zossiss, An hätte mer keng T'wär ons s<s brét wé läng.
translation.en: The whole mess is like sausage to us, and if we had none, it would fry us longer.

translation.lb: 11. De Prüm dén dêlt de Ségen aus, Dè Bech dé sékundéert,
translation.en: II. Prüm dispenses the blessings, Bech supports it,

translation.lb: An t'ass de Brincour dén d'ganzt Haus Schén un der Nuos 'rein féert.
translation.en: And it is Brincour who leads the whole house nicely by the nose.

translation.lb: Den Dell, dé firt mé widdeg dran, A könnt den Här Tornaco, Den Hess, den Toni Erpelding, Da rift d'ganz d'Chamber: Bravo!
translation.en: Dell, he pitches in wildly, then comes Mr. Tornaco, Hess, Toni Erpelding, and then the whole Chamber shouts: Bravo!

translation.en: III. Laval also stands up and utters his word, and that Robert chirps sometimes, that must astonish everyone;

translation.lb: Den Xavier de schléckt d'Pâfen an, • Dât kränkt de Burgermêschter An Uoleg schitt den Hemmer dann Op dé onröheg Gêschter.
translation.en: Xavier swallows the wafer, that upsets the mayor and Uoleg then throws the hammer at the restless spirits.

translation.lb: Refrain.

translation.lb: IV. De Welter könnt dann, an den Zaff Geléert doctrinéren,
translation.en: IV. Then Welter comes, and the learned one starts to preach,

translation.lb: Wé en der Mönschhet könnt den Draff Fun Armut eweg kuréren;
translation.en: How he could cure humanity of the affliction of poverty;

translation.lb: De Birtringer stêt och 'mol op An hält èng Riéd zum Lutschen,
translation.en: Birtringer also stands up and gives a speech for enjoyment,

translation.lb: Demo gét alles an d'Geschîr Fir d'Wêen an d'Postkutschen.
translation.en: But everything is set in motion for carriages and stagecoaches.

translation.lb: Refrain.

translation.en: V. With preaches and sermons and however they keep themselves,

translation.lb: T'bleiwt alles, ailes wé et ass, Beim gude' brâven Alen.
translation.en: Everything remains as it is, with the good old ones.

translation.lb: Lôsst ailes gôn ewé et gêt, Losst frôn a son a Kreischen.
translation.en: Let everything go the way it will, let them be happy and shout.

translation.lb: Onst Schöffelche' get gud gelêt Fir alles surgt den Här Fyschen.
translation.en: Our little shovel is well laid, Mr. Fyschen takes care of everything.

translation.en: At the Peace Court.

translation.lb: De Richter (zum Zeien).
translation.en: The judge (to the witness).

translation.lb: Kamfl soll den Ugekloten îech vernannt hun?
translation.en: Did the defendant allegedly call you a camel?

translation.lb: E bestreit dât ower ganz ferm.
translation.en: He denies that very firmly, though.

translation.lb: Den Zeien.
translation.en: The witness.

translation.lb: Et ass miglech, dass e vleicht en anert Wurt gebraucht huot mä gewënlech gin ech ower Kamël vernannt.
translation.en: It is possible that he might have used a different word, but usually, I am called camel.

translation.lb: England hält fest am Zukunftskrieg.
translation.en: England is steadfast in the future war.

translation.lb: „Btnmal muß bie ©ntfdjeibung fallen!"
translation.en: "The decision must fall soon!"

translation.lb: £)ört man 'ä »an Stnibon £jcr evfdwLlen.
translation.en: That's what one hears from London seriously.

translation.lb: „Unb fftujjtanb muff fidj anfelfen fdjaffen ©obalb alö möglid) mit bcn SBaffen!"
translation.en: "And the resistance must be put down as soon as possible with weapons!"

translation.lb: 2Saru:n? SÖÜJU?
translation.en: Why? What for?

translation.lb: fragt ftaunenb man. ©ajf ©nglanb Reiften nehmen fann.
translation.en: People ask in astonishment whether England can engage in conflicts.

translation.lb: Virsîchteg.
translation.en: Careful.

translation.lb: De Mêschter (um Desch, zum Lëerbôf).
translation.en: The master (at the table, to the student).

translation.lb: Du huos jo de'i ganzt FJêseh nach um Teller leien; fir wat ess d'et dann net?
translation.en: You still have the entire fish on your plate; why aren't you eating it?

translation.lb: De Böf. T'ass mer nach ze gliddeg.
translation.en: The boy. It's still too slippery for me.

translation.lb: De Méschter. Tobias, da blos et dach.
translation.en: The master. Tobias, then blow on it.

translation.lb: De Böf. Quetschen och, dass et nach fortflët.
translation.en: The boy. Also squeezing it so it doesn't slip away again.

translation.lb: Bei der Uolzecht.
translation.en: By the Alzette.

translation.lb: En Här, zu engem Pescher, nodém ass en em eng halef Stonn nogekuckt huot): Ech ka mer ne'ischt me Dommes denken ewë d'Feschen.
translation.en: A gentleman, to a fisherman, after watching him for half an hour): I can't think of anything more foolish than fishing.

translation.lb: De Fescher. Oh dach!
translation.en: The fisherman. Oh yes!

translation.lb: Den Här. A wât dann?
translation.en: The gentleman. And what then?

translation.lb: De Fescher. D'Nokucken! Dâss nach vill më domm.
translation.en: The fisherman. Watching! That's much more foolish.

translation.lb: Dratlos Depéschen.
translation.en: Restless Dispatches.

translation.lb: Den Här Mark huot aus dem Louvre fu Pareis eng gross Popp a Paschtôeschkléder komme loszt, fir an der Chamber dermat ze spillen.
translation.en: Mr. Mark has had a large doll in pastry clothes sent from the Louvre of Paris, to play with in the Chamber.

translation.lb: Den Här Kayser fu Eoodt ass kê Frent fum erwiérmte Kâbes, e plâdéert det Joer fir d'Bèsserstèllong fun de Kaplén.
translation.en: Mr. Kayser from Eodt is not a friend of the heated cabbage, he is pleading this year for the improvement of the chaplains.

translation.lb: Den Här Laval hât, fir den Hären aus der Chamber den Text ze liésen, èng famés Riéd prâparéert; sie war em dach e wéneg ze stark, wel wé en sie dohém ferbrannt huot, huot et de ganze Miérscherdall foll gestonk.
translation.en: Mr. Laval had prepared a famous speech to read the text to the gentlemen of the Chamber; it was a bit too strong for him, because when he burned it at home, the whole Mersch valley stank terribly.

translation.lb: Den Här Eyschen huot e neit Schmiér erfont, fir wann et net recht firu weit; 't sin e pour Eerekreizer an èng Parthie Subsidden dra geschmolt.
translation.en: Mr. Eyschen has invented a new lubricant, for when things don't go quite right; a few ear crosses and a batch of subsidies have been melted in.

translation.lb: Den Här Prüm huot nach de Krèmpchen am Gebéck fun sénge Riéden zu Köln an zu Lille, do lacht de Welter.
translation.en: Mr. Prüm still has cramps in his cheeks from his speeches in Cologne and in Lille, there Welter laughs.

translation.lb: Den Här Knepper liwert de Wein an d'Restauratiôn fun der Chamber, prima gezéckerten.
translation.en: Mr. Knepper supplies the wine and the restaurant of the Chamber, superbly sweetened.

translation.lb: Den Här Bech huot net mé fill fir de Prenz. sie soen, 't wär him mé èng deck Plâtz um Wöllem ofïeréert.
translation.en: Mr. Bech no longer has much for the Prince. They say he has been offered only a thick sheepskin place.

translation.lb: Den Här Kirpach ass fléck wé en Huos, e weit guor net mé an der Fotèll sëtze bleiwen.
translation.en: Mr. Kirpach is nimble as a rabbit, he doesn't want to remain sitting in the armchair anymore.

translation.lb: Zu Colmer um Schlast- sollen det Joer och letzeburger Lieferanten un d'Reih kommen.
translation.en: In Colmar at the feast, Luxembourg suppliers are also supposed to get their turn this year.

translation.lb: Schappmännchen.
translation.en: Schappmännchen.

translation.lb: Fu Rammeldang nom „blannen Haff-',
translation.en: From Rammeldang to the 'blind yard',

translation.lb: Wann ên net könneg ass am Fléen,
translation.en: If one is not able in the flying,

translation.lb: Muss ên dûrch Böscher déck a gratf Lanscht d'Stêkaul sech beraéhen.
translation.en: One must make one's way through thick forests along the sharp embankment.

translation.lb: De Wé ass schmuol a schlängelt seçh Dûrch d'Treisch lanscht majestätesch Èchen,
translation.en: The path is narrow and winds through the undergrowth past majestic oaks,

translation.lb: Dé Stûrm a Want stéts gént de Strech Statt sech ze béen, léwer brechen.
translation.en: The storm and wind always stand against the stretch, preferring to break rather than bend.

translation.lb: Ganz op der Hécht zét et sech platt Eng Stonn a mé no alle Seiten;
translation.en: At the very top, it stretches flat an hour or more in all directions;

translation.lb: Wién dese Plateau Nuots betratt, Fergösst et net op éweg Zeiten.
translation.en: Whoever steps on this plateau at night, never forgets it for eternity.

translation.lb: De wolle Jéer haust elei, Dé Klèng a Gross Schappmännchen nènnen;
translation.en: For many years, it has housed the beings known as Schappmännchen, small and large;

translation.lb: De Leiden ass d'wöll Juocht net nei, Sie hé'ren dack am Bosch d'wöllt Rènnen.
translation.en: The burden is not new to the wild hunt, they often hear wild racing in the forest.

translation.lb: Gént Hallefnuocht, wann 't deischter ass, An d'Leit séss an de Bètter drémen,
translation.en: Towards midnight, when it is dark, and people sit dreaming in their beds,

translation.lb: Da gét de Juochtspektâkel lass, An 't krâcht an 't rabbeit an de Bémen.
translation.en: Then the hunting spectacle begins, and it crashes and rumbles in the trees.

translation.lb: Wé Blötz an Donner dauscht dûrch d'Lûcht Gebiii, Geschötz, Gejeiz a Bloszen,
translation.en: Like lightning and thunder, there echoes through the air cries, shots, shouts, and blasts,

translation.lb: 'T mèngt ên, der Deiwel hätt seng Fùcht Am Bosch a géf matn Himmel roszen.
translation.en: One would think the devil had set loose his fury in the forest and rages against the skies.

translation.lb: Bâl ass et no, bal weit ewèch, Ass géf de Widderhall et droen;
translation.en: Soon it is near, soon far away, as if the echo carries it;

translation.lb: 'Lo klengt wé Spott et brét a frèch, Dann 'rem wé Seifzer déf a Kloen.
translation.en: Now it sounds like mockery, broad and cheeky, then again like deep sighs and lamentation.

translation.lb: Ass wann èng Musék nûn dûrch d'Loft Mat follem Spîl gezun géf kommen,
translation.en: It's as if music now draws through the air with a full play coming,

translation.lb: 'Sö héert Tén ên ongferhofft Fu Schèllen, Jummdèckel'n an Trommen.
translation.en: One hears tones unexpectedly from bells, cymbals, and drums.

translation.lb: Da klâkt et frôh an Hüh! Hott! Hâr! Schält et fun èngem Ènn zum àner,
translation.en: Then it sounds cheerful and 'Hüh! Hott! Hâr!' echoes from one end to the other,

translation.lb: Ass wären hei mat Won a Kâr AU Foerleit fu Cliérf bis Gàner!
translation.en: As if here with carriage and cart there are drivers from Clervaux to Gander!

translation.lb: Dann 'rem wé Geieschall a Flitt, Schlét hiérzlech léf et iéch un d'O'er;
translation.en: Then again like a vulture's cry and flight, it strikes lovingly sweetly at your ear;

translation.lb: An hannendrun kléngt 'wé e Litt Et dann fum bèschtgeschdlte Kôer.
translation.en: And afterwards sounds like a song from the best trained choir.

translation.lb: Wién dé Zeit an dem Bosch nach ass Gléft mir, ech wöll jo kê bedréen!
translation.en: Whoever is in the forest at this time, believe me, I wouldn't deceive you!

translation.lb: Dén trapp foll Rôh op d'Hêmecht lass, An 't werd him fir kên Zèns geschéhen!
translation.en: He who sets full peace towards home, no harm will befall him!

translation.lb: Wié giér Schappmännche kènne géf, Brauch him blôss èppes nozemâchen,
translation.en: Whoever would like to know Schappmännchen, only need imitate them,

translation.lb: Sei Bockel kritt mé, wé him léf, A Joer lâng fergêt him d'Lâchen!
translation.en: His hunchback gains more than he likes, and for a year his laughter will vanish!

translation.lb: Getrei befollegt.
translation.en: Faithfully followed.

translation.lb: D'Mama.
translation.en: The mother.

translation.lb: Poli, wë mécht ên, wann en esö eng lëf Visit krit?
translation.en: Poli, what does one do when one receives such a lovely visit?

translation.en: Immediately go there, then you give the gentleman your hand and then you say nicely: "Hello!"

translation.en: "Hello, you, Tobias, there!"

translation.lb: En extra merci fir d'Blumen an d'Messen.
translation.en: A special thanks for the flowers and the masses.

translation.lb: D'Sechswochemess ass e Freideg, den 27. 10. 1944 em 9 Auer an der Herz Jesu-Kirch op der Gare.
translation.en: The six-week mass is on Friday, 27.10.1944 at 9 o'clock in the Sacred Heart Church at the station.

translation.lb: Verdédegong vu Vere’der 1944 gi mer hei, iwersat en Artikel „La défense das Traîtres" erem, dén och fir ons vu gro'ssem Intresse ass.
translation.en: Defense of Traitors 1944 is being translated here with the article "The Defense of Traitors," which is of great interest to us too.

translation.lb: „De Conseil de l'Ordre vum Barreau vu Möns huet bescbloss, dass am Prinzip d'Verdédegong vun déne Perso'nen, de' op Grond vun den Art. 113—123 vum Code pénal ugesicht gin, freigestalt bleiwt.
translation.en: The Council of the Bar of Mons has decided that, in principle, the defense of persons prosecuted under Articles 113-123 of the penal code remains free.

translation.lb: Et ass ower, aus he'je Konvenienzigrönn, den Affelcote verbueden d'Verdédegong z iwerhuelen fir de'.
translation.en: However, for reasons of convenience, the attorneys are forbidden to take over the defense for the following individuals.

translation.lb: 1) de' d'Uniform ge'nt d'Belscht a seng Ailie'erten gedroen hun,
translation.en: 1) those who have worn the uniform against Belgium and its allies,

translation.lb: 2) de' eng Uniform gedroen hun an den deitschen oder rexisteschc Formatio'nen an Dengschter,
translation.en: 2) those who have worn a uniform in German or Rexist formations in service,

translation.lb: 3) de' am Dengscht oder am Sold vun der feindlecher Police geschafft hun,
translation.en: 3) those who have worked in the service or pay of the enemy police,

translation.lb: 4) de' dem Feind Höllef bru echt hun a scngem Krich.
translation.en: 4) those who have provided assistance to the enemy in this war.

translation.lb: An all déne Fäll get dem Ugekloten en Affekot d'office gestallt vunn Bâtonnier.
translation.en: In all these cases, the accused is provided a court-appointed lawyer by the Bâtonnier.

translation.lb: Wann desen Affekot, d;é fix d'Verdédegong bestalt ass, 'net pläde'ere kann, muss liién dem Conseil de l'Ordre seng Grönn bekannt gin.
translation.en: If the lawyer appointed for this defense cannot plead, they must disclose their reasons to the Council of the Order.

translation.lb: D'Provisio'n an d'Honorar fir de' Fäll, wo' den Affekot d'office bestalt get, gi ganz de patrioteschen Arichtongen iwerwisen.
translation.en: The provisions and fees for cases where the court-appointed lawyer is assigned are entirely remitted to patriotic institutions.

translation.lb: Eng helleg Pflicht!
translation.en: A sacred duty!

translation.lb: Et go'f ons a leschier Zeit widerhuelt d'Fro gestallt, ob de Staat fit d'Oennerstetzong vun déne Familjen opke'm, wo' de Papp oder de Jong fit d'Hémecht gefall ass.
translation.en: In recent times, the question has been repeatedly raised whether the state should support the families of those whose father or son has fallen for the homeland.

translation.lb: Dat götlt fir all de' de' am Krich gefall sin, an och fit ons Milizleit, de' elo am lèschte Streit ge'nt de Preiss nach hirt Liéwe geloss hun, oder nach losse müssen.
translation.en: That applies to all those who have fallen in war, and also for our militia members, who have recently fought against the Prussians and have given or still have to give their lives.

translation.lb: D'UNIO'N huet am Krich fir ail de" Leit gesurgt, de' an No't woren, si mecht et och elo nach.
translation.en: The UNION provided for all the people in need during the war, and it still does so now.

translation.lb: Et ass ower eng helleg Pflicht vum Staat, fir de' Familjen opzekommen an hinnen net en Almosen ze gin, ma dat wat hinnen zo'könnt: d'Me'glechkét weider o'ni Surgen ze liéwen.
translation.en: However, it is a sacred duty of the state to provide for the families and not to give them charity, but what is due to them: the possibility to live on without worries.

translation.lb: Mir erwarden dattons Regirong direkt zu deser Fro eng offiziell Stellong höllt, fir datt de' Familjen, de' o'nidém genug gelidden hun, we'negstens deser Surg enthuetve sin.
translation.en: We therefore expect the government to take an official position on this matter immediately, so that the families, who have already suffered enough, are at least freed from this worry.

translation.en: I can tell you that it is not goodwill that the farmer lacks, but rather personnel and yet again personnel.

translation.lb: Mir hu bei eisern gro'sse Betrieb z. B. als énzeg weiblech Krftft eis Mamm vun 61 Jor.
translation.en: In our large operation, for example, the only female labor we have is our 61-year-old mother.

translation.lb: Hu mir dat verdengt, nodém an der preisescher Zeit honnerte vu Jongen bei de Bauere verstoppt woren, an eis Jongen iwerall gudd geliéwt hun, jo, op Plazen eso'gur gemäscht go'wen.
translation.en: Have we deserved this after hundreds of boys were hidden with farmers during the Prussian times, and our boys were well-liked everywhere, even raised in some places?

translation.lb: Iwert d'Preisser, de' de Bauer krit, an de' de' den Arbechter kann am Butek bezuelen, wir och nach vill ze schreiwen.
translation.en: There is also much to be written about the prices that the farmer receives and what the worker has to pay in the shop.

translation.lb: Hei e Beispill: Fir e gudd Kallef kre'e mir 700 Fr.; wivill Flésch krit é fir dat Geld?
translation.en: Here is an example: We receive 700 francs for a good calf; how much meat can one get for that money?

translation.lb: E Liter Möllech/ kuscht 2.25 Frang, é Liter Be'er kascht 6—7 Frang!
translation.en: A liter of milk costs 2.25 francs, a liter of beer costs 6-7 francs!

translation.en: I have written enough for you today.

translation.lb: Ecb si gär averstanen, iech weider gené iwert d'Landwirtschaft ze oriente'eren.
translation.en: I am willing to continue informing you about agriculture with pleasure.

translation.en: We have made sure to present your letter as we received it, and we would be pleased to receive more from you, as well as from our other readers in the country about agricultural questions and concerns,

translation.lb: Fir allem Gespre'ch d'Sipölzt ze briéchen déle mir matt, dass heimatt net letzeburger Jopge gemengt sin,
translation.en: To break the silence in all conversations, we would like to clarify that this does not refer to Luxembourgish youth who withdrew from the Prussian Wehrmacht,

translation.lb: de' sçch der preisescher Wehrmacht entzunn hun.
translation.en: and have thus escaped the Prussian Wehrmacht.

translation.lb: Wat d'Fro vum Besetze vun onser Ostgrenz ubelangt,
translation.en: As far as the question of occupying our eastern border is concerned,

translation.lb: do könne mer ro'eg unhuelen dass, ir et mol eso'weit ass,
translation.en: we can calmly assume that by the time it comes to that,

translation.lb: sech eso'vill Freiwölleger gemellt hun,
translation.en: there will have been so many volunteers,

translation.lb: dass eng Conscriptio'n virof emol net duçchgefe'ert brauch ze gin.
translation.en: that a conscription will not initially need to be carried out.

translation.lb: De neien Unterrichtsminister Am ganze Land go'f d'Mattdélong iwer d'Ernennong vum Här Prof. Frieden zum Unterrichtsminister matt gre'sster Zefriddenhét opgehol.
translation.en: The new Minister of Education Throughout the entire country, the announcement of Mr. Prof. Frieden as Minister of Education was met with great satisfaction.

translation.lb: D'Unio'n frét des Le'song ganz speziell, well den Här Frieden aus hire Reien ervirgét, well et de Minister vun der Unio'n ass, dén hire Géscht kennt a verstét.
translation.en: The union is especially pleased with this decision, because Mr. Frieden comes from their ranks, because he is the Minister of the union who knows and understands their spirit.

translation.lb: Et ass ganz wichteg datt an deser Zeit grad un d'Spötzt vum Unterrichtswiesen en neie Mann gestallt get, é Mann we' é fir dé Posten ké besseren hätt fanne können.
translation.en: It is very important that at this time a new man is placed at the head of the education system, a man for whom no better could have been found for this position.

translation.lb: Mir wössen all datt e de Jonktem ass, dén d'Zokonft vum Land bedeit, an datt dese Jonktem no 4 Jor Naziregim nés an de' richteg Bunne geléd muss gin.
translation.en: We all know that it is the youth who represent the future of the country, and that this youth must be guided back onto the right path after 4 years of Nazi regime.

translation.lb: Et ass keng licht Aufgab, de' den Här Minister Frieden ze méschteren huet.
translation.en: It is no easy task that Minister Frieden has to master.

translation.lb: Wat d'Preisen am Unterricht an an der Erze'ong bei onsem Jonktem vernole'ssegt a verduerwen hun, dat ass net ze beschreiwen.
translation.en: What the Prussians have neglected and ruined in education and upbringing among our youth is indescribable.

translation.lb: Fir dat alles nés nozehuelen, dat ass eng schwe'er a verantwortungsvoll Arbecht, de' vill Energie verlangt, e klore Kapp, an e gro'sst Verstoe vun der se'lescher No't vum Jonktem.
translation.en: To catch up on all this, it is a difficult and responsible task that requires a lot of energy, a clear mind, and a great understanding of the spiritual needs of the youth.

translation.lb: Et stellt sech dann nach eng gro'ss Fro, un de' de Letzeburger nach nie eso' richteg wollt drugon: D'Fro vun der Sprôch.
translation.en: Then there still arises a big question, which the Luxembourgers have never really wanted to touch on: The question of language.

translation.lb: — No desem Krich ass de' Sach eso' akut gin, datt se net me' därf vernole'ssegt gin.
translation.en: — After this war, the matter has become so acute that it can no longer be neglected.

translation.lb: De' 4 Jor Krich hu färdeg bruecht wat fre'er ké färdeg brenge könnt, si hun de Jonktem vum Land gele'ert seng Sprôch kennen a gär hun.
translation.en: The 4 years of war have accomplished what could not be done before, they have taught the youth of the country to know and love their language.

translation.lb: De letzeburger Jonktem verlangt haut eng ganz aner Positio'n fir d'Letzeburger Sprôch, a matt Recht.
translation.en: Today's Luxembourgish youth demands a completely different position for the Luxembourgish language, and rightly so.

translation.lb: Natirlech bidden sech nach eng ganz Rei vu Schwieregkéten ir de' Fro definitiv ka geregelt gin.
translation.en: Of course, there are still a number of difficulties before the issue can be definitively resolved.

translation.lb: Mir erlaben ons dofir dem Här Unterrichtsminister nogeléen, datt endlech eng enhétlech Schreiwweis vum Letzeburgeschen festgeluegt get, an zwar me'glechst se'er, well dat ass elo ons gre'sst Suerg.
translation.en: We therefore allow ourselves to suggest to the Minister of Education that a uniform spelling of Luxembourgish be finally established, as soon as possible, because that is now our greatest concern.

translation.lb: Mir sin iwerzégt datt den Här Minister Frieden de Mann ass fir matt alle Schwieregkéten ferdeg ze gin a mir wönschen him all Gudds matt op de Wé am Dengscht vun onsem Jonktem a vum Land.
translation.en: We are convinced that Minister Frieden is the man to deal with all the difficulties, and we wish him all the best on his journey in the service of our youth and the country.

translation.lb: D'Unio'n.
translation.en: The Union.

translation.lb: Neischt am Eifer
translation.en: Nothing in the enthusiasm.

translation.lb: An der Volksstimme vun haut liése mer en Artikel „Reaktionäre Manöver in der UNION", wo' ons Astellong zu de Parteien zimlech scharf augegraff get
translation.en: In today's Volksstimme, we read an article 'Reactionary Maneuvers in the UNION', where our stance towards the parties is quite sharply attacked.

translation.lb: Mir wollen dorop ganz kurz dat hei äntweren:
translation.en: We would like to briefly respond to this:

translation.lb: 1. Mir können hei nömme confirme'eren, datt d'UNIO'N an d'ganzl Vollek matt all déne Mösstänn, de' aus der fre'erer Farwepolitik vun de Parteien ervirge'ngen, net d'accord sin, an datt d'Vollek tatsächlech eppes Neies verlängt.
translation.en: 1. We can only confirm here that the UNION and the entire population do not agree with all the grievances that have arisen from the outdated party politics, and that the people indeed demand something new.

translation.lb: 2. Dat Neit, wat mir virschloen, a wat mir engem Referendum vum ganze Vollek virlée wollen, nämlech eng me' stärk Berecksichtegong vun de Berufs organisatio'nen, huet matt E'streich.
translation.en: 2. The new proposal we suggest, which we want to present in a referendum to the entire population, namely a stronger consideration of professional organizations, has nothing to do with Spain or Portugal.

translation.lb: Italien, Spuenien a Portugal abselut neischt ze din.
translation.en: Italy, Spain, and Portugal have absolutely nothing to do with this.

translation.lb: Mir verlange gewielt Vertrieder, an net dèr, de' vun uewen erof ernannt gin, a mir we'sste gär wat dobei net demokratesch war.
translation.en: We demand elected representatives, not those appointed from above, and we would like to know what was undemocratic about this.

translation.lb: Mir musse leider feststellen, datt ons Virschle' vu verschiddene Leit matt Absicht verde't gin, well se Intresse dorun hun.
translation.en: We unfortunately have to ascertain that our proposals are being deliberately distorted by certain individuals because they have an interest in doing so.

translation.lb: 3. Mir könne ro'eg ervirhiewen, datt de Programm vun der UNIO'N ervirgângen ass aus 4 Programmen vu 4 verschiedenen Geheimorganisatio'nen, an et ass e gudd Zéchen, datt de' 4 Programmen an den Haptsâchen abselut iwerenégestômmt hun, en Zéchen, datt et Idie sin, de' vum ganze Vollek unerkannt gin.
translation.en: 3. We can calmly emphasize that the UNION's program emerged from 4 programs of 4 different secret organizations, and it is a good sign that the 4 programs absolutely agreed in the main points, a sign that these are ideas recognized by the entire population.

translation.lb: 4. Mir erlaben ons de' Fro, firwat grad (1 Volksstimme an der leschter Zeit d'Parteien eso' stârk a Schutz höllt, a we' et iwerhapt a Russland matt de Parteie stét?
translation.en: 4. We allow ourselves to ask why recently the Volksstimme is so strongly protecting the parties, and how things stand with the parties in Russia?

translation.lb: D'UNIO'N.
translation.en: The UNION.

translation.lb: Zum Artikel aus der Unio’n vum 11. 11. 1944 Nr. 7
translation.en: Regarding the article from the Unio'n dated 11.11.1944 No. 7

translation.lb: Wert mir Letzeburger vun onsem Steierminister erwarden
translation.en: What we Luxembourgers can expect from our Minister of Finance

translation.lb: De' Le'song, de' Der virgeschloen huet, huet nach dese Virdcl:
translation.en: The solution that has been proposed still contains this point:

translation.lb: och de' Leit kommen un d'Rei, de' et verstanen hun an déne ve'er Jor matt de Preise Geschäfter ze mächen
translation.en: also the people who understood and conducted business with prices during those four years will get their turn

translation.lb: a gleichzeiteg beim gudden, topeche Letzeburger (ower nömme wann d'Loft propper wor) ge'nt d'Preise lasszescholen, fir sech de sche'ne Männchen ze mächen.
translation.en: and at the same time, the good, brave Luxembourgers (but only when the air was clean) managed to let go of the prices to make themselves look good.

translation.lb: Am Fong ass neischt ge'nt se ze mächen, well d'Leit keng Uklo ge'nt se man, an da kann d'Unio'n net agreifen.
translation.en: In essence, nothing can be done against them, because people did not file complaints against them, and thus the Union cannot intervene.

translation.lb: Et gin der vill lafe gelöss, de' gudd konnten „Heil Hitler" soen a Geld spenden,
translation.en: Many were allowed to walk free, those who could say 'Heil Hitler' well and donate money,

translation.lb: an de' me' nidderträchteg woren we' de'je'neg, de' aus Angscht virum Ortsgruppenleiter oder soss engem Gielemännchen sech ge'nt onst Letzeburger Land vergängen hun.
translation.en: and were more despicable than those who out of fear of the local group leader or some other yellow man betrayed our Luxembourgish land.

translation.lb: De'je'neg woren eben eso' raffine'ert an hun sech gur net eso' weit blo'ss gestallt, datt se zu enger politescher Rechenschaft erugezun könnte gin.
translation.en: Those ones were so cunning and did not expose themselves enough to be held accountable politically.

translation.lb: Ower si sollen an därfen hirer Strof trotzdem net entgoen.
translation.en: But they should and must not escape their punishment nonetheless.

translation.lb: De Passus vun der Steiererklärong ass gudd.
translation.en: The clause in the tax declaration is good.

translation.lb: Matt engem Wurt: do kommen dèr och nach un d'Rei, de' virum Krich onser Regirong eso' sonderbar Erklärongen ofgin hun.
translation.en: In a word: there, those who gave such peculiar explanations to our government before the war will also get their turn.

translation.lb: A wann de Staat net surgt, datt et propper an onsem sche'ne Ländche get,
translation.en: And if the state does not ensure that it is clean in our beautiful little country,

translation.lb: da muss d'Vollek dofir surgen,
translation.en: then the people must ensure it,

translation.lb: ewell vun dénen all durf ké me' d'Geléenhét kre'en, eso' knaschteg Geschäfter ze mân önner démselwechten Deckmantel, we' an déne ve'er Krichsjoren.
translation.en: for none of them should get the opportunity anymore to conduct such filthy businesses under the same guise as in those four war years.

translation.lb: K.
translation.en: K.

translation.lb: D’Profiteuren „So", sot mei Frönd Joss, „hues de elo kape'ert, de' eng spille Patriot, an de' aner profite'eren a mâche Geld."
translation.en: The profiteers "You see," said my friend Joss, "do you understand now, one pretends to be a patriot, and the other profits and makes money."

translation.lb: „Eso' liun si et schon vrum an am Krich gemäch, an elo sin s'eröm deck am Gâng."
translation.en: "That's how they did it before, during the war, and now they're back at it again."

translation.lb: „Jo Joss", sot ech du,,,mé d'Krichsprofiteuren kre'en d'Handwierk geluegt, elo komme Preisser de' fest leien, si gin kontrolle'ert, an dan he'ert dat „schwärzt Schaffen" op."
translation.en: "Yes, Joss," I said then, "but the war profiteers are getting their craft curbed, now prices are set, they're being controlled, and then the 'black market' stops."

translation.lb: „Wann schon d'Le'n an d'Gchältcr fixe'ert sin, da müssen och d'Preisser a bestömmten Limite bleiwen, d'Resultat dovun ass dann eng stabil a gesond Liewenshaltong."
translation.en: "If wages and salaries are already fixed, then prices must also remain within certain limits, the result of which is a stable and healthy standard of living."

translation.lb: „Mei te'wen Jong", sot du de Joss, „ma der keng Illusio'ncn an zerbriech der de Kapp net iwer de' Sâchen. Ons Regirong war ve'er Jor fort an hat Zeit de' Problemen all;ert z'iwerle'en, — dat ass denen hir Such —, deng Sâch ass et fir no dir ze kucken."
translation.en: "My dear boy," said Joss then, "don't delude yourself and don't break your head over things. Our government was away for years and had time to think over all the problems, — that's their concern —, your concern is to take care of yourself."

translation.lb: „Arwur, ecti muss goen."
translation.en: "Anyway, I have to go."

translation.lb: Le'we Frönd Joss, délweis hues de Recht, an et dét engem gudde Letzeburger we' am Hierz, datt et momentan eso' ass.
translation.en: Dear friend Joss, partly you are right, and it pains a good Luxembourger to the heart that it is currently like this.

translation.lb: Nömmen du hues muenches vergiess, an ech wöll dech korrige'eren.
translation.en: But you have forgotten some things, and I want to correct you.

translation.lb: De' eng spillen net Patriot, mé si sin Patrioten, des Ke'er wor et keng Spillerei an et ass dëne Leit bludegen Iierscht; si sin zu Dausenden.
translation.en: Some do not pretend to be patriots, but they are patriots, this time it was no game and it is of bloody seriousness to these people; they are in thousands.

translation.lb: Da get et Leit de' spille Patriot an si profite'eren dovun fir hire Geldsak, si sin ze veruechten, an vili von hinnen luin datselwecht scho bei de Preise gemftch.
translation.en: Then there are people who pretend to be patriots and profit for their own wallets, they are to be despised, and many of them did the same already with prices.

translation.lb: Weider get et Leit, an dat sin de' Superklug, de' slo'ngen wärend der Zeit, wo' d'Letzeburger vun de Preisen gepisakt gi sin, ofseils, an hu Geld gemäch.
translation.en: Furthermore, there are people, and those are the super-smart ones, who hung back during the time when Luxembourgers were squeezed by prices, and made money.

translation.lb: Si hun ömmer verstan sech unzepassen, et ko m jo nöt drop un, an si hun fir d'Preisen geschafft.
translation.en: They always knew how to adapt, it never really mattered, and they worked for the prices.

translation.lb: HeirÇnner falen och de Zorl Leit, de' sech se'er Kammionetten ugeschâft hun a we' de Rlötz eweg waren an um Atlantik matgeschafft hun, dobei go'wen se nach politeseh a Ro' gelôss.
translation.en: Among them are also those who acquired their trucks and worked on the Atlantic when the places were vacant, meanwhile leaving politics behind.

translation.lb: Mé Joss, et ass jo nach net criwcr, nach lafen si frei dorömmcr, iné den Dag könt wo' si och de Kont regle'ere müssen.
translation.en: But Joss, it's not over yet, they still run around freely, until the day comes when they also have to settle the bill.

translation.lb: An dann nach Frönd Joss, mengs de nach, jidferén soll nömmen no sech kucken, a Geld mächen. — Wann dat eso' wir, da könte mir jo direkt apaken, da wir alles emsoss, a mir hätten a ve'er Jor neischt beigele'ert.
translation.en: And then, friend Joss, do you still think everyone should just look after themselves and make money. — If that were so, we could pack up right away, everything would be for nothing, and we would have learned nothing in four years.

translation.lb: Nén Joss, eso' sin mir net, well du wäre mir net besser we' de' Leit de' ömmer nömmen no sech gekuckt hun.
translation.en: No Joss, that's not how we are, because then we wouldn't be any better than the people who always just looked out for themselves.

translation.lb: Mir wollen mathöllcfen, datl mir dat erréchen wozo' mir en hellecht Recht hun, dat Recht op e frci't a gleeklccht Letzeburg.
translation.en: We want to help achieve what we have a holy right to, the right to a free and equal Luxembourg.

translation.lb: J.
translation.en: J.

translation.lb: A Russland op Wuecht Owend fäll»,
translation.en: In Russia, the Watchful Evening falls,

translation.lb: a Böscher kloen schwärz,
translation.en: a forest small and black,

translation.lb: onhemlech lauert d'Land,
translation.en: ominously the land lurks,

translation.lb: o, cch kann et net me' droen hem an d'Darf zn Dir mei Rand.
translation.en: oh, I can bear it no longer here and seek my edge towards you.

translation.lb: Sicht mein Dram op frieme Wéeo,
translation.en: My dream gazes upon foreign paths,

translation.lb: rifft meng Le'wt ans önnrem Schmiere;
translation.en: calls my people in other toils;

translation.lb: lôss se un dei Mond sech léen,
translation.en: let them lean on your moon,

translation.lb: weit mäch op dei wärmt, treit Hiera,
translation.en: far reaches towards your warmth, carries tears,

translation.lb: Iwer ons de'selwecht Staren an e göllne Mo'nd hält Wuecht.
translation.en: Above us the same stars and a golden moon keep watch.

translation.lb: A mir brennt dei Bild — we' gären, war ech bei Dir.
translation.en: And your image burns within me — how gladly, would I be with you.

translation.lb: Gudde Nuecht.
translation.en: Good Night.

translation.en: - signature. mann.

translation.lb: Letzeburger Liga ge’nt d’Tuberkulos.
translation.en: Luxembourg League against Tuberculosis.

translation.lb: D'Faiencerie vu Villeroy a Boch zo' Septfontaines stellt an den e'schten Deg am ganze Land verschidde patrtotesch Konschtge'gestänn vun hirer Fabrikatio'n zum Verkaf aus
translation.en: The Villeroy and Boch pottery in Septfontaines is displaying various patriotic art objects from their production for sale throughout the entire country in the first few days.

translation.lb: Si profite'ert vun der Geléenhét, fir d'Beme'ongen vun der iletzeburger Liga ge'nt d'Tuberkulos z'erlichteren, andém datt si hir en Del vum Erle's offre'ert.
translation.en: They take advantage of the opportunity to ease the burdens of the Luxembourg League against Tuberculosis by offering them a share of the proceeds.

translation.lb: Et göt Wèrt drop geluegt, datt de Verkafspreis et jidfer Portmonni erlabt, maltzemächen.
translation.en: Emphasis is placed on ensuring that the selling price makes it affordable for every wallet.

translation.lb: De' Konschtsâchen de', we' gesot, so' bal we' rae'glech an den Handel bruecht gin, stellen dur:
translation.en: The art objects, as mentioned, as soon as they are regularly brought to market, include:

translation.lb: t) Eng Bonbonnière matt dem Profil vun onser Gro'ssherzogin,
translation.en: 1) A candy box with the profile of our Grand Duchess,

translation.lb: 2>) e Konschtteller matt dem selwechte Bild an der Opschröft: Mir wolle bleiwe wat mer sin!,
translation.en: 2) An art plate with the same image and the inscription: We want to remain what we are!,

translation.lb: 3) an en aneren Teller matt der Devis: Trei zum Land, trei zur Kro'n!
translation.en: 3) and another plate with the motto: Loyal to the land, loyal to the crown!

translation.lb: E puer klenger Breloken, de' d'Ro's vum Prönz Jean, d'Initialen „Ch" an aner Motiver durstellen, gi spe'der, dalt hêscht, eso' bal se ferdeg virleien, dem Public zum Zweck, den arme Kranken bei;estoen, ugebueden.
translation.en: A few small pendants portraying the rose of Prince Jean, the initials "Ch," and other motifs, will be offered to the public later, that is, as soon as they are ready, for the purpose of assisting the poor sick.

translation.lb: De Consei'l vun der Liga wéss, datt de Letzebturger bei eso' Geléenhéten nöt knausert a gären hölleft, wo' et No't dét.
translation.en: The council of the League knows that the Luxembourger does not hold back and likes to help where there is need on such occasions.

translation.lb: Op et hei No't dét? Mir mengen eso'l De Krich huet seint, an nöt ze knapp, dozo' heigedroen, de' sozial Krankhéten aillegur, a besonnesch ower d'Tuberkulos, ze verbréden an de Widderstand ge'nt hirt Göft erofzesetzen.
translation.en: Is there a need here? We think so! The war has significantly contributed to the spread of social diseases, especially tuberculosis, and to decreasing resistance to its poison.

translation.lb: De beschten Dank fir de' nobel Höllef ass alle gesechert, de' sech um gudde Wierk bedélegen.
translation.en: The greatest thanks for the noble assistance is assured to all who participate in the good work.

translation.lb: Kanp et. eppes Sche'nres gin, We' dem Kranke beizestoen?
translation.en: Can there be anything more beautiful than standing by the sick?

translation.lb: We' dem Arme Gudds ze din, Wann hién drécken dausend Ploen?
translation.en: Than doing good for the poor when he is oppressed by a thousand hardships?

translation.lb: Göff och vun dem we'nge gär. Se'lero' dir ze beréden, Dat stierkt d'Hierz bis an de Kär, Dat wierkt de'f op d'Hierzensfréden.
translation.en: Give also gratefully. Encourage yourself to do so, it strengthens the heart to the core, it enhances the peace of the heart.

translation.lb: Haut, wo' Tromp ass be'se Gêscht Ass et duebel schc'n ze Iruechten
translation.en: Today, when hardship is often a guest, it is doubly beautiful to refrain.

translation.lb: Gudds ze-din, sengt Beseht, sengt Mêscht, An de Mönsch als Mönsch ze uechten.
translation.en: To do good, bless, and multiply, and to honor humanity as humanity.

translation.lb: Hei ass BBC-London Bonjour alleguerten, dohém an an der friémd!
translation.en: Here is BBC-London Hello everyone, at home and abroad!

translation.lb: Hei ass BBC-London, matt dem letzeburger programm...
translation.en: Here is BBC-London, with the Luxembourgish program...

translation.lb: De 9. märz 1941 sin des wieder fir d'e'scht radiodif fuseert gin.
translation.en: On March 9, 1941, these were broadcast for the first time.

translation.lb: Wal hu mir démola upgolauschtertl De' e'scht sendong hateu de' méscht Letzeburger verpasst, well si hate jo keng anong, datt et eso' eppes géng gin: am englesche radio, eng spéciell émissio'n fir dat klengt Letzeburg.
translation.en: But we listened to it that time! Most Luxembourgers missed the first broadcast because they had no idea that such a thing would exist: on the English radio, a special program for little Luxembourg.

translation.lb: Mé bei der zwéter sendong ho'nge mir all um radio an bu getauschter!
translation.en: But for the second broadcast, we were all gathered around the radio!

translation.lb: .... e wonnerbareii Iro'scht, erem neie iliéwensmndd bun de' stemmen onr vu London bruecht.
translation.en: .... a wonderful comfort, a new life courage brought by the voices from London.

translation.lb: An d'Hémecht ass erklongen, eso' sche'n huet si ons nach ni geschéngt; 'l ass engem eso' wéch gin...
translation.en: And 'The Homeland' was heard, it never seemed so beautiful to us; it touched us so deeply...

translation.lb: an dann ass én cmol matt der band iwer d'ae gefuer — d'mansJeidd hu sech net me' an d'ae gekuckt, si hu scch geschummt, weU d'tre'ne gebonzeit ko'men.
translation.en: and then suddenly the tape went over the air — people no longer looked each other in the eye, they were ashamed because the tears started to flow.

translation.lb: Vun 1943 un, hu mir d'„Lelzeburger" ve'er mol an der woeh gehe'ert A vum S. october un, ko'm d'Ietzeburger émissio'n cso'guer ail dagl
translation.en: From 1943 on, we heard the "Luxembourgish" four times a week and from October 8, the Luxembourgish program even came every day!

translation.lb: A munnecherén hoet 1043 de radio net me' gehe'ert.
translation.en: And some no longer heard the radio in 1943.

translation.lb: De' eng woren erscii-oss, de' ancr am Si oder an der Wehrmacht oder Gott wéss wo' nach.
translation.en: Some were shot, others in the SS or the Wehrmacht or God knows where else.

translation.lb: Mé och am Preiseland huet seoh d'BBC malt dem tetzeburger Programm gemeBt.
translation.en: But even in Germany, people tuned to the BBC with the Luxembourgish program.

translation.lb: lie' Letxeburger, de' an lieitscbland woren.
translation.en: The Luxembourgers who were in Germany.

translation.lb: wo' h un de' seoh ere'scht gefr6t.
translation.en: who only rejoiced.

translation.lb: wann s'erem Ictxebuxgesch he'eren l>un — an nacli dûreh 'de radio!
translation.en: when they could once again hear Luxembourgish — and through the radio!

translation.en: because they then showed the Prussians and the world: Luxembourg is German and remains German.

translation.en: And then Luxembourg spoke through the BBC to the world about its heroic struggle against the Prussian occupier, demonstrating that we were still Luxembourgers.

translation.en: And now there is peace; Luxembourg is free...

translation.en: The Luxembourgish voice was more necessary to us than daily bread.

translation.en: They were: 'Mr. Clasen, son of the former Luxembourg business representative in London, the chief commentator of the Luxembourgish broadcast, Mr. Fernand Stoll, son of Mr. Rend Stoll from Avenue Guillaume, Luxembourg, and last but not least, Mr. Armand Schleich from Esch/Alzette.

translation.lb: Den arbechter an der sehwe'erindustrie huet an déae battere krichsjoren der ganzer weit bewisen.
translation.en: The worker in the heavy industry has proven to the entire world during these bitter war years.

translation.lb: datt net d'schwetzen an d'te'nen d'sitaatio'n rette kann, mé datt d'doten zielen.
translation.en: that neither talking nor weeping can save the situation, but that deeds count.

translation.lb: Et woren emmer de' kleng, de' hu missen duerhalen.
translation.en: It was always the small ones who had to endure.

translation.lb: D'letzeburger Ingenieuren an d'betriebscheffer — matt we'negen ausnahmen — sin démois matt dem roff am knepplach gelaf, sto'ngen op der seit beim streik, an hun den arbechter ugehalen an dTdB, d'NSV an an d'DAF ze goen.
translation.en: The Luxembourgish engineers and company managers - with a few exceptions - ran off during that time, stood aside during the strike, and urged the workers to go to the TdB, the NSV, and the DAF.

translation.lb: Si hätten ower dem arbechter als virbild misse stoen, aplaz datt se dem klenge mann an de réck gefall sin.
translation.en: But they should have stood as role models for the workers, instead of betraying the little man.

translation.lb: Vun hinne woren der se'er we'neg an de reien vun der resistenz!
translation.en: Very few of them were among the ranks of the resistance!

translation.lb: An d'arbechter haten sech och allerhand virgeholi, fir wann den dag vun der ofrechnong sollt kommen!
translation.en: And the workers had quite a few things prepared for when the day of reckoning would come!

translation.lb: Et ass net villes ausgefe'ert gin!
translation.en: Not much has been executed!

translation.lb: Eng ganz mass vnn déneje'ncgen, dénen hir astellong am ganzen antisozial a netpatriotesch wor, sin erem op hir al plaze komm.
translation.en: A whole mass of those whose attitude was generally antisocial and unpatriotic have returned to their old positions.

translation.lb: All auslännesch hèren, de' gudd am ausländ op de rente so'tzen a keng anong vnn den affer vum letzeburger arbechter haten, sin erem um dill, an dat net ze knapps.
translation.en: All foreign lords who comfortably sit on pensions abroad and have no idea about the sacrifices of the Luxembourgish worker, are back in the fold, and not scarcely so.

translation.lb: Si wësse jo, datt se vnn he'ger plaz ans protëge'ert gin.
translation.en: They know that they are protected from on high.

translation.lb: Ass et do e «orner, wann d'arbechter d'flemm kre'enT
translation.en: Is it any wonder, then, when the workers get angry?

translation.lb: Ass et net ne'deg, do schnell a grëndleeh ze botzen?
translation.en: Is it not necessary to clean up quickly and thoroughly?

translation.en: Through a grand ducal decree of July 9, 1945, the finance minister or an instance designated by him can fully or partially release the goods, rights, and interests of a person belonging to an enemy power from sequestration, if they behaved accordingly during the war.

translation.en: Our boys had every chance to win the race, but they had terrible luck.

translation.en: According to the unanimous verdict of the sports press and the specialists, Kirchen and Bintner were in great form.

translation.en: They would have won the race without the terrible luck that pursued them on this 'dark Sunday'.

translation.lb: Vrum départ vrum Maison Alfoft un iwer Meiun, Corbeil, Juvisy wor ailes o'ni zwëschefall ofgelaf.

translation.lb: Kürz viru Versailles, ongefe'er 80 km virun der arrivée am Parc des Princes,ass de Bintner viru m peloton ausgerass a krut eng sche'n avance.
translation.en: Shortly before Versailles, about 80 km before the finish at Parc des Princes, Bintner broke away from the peloton and gained a nice lead.

translation.lb: Mé ongefe'er 20 km me' weit asa him eng feig gebrach.
translation.en: But about 20 km further, his tire burst.

translation.lb: No weideren 10 km ass de changement de vitesse him an d'hënnescht rad komm.
translation.en: After another 10 km, the gear change got stuck in his rear wheel.

translation.lb: Ve'ermol huet e missen ofklammen.
translation.en: Again, he had to get off.

translation.lb: An en huet missen op der gro'sser iwersetzong weiderfueren, so gudd et gong.
translation.en: And he had to continue on the high gear as best he could.

translation.lb: Trotzdem ass et him gelong, vun dénen âcht minutte retard, de' hié kritt h&t, der fënnef erem anzehuelen.
translation.en: Nonetheless, he managed to make up five of the eight minutes of delay he had incurred.

translation.lb: De Kirchen ass tëschent Meulan an Pontoise ausgeréckt a krut eng avance vun S minutten.
translation.en: Between Meulan and Pontoise, Kirchen broke away and gained a lead of 5 minutes.

translation.lb: Dat wor 65 km vum Parc des Princes eweeh.
translation.en: That was 65 km away from Parc des Princes.

translation.lb: 30 km weider hât e nach ëmmer 2 minutten avance virun dem e'schten peloton vun eppes 8 mann.
translation.en: 30 km further, he still had a 2-minute lead ahead of the first peloton of about 8 men.

translation.lb: Sei pech huet wollt, datt c just an der entrée vum Parc des Princes platt go'f.
translation.en: His bad luck wanted that he got a flat tire just at the entrance of Parc des Princes.

translation.lb: An hién ass pkitt iwer d'schno'er gângen, als ächte vi j i classement, mé nach an dem compacte peloton vun dénen e'schten 8 mann.
translation.en: And he just barely crossed the line, as the first in the classification, but still in the compact peloton of those first 8 men.

translation.lb: De Bintner ko'm 3 minutten derno am Parc des Princes un, nodem en, ewe' gesot, trotz dem détracte'erten zo'stand vun sengem velo 5 minutte vu sengem passagère retard vun 8 minutten erem gewonn hât.
translation.en: Bintner arrived 3 minutes later at Parc des Princes, having, as already mentioned, reclaimed 5 minutes of his previous delay of 8 minutes despite the battered state of his bicycle.
