translation.en: and when they are very tired from all the shouting, then they go to Aunt Josefine (because even if they do that just like that, it's just as good when she's not there, as always, she's moved) and then they get something good there, and that's true, there was always something good there, whenever they played, and Nicki knows, today there will also be something good, even if it's just a piece of bacon.

translation.lb: D'mamm ass verdrësslech, we' ojt soll se nach dat spillche matt de kanner mächen, we' oft sollen d'fendelen nach dobaussen henken, an de bo'w strich kre'en well en net begreife kann1...
translation.en: The mother is displeased, how often should she still play that game with the children, how often should the flags still hang outside, and the boy cry because he cannot understand1...

translation.lb: Et huet ki wert datt se sech de kapp zerbrecht, se ass fro', datt d'médche matt senge siewe joer eso' verstänneg ass an datt et de mond net opdét, dat frit schon net me' firwat se ki fende I ophenken, an et frit och net firwat datt se immer „Gro'ssherzogins-Geburtsdäg" spillen.
translation.en: It's not worth that she breaks her head over it, she is glad that the girl with her seven years is so sensible and that she does not open her mouth, she no longer asks why they don't hang flags, and she also doesn't ask why they always play 'Grand Duchess's Birthday'.

translation.lb: Wann et erlwer ass, wann d'still erêm op hirer pläz stinn, an d'poppen an de këschle leien, da setzt et sech niiwend seng mamm an t'kuckt se matt sengen donkelen aen treihèrzeg un: „Gelt marna, elo kann ech et gudd, a wann se könnt, dann ass meng tata Josefin och erim an der stät an da gi mer ■richteg oirun de palais an dann dir je mer richteg ruffenf"
translation.en: When it's all over, when the chairs are back in their place, and the dolls lie in the basket, then she sits next to her mother and looks at her with her dark eyes tenderly: "You see mama, now I can do it well, and when she comes, then my aunt Josefine is also back in the city and then we go to the palace and then we can really shout."

translation.lb: » Elo sin d'Preise scho läng aus cm Zand.
translation.en: » Now the Prussians have long been out of the country.

translation.lb: D'Ditg huet bäl zeng joer, et huet d'kommio'n scho gemâch, se hu scho läng net me' gespillt, et hätt ki wirt, set d'mamm, sie ke'm geschwin, an da ginge se kucken, de bo'w brauch jo och keng hanneneriwer me? ze kre'en, well wann elo getischt git, da tischte si och, malt engem länge ro't-weiss-bloe fendet.
translation.en: The girl Ditg is about ten years old, she has already made her first communion, they haven't played for a long time, it wouldn't be worth it, says the mother, she might soon come, and then they would go see, the boy also doesn't need to cry anymore, because when now is celebrated again, they will also be there, with a long red-white-blue flag.

translation.lb: Drei dig sitzt d'mamm scho beim kannerbettchen, d'fe'wer wellen net erof goen, si micht kompressen, d'kand fuebelt, et gel net si kann net an d'stät„
translation.en: Three days the mother has already been sitting by the child’s bed, the fever doesn't want to go down, she makes compresses, the child tosses, it knows it can't go to town.

translation.lb: „lemp, da gis du mam bo'w, mir gin dann eng äner ke'er, amese'ert iech gudd, wann en net pare'ert, giss de him eng bei d'bomm, a göff uecht datt e m neischt geschidd."
translation.en: "Well, then you go with the boy, we'll go another time, have a good time, if he doesn't listen, give him one at the tree, and make sure nothing happens to him."

translation.lb: An de papp git matt sengem jéngsten an d'stàt an et ass e wonnersche'nen dâg, si sti oit um palais, /lien huet dé klengeri op der schëller, a se jeitzen allenzwé bis se' hés sin,
translation.en: And the father goes with his youngest to the city and it is a wonderfully beautiful day, they stand at the palace, he has the little one on his shoulder, and they both shout until they are hoarse,

translation.lb: an de bo'w zitt dén âle mam schlapp: ,/Papp net eso', d'mamm huet gesot .... d'mamm huet det gesot an d'mamm huet dat gesot,"
translation.en: and the boy tugs the old one by the slipper: /"Dad, not like that, mom said.... mom said this and mom said that,"

translation.lb: an de papp lauschtert no, an se sin allenzwé eso' fro' an eso' glécklech,
translation.en: and the dad listens, and they are both so happy and so joyful,

translation.lb: dé klenge well en nach net wéss firwât, an de papp well en et zevill gudd wéss.
translation.en: the little one because he does not yet know why, and the dad because he knows it all too well.

translation.lb: Méndes owes gét et besser mam Ditg, et kann sech schon e we'neg am bettche setzen, an et kritt och e mei/elchen z'iessen;
translation.en: On Monday evening, Ditg feels better, she can already sit up a little in bed, and she gets a little something to eat;

translation.lb: den Nickg dèrf net bei et, en dèrf em och net verzielen, datt en an der stât war, d'mamm lét e fre' schlofen, dann ass se aus der angscht eraus e ge'm eppes maulen.
translation.en: Nicki must not go to her, he must not tell her that he was in the city, the mother lets him go to sleep early, then she is relieved from the worry that he might do something bad.

translation.lb: Dén dnere muergen ass se bis aus fir nom mëUechmann ze kucken, den Niekg quetscht sech zur dir eran, e licht sech op den ze'wen: „Dityt.... sehte'f s de nacht" We* e keng ântwert kritt, geheit en e blat pobeier, d'zeidong de' grad komm ass op den divi an e gét erëm eraut.
translation.en: The next morning she is up to look for the milkman, Nicki squeezes through the door, stands on his toes: "Ditg.... have you seen anything at night?" When he gets no answer, he throws a piece of paper, the newspaper that just arrived, on the blanket and goes out again.

translation.lb: Dat klengi sêtzt sech a sengem bettchen op... Eng zeidong malt billerl matt biller ouii der Gro'ssherzoginf
translation.en: The little one sits up in her bed... A newspaper with pictures of the Grand Duchess

translation.lb: Et danzt em zwar nach alles oirun den aen, iewel et force'ert sech, et buchstawe'ert, a we' et me' weit viru kennt, schluchzt et hart op: „Elo war se an der stät.... an ech hu se net gesin...."
translation.en: Everything dances before her eyes, yet she forces herself, she spells it out, and when she gets further, she sobs hard: "She was in the city.... and I didn't see her...."

translation.lb: I Soll d'mamm et tre'schtenf Sie i fënnt ki wuert, si hellt et aus dem bett, se duckelt et op hire scho'ss, a sie séngt et lues, lues an de schläft et gett kannerléd fir 'dût de' gro'ss Ici Verständnis h un, zu dim se Ici wi fannen, an eng mamm, de' dût spiert ass eso' onglécklech an eso' verlgssen, hir tre'nen drëpscn op em Icand sei käppchen, oder ass et well och sie dat selwecht denkt „an ech hu se net gesin...
translation.en: Should the mother comfort her? She finds no words, she lifts her out of bed, places her on her lap, and sings softly, softly until she sleeps, a children's song for understanding the big, so they would find here, and a mother who feels is so unhappy and so forgotten, her tears drip on the child's little head, or is it because she also thinks the same "and I didn't see her..."

translation.lb: Sie hellt d'zeidong an sie liest, sie mécht de wé malt vum Findet iwer d'gare, iwert d'nei brick bis bei de palais, sie geseit de' wull mënschen t an an hirem hèrz ziddert de Widerhall vun dausend stemmen.
translation.en: She takes the newspaper and reads, she makes the path with the picture from the station, over the new bridge to the palace, she sees the crowd of people, and in her heart, the echo of a thousand voices trembles.

translation.lb: An d'kënnchen op hirem seho'ss lächelt O wat e sche'nl gro'sst schlass, eso' sche'n we' dat vum dornre'schen, alles vu gold a sëlwer a glas, a spigelen, an elo git d'dir op an d'Gro'ssherzogin kënnt, a sie huet e schne'weisse rack un matt enger länger, länger schlif, 'an op hire sche'ne blonde locken huet se eng kro'n,'eng gelle kro'n matt edelsteng, et muss i blinzele well se lichten engem an d'aen, an se huet e bucki ro'sen an der hand, vill vill ro'sen, se muss se an den arem huelen, a wann i kuckt, da mengt in se steng ganz a ro'sen,
translation.en: And the little child on her lap smiles. Oh what a beautiful big castle, so beautiful like that from Sleeping Beauty, all of gold and silver and glass, and mirrors, and now the door opens and the Grand Duchess comes, and she is wearing a snow-white dress with a long, long train, and on her beautiful blonde locks she has a crown, a golden crown with jewels, it makes one blink because they shine in the eyes, and she has a bouquet of roses in her hand, many many roses, she must hold them in her arms, and when one looks, one thinks they are all roses,

translation.lb: an d'Dity kennt eran, op senge pläckege fe'sercher, an sengem nuetshiemchen, an et wellt ruff-en, et huet et dach eso' gudd gewosst, an elo kritt et kt wuert er aus, et wë/lt erëm fortlâfen, du kennt se op et duer, sie bickt• Sech, sie gel him eng bis op seng stir.
translation.en: and Dittie comes in, on his bare feet, in his nightgown, and wants to shout, he knew it so well, and now he can't get the word out, he wants to run away again, then she comes to him, she bends down, she gives him a kiss on his forehead.

translation.lb: « ■ Hat blinzelt eng ke'er matt den aeni „Mama elo hun ech se dach gcstn.
translation.en: « ■ He blinks once with his eyes "Mama, now I have seen her after all.

translation.lb: an et war grad eso' we's du ons et immer verzielt hues, iewel ech könnt net Tuffen, eih hat alles vergiess."
translation.en: and it was just as you always told us, even though I couldn't believe it, I had forgotten everything."

translation.lb: Et schle'ft vir im, d'mantm lét et erëm a sei bett, d'fc'wer si vergâng, .... Hat huet se gesinn, we' seng mamm cm se beschriewen, a we' seng drém bim se ail de' jore virgemolt, a we' se, de'w an onsen hèrzer fir ons alleguerte liewt.
translation.en: He sleeps quietly, the mother lays him back in his bed, the fever has gone, .... He has seen her, as his mother described her to him, and as his dreams painted her over all these years, and as she lives in our hearts for all of us.

translation.lb: Am land ass ké sall me’ den d’mensche fâst, wann d’Unio’n eng versammlong zesummerift Geschter • ow'end hupt et «ech bewiscn we' d'letzeburger zur Unio'n stin.
translation.en: In the country, there is hardly a hall large enough to hold the people when the Union calls a meeting. Last night, it was proven how the Luxembourgers stand for the Union.

translation.lb: De sali vum cinéma Marivaux wor ze kleng fir all de' ménschen ze fassen, an de gäng, an de couloiren alles vor voll, op der strôss stongen nach honnerte leidd.
translation.en: The hall of the Marivaux cinema was too small to accommodate all the people, and the corridors and the aisles were all full, with hundreds of people still standing on the street.

translation.lb: Mir behâpten net, ail de' leidd de* matt stârkem interessi den ausfe'- rongen vun onse riédncr gefoltegt sin wäre membere vun der Unio'n.
translation.en: We do not claim that all the people who followed our speakers' speeches with strong interest were members of the Union.

translation.lb: Et stét awer fest, si stin ohs no, si hun applaude'ert weil si matt ons d'accord sin.
translation.en: However, it is certain that they are close to us, they applauded because they agree with us.

translation.lb: Au enger anerer nummer komme mir op d'riéden vum Dr. Kongs, abbé Carmes an Chr. Calmes zréck.
translation.en: In another issue, we will return to the speeches of Dr. Kongs, Abbé Carmes, and Chr. Calmes.

translation.lb: Offiziell MATTDELONGEN Amtlech matt délong. — Fir all gewerbe a geschäftsschle'ssongen $us polltesche grënn ass d'friddensgericht vum canton zo'stänneg, wo' d%t geschäft oder de' entreprise ass.
translation.en: Official COMMUNICATIONS Official communication. — For all trades and business closures due to political reasons, the peace court of the canton is responsible where the business or enterprise is located.

translation.lb: All klo ge'nt eso' eng schle'ssong ass also an zwar -virum 14. 7. 45 anzeréchen.
translation.en: Every complaint against such a closure must therefore be submitted before July 14, 1945.

translation.lb: De ministre vum intérieur a vun der épuratio'n: R. ALS.
translation.en: The Minister of the Interior and of Purification: R. ALS.

translation.lb: Avis un tfzeidongen.
translation.en: Notice about extensions.

translation.lb: E büro vu vircenjtroll get an der post zu Letzeburg opgemâch.
translation.en: An office for pre-control is opened at the post office in Luxembourg.

translation.lb: — D'résender, de' aus dem Grand-Duché an d'ausland gin, müssen scch virdrun am guichet 6 an der h&ptpost mellen, de' vun 2 bis 4 auer nomëttes op ass.
translation.en: — Travelers going from the Grand Duchy abroad must report in advance at window 6 at the main post office, which is open from 2 to 4 in the afternoon.

translation.lb: Si müssen do all documenter, de' si w elles hu matt an d'ausland ze huelen, virweisen.
translation.en: They must present all documents they want to take abroad there.

translation.lb: Des vircontroll ass geschaf gin fir d'formalite'ten beim passage vun den grenzen z'erlichteren.
translation.en: This pre-control has been established to facilitate the formalities when crossing the borders.

translation.lb: De' ne'deg renseignement kann én um büro vun de laisser-passe'r gewur gin, am regirongsgebei oder am guichet 6 vun der hâptpost.
translation.en: The necessary information can be obtained at the bureau of laissez-passer, in the government building or at window 6 of the main post office.

translation.lb: Mattgedélt vum Office de Contrôle,
translation.en: Communicated by the Office of Control,

translation.lb: Alfred Kowalksky Up néwenszeit conseiller vum lnternationale Komponistenrerband.
translation.en: Alfred Kowalsky was, at the same time, a counselor of the International Composers' Association.

translation.lb: Direkter vun der Eecher Mmsckschet, Direkter vum haptstädteschen Orphéon, der Umion des eociétés de chant an dem Pâfendaler Männergesangverein.
translation.en: Director of the Eecher Music Society, Director of the capital city's Orpheon, the Union of Singing Societies, and the Pfaffenthal Men's Choral Society.

translation.lb: Componiat vu ve'er operen (Griselinde — Flammentod — Bordun a Vera) ver9chidde gro'ss orchesterwierker a karamermusek, ru viller anerer international unerkannter mutet a letzeburger cko'eratécker a volksliddercher.
translation.en: Composer of various operas (Griselinde — Death by Flame — Bordun and Vera), various large orchestral works, and chamber music, along with other internationally recognized works including Luxembourgish choral and folk songs.

translation.lb: Hién ass gestuerwen de 14. mé 194i lu Meta.
translation.en: He died on May 14, 1941, in Meta.

translation.lb: Lâng joren wor hién o'ni plaz ass schliesslech durch d'Prcîsen ge dringt gin eng plaz als gesangprofesser unzehuelen,
translation.en: For many years, he was without a position until he was finally forced by circumstances to accept a position as a singing professor,

translation.lb: durch seng echt letzeburger haltong huet hién niéecht iwer letzeburger komponisten geschwât, ochmoia iwer franse'sch a russcsch museker, mé beileiwen ni iwer preise sch musek,
translation.en: through his genuinely Luxembourgish attitude, he never spoke against Luxembourgish composers, much less against French and Russian musicians, but certainly never against Prussian music,

translation.lb: dofir ass hién dann ofgesat gin, a wo'sst sech net anescht ze hëllefen, we' no Metz ze entlafem
translation.en: therefore, he was then removed from his position, and knew no other way to help himself than to flee to Metz,

translation.lb: Um do'tsbett huet hién eng cantat geschrîwem iwer d'iibératio'n tum letzeburgcr Land, de' leider net fèrdeg gin ass.
translation.en: On his deathbed, he wrote a cantata about the liberation of the Luxembourg land, which unfortunately was not completed.

translation.lb: — D'familjen huet der Unio'n de ganzen text an e klengen e'schten dél vun der musek zo'kommen gelôss.
translation.en: — The family has allowed the Union to receive the entire text and a small first part of the music.

translation.lb: Sei leschi wirk wèrd dem letzeburgertum net verluer gosiL
translation.en: His last work would not be lost to Luxembourgish culture.

translation.lb: Sei ïeschtfi wonach wor, datt sei begriéwncs ké prnpagaudazuch sollt gin.
translation.en: His last wish was that his burial should not be a propaganda show.

translation.lb: Duerfir au hién hemlech hei zu Letzeburg an d'graw ■vu« sengem beachten colleg gebe« gin,
translation.en: Therefore, he was secretly buried here in Luxembourg in the grave of his respected colleague,

translation.lb: » ward eng sche'ner a glécklecher zeit of, fir a seng ro' ze kommen.
translation.en: » after a beautiful and happy time, to come to rest.

translation.lb: Seng letzeburger frën» werden hîén ni vergiéssen.
translation.en: His Luxembourgish friends will never forget him.

translation.lb: well et wor e richtege patriot.
translation.en: because he was a true patriot.

translation.lb: Aus der consultative (Fortgesat aus der leschter nummer.)
translation.en: From the consultative (Continued from the last issue.)

translation.lb: Den hèr Godart verlàngt, datt jidferé fir d'land soll affer bre'ngen, och de geschäftsmann, fueTdert, datt d'capitelstcier soW matt verstand verdélt gin an datt virun allem sollen d'krichsgewënmler gepléckt gin, schürf a matt eisernem biésen, hält drop, datt d'épuratio'n soll op normalem a 'legalem wé lafen an datt ooh beaonnesch d'jugend soll Vilm nazigéscht geseibert gin, verlàngt, datt an der reconstructio'n, d'transport- an d'benzinsfro muss gele'st gin an zwar op käse h te vun den hamsterer a schwärzhändler, ddnen hiren auto a benzin solle beschlagnahmt gin,
translation.en: Mr. Godart demands that everyone should sacrifice for the country, including the businessman, insists that the capital tax should be distributed wisely and that above all war profiteers should be heavily taxed, insists that the purification should proceed in a normal and legal way and particularly demands that the youth should be thoroughly cleansed, demands that in the reconstruction, the transportation and gasoline issue must be solved at the expense of hoarders and black marketeers, whose cars and gasoline should be confiscated,

translation.lb: stedèt fest, datt am opbau net genuch geschafft, mé gudd gelidwt get, propose'ert, datt d'giëlemânnercher an d'preisesch krichsgefângener sollen d' m inen opraumen, fuerdert, datt denen scandale'sen zo'stäno am sequester-orohester soll en enn gesät gin.
translation.en: states that in the reconstruction not enough work is done, but much is talked about, proposes that the prisoners of war should clear the mines, demands that the scandalous conditions in the sequestration department should come to an end.

translation.lb: Den hèr Hlidgen verlängt wunnéngen fir de' leidd, de' erem kommen a me' he'ch preisser fir d'land Wirtschaft.
translation.en: Mr. Hlidgen demands housing for the people who are returning and more high prices for the country's economy.

translation.lb: Den hèr Kuhn Consta te'ert, datt d'krichsschi<?den Bfflt schlecht fonctionne'ert. stellt fest, datt beim Sequester allerhand scandale virkomm sin (d'resistcnz hält op streng enquêtent. iërgert sech, datt d'errterp ren eur en an d'architecten bei der reconstruc tio'n onhëmlech verdéngen, fuerdert, datt am verwaltongswiesen vwm ravitaillement den aie Schlendrian an d'priorite'lswiésen müssen opbe'eren (de', de' scho bei de Preisen ailles kru+en, kre'en och elo erem dat méscht).
translation.en: Mr. Kuhn notes that the war damages system is functioning poorly. states that various scandals occur in sequestration (the resistance insists on strict investigations, is angered that contractors and architects are earning excessively in reconstruction, demands that in the administration of supplies, the old sloppiness and priority matters must be addressed (those who previously received everything at the prices, are now getting the most again).

translation.lb: Den hèr Sehroeder, reconstructio nscoinmissär bequemt sech, e kiengen aperçu ze gin iwert d'reconstructio'nskäsohten an iwer de benefice van den arohitecten an den entrepreneuren (wann et awer eso' viru gét we' elo, sin eoh iwerzégt, datt et läng net bei der milliard Weift, we' den hèr Sehroeder aus calcule' ert huet).
translation.en: Mr. Sehroeder, reconstruction commissioner, takes the opportunity to give a brief insight into the reconstruction costs and the benefits of the architects and contractors (however, if it continues like this, I am convinced that it will not long stay at the billion mark, as Mr. Sehroeder has calculated).

translation.lb: Den hèr Decker gere't aus dem gleis an déclame'ert matt jugendlecher pathetik a weinbegéschtertem enthusiassem der régi- rong Dupong an durno aill énzcl memberen von der virkrichsregirong Dupong en he'cht lueflidd, hfén hèllt sech iwregens selwer erexn a wesft der regirong dictaturmetbode vir bei der erweiderong an och bei der constitutio'n vun der Consultative.
translation.en: Mr. Decker goes off track and declaims with youthful pathos and almost tearful enthusiasm about the Dupong regime and then praises individual members of the pre-war government of Dupong highly, although he also criticizes the government for using dictatorial methods in its expansion and formation of the Consultative.

translation.lb: an der reconstructio'nsfro betont de« hèr Decker, wat mir schons an enger fre'erer nummer gesot hun, datt de'je'neg sinislre'ert, de' den urbechter freides owes, wannsehémtueren, liéwensmëttel a gedrénks maltgin, hir.reparativen gemâch kre'en an datt de' awcr, de' dat net mâche kennen, werde müssen.
translation.en: In the matter of reconstruction, Mr. Decker emphasizes, as we have already said in an earlier issue, that those who deliberately steal food and drink on Friday nights will have their repairs made, and those who can't do so will have to.

translation.lb: Den hèr Kill mengt, datt «Fwnbech+sloscht vun den anbeohter eso' kleng ass, well d'regirong de patrioteschen elan systematescli sabote'ert huet a well d'arbechtsconditio'nen an d'le'n net ideal sin, en iérgert sech, datt d'gro'ssindu- Strie d'productio'n am minett net kann oder net wëlilt an de gank bre'ngen.
translation.en: Mr. Kill thinks that the morale of the citizens is so low because the government has systematically sabotaged the patriotic spirit and because working conditions and living conditions are not ideal, he is frustrated that the big industries either cannot or do not want to bring the production in the mining area forward.

translation.lb: verlàngt spe'tstens bis zum Riérscht neiwahlen.
translation.en: demands new elections at the latest by autumn.

translation.lb: Den hèr Blwer Nlk verlängt, datt an der reconstructio 11 en ofkommen tëscht dem Staat enger-seits, den entrepreneuren an den architecten anerseits, muss realise'- ert gin, fuerdert, datt mer durch neiwahlen op d'iégalite't crem zréckkommen, dcclare'ert, datt darbechterpa-rle; an de Letzeburger Arbechterverband seoh vun dënen arbechter distance'ert, bei denen d'reconstmctio'n durch de „ravitaillement" léft,
translation.en: Mr. Blwer Nlk demands that in the reconstruction an agreement between the state on one side and the contractors and architects on the other must be realized, insists that through new elections we should return to legal equality, declares that the workers' council and the Luxembourg Workers' Association are distancing themselves from those workers through whom the reconstruction is driven by 'supplies.'

translation.lb: trëtt derfir an, datt d'industrie zu Stengefort crem nu.v; ">aut get an datt mer ons industrie sollen op fèrdeg produeter spezialise'eren, well dodurch d'existenzme'glechk-ét an d'onofhângegkét vun der hémecht garante'ert ge'f (mir hun dese gedenken scho vertrueden an triëde voll a ganz derfir an).
translation.en: advocates for the industry in Steinfort to be newly built and that we should specialize our industry in finished products, because this guarantees the possibility of existence and the independence of the homeland (we have already represented this thought and fully support it).

translation.lb: Den hèr staatsdictator a finanzathiet Dupong versprecht de KZ.ler, den déporte'erten, an alle krichsgeschiédegten hëllef (hoffentlech hält hiën des ke'er),
translation.en: Mr. state dictator and financial advisor Dupong promises help to the prisoners of the concentration camps, the deported, and all war-affected (hopefully he keeps it this time).

translation.lb: tbéorétise'ert iwer de Sequester princip a schwätzt vun der vi lier sequesterarbecht, bemiérkt als krichsminister, datt négociatio'nen am gâng sin, fir preisesch prisonne'er aJs arbechlskräften an d'reconstructio'n an an iandwirt schaft ze kre'en (endlechll),
translation.en: theorizes about the principle of sequestration and talks about the many sequestration tasks, notes as war minister, that negotiations are underway to obtain Prussian prisoners as workers for reconstruction and agriculture (finally!).

translation.lb: déclare'ert, datt d'verme'genssteier net an engem coup, mé a 6 bis 10 jor crhuewe get, datt de' kleng verme'- gen net getraff gin an datt eng gewëss progressio'n envisage'ert ass,
translation.en: declares that the wealth tax will not be collected in one go, but over 6 to 10 years, that the small wealths will not be affected and that a certain progression is envisaged,

translation.lb: äiitwert op d'fro nun hèr Lütgen datt onst gold gerett ass, datt d'titeren sech wahrscheinlich erem fannen an datt d'regirong 34 miltio'nen am exil dépense'ert huet,
translation.en: answers to Mr. Lütgen's question that our gold is saved, that the securities will probably be found again and that the government has spent 34 million in exile,

translation.lb: ass dermatt d'accord, den sinistre'erten, de' neischt verdengen, eng ënncr stëtzong zo'kommen ze lôssen, versieht nach eng ke'er sëng finanz- a Preispolitik ze justifie'eren (ons frae gesin am beschten nm portmonni, we' do den hues léft),
translation.en: agrees to allow the distressed, who earn nothing, to receive a support, once again justifies his financial and pricing policy (our women are best informed about the purse, where the money flows).

translation.lb: get d'verspriéchen of, datt de' finanzmesüren, de' nach kommen, d'irtëmmer an d'ormssio'nen rectifie' eren, de' gemat go'wen (hoffen tdecb) versprächt, d'profiteuren bei de steieren ze pdécken (et get he'cli zeit II), schle'sst matt engem appell un d'vollek berétwëlleg affer ze bre'ngen.
translation.en: gives promises that the financial measures that are yet to come will rectify mistakes and omissions that have been made (hopefully), promises to squeeze the profiteers regarding taxes (it's about time!), concludes with an appeal to the people to willingly make sacrifices.

translation.en: Many promises, a vague justification attempt, brought forth with no enthusiasm, no conviction, like a student called upon who isn't prepared for his lesson, and therefore stands with trembling knees and a red face before the strict professor, just like Mr. Dupong... as a beaten man. translation.lb: Politesch prozesser E lreideg, den 1. juni si folgend urtélei gesprach gin:
translation.en: Political trials in Luxembourg, on June 1st, the following verdicts were pronounced:

translation.lb: Peter KEMP van Esch-Uelzecht, ugeklot e Letzeburger bei der Gestapo ugin ze hun, ëmmer matt Heil Hitler gegre'sst ze hun an d'Letzeburger ugedriwen ze hun ze schaffen, ass zu 6 joer Zuchthaus verurtélt gin.
translation.en: Peter KEMP from Esch-Uelzecht, accused of having reported a Luxembourger to the Gestapo, always greeting with 'Heil Hitler', and urging Luxembourgers to work, was sentenced to 6 years in prison.

translation.lb: Nicolas GREGOIRE vu Letzeburg, iwerfe'ert e puer politesch ämter beklét ze hun, mitglied vun den auslandsdeitschen, an der NSDAP an op den Hitler vcrédegt gewiéscht ze sin, ass zu 10 zwangsarbecht a matt 10000 frang gebô'sst gin.
translation.en: Nicolas GREGOIRE from Luxembourg, accused of having held several political offices, being a member of the expatriate Germans and the NSDAP and being shown to have defended Hitler, was sentenced to 10 years of forced labor and fined 10,000 francs.

translation.lb: Arthur REICHLING vu» Lamperbirg, iwerfe'ert mitglied vun der NSDAP an op den Hitler verédegt gewiéscht ze sin, d'uniform gedroen an u propagandamärsch délgeholl ze hun, ass zu 3 joer prisong veryrtélt gin.
translation.en: Arthur REICHLING from Lamperbirg, accused of being a member of the NSDAP and having defended Hitler, wearing the uniform and participating in propaganda marches, was sentenced to 3 years in prison.

translation.lb: D'ietzeburger nationalite't krut hién op liéwensdauer ofgesprach.
translation.en: His Luxembourgish nationality was revoked for life.

translation.lb: Albert KOLSCHETTE vu Flarweiler, iwerfe'ert block- an organisatio'nsleiter vun der VDB gewiéscht ze sin, d'uniform an den hakekreizfuendel ge, droen ze hun a mattgehollef ze hun, d'plakater opzepechen, de' d'standrecht a Letzeburg bekanntgemâch hun, ass zu 3 joer prisong an zu enger geldbo'ss vun 3.000 frang verurtélt gin.
translation.en: Albert KOLSCHETTE from Flarweiler, accused of being a block and organization leader of the VDB, wearing the uniform and the swastika flag and helping to post the posters that declared martial law in Luxembourg, was sentenced to 3 years in prison and a fine of 3,000 francs.

translation.lb: D'ietzeburgesch nationalite't ass him entzun gin.
translation.en: His Luxembourgish nationality was revoked.

translation.lb: De Victor Besch, Itzig, go'f Vum Spezialgericht zu 5 jor zwangsarbecht an zu enger geldstrof vun 5000 frang condamne'ert.
translation.en: Victor Besch from Itzig was sentenced by the special court to 5 years of forced labor and a fine of 5,000 francs.

translation.lb: Hié wor blockleiter, hât 1942 en antrag fir 2T>lrrfcei gestallt an d'uniforra gedroen, zwé letzeburger ugeschmiert, de' matt 10 an 3 RM bestroft go'we an sache gestuel, nodém, datt bommen gefall woren.
translation.en: He was a block leader, had filed an application in 1942, wore the uniform, denounced two Luxembourgers who were fined 10 and 3 RM and stole items after bombs had fallen.

translation.lb: Dat elei an dat elo... Aus der Stars and Stripes.
translation.en: This and that... From the Stars and Stripes.

translation.en: — In the Stars and Stripes, under the section: THE B BAG BLOW IT OUT HERE, we found this small notice, which is interesting:

translation.lb: Letzeburg.
translation.en: Luxembourg.

translation.lb: — Ech wor se'er iwer. rascht an ugeékelt, we' ech dem James Cannon sein articel iwer d'stad Letzeburg, vum 28. mé geliés hun.
translation.en: I was very angry and disgusted when I read James Cannon's article about the city of Luxembourg, from May 28.

translation.lb: Et ass en directe schlag an d'gestcht fir de' vill frënu, de' ech zo' Letzeburg kennegele'crt hun.
translation.en: It is a direct strike in the face for the many friends I have made in Luxembourg.

translation.lb: Wärend dém mo'nt, dën ech do zo'bruecht hun, wor ech iwcrzégt, datt et de' sche'nste plaz wor, de' ech 110 menger ofrés vun de Staaten gesin hun.
translation.en: During the month I spent there, I was convinced that it was the most beautiful place I had seen on my travels from the States.

translation.lb: Bè, hèr CannonI
translation.en: Well, Mr. Cannon!

translation.en: — During a discussion in a café in Ewerleng, a young man, who spent two years in prison and concentration camps under the Germans, was called "h.. re German."

translation.lb: We' hannenuo séng komeroden dé betreffenden zur riéd gestadlt hun, ass de wlrt zu dém sénge gonschten intervene'ert an huet gesot, hié g e''. keng streidereien a séngem iocai dulden.
translation.en: When his comrades spoke to the person in question afterward, the host intervened in his favor and said he would not tolerate any disputes in his place.

translation.lb: Hién huet awer ké wuert ge-. sot, wel. é gudde letzeburger jong scliwe'er belédegt go'f.
translation.en: However, he did not say a word when a good Luxembourgish young man was badly insulted.

translation.en: Any comment is superfluous there.

translation.lb: Op wonsch vum hèr Alvisse publizc'ere mer des zo'schrëft:
translation.en: At the request of Mr. Alvisse, we are publishing this letter:

translation.lb: Luxembourg, le 23 mai 1945.
translation.en: Luxembourg, May 23, 1945.

translation.lb: I Au Comité Central de l'Union Luxembourg Messieurs,
translation.en: To the Central Committee of the Union Luxembourg Gentlemen,

translation.lb: Dans l'assemblée générale de l'Union du 16 mai à Bettembourg l'allusion suivante a été faite par un assistant:
translation.en: In the general assembly of the Union on May 16 in Bettembourg, the following remark was made by an attendee:

translation.lb: „Pourquoi Alvisse Octave est encore membre de l'Union?"
translation.en: "Why is Alvisse Octave still a member of the Union?"

translation.lb: Suite à cette question Monsieur Lütgen formulait la réponse suivante:
translation.en: Following this question, Mr. Lütgen formulated the following response:

translation.lb: „Alvisse a été envoyé par l'Union à Bruxelles, car nous ne le connaissions pas;
translation.en: "Alvisse was sent by the Union to Brussels because we did not know him;

translation.lb: il a été membre d'un groupement Belge de résistance, mais dès la première plainte, nous l'avons expulsé de l'Union et déshonoré de son bon nom de patriote Luxembourgeois."
translation.en: he was a member of a Belgian resistance group, but after the first complaint, we expelled him from the Union and dishonored his good name as a Luxembourgish patriot."

translation.lb: Vu que la plainte en question de Monsieur le Ministre Dupoug est irrévocablement basée sur une rancune personnelle, ou avantage d'une tierce personne,
translation.en: Since the complaint in question by Mr. Minister Dupoug is irrevocably based on personal rancor, or advantage of a third party,

translation.lb: je vous prie de faire, dan» l'intérêt de l'Union,
translation.en: I ask you to do, in the interest of the Union,

translation.lb: dans un délai de 14 jours
translation.en: within a period of 14 days

translation.lb: 1. Une enquête centre ma personne,
translation.en: 1. An investigation of my person,

translation.lb: 2. de publier immédiatement la présente lettre,
translation.en: 2. to immediately publish the present letter,

translation.lb: 3 de publier ensuite le résultat de l'enquête dans le journal de l'Union.
translation.en: 3. then to publish the result of the investigation in the Union's newspaper.

translation.lb: Veuillez agréer, Messieurs, l'expression de mes salutations distinguées.
translation.en: Please accept, Gentlemen, the expression of my distinguished greetings.

translation.lb: Alvisse Octave 36, rue Marie-Thérèse, Betterobeurg.
translation.en: Alvisse Octave 36, Marie-Thérèse Street, Bettembourg.

translation.lb: Zur affiche Pi-Men.
translation.en: Regarding the Pi-Men poster.

translation.lb: Den épuraUo'nsmiuisler Als beto'nt, datl de* riéd, de' hién séngerzcit zu Kueblenz gehalen hat, an de' il'Preisen am „Luxemburger Wort" den 3. october ItMO „reproduze'ert" hun, gänzlech dénature'ert a vun den nazien op hir zwecker mode!- le'ert go'w.
translation.en: The purification minister Als emphasizes that the speech he once gave in Koblenz, which was reproduced by the Prussians in the "Luxemburger Wort" on October 3, 1940, was completely distorted and manipulated by the Nazis for their purposes.

translation.lb: Vu, dalt hién huet schwelze missen, sei den her Als, hält hién séng riéd op d'rengt sozialt zo'geschnidden, hién hätt ower — bei déne bekannte preisesch« methoden — net verhënnere kennen, dattd'Preisen an der press séng riéd esn' gudd dem fett we' dem sënn no falsifie'ert a polilesch ëmgeschriwen hun.
translation.en: Mr. Als says that since he had to speak there, he kept his speech strictly socially focused, but with the well-known Prussian methods, he could not prevent the Prussians from misrepresenting and politically rewriting his speech in the press.

translation.lb: Den épuratio'nsminister désapprouve'ert dann an der condusio'n de procédé »un de Pi-Men, de' versichen, am dre'- wen ze fëschon an d'ëffentleo^i ménong fir hir zwecker an d'feier ie dreiwen.
translation.en: The purification minister then in conclusion disapproves of the process of the Pi-Men, who try to fish in troubled waters and stir public opinion for their purposes.

translation.lb: (Et ass opfalend, <lalt de'selwecht Pi- Men, de' vru kürzer zeit der regiroiig d'trei geschwuer hun, ek> ge'ntde'sel wecht leidd laçe'ten opkliéwen.
translation.en: (It is striking that the same Pi-Men, who not long ago swore loyalty to the government, are now seemingly starting to oppose it.

translation.lb: Dat rieht e bësse famo's no effecthascherei: wann et net hei gét, da probe'ere mer ait do...
translation.en: That seems a bit like showboating: if it doesn't work here, then we'll try there...

translation.lb: Emoi mecht é politik, de' aner ke'er flugziédeit é ge'nt se, émoi mecht én d'épuratio'n numéro deux an de' aner ke'er sabote'ert éa d'épuration numéro un — ower wo' Meiwt do eng linn. — d'Rédactio'n.
translation.en: One time they make a policy, the next they are against it, once they carry out purification number two and the next time they sabotage purification number one — but where is the line there? — The editorial.

translation.lb: Aui zesummenhank malt der affiche Pi-Men mecht den hèr justizminister Bodson drop opmiérksam, datt de' contesle'erl Letzeburger an der Belsch de belsche militârautorite'fen einstweilen nach ënnerstin.
translation.en: In connection with the Pi-Men poster, Justice Minister Bodson points out that the contested Luxembourgers in Belgium are still under Belgian military authority for the time being.

translation.lb: Wa verschiddjner vun hinno provisoresch vun do aus libére'ert go'wen, dann ass dat kén zwéngend argument, datt s' onschëlleg sin, weW, eso' bal we' de' beitsch autorite'ten ons do' betreffend leidd zur dispositio'n stellen, gin si hei vir letzeburger gerîchter gestallt an op hir schëllegkél?n-nersicht.
translation.en: If some of them were provisionally released, that is not a compelling argument that they are innocent, because as soon as the Belgian authorities present the relevant individuals to us, they will be tried here by Luxembourgish courts and examined for their guilt.

translation.lb: Croix Rouge Croix Rouge Luxembourgeoise Fir datt ons kléderhëllefsactio'n an de sinistre'erte ge'gende virum 1. januar 1946 fèrdeg get, bleiwt ons verdélongszentral au Letzeburg (Nouveau Paria) bis op weideres zo\
translation.en: Red Cross Red Cross Luxembourgish So that our clothing assistance actions in the affected areas are completed by January 1, 1946, our distribution center in Luxembourg (Nouveau Paria) remains until further notice.

translation.lb: Et get nemmen ausnähme gemat fir perso'r.en, de' nodem 1. september 1945 rapatrie'ert go'wen.
translation.en: Exceptions are only made for persons who were repatriated after September 1, 1945.

translation.lb: Eintausch vu kléder de" é kritt huet, kann aus déselwechte grënn virléfeg net me' gestatt gin.
translation.en: The exchange of clothing that was received cannot be allowed temporarily for the same reasons.

translation.en: Communiqué Luxembourgish Red Cross

translation.lb: Ons nationaléquipe Revue parlementaire Et gët ve'er me'glechkéten Entweder ass ons Chamber eng Législative oder ons Chamber ass eng Constituante oder ons Chamber ass eng Législative, de' niéwebei och Constituante as« oder ons Chamber ass eng Constituante, de' niéwebi och Législative ass.
translation.en: Our national team Parliamentary review And there are several possibilities Either our Chamber is legislative or our Chamber is constituent or our Chamber is legislative, which is simultaneously also constituent, or our Chamber is constituent, which is simultaneously also legislative.

translation.lb: Zwo' me'glechkéten gi vn vlrewech élémine'ert: Ons Chamber ass nët nure Législative, well si soll och d'Constitutio'n ärmeren.
translation.en: Two possibilities are immediately eliminated: Our Chamber is not only legislative, because it should also amend the constitution.

translation.lb: Ons Chamber ass och nët nure Constitutante, well si soll och gesetzmotio'nen légaldse'eren.
translation.en: Our Chamber is also not only constituent, because it should also legislate on motions.

translation.lb: Bleiwen also — nom legendäre Riesel — zwo' me'glechkéten.
translation.en: Therefore remain — according to the legendary Riesel — two possibilities.

translation.lb: Ons Chamber as« also entweder me' Législative we' Constituante oder me' Constituante we' Législative
translation.en: Our Chamber is thus either more legislative than constituent or more constituent than legislative.

translation.lb: Doriwer ass ons honorabel nationaléquipe sech nun awer net éneg.
translation.en: However, our honorable national team is not in agreement on this.

translation.lb: An et gët eng affekotegeschicht.
translation.en: And there is a lawyer story.

translation.lb: Keng geschieht vun allen affekoten, mé nure vun déne gestemmten aus der Chamber.
translation.en: Not a story of all lawyers, but only of those appointed from the Chamber.

translation.lb: D'sâch schéngt op den e'schten ament nët eso' wichteg, mé — Schein trügt — si huet et tatsächlech an sech.
translation.en: The matter seems not so important at first, but — appearances are deceiving — it is indeed significant.

translation.lb: Et ass nämlech dat heiten:
translation.en: It is namely this:

translation.lb: Wann d'Chamber me' Législative we' Constituante ass, da gët frësch gestemmt, wann d'Iégislativ period eriwer ass
translation.en: If the Chamber is more legislative than constituent, then a new election is held when the legislative period is over

translation.lb: Wann d'Chamber awer me' Constituante ass we' Législative, da gët frësch gestemmt, so' bal d'Conslitutio'n geännert ass.
translation.en: However, if the Chamber is more constituent than legislative, then a new election is held as soon as the constitution is changed.

translation.lb: An dat ass wahrscheinlech geschitt, e'er eng législativ périod an d'vergângenhét geschriwe gët.
translation.en: And that is likely to happen, before a legislative period is written into history.

translation.lb: An dat ass et, wat verschidde Parteien intresse'ert.
translation.en: And that is what interests certain parties.

translation.lb: Fir deitlech ze sin: de' eng méngen, si kennte bei den nèxte wähle besser ofschneideu, si wënschen eso' bal we' me'glech nei wählen; de' aner fanneu, da« gl hei Ae wählen ganz gndd of geschnidden hun a wëllen hir man dater eso' läng we' me'glech bell al en.
translation.en: To be clear: one group thinks they could perform better in the next election, so they want new elections as soon as possible; the other thinks they did quite well in the last elections and want to maintain their mandate as long as possible.

translation.lb: D'affekote sollen elo de fall tranche'eren, also de' leidd, vun déne be's zotige soen, si wieren dax rechtsverdre'er.
translation.en: The lawyers should now decide the case, that is, the people whom some sarcastically call legal representatives.

translation.lb: Ech wëll dftt net gesot hun, dât vun déne be'sen affekoten, awer wat ech wollt soen: menger ménong no hun nët d'affekoten doriwer ze befannen, ob d'Chamber me' Constituante ass we' Législative oder mé Législative we' Constituante, mé d'voilek.
translation.en: I do not want to say that about all lawyers, but what I wanted to say is: In my opinion, it is not the lawyers who should decide whether the Chamber is more constituent than legislative or more legislative than constituent, but the people.

translation.lb: Menger ménong no huet d'vollek schons entschéd, an zwar bei de wählen.
translation.en: In my opinion, the people have already decided, namely in the elections.

translation.lb: Well de' méscht parteien — fir nët ze soeen all — hun hir wahlpropaganda op d'Constituante opgebaut.
translation.en: Because most parties — if not to say all — built their election propaganda on the constituent theme.

translation.lb: Also wier de' nei Chamber me' Constituante we' Législative... nom wëll vum vollek!
translation.en: So the new Chamber should be more constituent than legislative... according to the will of the people!

translation.lb: Wann d'affekoten nët dér ménong sin, kënnte mer jo e klenge référendum ofhalen.
translation.en: If the lawyers are not of this opinion, we could hold a small referendum.

translation.lb: Fir wat och nët, et fillt én sech dach eso' richteg gehuewen a staatsbiergerlech, wann én dierf stëmmen, eso' guer dann, wann én secb selwer net ze wiéle brauch.
translation.en: Why not, after all, one feels quite uplifted and civic when allowed to vote, especially when one does not have to vote for oneself.

translation.en: It is reported from Vienna that the parliamentary and municipal elections proceeded without incident.

translation.en: Participation in the elections was very strong, and in some areas it was reportedly more than 90 percent.

translation.en: The election campaign was also conducted vigorously and fairly.

translation.en: The head of the provisional Austrian government said that this was a good sign for the establishment of a democratic Austria.

translation.lb: AH fre'er mcmberen vun der nazipartei wore vu m stëmmrecht ausgeschtoss gin.
translation.en: All former members of the Nazi party were excluded from voting rights.

translation.lb: Politesch prozesser Joseph Thlll, kniécht, Schëffleng, huet seng déngschter i'ir beopsichtegongsarbechten, de' de Preisen zo'gei'a'll sin, tigebuedcn, huet sech am september i 942 an d'Wchrmacht an nin Iflf vum joer 1943 an d'Waffen-SS gerne Ht, En ass den 19. uovembcr zu 18 mo'nt prisong verurtélt gin.
translation.en: Political defendant Joseph Thill, servant, Schifflange, offered his services for surveillance work which were in demand by the Prussians, joined the Wehrmacht in September 1942 and then volunteered for the Waffen-SS at the end of the year 1943. He was sentenced to 18 months in prison on November 19.

translation.en: Mrs. André Leenders (born Christine Herker), Esch-sur-Alzette, was a member of the Nazi Women's League, participated in numerous meetings, wore the badge of the NSF, frequently interacted with Nazi-minded individuals, and engaged in an act of denunciation, was sentenced to 3 years in prison on November 19.

translation.en: Mathias Zeimet, track worker, Sandweier, was one of the first from the locality in the VdS, block leader, cell leader, member of the NSDAP, always greeted with 'Heil Hitler', participated in political demonstrations, and instructed his block leaders to write political reports, was sentenced to 3 years in prison on November 19 and to the loss of Luxembourgish nationality.

translation.lb: De premier Attlee huet virum amerikan. congress geschwat
translation.en: Prime Minister Attlee spoke before the American Congress.

translation.lb: Den englesche Premierminister Attlee huet gësehter virun dem amerikanesche congress geschwat an a klore linnen d'aussepolitik duergeluecht, we' England se visà-vis vun Amerika an dénen anere länner ze fe'ere wëlles huet.
translation.en: The English Prime Minister Attlee spoke recently before the American Congress and clearly outlined the foreign policy that England intends to pursue with respect to America and other countries.

translation.lb: Ons ge'geseiteg politik, eso' sot den Attlee, muss eso' gefe'ert gin, datt si net nuren dem intresse vun onse be'de länner, mé dem intresse vun de natio'ne vun der ganzer weit déngt.
translation.en: Our mutual policy, said Attlee, must be conducted in such a way that it serves not only the interests of our two countries, but also the interests of the nations of the entire world.

translation.lb: Wann och England an Amerika stärk arme'en zur verfügong hätten, da wir dat net fir ugrëffsziller ze verfollegen, mé nuren aus dem grond fir de weltfridden sëcherzesteilen.
translation.en: Even if England and America have strong armies at their disposal, this should not be pursued for aggressive purposes, but only to ensure world peace.

translation.lb: Ons politik muss der zivilisatio'n vun der ganzer weit zugudd kommen.
translation.en: Our policy must benefit the civilization of the entire world.

translation.lb: Amerika ass haut de' stärkst muecht vun der weit, an si muss de' krâft an den déngscht vum weltfriddt stellen.
translation.en: America is today the strongest power in the world, and it must put its strength at the service of world peace.

translation.lb: Vun de verlöschter am krich sot den Attlee, datt Amerika bonnert dausende vu sénge jonge verluer huet, mé trotz allem huet Amerika net dat mattgemâch, wat England an de preiseschen terrorugrëff auszehalen hat.
translation.en: Regarding the losses in the war, Attlee said that America lost thousands of its young men, but despite everything, America did not endure what England had to suffer from the Prussian terror attacks.

translation.lb: De 27. januar kommen de' uertschaffte matt 5 bis 20 000 awunner un d'rei.
translation.en: On January 27th, areas with 5,000 to 20,000 inhabitants will follow.

translation.lb: D'terminer fir d'wahlen an de landbezirker an an de gre'ssere sticd si nach net festge•Iuegt gin.
translation.en: The dates for the elections in the rural districts and in larger towns have not yet been set.

translation.lb: Ons nationalhelden Kaum go'w et dag, dann huet de Jängi a sengem bauerewiésen ugefâng ze ramo'ercn an ze schaffen.
translation.en: Our national hero Scarcely a day went by when Jängi didn’t begin to work and rumble in his rural meadow.

translation.lb: Wann én hién eso' muergcsfre' gehe'ert huet peifen, dann hätt én him dach nimols middegkét zo'getraut.
translation.en: If one heard him whistling in the early morning, nobody would ever think he was tired.

translation.lb: Mé hätt én ower alles gewo'sst:
translation.en: But one would have known everything:

translation.lb: <fctt de Jängi erem d'ganz nuecht Snnerwé wor, fir no senge jongen ze kucken, oder fir c neien op seng plaz ze fe'eren a fir se alleguerten ze ravitaille'eren,
translation.en: that Jängi had again been tirelessly up all night checking on his youth, or to escort a newcomer to his place and to supply them all,

translation.lb: oder datt hién erem geseilter nuecht de bre'fdre'er vun der resistenz gespillt huet,
translation.en: or that he had again played the role of the mail carrier of the resistance during the concealed night,

translation.lb: da kennt é nure respect virum Jängi kre'en a gleichzeiteg drun erënnert gin, gené we' hié seng pflicht als patriot z'erfëllen.
translation.en: then one could only gain respect for Jängi and simultaneously be reminded of how he fulfilled his duty as a patriot.

translation.lb: Well de' huet nién erfëllt.
translation.en: Because he fulfilled it.

translation.lb: Dat wessen de' Reisdorfer a speziell de' aus der ganzer emge'gend haut am beschten, wat de Jängi fir d'kand vun deser oder dèr mamm geléscht huet.
translation.en: The people of Reisdorf and specifically those from the entire surrounding area know best today what Jängi achieved for the children of this or that mother.

translation.lb: Hién huet ké sehne' a ké rén gescheit, wann et gehéscht huet, sech op de velo ze setzen a patriotesch turen ze fueren.
translation.en: He cared for neither sinews nor rain when it meant getting on the bike to take patriotic rides.

translation.lb: Dofir wor den häss ge'nt alles wat preisesch wor, an d'le'wt vu senger Hémecht him vill ze de'w an engem treie bauerenhierz verankert.
translation.en: Therefore, his hatred was against all things Prussian, and the love for his homeland was deeply rooted in his loyal farmer's heart.

translation.lb: Aus le'ft zu sengem ve', dat 110 fudder verlângt huet, huet kén hién zréckgehale während der Rundstedtoffensive a sein hémechtsduerf ze fueren, duerch de preisesche granatrén, fir sengen an aner leidds be'schten, dat ne'degt fudder eichen ze goen.
translation.en: Out of love for his livestock, which required 110 loads, nothing held him back during the Rundstedt Offensive from going to supply the necessary feed, in his home village, through Prussian shellfire, for his and others' welfare.

translation.lb: Zu Me'schdref bei der brock huet de' verhâsst granat de Jängi getraff.
translation.en: At Mecher near the bridge, the detested grenade hit Jängi.

translation.lb: Matt sengem perd ass hié kurz drop gestuerwen.
translation.en: Along with his horse, he died shortly after.

translation.lb: Jängi! wanns du och net me' bei ons kanns sin; du bass net do't, de! géscht bleiwt ëmmer bei ons, hién hëlleft matt ons d'gcdanken an ons wierder ëmmer am richtege sënn ze fe'eren.
translation.en: Jängi! Though you can no longer be with us, you are not dead; your spirit always remains with us, helping us steer our thoughts and words always in the right sense.

translation.lb: Du bass et dén on3 set: „Sitt hârt mé bleiwt gerecht".
translation.en: You are the one who said: "Be strong but remain just."

translation.lb: Eso' ve' mir am krich geschwuer hun e'weg gudd Letzeburger ze bleiwen, eso' schwiere mir dir haut, dech nimols ze vergiéssen, Boss wir et net weit hir matt onsem patriotissem.
translation.en: As we swore during the war to forever remain good Luxembourgers, so we swear to you today to never forget you, Boss it is not far with our patriotism.

translation.lb: An eso' we' op all anere nationalheld, ass d'ganzt Letzeburger vollok stolz op dech:
translation.en: And just like with every other national hero, the entire Luxembourgish people are proud of you:

translation.lb: Jängi, du bass gefal,, we' nuren e wirdegen an active Patriot fale kann.
translation.en: Jängi, you fell as only an honorable and active patriot can fall.

translation.lb: Jean JACOBY
translation.en: Jean JACOBY

translation.lb: Nei filmstars Wärend 5 jor hât Europa ké contact mam amerikaneschen cinéma.
translation.en: New film stars During 5 years, Europe had no contact with American cinema.

translation.lb: An dèr zeit sin eng partie nei filmgre'ssten entstânen.
translation.en: In that time, several new greats of film emerged.

translation.lb: Un 1. stell stét de Bing Crosby, dém seng wârem stëmm millio'ne vun nolausohterer eso' gudd gefällt an dén d'haptroll am film: „La route semée d'Etoiles" hât.
translation.en: In first place is Bing Crosby, whose warm voice was so greatly appreciated by millions of listeners and who had the leading role in the film: 'The Road to Stars'.

translation.lb: Dono kënnt d'Veronika Lake, bekannt duich d'filmen „I wanted wings", „The Gun for Hiré", „Les anges de miséricorde", „Bring on ttie girls".
translation.en: Then comes Veronica Lake, known through the films 'I Wanted Wings', 'The Gun for Hire', 'The Angels of Mercy', 'Bring on the Girls'.

translation.lb: Dé Bob flope ass de populärsten artist vum amcrlkanesche radio, dén och am filin duerch seng aussergewe'nlech komik gro'sse succès hât.
translation.en: Bob Hope is the most popular artist of American radio, who also had great success in film through his extraordinary comedy.

translation.lb: Duerch hiren talent ass d'Paulette Boddard opgefall.
translation.en: Paulette Boddard stood out through her talent.

translation.lb: De Barry Pltgerald ass duerch d'roll vum paschto'er am film „Going my way" bekannt gin.
translation.en: Barry Fitzgerald became known through the role of the pastor in the film 'Going My Way'.

translation.lb: „Les anges de miséricorde" hun dem Sonny Tufts vill renommée abruecht, wärend d'Eddie Bracken an de Ray Milland sech e numm duerch „The Major and the Minor" an „Lady in the Dark" gcmâch hun.
translation.en: 'The Angels of Mercy' brought much fame to Sonny Tufts, while Eddie Bracken and Ray Milland made a name for themselves through 'The Major and the Minor' and 'Lady in the Dark'.

translation.lb: Des nimm setze sech bestëmmt och geschwënn an Europa duerch a sin dann eso' bekannt we' de' virkrichsfilmstars.
translation.en: These names will certainly soon become established in Europe as well and will then be as well-known as the pre-war film stars.

translation.lb: MEMORANDUM un de Jängy Serres, Wuelessem Enner enger gro'sser bedélegong vun en etlech honnert menschen hu mir e mëttwoch de 24. october 1945 d'begängnes vun onsem le' wen an onvergiéssleche komerod a refractaire de Jängy Serres gefeiert.
translation.en: MEMORANDUM to Jängy Serres, Wuelessem Under a large participation of several hundred people, we celebrated the memorial of our beloved and unforgettable comrade and defiant opponent Jängy Serres on Wednesday, October 24, 1945.

translation.lb: Leider wor et ons nach durch verschidde grënn net vergönnt gewiéscht, seng stiérwlech iwerreschter eriwer ze huelen, a mir müssen domatt bis spe'der Warden — egal — et wor eng schlicht an dach eng sehe' feier, a jidderén huet bewisen, we' se'er datt him den heildendo'd vum Jängy zu hèrze gâng ass,
translation.en: Unfortunately, for various reasons, we have not yet been granted the permission to take over his mortal remains, and we must wait until later for that—anyway—it was a simple yet dignified ceremony, and everyone proved how deeply Jängy's heroic death touched their hearts,

translation.lb: an de' zwo' riéden vun den hèren David a Knaff haten e klengen tro'scht fir d'familjen, de' nach bis elo zu der traureger nouvelle emmer an der hoffnong geliéwt hât, hire le'we jong erem ze gesin.
translation.en: and the two speeches by gentlemen David and Knaff offered small comfort to the families, who until now always lived in hope despite the sad news of seeing their dear son again.

translation.lb: De Jängy wor e gudde jong a vu jidderengem bele'wt gewiéscht an d'leidd hun all gemengt et kënnt net sin, we' si d'nouveHe vu sengem do'd kritt hun.
translation.en: Jängy was a good boy and liked by everyone and people all thought it couldn’t be true when they received the news of his death.

translation.lb: Nodém datt hién en etlech me'nl hei am land verstoppt wor, ass hién an d'Frankrcich viru komm, wo' hién durch feige verrot vun engem Letzeburger durch d'preisesch spirnues opfond gin ass.
translation.en: After he had been hiding for several months here in the country, he advanced to France, where he was discovered by the Prussian spies through the cowardly betrayal of a Luxembourger.

translation.lb: Sei wé huet durch verschidde beriichtegt preisesch prlsongen a KZer gefo'ert bis en endlech zu Dietz un der Lahn als é vun de sîwen e'schten vu 16 letzeburger jongen sei jongt liéwen den 19. 9. 44 fir ons hémecht an ons befreiong hir gin huet.
translation.en: His path led through various notorious Prussian prisons and concentration camps until he finally ended up at Dietz on the Lahn as one of the seven first of 16 Luxembourg boys who gave his young life on 19. 9. 44 for our homeland and our liberation.

translation.lb: Nach kurz e puer minutten virun hirem do'd hun si, we' mir durch de géschtlechen aus dem prisong. de pfarrer Friedrich Kneip wessen, aus der le'wt zu hirer hémecht an zui kro'n, d'ietzeburger aationalhymne gesongen,
translation.en: Just a few minutes before their death, as we know from the prison chaplain Pastor Friedrich Kneip, they sang the Luxembourg national anthem out loud to their homeland towards the crown,

translation.lb: an nodém si zesummen de' iescht cigarett gefëmmt haten, an an der rei opgestallt go'wen, hun si nach all eng ke'er ausgeruff: „Vive ons Grande-Duchesse" a „vive onse prince Jang".
translation.en: and after they had smoked one last cigarette together and lined up in a row, they all once again shouted: ‘Long live our Grand Duchess’ and ‘long live our Prince Jean’.

translation.lb: Et woren de' lescht wiérder ir si durch d'preisesch kugelen niddergestreckt go'- wen.
translation.en: Those were the last words before they were struck down by the Prussian bullets.

translation.lb: Et ass dest en herrieche beweis vun daperer heldenhaftegkél an de'wer hémechtsle'wt vun dese jongen, de* trei bis zum leschten otemzuch zu hirem land an zu hirem glaw gehalen hun.
translation.en: It is a magnificent proof of brave heroism and true love of these boys for their homeland, who held fast to their country and faith until their last breath.

translation.lb: Si sin net nemmen holden — nén — si sin och märtyrer, de' muddeg alles erdroen hun fir ons freihét matt hirem hèrzbludu z'erkafen.
translation.en: They are not only heroes—no— they are also martyrs who bravely endured everything to buy us freedom with their heart's blood.

translation.lb: An e'weg wèrde mir si net vergiéssen, si, de' ons allen matt engem oprichfege beispill vu Patriotismus viraus an den do'd gSnge sin.
translation.en: And we will never forget them, those who went ahead into death with an honest example of patriotism for all of us.

translation.lb: An du Jängy, du bass é vun déne jongen, de' alles fir onst le'wt hémechtsland erdroen hun, all quäle vu prisong a KZ, an de' virun aller weit bekannt hun, wat et héscht fir Letzeburg ze kämpfen an och ze stiérwen.
translation.en: And you Jängy, you are one of those boys who endured everything for our beloved homeland, all the torments of prison and concentration camps, and who made known to everyone what it means to fight and also to die for Luxembourg.

translation.lb: Dei numm stét matt gëllene buchstawen agedroen a wanns du och kirperlech do't bass, an onsem géscht liéws du dach weiderhi virun.
translation.en: Your name is inscribed with golden letters and even though you are physically dead, you continue to live in our spirit.

translation.lb: A mir wèrden dir et nimols vergiéssen, wats du an déne stonnen zu Dietz un der Lahn fir ons all erdroen hues.
translation.en: And we will never forget what you endured for us all in those hours at Dietz on the Lahn.

translation.lb: De manktem u Je'erpersonaal ass och ganz gro'ss.

translation.lb: well durch d'seiberongsactio'nen 95°/» vum personal am preisesche gesondhétswiésen ausgeschabt si gin, datselwecht gëlt och fir d'personal vun de spidéler, wo' 85'/» vum personal we'nst nazifrëndlechkét entiôss si gin.

translation.lb: Weider dre't de manktem u kuelen an u liéwesmëtted zu der verbrédong vun de krankhéten a seiche bei.

translation.lb: In seinen Sitzungen vom 23. und 24. Oktober hat der Rat für wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit zwischen Frankreich, Holland, Belgien und Luxemburg die Einsetzung einer Spezialkommission für soziale Sicherheit und Arbeitsbeschaffung beschlossen.
translation.en: In its meetings on October 23rd and 24th, the Council for Economic Cooperation between France, Holland, Belgium, and Luxembourg decided to establish a special commission for social security and employment provision.

translation.lb: Die erste Sitzung dieser Kommission, die die Politik der vier Regierungen auf dem erwähnten Gebiet koordinieren soll, findet heute, 7. Dezember, in Paris statt.
translation.en: The first meeting of this commission, which aims to coordinate the policies of the four governments in the mentioned area, takes place today, December 7th, in Paris.

translation.lb: Luxemburgischerseits nehmen an dieses Tagung teil; Hr. Paul Wilwertz, Regierungsrat und Kommissar des Arbeitsamtes; Hr. Nie. Pierre Feyder, Beamter im Arbeitsministerium, Sekretär der luxemburgischen Delegation.
translation.en: On Luxembourg's side, participating in this conference are; Mr. Paul Wilwertz, government councilor and commissioner of the employment office; Mr. Nie. Feiten, president of the arbitration court for social insurance; Mr. B. Bärbel, delegate of the labor minister, president of the workers' chamber; Mr. Pierre Feyder, official in the labor ministry, secretary of the Luxembourg delegation.

translation.lb: De’ nei griechesch regirong
translation.en: The new Greek government

translation.lb: De neie griechesche Rnisterpresident huet gëschter eng erklärong ofgin an dèr hié beto'nt huet, datt seng regirong viru ganz gewaiteg aufgaben gestallt wir.
translation.en: The new Greek Prime Minister gave a statement yesterday in which he emphasized that his government was faced with very challenging tasks.

translation.lb: Griechenland hätt nach ni an senger geschieht virun eso' engem chaos gestanen..
translation.en: Greece had never faced such chaos in its history.

translation.lb: De' e'scht aufgaben vun der neier regirong wire fir d'allcre'scht un d*wirtschaftlech problesner erunzetriéden an och fir d'öffentlech uerdnong erera hirzestellen.
translation.en: The first tasks of the new government would be to address economic problems and restore public order.

translation.lb: D'politesch gleichhét vun de Griechen misst erem hirgestallt an de respect vrum geselz erem durchgesat gin, fir datt frei a gerecht wählen ofgehale kennte gin.
translation.en: The political equality of the Greeks had to be reestablished, and the respect of the law enforced so that free and fair elections could be held.

translation.lb: An engem appel] un d voliek huet de ministerpresident et opgefuerdert, ro' an disziplin ze halen ande' dégiech arbecht opzehuelen.
translation.en: In an appeal to the people, the Prime Minister urged them to maintain calm and discipline and to resume their proper work.

translation.lb: Wetter huet de griechesche ministerpresident de regent Damaskinos gebiéden, seng démissio'n «rem rèckgângeg ze mächen an d'regentschaft virun ze fe'eren.
translation.en: Moreover, the Greek Prime Minister asked Regent Damaskinos to withdraw his resignation and continue the regency.

translation.lb: E correspondent vun der Londoner „Times" mellt, datt da» jetzegt griechescht cabinett all Parteien an sech verénegt, vun der conservativer republikanescher meltelstandspartei bis zu dèr lénkster partei an hié begre'sst, datt dat de' e seht richteg democralesch regirong wir, de' Griechenland seit joren gehat hätt.
translation.en: A correspondent from the London 'Times' reports that the current Greek cabinet includes all parties, from the conservative republican middle-class party to the leftmost party, and he welcomed it as the most truly democratic government Greece has had in years.

translation.lb: ENG GRO’SS ENQUETE VUN DER ZEIDONG D’ Unio’n Wo fir de Malaise am Land?
translation.en: THE GREAT INQUIRY OF THE NEWSPAPER D'Unio’n Where is the malaise in the country?

translation.lb: An enger série vun articelen, de' an zwangloser foliecb publize'ert gin, rnncrsieht d'zeitong „D'Unio'n" d'ursâehc vun dem gro'sse malaise bei am land.
translation.en: In a series of articles, which will be published in a loose succession, the newspaper "D'Unio’n" will examine the causes of the great malaise in the country.

translation.lb: Mir gin d'kritik u ville slaatlechen a privaten arîchtongen an arbechtsmethoden eso' erem, we' mir se an alle schichte vun der populatio'n gche'ert hun.
translation.en: We will review the criticism of many state and private institutions and working methods just as we have heard it in all strata of the population.

translation.lb: Mir streichen typesch a besonnesch krass fäll ervir, fir de manktcm un der organisatio'n an domatt d'nole'ssegkéten an de gesetzleche regclongen opzedecken.
translation.en: We highlight typical and especially severe cases to reveal the lack of organization and thereby the negligences in the legal regulations.

translation.lb: Dat ass den aweck vun nnser enquête.
translation.en: That is the purpose of our inquiry.

translation.lb: Andém. datt mir dat mflchen, gi mir schon d'müttelen un, de' eng rapid gesondong erme'glechen an aus der kritlk craus ze'e mir de' no'twenneg schlussfolgcrongen a mâche mir d'vlrschle' fir eng me' gerecht a besser le'song.
translation.en: By doing this, we already provide the means that enable rapid healing and from the criticism draw the necessary conclusions and make proposals for a fairer and better solution.

translation.lb: Mir richte nach eng ke'er en appeil un all ons îatlbierger. un de' mir bis elo net eruntriéde konnten: Schreiwt ons Er ménong, ëuncrbréd ons Er virsehle', sot ons Er beobachtongen.
translation.en: We once again make an appeal to all our fellow citizens, to those we have not yet reached: Write us your opinion, share your suggestions, tell us your observations.

translation.lb: Denkt net, si wire net wiehteg genucb.
translation.en: Do not think they are not important enough.

translation.lb: El ass dach grad d'le'song vun den détaiifroen, de' am méschten d'onzefriddenbét ervirbregt.
translation.en: It is precisely the solution to the detailed questions that brings out the most dissatisfaction.

translation.lb: AU klengen détail get dem probiem en Sneren aspckt an erme'gleeht et, d'gefoer vun abus'en ze verklengeren oder z'éllmine'eren.
translation.en: Any small detail gives the problem a clearer aspect and allows the danger of abuses to be reduced or eliminated.

translation.lb: Sot net. dofir sin aner leldd do.
translation.en: Do not say that others are responsible for that.

translation.lb: Dir kritizc'ert jo och, dir bekiot iéch iwer ongerech tegkéten oder scheinbar ongerecht egkéten.
translation.en: You also criticize, you complain about injustices or seemingly unjust conditions.

translation.lb: Dann délt ons d'ursâeh vun Erem lérger matt.
translation.en: Then share with us the cause of your anger.

translation.lb: Mir versiehe remednr ze schâfen, wann et nc'deg a me'glech ass.
translation.en: We strive to create remedies when necessary and possible.

translation.lb: Schreiwt ons.
translation.en: Write to us.

translation.lb: Dir hëlleft doduerch Iéch selwer an Ere mattbiérger.
translation.en: By doing so, you help yourself and your fellow citizens.

translation.lb: Vergiésst och net, en iwel kennen, ass dén e'schte scbrëtt fir eng besscrong ze fannen.
translation.en: Also remember, recognizing an evil is the first step to finding a remedy.

translation.lb: Regirongscrise an Italien
translation.en: Government crisis in Italy

translation.lb: An Italien ass durch en austrëtt vun der liberaler partei aus der regirong eng crise entstanen.
translation.en: In Italy, a crisis has arisen due to the withdrawal of the liberal party from the government.

translation.lb: Des partei huet dem ministerpresident Parri virgeworf, hién hätt neigongen zu dictatorial methoden.
translation.en: This party has accused Prime Minister Parri of inclining towards dictatorial methods.

translation.lb: Englesch berichter aus Ro'm mengen, datt a nèxter zeit matt der gesamtdémissio'n vun der italienescher regirong ze rechne wir.
translation.en: English reports from Rome suggest that, in the near future, a total resignation of the Italian government should be expected.

translation.lb: Ir d'liberal partei aus der regirong zréckgetrueden ass, hat si e schärfen ugrëff op de ministerpresident Parri lassgelôss.
translation.en: Before the liberal party withdrew from the government, it launched a sharp attack on Prime Minister Parri.

translation.lb: Hién hât sech geweigert op hire virschlag e puer al ministeren a ministerpresidenten we z. b. de gr~f Orlando, de fre'ere ministerpresident Bonomi a. e. w. a sei cabinett opzehuelen an dodurch huet hién d'vertrauen vun der liberaler partei verluer.
translation.en: He had refused their proposal to include a few former ministers and prime ministers, such as Count Orlando and former Prime Minister Bonomi, in his cabinet and thereby lost the confidence of the liberal party.

translation.lb: Et get ugeholl, datt sei ganzt cabinett sech net me' läng haie kann.
translation.en: It is assumed that his entire cabinet cannot hold out much longer.

translation.lb: Ennerstefczt get d'regirong Parri nach vun der actio'nspartei, de Sozialisten an de kommunisten.
translation.en: The Parri government is still supported by the action party, the Socialists, and the communists.

translation.lb: Vun der défense op d’conterattack!
translation.en: From defense to counterattack!

translation.lb: Den hèr Thewes, »un der législntivcr épuratio'nskommissio'n an d'défcnsiv geheit, gét an enger conterattack zur offensiv iwer.
translation.en: Mr. Thewes, in the legislative purification commission and in the defensive, goes from counterattack to offensive.

translation.lb: Senger ménong no ass den avis vun der commissio'n (no dém den hèr Thewes fir an d'Chamber onwîrdeg erkle'ert get) d'resultat vun engem manëwer vun senge politeschc ge'gner, de' drop auswiren, hién, den hèr Thewes, op de' inane'er z'évince'eren an senger politcaeher carrière de grawstén ze setzen.
translation.en: In his opinion, the opinion of the commission (after Mr. Thewes is declared unworthy for the Chamber) is the result of a maneuver by his political opponents, who aim to eliminate him, Mr. Thewes, and put an end to his political career.

translation.lb: Der épuratio'nscommissio'n wèrft hié vir, datt ei Mm hätt wellen durch e tnarehandage-spiiichen eng fâl stellen an datt si wollt durch hiren avia d'Chamber an d'land trompe'eren!
translation.en: The purification commission accuses him of having wanted to set a trap with false speaking and that they wanted to deceive the Chamber and the country through their advice!

translation.lb: D'Chamber, sét den hèr Thewes, breicht e sëndebock, fir hir lischt op dén ofzciueden, an elo hätt se hién dofir ausgesicht:
translation.en: The Chamber, says Mr. Thewes, needs a scapegoat to divert attention from their actions, and now they have chosen him for that purpose:

translation.lb: mé do wir si bestimmt net on de' ricliteg ad res s komm,
translation.en: but they have certainly not come to the right address,

translation.lb: well, wann hién misst am ëffcntleche liéwen d'blat botzen, da missten awer och bcstëmmt de' hèren hir politesch valisse paken,
translation.en: because if he had to clean the slate in public life, then others would certainly also have to pack their political bags,

translation.lb: de' sengerzeit anno diaboli 1940! un den hèr Hitler d é sche'ne bre'w geschriwen,
translation.en: those who had written the beautiful letters to Mr. Hitler back in 1940!

translation.en: Mr. Thewes finds it strange that a Chamber that created no resistance to the Prussian and thus indirectly opened fair fields to the Nazis,

translation.en: that such a Chamber sits in judgment over others.

translation.lb: De' clanpolitik, de' hién zum Bammelsündebock stempele wellt misst endlech ophe'eren an dofir misst fir onzefänken de proporzsystem den d'clanmanëver favorise'ert durch directe vote ersat gin...
translation.en: The clan politics that wish to stamp him as a scapegoat must finally stop, and for that, the proportional system that favors clan maneuvering must initially be replaced by direct voting...

translation.en: The brown coal production increased by 2%, which is also only a quarter of the wartime production.

translation.lb: An der englescher occupatio'nszon ass d'productio'n em 76% an dMûcht gâng.
translation.en: In the English occupation zone, production rose by 76%.

translation.lb: D'iiaptursâch, datt net me' produze'ert ka gin, ass ëmmer nach dé gro'sse manktem a kuelegro'wcnarbechtcr.
translation.en: The main reason that more cannot be produced is still the significant shortage of coal miners.

translation.lb: Nodéin de Stinnes an de' hapUeidd vun de kuelegro'wen verhafft si gin, leit d'iédong e4o an den hänn vu neie leidd, de' 250 aUie'erten offize'er ënnerstin.
translation.en: After Stinnes and the leaders of the coal mines were arrested, the management is now in the hands of new people, supported by 250 Allied officers.
