translation.en: Everyone here is asking these two questions.

translation.lb: ewell de' méscht, matt hackekreizer beschmirten heiser, matt 'weneg ausnahmen, zum gre; ssten dél vu gudde Letzeburger bewo'nt sin.
translation.en: Since most houses smeared with swastikas, with few exceptions, are inhabited by respectable Luxembourgers.

translation.lb: D'schmlrarbecht go'f matt schwarzer fuerw ausgefo'ert.
translation.en: The smearing was done with black paint.

translation.lb: Wo' d'rollueden net erof woren, go'wen de* onsvmpathesch kreizer an d'glace geschmîrt, an un denen aneren heiser op d'rolliieden, jo e.so' guer op d vischt dîren.
translation.en: Where the shutters were not down, the unsympathetic crosses were smeared on the glass, and on other houses on the shutters, even on the front doors.

translation.lb: D'ganz Didelenger populatio n wënseht, datt de' sclrmîrerten entlarvt gin an dann endlech hir gerecht strof kre'en.
translation.en: The entire population of Dudelange wishes that the smearers are uncovered and finally receive their deserved punishment.

translation.en: Before the war, Dudelange was a city where carnival was celebrated very joyfully.

translation.en: Especially carnival Monday, Shrove Tuesday and mid-Lent Sunday were the main days, during which a nice sum of money was always raised through the large sale of masquerade tickets.

translation.lb: Och de' lesclit virum krich. op halleffäschtesonndeg hei ogarnise'ert cavalkaden. haten all joer e gro'sse succès.
translation.en: Even the cavalcades organized here on mid-Lent Sunday before the war always had great success every year.

translation.lb: Matt all dese sehe'nen dég an traditio'nen ass et det joer nun- ower leider nach ëtnrner gratf ewe' wäfend dem krich... esseg.
translation.en: With all these beautiful days and traditions, this year is regrettably still somewhat limited during the war...

translation.lb: well jo bekanntlech d'verkléden op de strôssen an an den danzsäll, eso" we' och nach eso'guer d'maskebàler nach ëmmer verbuede sin.
translation.en: because as you know, dressing up in the streets and in the dance halls, as well as the masquerade balls, are still prohibited.

translation.lb: We" nun ower an der dagespress ze liésen ass, gin erem a villen uertschaften hei am land, ewe' iwregens och schon dal leschte joer.
translation.en: However, as reported in the daily press, many towns in the country are again, just like last year.

translation.lb: cavalkaden ofgehâlen, eso' datt och onse Syndicat d'initiative bal erem drun denke kann, fir d'organisalio'n fir de' traditionnel Didelenger cavalkad op halleffâschtesonndeg erem an d'hand ze huelen.
translation.en: holding cavalcades, so that our Syndicat d'initiative can soon consider organizing the traditional Dudelange cavalcade on mid-Lent Sunday again.

translation.lb: Fir det joer hun ower verschidde vereiner schon erem irgend eng fuesendssoirée annonce'ert.
translation.en: For this year, however, some associations have already announced some sort of carnival evening.

translation.en: The beginning will be next Sunday, the 8th of February, with the workers' singing and mining club hosting a farmer's night at the union hall and the football club U. S, D. organizing a big carnival ball in the newly renovated Salle Bodry in the foundry quarter.

translation.lb: Den op der minière „Thillèbiérg" beschiiftegte, ve'erzegjähregen fo'ermann J. P. Wagner vun De'fferdeng war vu senge kaschtleidd zënter e puer dég net me' gesi gin.
translation.en: The 40-year-old foreman J. P. Wagner from Differdange, employed at the 'Thillèbiérg' mine, had not been seen by his colleagues for several days.

translation.lb: E samschdeg, de 7. 2. mures hun arbechter op der minière bei den zwe' gro'sse wâsserbassengen en hutt an e mantel gesi leien, an dem eng eidel pavetût stuch op den nu m m Wagner.
translation.en: On Saturday morning, the 7th of February, workers at the mine saw a hat and a coat lying near the two large water reservoirs, with an empty wallet bearing the name Wagner.

translation.lb: Vermutungen, datt de genannte Wagner sech vleicht geboll hätt, huet d'directio'n veranlasst de' zwe' bassengen auslàfen ze iossen, wo' dann och an dem engen seng leich fond go'f.
translation.en: Suspicions that the mentioned Wagner might have drowned himself led the management to let the two reservoirs be drained, whereupon his body was found in one of them.

translation.lb: Nom dokterbefond lo r g en ongefe'er 12 stonnen am wàsser.
translation.en: According to the doctor's report, the body had been in the water for approximately 12 hours.

translation.lb: D'genda rmerie war gleich op der plittz a si hun d'ieich vum J. P. Wagner, dé jonggesell war, an d'morgue iwerfe'ere geloss.
translation.en: The gendarmerie quickly arrived at the scene and transferred the body of J. P. Wagner, who was unmarried, to the morgue.

translation.en: The Union intends this year during the great holiday not only to send French resistance children, but also children from England to Luxembourg families for a few weeks for recuperation.

translation.lb: Dat schc'nt wierk, dat mir dat vcrgangent joer matt eso'vill sueeès durchgefe'ert haten, soll domatt oeh op ons englesch frënn ausgebrét gin.
translation.en: The nice work, which we carried out with so much success last year, should thus also be extended to our English friends.

translation.en: We all know what we owe the brave English people.

translation.lb: Mir Letreburger wëllen dofir derzo' beidroen, bei dèr gro'sser materieller no't, de' vil! arem kanner aus England baut als folleg vum krieh erdroe müssen, eng kleng erlîehterong ze schäfen.
translation.en: We Luxembourgers therefore want to contribute to providing a small relief in the great material need that many poor children from England have to endure as a consequence of the war.

translation.lb: Mir biéden ons befrënnt familjen, ons schon elo mattzedélen, watfir kanner (jong oder médchcn) a vu wat fir engem alter si bei sech ophnele wëllen, fir dalt mer ons an onsc verhandlongeu einegennösse richte kënnen.
translation.en: We ask our friendly families to already let us know which children (boys or girls) and of what age they would like to host, so that we can arrange accordingly in our negotiations.

translation.lb: Beschluß, wodurch die Tage der Loosziehung für die Miliz-Aushebung von 1859 festgesetzt werden.
translation.en: Decision by which the days for the draft lottery for the militia recruitment of 1859 are determined.

translation.lb: Luxemburg, den 17. Januar 1859.
translation.en: Luxembourg, January 17, 1859.

translation.lb: D« Ttaatsminister, Präsident der Regierung;
translation.en: The State Minister, President of the Government;

translation.lb: Nach Einsicht der Gesetze über die Miliz;
translation.en: After reviewing the laws regarding the militia;

translation.lb: Beschließ t:
translation.en: Decides:

translation.lb: Art. 1. Die Loosziehung der Milizpflichtigen der Aushebung von 1859 soll an den hierunter bezeichneten Orten und Tagen, um IN Uhr Vormittags, Statt finden:
translation.en: Art. 1. The draft lottery for those obligated to serve in the militia for the recruitment of 1859 shall take place at the locations and on the days specified below, at 11 o'clock in the morning.

translation.lb: Ait. 2. Die Milizpflichtigen der vom Hauptotte des Cantons entferntesten Gemeinde!! sind zur Loosziehun.; zueist zugelassen.
translation.en: Art. 2. The conscripts from the municipality farthest from the canton's main town shall be admitted to the lottery first.

translation.lb: Art. 3. Die Districtscommissäre und die Gemeindeverwaltungen haben, so» weit die Sache sie detrifft, sich nach den Bestimmungen der Art. 74 bis 86 des Gesetzes vom 8. Januar 1817 zu richten.
translation.en: Art. 3. The district commissioners and municipal administrations are to comply, as far as it concerns them, with the provisions of Articles 74 to 86 of the law of January 8, 1817.

translation.lb: Art. 4. Gegenwärtiger Beschluß soll i» allen Gemeinden des Großherzog» thumö bekannt gemacht und angeschlagen werden.
translation.en: Art. 4. The present decision shall be made known and posted in all communities of the Grand Duchy.

translation.lb: RE’MECH Mat dem viite Feslè fei'ren Get de Mé det Jobr en dei'ren Awer och e sche'ne Mo'nt,
translation.en: RE’MECH Celebrate with the fifth celebration of May this year but also a beautiful month,

translation.lb: Christi-Himmeltahrt a Peischten Wöüt all Mönsch sech eppes léschten, Dat am Fre'johr sech och lo'nt.
translation.en: Ascension Day and Pentecost everyone wants to treat themselves to something, which in spring is also worthwhile.

translation.lb: Wann nés d'Böscher, d'Blumme spre'ßen, Ge'f é gär d'Natur gene'ßen,
translation.en: When the bushes, the flowers sprout again, one gladly enjoys nature,

translation.lb: A wo'me'glech eppes me', Zossiß-, Hâm- a Ke'sseschmieren We' e Patt dem Duscht ze wieren Aß do wuel de béschten Dre'.
translation.en: And if possible a bit more, sausage, ham and cheese to spread, with a drink to quench the thirst is probably the best thing around.

translation.lb: Hätt Dir dat gär gudd zerve'ert, Sche'n zesumme combine'ert, lessen, Drenken an d'Natur,
translation.en: If you would like that well served, nicely combined together, reading, drinking and nature,

translation.lb: Ge'f ech nach en Dâg lech roden, Den eis grad könnt we' gebroden Och am Mé an émoi nur.
translation.en: I will advise you to take another day, that could be well spent also in May and always only once.

translation.lb: Gitt en Tour no Re'mech mächen, Op de Moart de Wein ze schmächen Näxte Méndeg, d'aß dat beseht.
translation.en: Take a trip to Remich, to taste the wine at the market next Monday, that is what is best.

translation.lb: An sech nömmen net gene'ert, Mir sin all do Invite'ert, D'Musel frét sech op hir Gäscht.
translation.en: And do not shy away, we are all invited, the Moselle is happy about its guests.

translation.lb: An Dir braucht net läng ze sichen, Net no enger gudder Kichen, Nach no engem gudde Patt,
translation.en: And you don't need to search long, not for a good kitchen, nor for a good drink,

translation.lb: Mä, paßt op I soß, 't aß en Dauer, Sidd dir wuel em ve'er Auer Oder iönnef, scho schachmatt.
translation.en: But, watch out I say, it's a marathon, you might well be knocked out around four hours or less.

translation.lb: Sollt én Dönschdes et bereien An nach an de Schwächte leien, Je, mei Gott, wat soll da sin,
translation.en: Should one regret it on Thursday and still lie in weaknesses, well, my God, what should that be,

translation.lb: Möttwochs aß e schon nés röchteg A sét frédeg sech a löschteg: , D'näxt Johr gin ech nés dohin I" Memo,
translation.en: By Wednesday one is already alright again and feels cheerful and happy: 'Next year I'm going there again!' Memo,

translation.lb: Opruff un d’Joergäng 1925, 1926 an 1927.
translation.en: Call to the age groups 1925, 1926, and 1927.

translation.lb: No enger Recksproch main Här Arme'minister we'nt de Jongen, de' bei de Preisen an der Wehrmacht, dem RAD oder der Heimatflak gedengt an nom Krich bei d'letzeburger Arme' agezu go'fen oder sin, huet d'Ligue Ons Jongen Löschten opgestallt, de' dem Arme'minister ônnerbrét gin.
translation.en: After consultation with the honorable Minister of Defense regarding the young men who served with the Germans in the Wehrmacht, the RAD or the Homeland Flak, and were drafted into the Luxembourg Army after the war, the League 'Ons Jongen' has prepared lists to be submitted to the Minister of Defense.

translation.lb: Well d'Ligue de' Angaben brauch fir hier Dossier'en ze komplette'eren sin de' betreffend Jongen resp. hir Famil.ien gebieden, ons folgendes schreftlech matzedélen'
translation.en: Because the League needs this information to complete their files, the young men concerned or their families are asked to provide the following in writing:

translation.lb: 1. Numm, Virnumm an Adresse.
translation.en: 1. Name, first name, and address.

translation.lb: 2. Geburtsdatum,
translation.en: 2. Date of birth,

translation.lb: 3. W'e'ni agezunn bei de Preisen,
translation.en: 3. When conscripted by the Germans,

translation.lb: 4. We' lang agezunn (RAD, Wehrmacht, Maquis, asw. We' lang gefangen, We'ni rapatrie'ert.
translation.en: 4. Duration of conscription (RAD, Wehrmacht, Maquis, etc. Duration of captivity, date repatriated.

translation.lb: 5. Verhältnes zur letzeburgescher Arme: a) schon agezwri gewiescht, vu —bis, b) zereckgesat bis we'ni, c) zur Zeit agezunn, bis we'ni ze dengen
translation.en: 5. Relationship to the Luxembourg Army: a) previously conscripted, from — to, b) discharged until when, c) currently conscripted, until when serving

translation.lb: f Mir bieden heimatt des Jongen oder hier Familjen an hierem egenen Interese ons eso fort des Angaben zo'kommen ze lossen.
translation.en: We hereby request these young men or their families, in their own interest, to promptly send us this information.

translation.lb: (Matgedélt vum Secrétariat vun der Ligue „Ons Jon gen", 9, Avenue de la Porte Neuve, Letzeburg).
translation.en: (Communicated by the Secretariat of the League "Ons Jongen", 9, Avenue de la Porte Neuve, Luxembourg).

translation.lb: AVIS IWER DE SERVICE MILITAIRE VUN DER CLASSE 1929.
translation.en: NOTICE REGARDING THE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE CLASS OF 1929.

translation.lb: Durch den Arrêté grand-ducal vunt 31. Januar 1948 sin de' jong Letzeburger, de' teschcnd dem 1. Januar an dem 31..Dezember.1929 gebuer sin. zum Servi;e Militaire obligatoire ageruff.
translation.en: By the Grand-Ducal Decree of January 31, 1948, the young Luxembourgers born between January 1 and December 31, 1929, are called to compulsory military service.

translation.lb: Den Art. 3 vum Arrêté grand-ducal vum 31. Januar 19-tS bestörnmt dass de Service Militaire vun der Classe 1929 op 6 Me'nt rcduze'ert ka ein; wann d'Jongen eng demande un d'Administration Militaire machen, sief et am Ament vum Recensement, sief e: am Ament vum Recrutement.
translation.en: Article 3 of the Grand-Ducal Decree of January 31, 19-tS stipulates that the military service of the class of 1929 can be reduced to 6 months if the young men make a request to the Military Administration, either at the time of the census or at the time of recruitment.

translation.lb: Den Art. 3 ass eso' ze verstoen, dass ail deman ■ den, de Service Militaire vun der Classe 1929 op 6 Me'nt zi reduze'eren, ugehoil gin, o'ni dass én duerfir speziell GrÔiin brauch unzegin;
translation.en: Article 3 is to be understood so that all requests to reduce the military service of the class of 1929 to 6 months are to be approved without needing to specify special reasons.

translation.lb: praktesch dauere de Service Militaire vun der Classe 1929 aiso nomme 6 Me'nc
translation.en: Practically, the military service of the class of 1929 thus only lasts 6 months.

translation.lb: Fir de', jog Le'zeburger vun denen ane-e Classen de' nach beim Militaire sin oder hire Service Militaire nach zu mächen (tun, göt eng Le'song an dem selwechte Sönti getraff.
translation.en: For the young Luxembourgers from other classes who are still in military service or who still have to complete their service, a solution in the same sense is made.

translation.lb: eso' schnell an eso' weit ewe' de Besoin vum Service et e r labt
translation.en: as quickly and as far as the needs of the service allow it.

translation.lb: Omm Wé zur preisescher Armee fläsch eraus: „Elo" gët emol eng geholl Jongen".
translation.en: Everyone in the Prussian army takes out a bottle: "Now let's have a drink, boys."

translation.lb: D'Fläsch mecht den Tour.
translation.en: The bottle makes the round.

translation.lb: Et ass e gudde Quetsch.
translation.en: It's a good schnapps.

translation.lb: Mat engem Schlag ass d'Stömmung change'ert: „Schlot alles futti."
translation.en: With a single blow, the mood changes: "Smash everything to pieces."

translation.lb: D'Fenstere rabbelen, de' gössen Äschebecher gin ofgebrach a fle'en eraus, sämtlech Emailschölter gin dé selwechte Wé.
translation.en: The windows rattle, the heavy ashtrays are broken off and thrown out, all enamel signs go the same way.

translation.lb: Da kommen d'Ridoen mat de Stângen un d'Reih, d'Luchte gin futti geschloen.
translation.en: Then the curtains along with the poles follow, the lights are smashed.

translation.lb: An alle Compartimenter ass de' selwechten Zodi.
translation.en: In all compartments, there's the same commotion.

translation.lb: Ons Kabinetsdîr fle'ht zu Wasserbölleg iwert d'Breck.
translation.en: Our compartment door flies over the bridge at Wasserböllig.

translation.lb: Eso läng we' mir op letzeburgeschem Buedem wären, stongen iwerall Leit ze wenken an awur ze rufen.
translation.en: As long as we were on Luxembourgish ground, people stood everywhere waving and shouting farewell.

translation.lb: Elo ass dat eriwer an ailes wat sech elo lanscht Bun weist, kritt Frechhéte gemacht.
translation.en: Now that's over and everything that shows along the track gets mocked.

translation.lb: Zong eraus gestreckt dat ass dat mannst, gewe'hnlech héscht et: „Leckt ons am A... dir h... sau Preisen, oder wirt der gudd all freckt."
translation.en: Sticking out the tongue is the least, usually it goes: "Kiss our a... you stupid Prussian pigs, or you'll all be dead."

translation.lb: „Tre'er" „Alles aussteigen."
translation.en: "Tre'er" "Everyone get off."

translation.lb: M. (An der nächster Nummer de Rescbt)
translation.en: M. (The rest in the next issue)

translation.lb: E puer Me'nt sin eriwer.
translation.en: A few months have passed.

translation.lb: Et ass nött alles gàngen, we' mir et geduecht haten.
translation.en: Not everything went as we had thought.

translation.lb: Frech an arrogant Gesichter weise sech eröm op der Strôss, mat engem unverschimte Culot, desèlwechte Moment wo' doiwer ons Leit nach leiden, bludden a stierwen.
translation.en: Bold and arrogant faces show themselves again on the street, with an insolent audacity, at the very moment when our people are still suffering, bleeding, and dying.

translation.lb: Den Neiopbau vum Land könnt nöt vum Fleck, alles bleiwt am âle Gleis vu virum 10. Mé 1940.
translation.en: The reconstruction of the country is not progressing, everything remains on the old track from before May 10, 1940.

translation.lb: Mir fro'en ons op mer de ve'er Jor fir neischt solle gelidden hun.
translation.en: We ask ourselves if we have suffered the past four years for nothing.

translation.lb: Mat neien a schmirzlechen Erfrierungen sti mir op der Schwell vum neie Jor.
translation.en: With new and bitter experiences, we stand at the threshold of the new year.

translation.lb: Datt mir ■ 1945 definitiv Défaite vun der Nazipescht an Befreiong vu ganz Europa erliéwen, dat wösse mir.
translation.en: That in 1945 we will witness the definitive defeat of the Nazi scourge and the liberation of all of Europe, we know that.

translation.lb: 1945 get Musel eröm frei, an domatt ganz Land.
translation.en: In 1945 the Moselle will be free again, and with it the entire country.

translation.lb: 1945 kommen ons Leit an ons Jongen eröm.
translation.en: In 1945 our people and our boys will return.

translation.lb: Mir wollen ons schon elo virberéden, se würdeg z'empfänken, a matt hinnen zesummen de' gro'ß Botz virzehuelen, dé elo jo guer nött viru könnt.
translation.en: We want to prepare already now to receive them with dignity, and together with them conduct the great cleanup, which currently cannot begin.

translation.lb: Am Gedenken un onse Misär, am Gedenken un ons Märtyrer, wolle mer dann mat hinnen zesummen e neit Letzeburg oprlchten, ons Demokratie weider ausbauen a befestegen, al faschistesch Bestriewongen am Keim erstecken.
translation.en: In memory of our misery, in memory of our martyrs, we want to build a new Luxembourg with them, further develop and strengthen our democracy, and nip old fascist aspirations in the bud.

translation.lb: Eso' mache mir ons Pflich als Letzeburger, ower och als Mönschen.
translation.en: Thus, we fulfill our duty as Luxembourgers, but also as human beings.

translation.lb: Eso' höllefe mir och mat um Opbau vun enger neier Welt, an der Jugend sech emanzipe'ert an nött nömmen me' Kano'nefudder ass.
translation.en: In this way, we also contribute to the construction of a new world, in which youth emancipates itself and is no longer just cannon fodder.

translation.lb: J. G.
translation.en: J. G.

translation.lb: D’Assemblée Générale des délégués vum 16. Dez. 1945 vun der Ligue „Ons Jongen“ fuerdert op Grond vun dem letzeburger Militärgesetz dât d'Anze'ong vun de Joergäng 1925-26 fîr de Januar virgeseit d'Upassong vun dësem Militärgesetz un dât franse'scht.
translation.en: The General Assembly of the delegates on December 16, 1945, of the League 'Ons Jongen' demands based on the Luxembourg military law that the call-up of the 1925-26 birth years scheduled for January should match this military law to the French one.

translation.lb: Dëst franse'scht Militärgesetz bestëmmt: I.
translation.en: This French military law stipulates: I.

translation.lb: All Franso's dén an de „Service de Travail obligatoire en Allemagne" huet misse goen an iwer é Joer an Deitschland wor oder sech fir de' selwecht Zeit, dem Dengscht entzunn huet, gött vum Militärdengscht dispense'ert a kritt direkt seng „fiche de démobilisation."
translation.en: Any Frenchman who had to go to the 'Compulsory Work Service in Germany' and was over a year in Germany or evaded the service for the same period is exempted from military service and receives his 'demobilization card' immediately.

translation.lb: Dobei gëtt dât Joer als Militärdengschtjoer ugerechent, d. h. we' wann en é Joer bei de Franso'se gedengt hätt an e kritt vum Regionskommandant sei Sold als franse'schen Zaldot nobezuelt dat mecht 50 Centimes pro Dâg.
translation.en: This year is counted as a military service year, meaning as if he had served a year with the French, and he receives back pay from the regional commander as a French soldier, which amounts to 50 centimes per day.

translation.lb: 11. Fir all Elsass-Lothrenger den an den R.A.D. oder an d'Wehrmacht force'ert gin ass, göllt dât selwegt.
translation.en: II. For all Alsace-Lorrainers who were forced into the R.A.D. or the Wehrmacht, the same applies.

translation.lb: Soll ons Regierong manner Verständnes hun fir de Leidenswé vun onse Jongen we' de' franse'sch Regierong et bewisen huet vis-à-vis vun den Elsass- Lothringer.
translation.en: Should our government have less understanding for the suffering of our boys than the French government has shown towards the Alsace-Lorrainers.

translation.lb: Dofir fuerdere mir fir ons Jongen vum Jorgank 1925-26 Urechnong vun hirer Dengschtzeit an der Wehrmacht oder R.A.D.
translation.en: Therefore, we demand for our boys from the 1925-26 birth years the crediting of their service time in the Wehrmacht or R.A.D.

translation.lb: D’Universite’ tsto’ denten zu Stahleck Wé dé letzeburger Sto'denten an» -Hirscht 1940 flr t'éscht op preiseschen Universite'te waren, wé se sech do awer och gur nit dem preisekche System upasse wollten an all Dag de Preisen nei Schwieregkéte gemét hun, dun huet d'Reichsstudendefiihrung zesumme mam Gauleiter, fir d'Allerhélgendég, op der Burg Stahleck én „Einführungslager" organise'ert.
translation.en: The university students at Stahleck, when the Luxembourgish students first attended Prussian universities in the fall of 1940, did not want to adapt to the Prussian system and created new difficulties for the Prussians every day, then the Reich student leadership, together with the Gauleiter, organized an 'introductory camp' at Burg Stahleck for All Saints' Day.

translation.lb: Et kann é nömme so'en, dat dé ganz Sçhulung fir d'Preisen eng énzeg Enttäuschung war.
translation.en: It can only be said that the entire indoctrination was a complete disappointment for the Prussians.

translation.lb: D'Riédner kruten ail Argument widerluegt, go'wen ausgepaff, an de Kratzenberg, den Urmes an de Riekmann hu virun eso engem widerspenstege Publikum geschwât, dat se d'Nerve verluer an nomme mé furchtbar Drohungen erausbruecht hun.
translation.en: The speakers had all their arguments refuted and were booed, and Kratzenberg, Urmes, and Riekmann spoke in front of such a stubborn audience that they lost their nerves and resorted to terrible threats.

translation.lb: 300 jong Letzeburger hun démols de Preise bewis, dat si zu Letzeburg keng Iîcht Sâch ge'fe fannen.
translation.en: 300 young Luxembourgers proved to the Prussians at that time that they would find no easy prey in Luxembourg.

translation.lb: Mä ongefe'er 20 Sto'denten a Sto'dentinnen hun sech bei der Geléenhét fun hinne getrennt a bewosst zum Deitschtum bekannt.
translation.en: But about 20 male and female students separated themselves on that occasion and consciously embraced the German identity.

translation.lb: Den éschten Owend go'f nämlech gesot, nömmen de' deitschbewosst Letzeburger breîchten bei der Flaggenhissung derbei ze sin, et wir é vollkomme freiwöllegt Bekenntnis.
translation.en: On the first evening, it was said that only the German-conscious Luxembourgers needed to be present at the flag-raising, it would be a completely voluntary confession.

translation.lb: 20 Sto'dentinnen a Sto'denten hun sech font, fir dat Bekenntnis ofzeléen an den Arem an d'Lucht ze hiéwen we' den Hakenkreizfuendel opgezu go'f.
translation.en: 20 students found themselves to make that confession and raise their arms in salute when the swastika flag was hoisted.

translation.lb: De' aner, de' och spe'der op der Universite't Résistenz gemét hun. an duerfir délweis d'Studie verbuet krueten oder sogur agesat golfen, hun dén Dag nit vergiéss.
translation.en: The others, who later resisted at the university and therefore partially had their studies banned or even were imprisoned, have not forgotten that day.

translation.lb: Wann sie d'Verréder haut bege'nen, da kucken se matt Verachtung op se, an si hoffen datt och de' ârmse'leg Kréaturen, de' schon démols an der Vdß woren, zur Rechenschaft gezu gin.
translation.en: When they encounter the traitors today, they look at them with contempt, and they hope that the pathetic creatures who were already in the VdS back then will be held accountable.

translation.lb: D'Nimm si nit vergiéss.
translation.en: The names are not forgotten.

translation.lb: Si hoffen datt d'Staatsanwaltschaft én oder dén aner Dag Zeit fönnt fir sech matt dénen Herrschaften ze beschäftegen, de' all Dag beim Här Lippmann so'tzen.
translation.en: They hope that the public prosecutor’s office will find time one of these days to deal with those gentlemen who sat every day with Mr. Lippmann.

translation.lb: Vill sin et der nit.
translation.en: There are not many of them.

translation.lb: De' mést Sto'denten de' och nach bis un d'Enn eng Studienerlabnis kruten.
translation.en: Most students who were still granted a study permit until the end.

translation.lb: hu bei all Geléenhét bewis. datt sie sudd Letzeburger waren.
translation.en: They have proven on every occasion that they were real Luxembourgers.

translation.lb: Si hoffen durfir dat all de'jeneg, de' sech doiwer zu de Preise bekannt hun, we'negstens d'Me'glechkét geholl kre'en, hdnncno am öffentleche Liéwen eng Roll ze spillen, wann nit genug virleit fir se einfach anzespären.
translation.en: They hope that all those who admitted to the Prussians will at least be prevented from playing a role in public life, if not simply imprisoned.

translation.lb: Ve'er Joer hu mer se gefârt a gehâsst, an haut kommen de Hären op eis dur, lachen, réchen eis d'Hand, a mengen domat wir ailes vergiéss.
translation.en: For four years we feared and hated them, and today the gentlemen come to us, laugh, hold out their hands, and think that everything is forgotten.

translation.lb: n.
translation.en: n.

translation.lb: ONS EVAKUE’ERT Honnerten an Dausende vun Evakue'erten aus déne vun de Preisen menace'erten a besâtene Gebidder sin elo bei ons an der Stad an e böschen iwerall önnerbruecht.
translation.en: OURS EVACUEES Hundreds and thousands of evacuees from areas threatened and occupied by the prices are now with us in the city and housed a little everywhere.

translation.lb: Am Jor 1940 hâte vill vun hinne enger ganzer Reih vü Leidden eng Önnerkonft bei sech besucrgt.
translation.en: In the year 1940, many of them had procured themselves accommodation after a whole series of sufferings.

translation.lb: An elo sin si grad eso' weid we' de' Evakue'ert vuri 1940, matt dém ônnerschéd datt e kale Wanter vir der Dir stét an datt 4 Krichsjor onser Energie am >Aushâlen schons stärk zo'gesât hun.
translation.en: And now they are just as far as the evacuees before 1940, with the difference that a cold winter is at the door and that 4 war years have already considerably weakened our endurance.

translation.lb: Si sin elo #vill nje', schlecht drun we' hir Leidensgefährten vun 1940.
translation.en: They are now a lot closer, worse off like their fellow sufferers of 1940.

translation.lb: Dösen ongléckleche Landsleidd, vun déne vill bâl alles verluer hun, gölt elo onst ganz Matléd.
translation.en: These unfortunate compatriots, many of whom have almost lost everything, deserve now our full compassion.

translation.lb: Mir wönschen hinnen zu Ncijoschdag, dass se geschwönn eröm an hir Hémecht zreck könne gon.
translation.en: We wish them by Christmas that they can soon go back to their homeland.

translation.lb: Jidfer Letzeburger muss dann höllefcn, datt sie sech eröm huerteg eng nei sche'n Hémecht opbaue können.
translation.en: Each Luxembourger must then help them to soon rebuild a new beautiful homeland.

translation.lb: Bis dohin wärde mir alles mân, fir hinnen den Openhalt bei ons nöt nömmen erdre'glech, mais och eso' angenehm we' me'glech ze mächen.
translation.en: Until then, we will do everything to make their stay with us not only tolerable but also as pleasant as possible.

translation.lb: D'Letzeburger Solidarité'* darf net nömmen op dem Pobeier sfcen, maïs si muss och Wirklechkét gin.
translation.en: The Luxembourgish solidarity must not only exist on paper, but it must become reality.

translation.lb: Aus der Resistenz D'Unio'n schreiwt an hirer Nummer 12, si hätt le'wer et ge'w mat der Bildong vun dér geplangter Assemblée consultative (aïs Ersatz fir de' onvollstänneg Chamber) me' Gescheck gemach.
translation.en: From the resistance, the Union writes in their issue number 12 that they would rather have had more skill in forming the planned consultative assembly (as a replacement for the incomplete chamber).

translation.lb: Eigentlech sollt se schons fonktione'eren.
translation.en: Actually, it should already be functioning.

translation.lb: D'Unio'n wollt an der Assemblée 15 Sötzer hun, wat aus dösem passage ervirgét (Nr. 12 vum 27. Januar): „D'Unio'n verlangt an der assemblée consultative vu 45 Memberen 15 Sötzer fir d'Resistenz.
translation.en: The Union wanted to have 15 seats in the assembly, which is evident from this passage (No. 12 from January 27): "The Union demands 15 seats for the resistance in the consultative assembly of 45 members.

translation.lb: Ons Vertrieder musse vun enger Löscht gewielt gin, Ausfe'erongen vun der Unio'n sin de' d'Unio'n virschle't".
translation.en: Our representatives must be elected from a list, explanations from the Union are what the Union proposes."

translation.lb: No den Ausfe'erongen vun der Unio'n sin de' âl Parteien nöt ganz mat der Zuel vu 15 averstânen.
translation.en: According to the Union's explanations, the old parties do not completely agree with the number of 15.

translation.lb: Un „Ons Jongen“ Jongen! T'bestl wuel Ménongsverschiddenhéten an Differenzen zwöschen léch an ons, awer t'si keng Kontrasten, de' ons vunenäner trennen.
translation.en: To 'Our Boys' Boys! There may indeed be differences and variations of opinion between you and us, but there are no contrasts that separate us from each other.

translation.lb: Nén, t'ass nömmen an engem klengen Dél vun onse Programmer, wo' mir auserné gin; an allen anere Ponkte gesi mir not an, datt e komerodschaftlecht Zesummeschaffen mat léch ausgeschloss sollt gin.
translation.en: No, it is only in a small part of our programs where we are different; in all other points, we see that a cooperative collaboration with you should not be excluded.

translation.lb: Am contraire, mir müssen zesummenhalen, wa mir wollen eng nei Jugend op d'Bé setzen an dem Land de' Dengschter léschten, de' der Jugend opleien.
translation.en: On the contrary, we must unite if we want to establish a new youth and serve the country, which is the duty of the youth.

translation.lb: Mir schlon léch dofir vir, zwar getrennt Organisatio'nen ze bleiwen, doriwer eraus awer enk matenäner ze goen, eso'weit onse Wé déselwechtcn ass.
translation.en: Therefore, we propose to you to remain separate organizations, but closely cooperate as far as our paths are the same.

translation.lb: Datt ons Programmer sech not ge'- genseiteg ausschle'ssen, gesitt Dir dorauser, datt onser Maquien én ganz gudd kann zugleich Member vun Erer Ligue sin.
translation.en: That our programs do not mutually exclude each other is seen in the fact that our Maquiens can also be members of your League.

translation.lb: De wésentlechsten Oennerschéd zwöschen ons ass, datt onsen Oemfank me' kleng ass we' Eren, et ons dofir awer me' lîcht ass, fir verschidden Idealer unzestriéwen.
translation.en: The most essential difference between us is that our scope is smaller than yours, making it easier for us to strive for different ideals.

translation.lb: Dir hut Maquien an Deserteuren, mir hun nömmen Maquien, also Jongen, de aktiv résiste'ert hun, an op Grond vun döser, ech wöll soen „spezieller" Qualite't, hu mir zesummen Besonnesches vir, bestömmten Idealer an och materiell Interessen, de' iwer Er allgemeng erausgin.
translation.en: You have Maquien and deserters, we have only Maquien, thus boys who actively resisted, and based on this, I would say 'special' quality, we have certain particular ideals and also material interests that go beyond your general scope.

translation.lb: Verstittons awer nöt falsch.
translation.en: But do not misunderstand us.

translation.lb: Mir wollen ons nöt iwer léch ewechsetzen; nén, mir wollen nöt me' sin we' de Jongen, de' nöt am Maquis woren.
translation.en: We do not want to place ourselves above you; no, we do not want to be more than the boys who were not in the Maquis.

translation.lb: We' mir also mat onsem Programm kengeswés an dat Ert agreifen oder léch irgendwe' schiédegen, so' komme mir och mat onsen Zeidongen lânscht enâner.
translation.en: So if we do not interfere with your field in any way with our program or harm you in any way, then we will coexist with our papers.

translation.lb: Während Eer Zeidong bis elo me' de Charakter vun enger illustre'erter Zeitschröft hât, behâle mir fir de Moment e gewössen aktuellen, un d'politesch an d'kulturelt Liéwen gebonnenen Teint bei.
translation.en: While your paper has had the character of an illustrated magazine so far, for the moment, we retain a certain current flavor tied to political and cultural life.

translation.lb: Ons Bliéder ergänzen sech also' gegenseiteg.
translation.en: Our pages thus complement each other.

translation.lb: So', Jongen, elo wösst Dir onse Standponkt.
translation.en: So, boys, now you know our standpoint.

translation.lb: Dir gesitt, mir sin not de' streidereg Elementer, de' Dir an ons erwärd hätt, ower e'erlech an oprîchteg Komeroden.
translation.en: You see, we are not the contentious elements you would have expected in us, but honest and straightforward comrades.

translation.en: "The Maquisard"

translation.en: Lux Félix was shot dead on August 3, 1943 in Heiderscheid

translation.lb: Schwe’er Verwonnter Gleich no der Liberatio'n hat d'Ligue sech agesat bei der Regirong, fir de' Jongen, de' eng Spezialbehandlong breichten, direct önner ze brengen.
translation.en: Severely injured Immediately after the liberation, the League advocated with the government to place the boys who needed special treatment directly.

translation.lb: D'Regirong hât och hir Höllef versprach.
translation.en: The government had also promised its assistance.

translation.lb: Elo ass et endlech dem Hèr Majo'er Konsbruck durch seng privat Relatio'- nen réusse'ert,.verschidde Jongen bei d'Amerikaner an e Lazarett ze brengen.
translation.en: Now, Mr. Major Konsbruck has finally succeeded through his private connections in placing some boys with the Americans in a hospital.

translation.lb: Mir soen dem Hèr Konjbruck fir seng Beme'ongen Villmols merci.
translation.en: We express our sincere gratitude to Mr. Konsbruck for his efforts.

translation.lb: D'Amerikaner hun ons ze verstoe gin, datt durch de' Verzögerong, de' elo bei gewösse schwe'ere Fäll agetrueden ass, de' betreffend Jongen definitiv Krüppel bleiwen.
translation.en: The Americans have made us understand that due to the delay that has now occurred in certain serious cases, the boys concerned will remain permanently crippled.

translation.lb: Pat verdanken sl onser Regirong..
translation.en: But we owe this to our government..

translation.lb: Letzeburg huet also crem e pur Staatskröppele weider.
translation.en: Luxembourg thus continues with a few state cripples.

translation.lb: Dat schengt onser Regirong vollständeg egal ze sin; de' pur hoügreg Frangen, de' se fainne gin, ruine'eren de Staat och schliesslech net, an d'Gesondhét vun de Jongen ass Niéwesâch.
translation.en: This seems to be completely indifferent to our government; the few measly francs they receive won't ruin the state in the end, and the health of the boys is a secondary matter.

translation.lb: Et kann awer nach gro'sst Onhél vermidde gin, well nach si vill Jongen do, de' direct fort missten, an et kommen der all Dag me'.
translation.en: Yet the greatest misfortune can still be avoided because there are still many boys who need to be sent away immediately, and more are coming every day.

translation.lb: Soll ons Regirong sech da gur net em si bekömmere wollen?
translation.en: Shouldn't our government want to take care of them at all?

translation.lb: D’Ligue „Ons Jonjen“
translation.en: The League "Our Boys"

translation.lb: UN ONS ABONNENTEN: Vergiésst net iéch des Dég perse'nlech bei èrer Post ze abonne'eren.
translation.en: TO OUR SUBSCRIBERS: Do not forget to renew your subscription at the post office these days.

translation.en: CENSORSHIP.

translation.lb: De Johny huet seng Zensur aus der Scho'l matbruecht.
translation.en: Johnny brought his report card home from school.

translation.lb: Sei Papp kuckt se rosen a mengt: „Mei Bcschten.
translation.en: His father looks at it angrily and says: "My goodness.

translation.lb: gudd ass se net, mais ech wöll hoffen, dass se fir O'schteren besser get."
translation.en: it's not good, but I hope it will be better by Easter."

translation.lb: ~Eso' ass et richteg Papp", sét de Bo'w, „nömme net de Mudd vetle'eren."
translation.en: "That's right, Dad," says the boy, "just don't let mom find out."

translation.lb: Hallo! Hei schwätzt d’ARMMÉE Gro'sse Mars,
translation.en: Hello! Here speaks the ARMY Great Mars,

translation.lb: Bis clo hong Dei Bild an engcr Deischterer Nisch vun onser Kirch.
translation.en: Until now, your image was in a darker niche of our church.

translation.lb: Eise Kanner sin d'Aen iwergâng vrum blenkegen Altor,
translation.en: Our children's eyes looked past the gleaming altar,

translation.lb: wo' den Härgott eleng hinne seng Hann entge'nt gestreckt buet.
translation.en: where the Lord alone stretched His hand toward them.

translation.lb: Si wore vum Frid a vum Gléck geblönnt,
translation.en: They were dazzled by peace and happiness,

translation.lb: an 't buet ké vun eise Be'wercher Dech gesin an Dengem schwärzen Eck.
translation.en: and none of our people could see you in your dark corner.

translation.lb: Ele hu se Dir der Deiwel wéss vién tîm Haptaltor en Tabernakel opgemat an Dei greissiecht Bild driwer gehäng.
translation.en: They have placed a tabernacle at the main altar and hung your terrifying image above it.

translation.lb: Du stierks ons entge'nt matt Dengem schiele Bleck an Du hues en onhémlecht Schmunzelen op Denge Löpsen.
translation.en: You stare at us with your squinting glance and you have an eerie smile on your lips.

translation.lb: Eise Be'wercher stecht de! glönnerege Casque an d'Aen,
translation.en: Our men are blinded by the gleaming helmet,

translation.lb: a si frée 6ech hémlech drop,
translation.en: and they secretly look forward to it,

translation.lb: spe'der emol au Dei gro'ssen Automatebukek ze schlausen.
translation.en: to later get a chance to slam your big automatic gun.

translation.lb: Riéts am Schöff sin eis Männer jalo's iwert dem Jonktem seng onverhofft E'er a lenks an de Bänke schlecken d'Mammcn hir Tre'nen of a biéden:
translation.en: To the right in the choir, our men are jealous of the youth's sudden honor, and to the left, the mothers in the pews wipe away their tears and pray:

translation.lb: „Gro'sse Mars an Dengem Himmel do uewen, gefârt ass Dei Numm a gehâsst ass Dei Reich ower Dei wöll geschitt we' am Krich so' am Fridden.
translation.en: "Great Mars in your heaven above, feared is your name and hated is your kingdom but your will shall be done as in war so in peace.

translation.lb: Hai Dei Bro't, well et schmâcht ons no Pollefer.
translation.en: Here is your bread, for we long for unleavened bread.

translation.lb: Du belueds d'Männer matt Scholden an d'Frae matt Lcd.
translation.en: You burden the men with guilt and the women with misery.

translation.lb: Erle's dach ons Kanner vun Dengem Iwel! Amen.
translation.en: Deliver our children from your evil! Amen.

translation.lb: Du lauschters ower Deng Ae bleiwe stâr an Deng Löpse voll Spott.
translation.en: You listen but your eyes remain rigid and your lips full of mockery.

translation.lb: An ech wéss Deng Gedanken:
translation.en: And I know your thoughts:

translation.lb: Du ses: „Steif niéwent mir gét der Do't.
translation.en: You say: "The dead stand beside me.

translation.lb: Hién holt sech aus menger Arme',
translation.en: He takes from my army,

translation.lb: wién em gefällt we' am Krich, so' am Fridden:
translation.en: whomever pleases him as in war, so in peace:

translation.lb: virgôschter dén a göschter desen an haut erem en aneren.
translation.en: the day before yesterday this one and yesterday that one and today another again.

translation.lb: A muer..
translation.en: And tomorrow..

translation.lb: Ech wéss dobaussen dauschen Deng Aeroplanen a krauchen Deng eise Gefierer:
translation.en: I know your airplanes roar outside and your iron vehicles crawl:

translation.lb: We'ni geheis De dé nexten aus Dengcm Himmel a we'ni zerdrecks De erem én ennert Denge Ketten...?
translation.en: When will you call the next one from your heaven and when will you crush another under your chains...?

translation.lb: Gro'sse Mars erle's ons Kanner vun Dengem Iwel,
translation.en: Great Mars, deliver our children from your evil,

translation.lb: gléw ower net,
translation.en: but do not believe,

translation.lb: datt ech Ner derfir eng Kèrz stöften.
translation.en: that I would burn a candle for you.

translation.lb: Mam ne'dege Respekt Eng Mamm.
translation.en: With necessary respect, A Mother.

translation.lb: rbr.
translation.en: rbr.

translation.lb: Sportsenquête Nr. 1: Eis Nationaléquipe 7:0 zu Charleroi ge'nt d'Belsch a 6:2 dohém gent Holland, dat war e bössche stärk.
translation.en: Sports survey No. 1: Our national team won 7:0 in Charleroi against Belgium and 6:2 at home against Holland, that was quite strong.

translation.lb: Mer sin eis gewöss éneg, wa mer soen, dass bei eiser Nationalequipe eppes net klappt.
translation.en: We are certainly in agreement when we say that something is not working with our national team.

translation.lb: An duerfir mâche mer des enquête bei all eise jonge Sportsfrönn.
translation.en: And that's why we are conducting this survey among all our young sports friends.

translation.lb: Mer sin iwerzegt, dass Dir all d'Fo'ssballiéwen am Land verfollegt, a mer biéden lech, eis èr Ménongen anzeschécken.
translation.en: We are convinced that you all follow football life in the country, and we ask you to send us your opinions.

translation.lb: Dat, wat eriwer ass, wolle mer awer net kritise'eren an och kengem vun déne Spiller, de' derbei waren, e Virwuerf mächen.
translation.en: However, we do not want to criticize what is past, and we will not blame any of the players who were involved.

translation.lb: Si alléguer hun hirt Beseht gemacht.
translation.en: They all did their best.

translation.lb: Et soll eis dröm goen e Wé ze fannen, we' mer et an Zo'konft besser könne mächen, we' mer eröm aus deser Krisis eraus könne kommen.
translation.en: Our goal is to find a way to do better in the future, to get out of this crisis.

translation.lb: T'ass bekanntlech ganz einfach, ömmer nömmen ze kritise'eren, mais mir hâlen un eisern Programm fest, wo' mer eis als Ziel d'Mathöllef um Neiopbau vun eisern Sport gesät hun.
translation.en: It is admittedly very easy to constantly criticize, but we adhere to our program, where we have set as our goal to contribute to the rebuilding of our sports.

translation.lb: Schéckt eis èr Ménongen an, well önnert ville Wée fönt én och de richtegen.
translation.en: Send us your opinions, because among many ways, one also finds the right one.

translation.lb: Vermierkt op der Enveloppe „Enquête Sports" an adresse'ert èr Zo'schröften un d'Redaktio'n vun „Ons Jongen".
translation.en: Mark the envelope "Sports Survey" and address your letters to the editors of "Ons Jongen".

translation.lb: Mir denken un ons verschléft a mutile’ert Komeroden...
translation.en: We think of our fallen and mutilated comrades...

translation.lb: Vun desem sche'ne Gedanke gedriwen an encourage'ert, huet ons kleng Sectio'n Helzen Fuessonndeg é gro'ssen Theaterowend organise'ert.
translation.en: Driven and encouraged by this beautiful thought, our small section Helzen organized a big theater evening last Sunday evening.

translation.lb: Et huet alles wonnerbar geklappt, an eso'guer de' onzefriddenst Leidd sin op hir Käschte komm.
translation.en: Everything went wonderfully, and even the most dissatisfied people found satisfaction.

translation.lb: Als Haptstéck ass ënnert der Lédong -vum President Diederieh an dem Maquisard Wenkin de' sche'n Operette vum Her Alb.
translation.en: As the main piece, under the direction of President Diederieh and the maquisard Wenkin, the beautiful operetta by Mr. Alb.

translation.lb: Kayser „De Maquisard" opgefe'ert gin.
translation.en: Kayser "The Maquisard" was performed.

translation.lb: Vu Jongen a Médercher, de' selwer schwe'ert Léd erfueren hun, sin de Leidden op é neis de' hierzzereissendst Szenen aus de Krichsjoeren virun d'Aen gefe'ert gin:
translation.en: From boys and girls who themselves experienced heavy suffering, the most heart-wrenching scenes from the war years were vividly brought to life:

translation.lb: D'Verzweiwlong vun engem Jong, dé, fir senger kranker Mamm d'ömsidlon» z'erspueren, erem hannescht an d'Front gét;
translation.en: The desperation of a boy who returns to the front to spare his sick mother the relocation;

translation.lb: d'Hierzbludden vun enger Mamm, de' hire Jong an den Do't geseit goen fir hir d'Liéwen ze retten;
translation.en: the heartbreak of a mother who sees her son going to his death to save her life;

translation.lb: d'Roserei vun engem Papp, dé kén Auswé me' fënt;
translation.en: the fury of a father who finds no more way out;

translation.lb: d'Léd an de courage vun engem Médchen, dat trotz allen Zo'drenglechkéten sengem Jong trei bleiwt a schliesslech d'Brutalite't vun der SS.
translation.en: the suffering and courage of a girl who remains loyal to her boy despite all adversities, and finally the brutality of the SS.

translation.lb: Op ganz einfach Art a Weis huet den Hèr Kayser des Szene beschriwen, ganz natirlech a wirklech méschterhaft hun d'Acteuren se présente'ert.
translation.en: In a very simple way, Mr. Kayser described these scenes, and the actors presented them very naturally and indeed masterfully.

translation.lb: E specielle Luew de Jofferen, de' et fèrdeg bruecht hun, mat hirem wonnersche'ne Gesank all Stëmmong beim Publikum ervirzeruffen, ob traureg oder lëschteg.
translation.en: Special praise to the young women who managed to evoke every mood in the audience with their beautiful singing, whether sad or cheerful.

translation.lb: Do wo' d'Wierder an d'Gesten de Sënn an dat Tragescht vun den Szene net vollstänneg konnten eremgin, huet d'Guitarre vum Hèr Zeig, méschterhaft gespillt, wirklech Wonner gewirkt.
translation.en: Where words and gestures could not fully convey the meaning and tragedy of the scenes, Mr. Zeig's guitar, masterfully played, truly worked wonders.

translation.lb: Répétition vun de Wierder „Mamm kreisch net, dei Jong kënt zréck", an d'Präsenz vum Engelchen ha verschiedenen Szenen é besonnesche Wèrt gin.
translation.en: The repetition of the words "Mother, don't cry, your boy will return", and the presence of the little angel gave certain scenes a special value.

translation.lb: De Beiprogramm, „Eng komesch Verwiésslong" an engem Akt, de Virdrag „O de' Fraleit", an „der Führer spricht" huet d'Leidd emol erem eng Ke'er vnn Hierze lâche gedoen.
translation.en: The supporting program, "A Funny Misunderstanding" in one act, the lecture "Oh the Ladies", and "the Leader speaks" once again made people laugh heartily.

translation.lb: De' sehe' Recette vun 8000 Fr. huet bewisen, datt ons e'slécker Leidd, dénen d'Brutalite't vun der Rundstedtoffensiv batter Wonne geschloen huet, dem Léd an der schlëmmer Lag vun onse mutile'erte Komeroden net fère stin.
translation.en: The handsome proceeds of 8000 Fr. proved that our simple people, who were bitterly wounded by the brutality of the Rundstedt offensive, do not remain indifferent to the suffering and dire situation of our mutilated comrades.

translation.lb: Si huet bewisen, datt si é vun den Haptzwecker vun der Ligue verstânen huet, nämlech déne Jongen, de' krank oder verwond eremkomm sin, materiell a moralesch ënnert d'Arem ze greifen.
translation.en: It showed that it has understood one of the main purposes of the League, namely to materially and morally support the boys who returned sick or wounded.

translation.lb: Le'f E'slécker, mir soen iéch merci am Numm vun onse mutile'erte Komeroden a speciell am Numm vun dém Jong, dém den Erle's vun desem Owcnd zo'fle'sst.
translation.en: Dear readers, we thank you in the name of our mutilated comrades and especially in the name of the boy who owes the relief of this evening.

translation.lb: J.
translation.en: J.

translation.lb: OPRUFF un d’De’ffergenger Leidd!
translation.en: CALL to the Differdange people!

translation.lb: Am Mé-Juni 1944 sin zwé letzcburger Refractairen (e gro'ssc Blonden „groe Costume" an e Klengen „donkle Costume") bei der Familien ALIX zo' Longwy, \, rue Carnot, gewiescht.
translation.en: In mid-June 1944, two Luxembourgish draft evaders (a tall blonde 'grey suit' and a short 'dark suit') stayed with the family ALIX in Longwy, rue Carnot.

translation.lb: Den Hèr Alix hât de' zwé Jongen am Zug vu Pareis op Lonkech kennegele'ert an se du matt Hém geHoll.
translation.en: Mr. Alix met the two boys on the train from Paris to Longwy and then took them home.

translation.lb: Nodém se him erzielt hâten, datt se Hémlech erem op Letzeburg (De'fferdeng) genge goen, hun se bien verlôss.
translation.en: After they told him that they intended to secretly return to Luxembourg (Differdange), they left him.

translation.lb: Well bis haut ké vun dénen zwé Jongen sech bei him gemellt huet, an sie de' Zeit eng Valisse bei him stoe geloss hun, biede mer all Leidd, de' eventuell Renseignementer kennte gin, sech un ons ze wenden.
translation.en: Since until today neither of the two boys has contacted him, and they left a suitcase with him, we ask anyone who might have information to contact us.

translation.lb: D'Valisse selwer wâr aus brongem Liéder matt folgendem Inhalt:
translation.en: The suitcase itself was made of brown leather with the following contents:

translation.lb: Eng Täschelücht matt Ofblenduong (Mark Hasséo), eng Kléderbiescht, en Epongenhandduch an e kare'ert Handduch, 5 Nueschnappecher, 1 Steck Sunglight Séf, e Blrtmesser mam Firmennumm J. Dossing, Esch-Alz. matt den Initialen K. C.
translation.en: A flashlight with dimming function (Brand Hasséo), a clothes brush, a sponge towel and a checkered towel, 5 handkerchiefs, 1 piece of Sunglight soap, a pocket knife with the company name J. Dossing, Esch-Alz. with the initials K. C.

translation.lb: Zeidong „Ons Jongen", Bvd. Royal 45, Letzeburg.
translation.en: Newspaper "Ons Jongen", Bvd. Royal 45, Luxembourg.
Phone 57-42.

translation.lb: Le'w Médercher, hei ass Er Seit!
translation.en: Dear readers, here is your page!

translation.lb: Et ass nëmmen én Zo'fall, datt se des Ke'er ganz op franse'sch ass.
translation.en: It is merely a coincidence that this time it is entirely in French.

translation.lb: Hëlleft matt, se interessant a liéweg ze mächen.
translation.en: Help with making it interesting and lively.

translation.lb: Wann et dann net me' duer gét matt enger Seit, dann huele mer der zwo'.
translation.en: If one page is not enough, then we will take two.

translation.lb: D'Redactio'n.
translation.en: The editors.

translation.lb: DE MERCI fir all de’, de’ «ONSE JONGEN» a schwe’erer Zeit gehollef hun
translation.en: THANKS to everyone who helped «OUR BOYS» in difficult times

translation.lb: We' de Gauleiter den e'schte September 1942 de preisesche Militärdengscht fir d'Letzeburger Jongen dekrete'ert huet, wor zwar scho matt preisescher Grëndlechkét de Kader vun dém komplize'erte Verwaltongsapparat fir de Rekrutement aukalkule'ert, ennert de beschte Volksa Parteigenossen tëschend Eifel an Hunsreck erausgefëscht a matt alle Schikanen instruwe'ert gin.
translation.en: When the Gauleiter decreed on the first of September 1942 the Prussian military service for the Luxembourger boys, with Prussian thoroughness the framework of that complicated administrative apparatus for the recruitment was calculated, selected among the best party comrades between Eifel and Hunsrück, and equipped with all kinds of harassment.

translation.lb: De' gefe'erlechst brong Blannschlecher lo'gen op enger gëfteger Kopp zesummegekrengelt, de' seit Wâsserbëlleg op dem Do'desapostel Simon sein Zechen ze bîchten, fir en Zock iwer d'Breck an d'Ländchen ze kreichen, a weit vum Krich ower no beim fette Kascht e gemitleche Wénkel an der Sonn z'erwëschen.
translation.en: The most dangerous brown deceivers lay together on a poisonous hill, since Waterbilling to confess their debts to the apostle Simon of Death, to get a trip across the bridge into the country, and far from the war but close to the fat fare to catch a cozy corner in the sun.

translation.lb: Schon déselwechten Dâg go'f et en Donnerwiéder, dat de' Kueblenzer Meteorologen net virausgesin haten: am Minettsbassin hun d'Sirene Feierschicht geblosen, an am E'slek go'f d'Mëllech an de Kulang geschott.
translation.en: Already on that same day, there was a thunderstorm that the Koblenz meteorologists had not foreseen: in the Minett basin, the sirens blew the fire shift, and in the Oesling, the milk was poured into the drain.

translation.lb: hirem Bludd proteste'ert ge'nt d'Schmot, de' dem letzeburger Jonktem ugedoe go'f.
translation.en: Their blood protested against the dirt imposed on the Luxembourg youth.

translation.lb: Hinne virum allem soen ons Jonge merci.
translation.en: Above all, our boys say thank you.

translation.lb: Dem Gauleiter seng Kaderen hun dichteg gewullt a gewuddert.
translation.en: The Gauleiter's cadres rummaged and roared diligently.

translation.lb: Den 18. Oktober sin de' e'scht Borschten op der Hollerecher Gare verpâckt gin.
translation.en: On the 18th of October, the first recruits were packed at the Hollerich station.

translation.lb: Et wor e rénegen Dâg, den Himmel ho'ng deischter iwert der Stâd ower de' brong Blannschlecher lo'ge fett an zefridden an der Sonn vun hirem e'schte Succès.
translation.en: It was a rainy day, the sky hung dark over the city, but the brown deceivers lay fat and satisfied in the sun of their first success.

translation.lb: „Wer streikt wird erschossen!", huet de Gauleiter gebirelt.
translation.en: “Whoever strikes will be shot!”, shouted the Gauleiter.

translation.lb: En huet matt der „Wehrpflicht" och nach den „Ausnahmezustand" an d'„Standgericht" importe'ert e lauter deitsch Reichspatenter.
translation.en: He also imported the "state of emergency" and the "martial law" along with the "conscription", all according to German Reich patents.

translation.lb: Nei Kadere go'wen zesummegeblosen, nei Büroen opgemat, nei Schnoffelhonn lassgelos an nei Hongerlidder am seftege Letzeburger Trach gefiddert.
translation.en: New cadres were assembled, new offices opened, new hounds unleashed, and new hunger songs fed in soft Luxembourg garb.

translation.lb: Do'desurtéler go'we grell un all Kreizwé ausgehâng de' e'scht Salve si vrum Dolîcht lassgângen, an de' e'scht Heide vun eiser aktiver Resistenz hu matt Mé aner Kaderen fongen un ze schaffen, o'ni „Verordnungsblatt", o'ni pompös Büroen, o'ni militäreschen Appui, o'ni preisesch Millio'nen, o'ni Tamtam a Propaganda verbasse, verbuerge, versprét, ower éneg an hirer Décisio'n, de Jongen ze hëllefen.
translation.en: Death announcements were glaringly displayed at every crossroads, the first salvos were fired early, and the first forces of our active resistance began working with other cadres, without "decrees", without pompous offices, without military support, without Prussian millions, without fanfare and propaganda hidden, concealed, spread, yet unwavering in their decision to help the boys.

translation.lb: De Streik wor eriwer ower net vergies.
translation.en: The strike was over but not forgotten.

translation.lb: Am Minettsbassin hun d'Sirenen erem op d' Arbecht geblosen ower an der hémlechster Gro'f ass fir d'Refraktären e
translation.en: In the Minett basin, the sirens blew for work again but for the refractories in the darkest grave there is a

translation.lb: Le Remerciement de nos Jeunes à tous ceux qui les ont aidés pendant les dures années de l'occupation
translation.en: "Thanks to all those who helped our young during the hard years of occupation"

translation.lb: Stellung huelen!
translation.en: Take a stand!

translation.lb: Ro'eg gét de Letzeburger sei Wé.
translation.en: The Luxembourger calmly goes his way.

translation.lb: De Jonktem, aus dem Maquis an aus friemen Arme'en eröm gléeklech an der Hémecht ukom me' oder we'neger grued a gesond stét am de'gleche Kampf öm de'glecht Bro't.
translation.en: The youth, having returned happily from the Maquis and foreign armies to their homeland, stands more or less healthy and upright in the same struggle for the same bread.

translation.lb: Wât ower bc'den, der élerer Generatio'n wie der villgepre'fter Jugend, gemeinsam ass, ass:
translation.en: What, however, is common to both the older generation and the much-praised youth, is:

translation.lb: d'Trauer öm de', de' dem Naziterror engerseits durch K. Z. Ömsiedlung a Front zum Affer gefall sin,
translation.en: the mourning for those who fell victim to the Nazi terror through internment camps and the front,

translation.lb: an op dar Inerer Seit d'Sureg an d'Ongewôsshét öm de', vun dénen bis elô och de' klengst Nôricht félt.
translation.en: and on the other side the worry and uncertainty about those from whom not even the smallest news has been received.

translation.lb: Dat alles gött verschärft durch dén trauregen ömstand, dass zieh zweifelhaft, jo me' wie zweifelhaft Elementer frei doröm lâfen:
translation.en: All this is exacerbated by the sad circumstance that dubious, indeed more than dubious elements, are freely roaming around:

translation.lb: Letzeburger wie Auslännerü We' hiewen se net iwerall eso' lues de Kapp!
translation.en: Luxembourgers as well as foreigners! Where do they not subtly raise their heads everywhere!

translation.lb: Jo muncherorts fillcn sech der wie d'Häre vum Land.
translation.en: Yes, in many places they feel like the masters of the land.

translation.lb: Net genuch, dass der verschidden besonnesch Auslänner hîrer Fréd offen freie Lif geloss hun wie de' verkracht Existenz vun engem Simon seng onhélvoll Wehrmachtsverfügong erlôss huet,
translation.en: It's not enough that some, especially foreigners, openly indulged in their joy as the collapsed existence of a Simon allowed his disastrous Wehrmacht decree,

translation.lb: scheien de'selwecht sech haut schon net me', mat Drohungen opzetrieden ge'nt ons Jongen, de' de Maquis, d'Front asw. kannt hun.
translation.en: the same ones today don’t even hold back from making threats against our boys who knew the Maquis, the Front, etc.

translation.lb: Ech hun an dösem Moment zwé Beispiller aus Dideleng virun Aen:
translation.en: I have at this moment two examples from Dudelange before my eyes:

translation.lb: Sét do jo net c.so' é Borscht, den de Preisen op all Mane'er e le'ft A gemât huet an dém seng Mamm sech am Himmel gegléft huet wann d'Ländchen oder eng énzel letzeburger Famill eröm én Onhél getraff huet,
translation.en: Wasn't there such a rascal who lived it up at the expense of the locals in every way and whose mother felt elated when the country or a single Luxembourgish family met another misfortune,

translation.lb: sét de' jo net zu drei ânerer, de' während 1940-45 hîre Mann gestân hun:
translation.en: didn't he say to three others, who stood their ground during 1940-45:

translation.lb: „Dir kritt der op d'Schnöss, a wann et zeng Joer dauert!"
translation.en: "You'll get smacked in the face, even if it takes ten years!"

translation.lb: Wôr do de ve'erten August zu Dideleng dât „fête d'amitié franco-luxembourgeoise".
translation.en: The 'Franco-Luxembourgish friendship festival' took place on the fourth of August in Dudelange.

translation.lb: Déselwechte „Brudder", dé leider enger vun dénen didelenger Musiken ugehe'ert, sét zu Sengesgleichenchen, wie hien de' drei onzertrennlech Komerôden geseit:
translation.en: The same 'brother', who unfortunately belongs to one of those Dudelange musicians, said to his peers when he saw the three inseparable comrades:

translation.lb: „Dit göt nach Handarbecht!"
translation.en: "This will still be manual work!"

translation.lb: Én hât de' Wieder verlauschtert an direkt matgedélt.
translation.en: Someone had overheard the words and immediately reported them.

translation.lb: Dât si wuel net de' énzeg Fäll!
translation.en: These are probably not the only cases!

translation.lb: Alleruerts he'ert é Kloen, dass de' fre'er korrompe'ert Elementer elo genau eso' frech gin wie sie et zur preisescher Tyranneizeit wôren!!
translation.en: Everywhere one hears complaints that the former corrupt elements are now being just as cheeky as they were during Prussian tyranny!!

translation.lb: Ech froen op dât eso' weider goe soll am Duerf?
translation.en: I ask if this should continue in the village?

translation.lb: Solle mir de Kapp bécken, wo' mir et fönnef Joer hu mâche missen, wo' mir joerlang ôm eist Liewe gebangt hun, se'f et am Maquis gewiescht oder an enger Hémechtsstopp oder am Rén an an der Kélt an am Knascht un der Front, dauernd vum Do'd ömlauert, wärend Onro' a Suerg ons Elteren keng Ro' geloss hun?
translation.en: Should we bow our heads, as we had to do for five years, during which we feared for our lives for years, whether it was in the Maquis or in a homeland shelter or in the rain and cold and in the prison at the front, constantly surrounded by death, while unrest and worry gave our parents no peace?

translation.lb: Solle mir ons dât gefalle misse lôssen, wo' mir eso' lang gezwongen aus der Hémechot fort wôren, wärend eso' traureg Elementer am Dröchenen an a Sôcherhét sûzen, vun der preisescher Gonscht ömfangen?
translation.en: Should we have to put up with this, having been forced away from the homeland for so long, while such sad elements sat in comfort and safety, surrounded by Prussian favor?

translation.lb: Am Num vun al!
translation.en: In the name of all!

translation.lb: Dém a vun all dénen Dausenden vun onse Jongen, Frönn a Komeroden, de frieme Buedem deckt, ruffe mir éstômmeg: „Nén, dât kann net eso' bleiwen, dât duerf net eso' bleiwenü!"
translation.en: Those and all the thousands of our lads, friends, and comrades, covered by foreign soil, we cry out unanimously: "No, it cannot stay like this, it must not stay like this!"

translation.lb: l. r.
translation.en: l. r.

translation.en: GRAND-DUCHY The Gillen's lull at the velodrome in Luxembourg.

translation.lb: De Cortège mat der Jubileumsgesellschaft a mat der Nanzeger Militärmusek.
translation.en: The parade with the anniversary society and the military band of Nancy.

translation.en: Tennis: Geza Wertheim (right) champion of Luxembourg in men's singles and his partner Mr. Possamai.

translation.en: Photos Jacoby Right: The French and Luxembourg Cadets and Seniors teams at the stadium in Luxembourg.

translation.lb: Le’wt a Liewen
translation.en: People and Life

translation.lb: Eren Artikel „Le'wt a Liewen" huct mech de'f ergraff.
translation.en: The article “People and Life” has really gripped me.

translation.lb: Ech hu mech no langem Nodenken endiech mat dém Tro'scht àffont: et ass jo nömmen eng Geschieht.
translation.en: After a long reflection, I finally found solace in the thought: it is only a story.

translation.lb: An dach gin ech engem klengen Zweiwcl net lass.
translation.en: And yet, I cannot get rid of a small doubt.

translation.lb: Et stét eso' einfach awer eso' aus der Se'l eraus do geschriwen, we' wann et Wirklechkét wier.
translation.en: It is written there so simply but also so vividly, as if it were reality.

translation.lb: Mais kint dât me'glech sin?
translation.en: But could that be possible?

translation.lb: Kann e gudd letzeburger Médchen éngem Jong séngem Jong —herzlos ze fille gin, datt hien elo, nom Krich, darf we' démols...., we' hien nach ganz Glidder hat?
translation.en: Can a good Luxembourgish girl make a boy feel heartless, that now, after the war, he has to be as before...., as when he still had all his limbs?

translation.lb: Grad elo verdéngt sei Jong dach nach vill vill me' Le'wt, mat séngem enge Bén muss en dem Médchen dach nach vill me' gro'ss erschéngen, en ass en Held, dé fir seng Hémecht, seng Leit an duerfir och fir sei Médchen sei Glidd geaffert huet.
translation.en: Especially now, his boy deserves much, much more life; with his one leg he must seem even greater to the girl, he is a hero who sacrificed his limb for his homeland, his people, and also for his girl.

translation.lb: Nén, ech kann net gléwen, datt et eso Médercher, d. h. gudd letzeburger Méder cher, we' do ént an dér Geschichtchen beschriwe go'f, gött.
translation.en: No, I cannot believe that there are such girls, that is, good Luxembourgish girls, as described in that little story.

translation.lb: Soss ge'w ech mech bâl schummen, ént zezin.
translation.en: Otherwise, I would almost be ashamed to be one.

translation.lb: Hort
translation.en: Listen

translation.lb: d’Städtesch Tramsschaffner a mir Stodenten!
translation.en: The city's tram conductors and we, students!

translation.lb: REPORTAGE VUM ENGEM STODENT
translation.en: REPORT FROM A STUDENT

translation.lb: STODENTEN AN DEN UNHÄNGER!!
translation.en: STUDENTS IN THE TRAILER!!

translation.lb: D’GINN NATIRLECH VILL FEIN SCHAFFNER’
translation.en: THERE ARE NATURALLY MANY FINE CONDUCTORS

translation.lb: -ME OCH.
translation.en: -ME TOO.

translation.lb: DA RÉCKELT EMÔL AN DE WÔN EKAN!
translation.en: THEN IT MOVES INTO THE CARRIAGE!

translation.lb: ENG DE’ LO’ KURZ GESCHITT ASS!
translation.en: ONE IS NOW SHORT CUT!

translation.lb: Le’wt a Liéwen We' et schéngt huet dës Erziélong, wat keng „Geschieht" ass, sondern eng Tatsâch, an muenchem klengen Hiérz en traurege Schein hannerloss.
translation.en: People and life As it seems, this story, which is not a ‘tale’ but a fact, left a sad impression on many a small heart.

translation.lb: E Bravo trotzdém fir die trei Kanner de' sech gént d'Tatsâch wiéren.
translation.en: A bravo nonetheless for the loyal children who oppose the fact.

translation.lb: Jo léf Joffer H„ leider sinn net all Letzeburger Médercher derselwegter Ménong we' Dir.
translation.en: Yes dear Miss H, unfortunately not all Luxembourgish girls share the same opinion as you.

translation.lb: lér Äntwert op mein Artikel huet bestömmt mengem mutile'erten Komeroden vill Fréd gemâch.
translation.en: Your response to my article surely brought much joy to my mutilated comrade.

translation.lb: lér Äntwert huet bewiesen, dass et och nach echt Letzebuiger Médercher get, de' et wért sinn de Liéwenskomerod vun engem jongen Held ze ginn,
translation.en: Your response has proven that there are still real Luxembourgish girls who are worthy to become the life companions of a young hero,

translation.lb: dén seng gesond Glidder fir seng Hémecht geaffert huet an domadden och fir ons Médercher.
translation.en: who sacrificed his healthy limbs for his homeland and thereby also for our girls.

translation.lb: lér Äntwert ass ferner eng Verurtélung vum betr. Médchen öm dat sech d'Erziélong drént.
translation.en: Furthermore, your response is a condemnation of the concerning girl about whom the story revolves.

translation.lb: Ferner wöll ech bemierken, dass d'Artiklen aus „Ons Jongen" op Tatsâche bero'en.
translation.en: Furthermore, I would like to note that the articles from ‘Ons Jongen’ are based on facts.

translation.lb: Eben durch ons Zeitung wolle mir de Leidd én Ablick ginn an die schwe'er Zeit, de' am Donklen hannerun ons leit.
translation.en: Precisely through our newspaper, we want to give insight into the suffering and the difficult times that lie in the darkness behind us.

translation.lb: J. L.
translation.en: J. L.

translation.lb: Aus onse Sectio’nen De leschte Sonndeg huet d'Ligue „Ons Jongen" d'Sektio'n Rodange hir Liewensretter invite'ert fir hinnen merci ze soen, fir dén dévouement dé si de Refractairen zo'ko'me gelôss hur,.
translation.en: From our sections, last Sunday, the League 'Ons Jongen' invited the Rodange section's rescuers to thank them for their dedication, which they showed to the resistors.

translation.lb: Muerges war eng feierlech Ho'mass fir ail gefâlen a fusile'ert Komeroden.
translation.en: In the morning, there was a solemn church service for all fallen and executed comrades.

translation.lb: No der Mass ass eng Gerbe um Kirfech niddergeluegt gin.
translation.en: After the Mass, a wreath was laid in the cemetery.

translation.lb: D'Chorale Ste. Cécile huet en ergreifend Lidd virgedroen.
translation.en: The choir Ste. Cécile performed a moving song.

translation.lb: Fir d'lescht hun „Ons Jongen" hir Gäscht an de Scho'lsall gefo'ert.
translation.en: Lastly, 'Ons Jongen' brought their guests to the school hall.

translation.lb: De Président Roger Libert huet am Num vun der Sektio'n de' gro'ss Mériten fun de Patrioten erfirgehuewen.
translation.en: The President Roger Libert highlighted the great merits of the patriots on behalf of the section.

translation.lb: an huet fir eng minute stöllt Gedenken gebieden fir de', hirt d'Liewen f''r eso'eng gro'ss Sâch gelôs hun.
translation.en: and called for a minute of silence in remembrance of those who gave their lives for such a great cause.

translation.lb: Duerno hun d'Leit hir Diplomen iwerrécht kritt, an de Burgerméschter Philippart huet als Ofschloss nach eng Ke'er déne Leit ain Num vun der ganzer Gemeng merci gesôt.
translation.en: Afterward, the people received their diplomas, and as a conclusion, Mayor Philippart once again thanked these people on behalf of the entire community.

translation.lb: Froen DE’ ONS ERRÉCHEN...
translation.en: Questions TO REACH US...

translation.lb: „A MIR ÄNTWEREN!
translation.en: "AND WE ANSWER!

translation.lb: Le’wen M. aus dem Nord.
translation.en: Dear M. from the North.

translation.lb: Ech erlabe mer, dir ganz kuurz ze äntwerten.
translation.en: I allow myself to answer you briefly.

translation.lb: Mäng Piaatz ass och aJt bemässt hei an der Zeitung,
translation.en: My place is also well-measured here in the newspaper,

translation.lb: Ech kann awer nach ömmer mamm beste Wollen n#t mat dir d'accord sen wanns du säh's, dir gingts an all Sprohch dinken de' der schreiwe könnt.
translation.en: I still cannot agree with you with the best intentions when you say, you think in every language you can write.

translation.lb: Gef der emol eng Ki'er me' a probi'er et sclwer aus, da geseis de et.
translation.en: Look again once and try it yourself, then you will see.

translation.lb: Lauster emol gudd.
translation.en: Listen carefully.

translation.lb: Wann ech zu mängem Cousin soen: Ech kommen zo' dir.
translation.en: When I say to my cousin: I come to you.

translation.lb: Dann hun ech vun daitsch op letzeburgesch îwersât,, geldu.
translation.en: Then I have translated from German to Luxembourgish, you know.

translation.lb: Wann ech awer par contraire op daitsch soen: Ich komme bei dich,
translation.en: But if, on the contrary, I say in German: I come to you,

translation.lb: dann hun ech daitsch geschriewen, a letzeburgesch geduecht.
translation.en: then I have written in German, but thought in Luxembourgish.

translation.lb: Eso' we' dat ville Lädden, de' hir Pai op daitsch nozêlen, passi'ert, wann se emol eng Ki'er hirem Cousin an d'lslick schreiwen.
translation.en: That is how it happens to many people who count their wages in German, when they occasionally write to their cousin in Luxembourgish.

translation.lb: Et muss en eng Differenz machen teschent letzeburgesch denken, an, emol durch en hasard oder well en de Moment kenet anert Wurt fent, eng daitscht Wurt gebrauchen.
translation.en: One must make a difference between thinking in Luxembourgish and, sometimes by chance or because one finds no other word at the moment, using a German word.

translation.lb: (Ce qu'il fallait démontrer).
translation.en: (Which needed to be demonstrated).

translation.lb: Wanns du awer nach beim letzeburgesch schraiwen, fir d'ischt op daitsch dinks. dann ass dat traureg,
translation.en: But if you still think in German when writing in Luxembourgish, that is sad,

translation.lb: well da mächs du esu gelungen we' et och ass, dat hei.
translation.en: because then you do it as well as it is here.

translation.lb: Du dinks op letzeburgesch, construi'ers dei Satz op daitsch, an iwersetz en erem op' letzeburgesch.
translation.en: You think in Luxembourgish, construct the sentence in German, and then translate it back to Luxembourgish.

translation.lb: Dat r ws du natîrlech net, ma dat ass esu.
translation.en: Of course, you don't naturally do that, but it is like that.

translation.lb: Ech kann der et awer mat naischt besser beweisen, wi wann ech soen, du solls et selwer probi'eren.
translation.en: I can prove it to you no better than by saying you should try it yourself.

translation.lb: Mat all dem aneren wats du schreiws sen ech natîrlech averstanen.
translation.en: With everything else you write, I naturally agree.

translation.lb: Nu geff dich drun, ech lauschteren.
translation.en: Now go ahead, I'm listening.

translation.lb: De Lauschterer
translation.en: The Listener

translation.lb: De’ ons d’Liéwen gerett hun Eso' vill gött haut geschwât a geschriewe vun gro'ssen Léschtongen, se'f et am Sport oder an der Technik.
translation.en: Those who have saved our lives, much good has been spoken and written about great achievements today, be it in sports or in technology.

translation.lb: De Moment sinn mir selwer ganz ageholl dervun, mé no' an no' denke mir nött mé drun.
translation.en: At the moment we are quite absorbed by it ourselves, but little by little we no longer think about it.

translation.lb: Mé eppes vergiésen ons Jongen nie, eppes wat keng Zeit an hire jongen Hiérzer ka verwöschen:
translation.en: But our boys never forget something, something that no time can erase in their young hearts:

translation.lb: all de' gudd Leidd, de' hinnen ennert Liéwensgefohr hiert égent Haus während dér schwärzer, schwe'rer Zeit als Hémecht ungebueden hun.
translation.en: all the good people who offered them their own home as a refuge during the darkest, most difficult time, even under the danger of life.

translation.lb: Nén, nie am mengem Liéwe könnt ech d'Familjen Jos. Sonveau-Nussbaum vu Niederpallen vergiésen, an ech méngen den R. W., J. T., R. M. an d'Joffer M. H. och nött.
translation.en: No, never in my life could I forget the Jos. Sonveau-Nussbaum family from Niederpallen, nor do I think that R. W., J. T., R. M., and Miss M. H. could either.

translation.lb: Wât d'Familje Sonveau fir ons gemâch huet, dat le'sst sech nött an e puer eidle Wiérder beschreiwen.
translation.en: What the Sonveau family did for us cannot be described in a few empty words.

translation.lb: Emoi selwer nött Letzeburger, hun sie trotzdém hiérer zwéter Hémecht vill jongt Mônscheliéwen durch den Krieg erdurch erhalen.
translation.en: Though not Luxembourgers themselves, they nevertheless saved many young lives in their second homeland during the war.

translation.lb: Si wo'sste wat Eltereléd wâr, och si haten durch d'Fclgen vum Krieg é vun hiere Jongen, dén an der beischer Arme' gedéngt hât, verluer.
translation.en: They knew what parental sorrow was, as they had also lost one of their sons, who had served in the troops, due to the consequences of the war.

translation.lb: D'Familje Sonveau huet et verstânen, ons durch die donkel Zeit erdurch ze fe'eren.
translation.en: The Sonveau family knew how to guide us through the dark times.

translation.lb: All Gefohr hunn si ons vergiésse gedo'en.
translation.en: They made us forget all the danger.

translation.lb: Nött nömmen eleng si eso' immens Gro'sses fir ons letzeburger Jonge geléscht, nén och hir Kanner, de' am Land bestuedt wären, hun hiért Liéwen fir ons Jongen an d'Spill gesät.
translation.en: Not only did they themselves achieve something immensely great for our Luxembourgish boys, but their children, who were married in the country, also risked their lives for our boys.

translation.lb: Nött eleng fir hiér Refraktairen hunn si gesuergt, nén am ganzen Ômkrés go'fen ons Jonge vun hinnen proviante'ert.
translation.en: They not only took care of their resisters, but in the entire area our boys were supplied by them.

translation.lb: Alles huet d'Familje Sonveau matt gro'sser Selbstverstândlechkét gemach, oni ze zécken, de preisesche Bluddhonn zum Trotz.
translation.en: The Sonveau family did everything with great self-evidence, without hesitation, despite the Prussian bloodhound.

translation.lb: Merci, chère famille Sonveau, au nom de vos noirs, je vous dis de tout coeur mille fois „Merci".
translation.en: Thank you, dear family Sonveau, on behalf of your black ones, I say to you with all my heart a thousand times "Thank you".

translation.en: How can news be given?

translation.en: In Metz, he was sentenced to death: pardoned to 15 years of imprisonment on 8th June 1944.

translation.en: On 15th June 1944, he was sent to the prison Zweibrücken.
