Sch. vu Kél: Aus der Eifel: R.B.A.J.M.H. léch alléguer soe mer villmols merci fir èr Bre'f, de' der ons iwer d'Enquête No. 2 ageschéckt hutt, mais, we' Dir jo an onser lcschter Nummer könnt gesin, ass se ofgeschloss gin, et dét ons léd, mais mir kenne keng ganz Zeidong voll drécken iwert de'selwecht Fro.
translation.en: OUR MAILBOX A Boy from Schifflange F.: N. Sch. from Kél: From the Eifel: R.B.A.J.M.H. we all say thank you very much for your letter that you sent us regarding Inquiry No. 2, but, as you could see in our last issue, it has been concluded, we are sorry, but we cannot publish an entire newspaper about the same question.

translation.lb: Verle'ert iéwer dofir de Mutt net a schreiwt ons dichteg iwer en anere Problem oder eng aner Enquête.
translation.en: Don't lose heart because of that and write to us diligently about another problem or another inquiry.

translation.lb: D'M. P. vu Miersch: Dir schéckt ons e ganz gro'ssen an détaille'erte Bericht iwer d'Fraternise'eren, veröffentleche konnte mer e leider net, well ère Numm félt.
translation.en: Mr. P. from Mersch: You sent us a very large and detailed report on fraternization, unfortunately we could not publish it because your name is missing.

translation.lb: ENG RÉS OP DE MO’ND. No 1. Ir mer fortgefuer sin, hu mer eng Tâss Atom an eis Rake’t geschott an du lass!
translation.en: A JOURNEY TO THE MOON. No 1. Before we set off, we fired a cup of atom into our rocket and then off we went!

translation.lb: No 2. Op der Möllechstrôss hu mir emol eng kleng Rascht gehalen an de’ gudd Möllech geschmâcht. (Dat war fir d’s’scht, datt ech der gedronk hun).
translation.en: No 2. On the Milky Way, we once took a small rest and tasted the good milk. (That was the first time I drank it).

translation.lb: No 3. Op em Mo’nd kann é Spréng mâchen bis zu 100 Meter. (Awer net wann é grad giéss huet.) (Bekanntlech ass d’Unze’ongskrâft um Mo’nd net so’ gro’ss we’ op der Erd!)
translation.en: No 3. On the moon, one can jump up to 100 meters. (But not if it just rained.) (As is well known, the gravitational pull on the moon is not as strong as on Earth!)

translation.lb: No 4. Ennerwé hate mer de’ ongeheier Chance, de Mann vum Mo’nd ze treffen. Fir d’e’scht war hién e we’neg mësstrauesch, mais we’ mir him eng „Maryland“ go’wen, du go’f e me’ fröndlech, a we’ mir soten mir wäre Letzeburger, du sot hié, sein Ur-Ur-Urgro’sspapp wär och vun do gewiéscht. De Mann am Mo’nd sot, hié wär ere’scht 40 Millio’nen Joer âl.
translation.en: No 4. On the way, we had the incredible chance to meet the Man in the Moon. At first, he was a bit suspicious, but when we gave him a 'Maryland', he became more friendly, and when we said we were Luxembourgers, he said his great-great-great-grandfather was also from there. The Man in the Moon said he was only 40 million years old.

translation.lb: No 5. ’t ass schued, datt mer keng Plâz me’ an onser Rake’t haten, soss hätt ech mer eso’ é le’ft De’erche vum Mo’nd mattbruecht fir dohém op de Canapé.
translation.en: No 5. It is a pity that we had no more space in our rocket; otherwise, I would have brought such a lovely cover from the moon to the couch at home.

translation.lb: — We’ mer erem fortgefuer sin, hate mer Kremp fir d’Welt eremzefannen ënnert dénen anere Planeten!
translation.en: — When we set off again, we had trouble finding Earth again among the other planets!

translation.lb: Matt Fréde stelle mer fest, datt d'Action de Recherches vun der Ligue „Ons Jongen" no onse vermösste Komeroden eso' e gro'sst Interesse an Uklank bei déne verschiddensten Organisationen fonnt huet.
translation.en: With joy, we note that the Action of Searches by the League "Ons Jongen" for our missing comrades has met with great interest and resonance among the various organizations.

translation.lb: Speziell merci soe mir heimatt dem Hochwiiraegen Hür Beschof fir sein Opruff un de Klerus vum Land, so'we' der Eltercnassociatio'n an dem Lehrercorps, de' ons Beme'ongen eso' gro'ssmiddeg ennerstötzen.
translation.en: We especially thank His Excellency Mr. Bishop for his appeal to the clergy of the country, as well as the Parent Association and the teaching corps, who generously support our efforts.

translation.en: On the first week when my wife was on vacation, I cooked my favorite dishes myself.

translation.lb: An elo gm ec han d'Wiertschaft." ~Huet et iéch dohém eso' eleng net me' geschmâcht."
translation.en: And now I have the whole household under control." ~Has it not pleased you to be alone at home?

translation.lb: „Daf net, mais ech hu kc properen Teller me',"
translation.en: "Not really, but I don't have a single clean plate anymore."

translation.lb: De Lauschterer Médercher, eweg vuri de Plâzen Quetschen och!
translation.en: The listening girls, also away with the pruning shears!

translation.lb: Ech mengen, de' Dämmen a Jöfferchen, denen hir Pappen a Männer deck Gehälter an d'Täsch stiechen, sötzen haut me' fest, we' si jé sutzen.
translation.en: I think, the ladies and young women, whose fathers and husbands stuff big salaries in their pockets, sit more firmly today than they ever sat.

translation.lb: Vun Erausgeheien keng Ried, et ass jo net, we' wann si de Budget belâschte gengen.
translation.en: No talk of throwing them out, it's not as if they would burden the budget.

translation.lb: D'Jongen könne jo Klenschen drecken an um Paltong ze'en, dorunner ste'eren de' Leit sech net de' Bo'n.
translation.en: The boys can flatten pennies and play with their suspenders, it does not interest people in the least.

translation.lb: 'Dât nennt én sozial Astellong, Net gcnuch domatt!
translation.en: That is called social attitude, but that's not enough!

translation.lb: Des Dég hât ech an den Annuaire Officiell 1946 gelûsst, a ganz zo~ fällcg hun ech d'Kapitel vun de Gemengeverwaltongen opgcschloen, fir emol ze kucken, wât de' âl Kollegen do ömrappen.
translation.en: These days I leafed through the Official Directory of 1946 and accidentally opened the chapter on municipal administrations to see what the old colleagues were mobilizing there.

translation.lb: Ech hun eng schwe'er mat dem Hummer kritt.
translation.en: I got a heavy blow with the hammer.

translation.lb: Ké vun ail déne Jongen, de' bei der Hâptgemengeverwaltong vum Bassin Minier beschäftegt sin, figure'ert am Atanuaire Officiel, a wann si iwerhâpt ernimmt gin, dann aus Gottes Bârmhierzegkét als ganz bescheiden ~aides-com"îïiis".
translation.en: None of all those boys employed at the central municipal administration of the mining basin are listed in the Official Directory, and if they are mentioned at all, then out of God's mercy as very humble aides-comptables.

translation.lb: De' Jöfferchen ower, de' sech op Gemengekeschten eng schwc'er Dott do zesummcschären, fe'eren am Verein mat hiea Kollegen, de' bei de Preisen embauche'ert go'fen.
translation.en: The young women, however, who accumulate a heavy dowry at municipal expense, celebrate in the club with their colleagues who got hired by the pre-war prices.

translation.lb: den hochtrabenden Titel..Commis" oder „Fonctionnaire", an ech wess net wât nach.
translation.en: the high-sounding title..Commis" or "Functionary", and I don't know what else.

translation.lb: Allem Uschein no gölt bei iech zo' Esch d'Egenschaft vum Commis als „acquise", wann d'Astellong önner dem Naziregime erfollegt ass.
translation.en: Apparently, in Esch, the position of Commis is considered "acquired" if the hiring took place during the Nazi regime.

translation.lb: Dât ass jo eng Opfâssong we' eng aner, an et föndt én sc leider nach op ville Plätzen.
translation.en: That is an opinion like any other, and unfortunately, one still finds it in many places.

translation.lb: An all de' aner, de' d'Gleck net hâten, sech am Krich heihém hanner de wärmen Uewen ze verkrauchen an sech iwer de' Onglecklech (mir können sc och de' Domm nennen), de' déportc'ert, landesverwisen oder op bluddeg Schluechtfelder vcrschléft woren, löschteg ze mächen, bleiwen e'weg de' Gelackmeiert!
translation.en: And all the others, who didn't have the luck to crawl behind the warm ovens here at home during the war and make fun of the unfortunate (we can also call them the stupid), who were deported, exiled, or sent to bloody battlefields, remain eternally the losers!

translation.lb: Schütze A.... huet et bei de Preise scho gehéscht, an si bleiwen et allem Uschein no och nach bei de Letzeburger.
translation.en: Schütze A.... already said it at the prices, and they apparently still remain so with the Luxembourgers.

translation.lb: Ech hun den Annuaire op d'Seit geluccht a mech getre'scht mat dem Gedanken: Viva de' Domin, an Net iergecen, nömme wonneten!
translation.en: I looked at the Directory and consoled myself with the thought: Long live the silly ones, and not chase, just be content!

translation.lb: 40 Millio’nen fir den neie President vun der franze’scher Republik 1876 an der Zeit wo' de franze'scbcn Arbechter 200 bis 300 Frang verdengr, huet den de'2eitege Président, de Maréchal Mac-Mahon 900.000 frang kritt,
translation.en: 40 million for the new President of the French Republic in 1876 at a time when French workers earned 200 to 300 francs, the then President, Marshal Mac-Mahon, received 900,000 francs,

translation.lb: phrs 300.000 Frang „frais de représentation,, also am ganzen 1 Millio'n 200.000 Frang d Joer, de'selwecnt Somme krut de Félix Faurc 1899.
translation.en: plus 300,000 francs 'representation expenses', thus totaling 1 million 200,000 francs a year, the same amount Félix Faure received in 1899.

translation.lb: We' 1920 d'Preisser am Frankreich an d'Lûcht gongen, huet den de'zeitege Président Desehancl 800.000 Frang me' gefrôt de' en och bewöllegt krût.
translation.en: When prices in France rose in 1920, the then President Deschanel demanded and received an additional 800,000 francs.

translation.lb: Dât woren also 2 Millio'nen de' hien sengen Nokommen démols zo'komme gelôss huet.
translation.en: So that was 2 million that he left to his successors at the time.

translation.lb: 1928 ko'm eng nei Crise, wo' de' so'- genannt paie vum Président op 3 Millio'nen 600.000 Frang geklommen ass.
translation.en: In 1928, a new crisis came, where the so-called salary of the President rose to 3 million 600,000 francs.

translation.lb: (1.800.000 Frang Gehalt, 900.000 Frang „frais de représentation" an 900.000 Frang.irais de maison").
translation.en: (1,800,000 francs salary, 900,000 francs 'representation expenses' and 900,000 francs 'household expenses').

translation.lb: 1943 huet de Pétain 9 Millio'nen 300.000 Frang d'Joer kritt, ausserdem hôt en nach eng extra Caisse och „caisse noire" genannt wo' keng offiziell Ennerlâgen firleien.
translation.en: In 1943, Pétain received 9 million 300,000 francs a year, additionally he had an extra fund also called 'black box' where no official documents were available.

translation.lb: De Lukas (Kompositio'n: Pe’ter Faber
translation.en: The Lukas (Composition: Peter Faber

translation.lb: Go'f Kirmes ofgehâlen Eng E'maus, Schuebermöss
translation.en: Held a fair at Emmaus, Schuebermöss

translation.lb: De Lukas duerft net fêlen, Gerufft huet hie gewöss:
translation.en: Lukas must not be missing, he certainly cried:

translation.lb: „Kommt Hérchen, huelt den Hummer, Hât drop dass d'Fatze fle'n,
translation.en: "Come gentlemen, take the hammer, Make sure the scraps fly,

translation.lb: Medaille fir an d'Knäpplach Sin hei bei mir ze kre'n!"
translation.en: Medals for the buttonhole are here to be had from me!"

translation.lb: De Lukas wor nach emmer, Gewinnt vill ze verdron,
translation.en: Lukas was still always, often drinking too much,

translation.lb: Hie stâmt nach aus den Zeiten, Wo' d'Leit net duerfte klon.
translation.en: He originates from the times when people were not allowed to grumble.

translation.lb: Mê haut, wo' d'Welt ganz ânescht, So' kötzlech d'Mönsche sin
translation.en: But today, the world is completely different, people are so peculiar

translation.lb: Haut ass et strèng verbueden Als Lukas sech ze gin.
translation.en: Today it is strictly forbidden to act like Lukas.

translation.lb: Am Schapp duer bei d'âlt Eisen Flo'g hien ên Dâg op d'Seit
translation.en: In the cupboard there by the old iron, he flew one day to the side

translation.lb: A go'f o'ni Erbarmen Vu' Ko'p zu Ko'p geheit.
translation.en: And was thrown without mercy from head to head.

translation.lb: So' ass och d'Mônscheliéwen! Zerschloe we' e Gèck
translation.en: Such is also human life! Smashed like a fool

translation.lb: Fle't ên ewe' de Lukas E Muergen an en Eck.
translation.en: Lukas disappears in a corner one morning.

translation.lb: Wat fir eng De'eren gin um Kapp?
translation.en: What kind of animals are on the head?

translation.lb: Firwat fenkt én d'Kerzen an der Kirch un?
translation.en: Why does one light the candles in the church?

translation.lb: We' gett én engem Perd me' e grosse Wert?
translation.en: Who places more value on a horse?

translation.lb: Zwé Blanner hun e Brudder. Dese Brudder huet keng Bridder. Virwat?
translation.en: Two blind people have a brother. This brother has no brothers. Why?

translation.lb: Well de' zwé Blanner seng Schwestere sin!
translation.en: Because the two blind people are his sisters!

translation.lb: An der Preisenzeit geseit e franz. Be'fchen, dén niewent sengem Papp am Zug setzt, de Koppel vun engem Preis matt der Enschrëft „Gott mit uns".
translation.en: During peacetime, a French boy sitting next to his father on the train sees the cap of a Prussian with the inscription "Gott mit uns".

translation.lb: „Hié frét sei Papp, wat stét do op dem Rim vun dém Zaldot?
translation.en: "He asks his father, what is written on the soldier's brim?

translation.lb: Dat héscht „Gott mit uns" entwert de Preis am Papp senger Plâz.
translation.en: That means "God with us", answers the Prussian instead of his father.

translation.lb: „Abé, sot du de Be'fchen, dass ons égal, gelu Papp, an d'Englänner sin mat ons."
translation.en: "Ah well, said the boy, that's the same for us, look father, the English are with us."

translation.lb: Wat ass Luxembourg?
translation.en: What is Luxembourg?

translation.lb: 1. onst Ländchen,
translation.en: 1. our little country,

translation.lb: 2. de' belsch Provinz „Luxembourg",
translation.en: 2. the Belgian province 'Luxembourg',

translation.lb: 3. de Grôf vu „Luxembourg", Louis XIV, berühmt gin durch franse'sche Marschall ennert dem séng Schluechten, de' e gewonnen huet zo' Fleurus (1690), Steinkerque (1692) a Nerwinde (1693),
translation.en: 3. the Count of 'Luxembourg', Louis XIV, made famous by the French marshal under whom he won the battles at Fleurus (1690), Steinkerque (1692) and Neerwinden (1693),

translation.lb: 4. „Luxembourg" Palais zo' Pareis, ént vun déne sche'nste Gebeier vu Pareis vu 1615 bis 1620 gebaut gin, wo' de' gro'ss Konferenzen an der leschter Zeit gehale si gin.
translation.en: 4. 'Luxembourg' Palace in Paris, one of the most beautiful buildings in Paris built from 1615 to 1620, where the grand conferences have been held in recent times.

translation.lb: D’Wuert Tram oder Tramway? (Aus dem engleschen.)
translation.en: The Word Tram or Tramway? (From the English.)

translation.lb: 1. Tram ass eng platt Schinn...
translation.en: 1. Tram is a flat rail...

translation.lb: A way... ass d'Bunn.
translation.en: A way... is the track.

translation.lb: 2. Tramway... ass eng Bunn de' geluecht ass op enger gewe'nlecher Strôss, a platt... also net we' bei der Eisebunn erausstét.
translation.en: 2. Tramway... is a track laid on an ordinary street, flat... thus not standing out like the railway.

translation.lb: 3. Tramway... get och nach en elektischen oder en Dampzuch genannt.
translation.en: 3. Tramway... is also sometimes called an electric or steam train.

translation.lb: Nach bass du stärk an hârd.
translation.en: Still, you are strong and tough.

translation.lb: nach bass du brutal, an o'ni Erbârmen.
translation.en: Still, you are brutal and without mercy.

translation.lb: Awer et ass deng lescht, verzweifelt Krâft, de's du opdreiws fir eis nach eng ke'er ze kniechten an ze weisen dass du Méschter bass.
translation.en: But it is your last, desperate strength that you exert to subjugate us once more and show that you are master.

translation.lb: Awer mir spieren et, du muss trotzdém geschwen weichen, well deng Krâft ass âl a verbraucht, du be'sen hârden Wanter.
translation.en: But we can feel it, you must nevertheless soon yield, because your strength is old and spent, you harsh winter.

translation.lb: An net weit hannert dir stét dât le'wt jongt Frejo'er a sammelt all seng Energie a Krâft fir dech ze iwerrennen.
translation.en: And not far behind you stands spring, full of life, gathering all its energy and strength to overrun you.

translation.lb: Net me' läng dauert et, an du leis gebrach um Buedem.
translation.en: It will not take much longer and you will lie broken on the ground.

translation.lb: Da könnt de' frösch vergoldt Frejo'erssönnchen mat hirer jonker Krâft a Le'ft, den Himmel vertauscht sein ellent grôt Kléd ge'nt e wonnersche'nt hellblôt,
translation.en: Then comes the fresh golden spring sun with its youthful strength and life, the sky swaps its ugly gray clothes for a wonderful light blue.

translation.lb: all Bém a Gestreich laueren mat me'sam zereckgehâlener Krâft drop fir können auszesche'ssen, ze ble'en an ze liewen.
translation.en: All trees and shrubs lie in wait with restrained strength to be able to sprout, to bloom and to live.

translation.lb: An de Buedem ötemt erlichtert op, wann de' schwe'er Eis- a Schne'- decken vun him erôf ass, a seng jong Sôten erausspiesse können.
translation.en: And the ground breathes a sigh of relief when the heavy layers of ice and snow are gone from it, and its young shoots can sprout forth.

translation.lb: D'Villerchcr kommen nés zereck an erfréen eis Dâg an Nuecht mat hirem onermiddleche Liebesgezwitscher.
translation.en: The birds return again and delight us day and night with their tireless love chirping.

translation.lb: D'Frejo'ersönnchen zaubert an d'jong Hierzer en onroegt Klappen, Wârden, Hoffen a Verlängeren.
translation.en: The springtime sun conjures an uneasy beating, waiting, hoping, and longing in young hearts.

translation.lb: A verzweifelt Hierzer lét se e klengen Hoffnongsstrâhl, dén ömmer me' gro'ss a stärk, an ebémol e fest vertrauende Glaw ass.
translation.en: And in desperate hearts, it allows a small ray of hope, which grows larger and stronger, and suddenly becomes a firm trusting faith.

translation.lb: An an der Friemd kucke verzweifelt, Hemechtskanner net me' eso' onglecklech an tro'schtlos no hém.
translation.en: And in foreign lands, the eyes of desperate, expatriate children are not so miserable and desolate.

translation.lb: Och bei hinne get et Frejo'er, den Himmel get blö, d'Blummen ble'en an d'jong Sonn wiermt hir onro'eg Hierzer a get hinne frösche Mut a Krâft.
translation.en: Spring also comes to them, the sky turns blue, the flowers bloom, and the youthful sun warms their restless hearts and gives them fresh courage and strength.

translation.lb: Sie hoffen dass elo alles besser get an dass sie geschwenn an hir onvergiesslech Hemecht zereckkommen.
translation.en: They hope that now everything will get better and that they will soon return to their unforgettable homeland.

translation.lb: Duerfir le'wt Frejo'er, komm se'er, an hél mat denger Krâft a Le'wt all Wonnen, de' de be'se Wanter geschloen huet.
translation.en: Therefore live, spring, come quickly, and heal with your strength and life all the wounds dealt by the harsh winter.

translation.lb: Komm a wierm ail kâl, verzweifelt Hierzer, a gef hinnen neie Mut a Liewensfréd!
translation.en: Come and warm all cold, desperate hearts, and give them new courage and joy in living!

translation.lb: Ma. We.
translation.en: Ma. We.

translation.lb: De franse ’ sche Scoutissem Fir op den Jam a Frankreich ze goen soll é jiddenfalls wössen, we' de' franse'sch Scouten organise'ert sin:
translation.en: The French scouting for going to the Jam in France should in any case know how the French scouts are organized:

translation.lb: 1940 hun d'Chef vun déne $ Scoutsverbänn, de Scouts de France (kath.).
translation.en: In 1940, the leaders of those scout associations, the Scouts de France (Catholic).

translation.lb: Eclaireurs de France (neutral), Eclaireurs Unionistes (protestant.).
translation.en: Eclaireurs de France (neutral), Eclaireurs Unionistes (Protestant).

translation.lb: Eclaireurs Israélites a vun dénen 2 O-'H •- verbann, de Scouts de France (kath.) an den Eclaireuses de France secii zu Oradou getraff an eng Dachorganisation, ongefe'er we' orts L. B. S. A. enner dem Numm Fédération du Scoutisme Français, gegrönnt.
translation.en: Eclaireurs Israélites and from those two associations, the Scouts de France (Catholic) and the Eclaireuses de France met in Oradou and established an umbrella organization, roughly like our L.B.S.A. under the name Fédération du Scoutisme Français.

translation.lb: Chef-Scout ass de Generol Lafont.
translation.en: The Chief Scout is General Lafont.

translation.lb: D'Fédération du Scoutisme Français ass vum Staat unerkannt a gene'sst e. a. Ofzéchen- an Uniformschutz.
translation.en: The Fédération du Scoutisme Français is recognized by the state and enjoys, among other things, emblem and uniform protection.

translation.lb: Ons Jongen on NOT!
translation.en: Our Boys are NOT!

translation.lb: Si sin tätsächlech an No't, „Ons Jongen", me' we' jé virdrun!
translation.en: They are indeed in need, „Our Boys", more than ever before!

translation.lb: Grâd elo, wo' iwert hirt Lo's débatte'ert get, a wo' hir Stëmm hârt a fest duerch d'Land schäle soll, lâfe se Gefôr, hiren énzege Porte-parole am öffentleche Liewen ze verle'eren, hir Zeidong.
translation.en: Right now, when their fate is being debated and their voice should resound loudly and firmly across the country, they risk losing their only spokesperson in public life, their newspaper.

translation.lb: Drei Joer lâng huet se de Souvenir vun dénen emmer erem lieweg gehâlen, de' weit uechter d'Welt versprét, den Do't fond hun.
translation.en: For three years, it has continuously kept alive the memory of those who, spread across the world, found death.

translation.lb: Drei Joer lâng huet se d'E'er he'chgehal vun dénen, de' o'ni Recht hir Schmot eleng an d'Hémecht bruecht hun.
translation.en: For three years, it has upheld the honor of those who carried their wounds home without justice.

translation.lb: Drei Joer lâng huet s'emmer erem un d'Gewësse vum Land appelle'ert, wann et drëm go'ng, de' Komeroden, de' nach drop laueren, hémzehuelen.
translation.en: For three years, it has persistently appealed to the conscience of the nation when it came to bringing back comrades who are still waiting.

translation.lb: Drei Joer lâng huet s'emmer erem op de Misère vun dénen higewisen, de' moralesch a kierperlech krank an hir Dierfer ko'men.
translation.en: For three years, it has continuously pointed to the misery of those who came morally and physically ill to their villages.

translation.lb: Mir verstin, dass é midd get, drei Joer lâng de'selwecht Kloen ze he'eren, besonnesch an enger Zeit, wo' d'Liewe mächteg weiderdreiwt an emmer erem nei Zweiflen, an anere Misère mat sech dre't.
translation.en: We understand that one gets tired of hearing the same complaints for three years, especially in a time when life powerfully moves forward, constantly bringing new doubts and other miseries.

translation.lb: Ower mir hoffe fest, dass „Ons Jongen" hir Stëmm an der Offentlechkét net verle'eren well an all Stiedchen, an all Dierfchen op mannst e Grapp Hierzer schlon, de' drop hâlen, dass de Souvenir vun eise Gefâlenen, d'E'er vun dénen, de' iwreg blo'wen, an d'helleg Rechter vun dénen, de' hir Glidder verluer hun, net ennert dem Trëtt vun enger egoïstescher Nokrichszeit zerdreckt gin.
translation.en: But we firmly hope that „Our Boys" do not want to lose their voice in the public and that in every small town, in every village, at least a handful of hearts beat, insisting that the memory of our fallen, the honor of those who remained, and the sacred rights of those who lost their limbs are not crushed under the stride of a selfish post-war era.

translation.lb: Mir appele'eren dofir un de' Hierzer, de' hierem Gewëssen, hierer E'er an hierer Mënschlechkét et schëlleg sin, derfir ze suergen, datt d'Stëmm vun de Jongen, vun hi r e Jongen, net am Wand verfle't a vergét, we' e wielecht Blât am Hierscht.
translation.en: We therefore appeal to the hearts, which owe it to their conscience, their honor, and their humanity, to ensure that the voice of the boys, of their boys, does not get lost and forgotten in the wind, like a withered leaf in autumn.

translation.lb: Mir hun oft am Krich mat engem bluddege Grapp no enger drechener Kuescht gebiedelt, mir hun oft mat enger raschteger Konservebéx no Wässer gegruewen mir gesin et guer net als One'er un, haut virun d'Leidd aus eise Stied an Dierfer ze frieden an em hir Hëllef ze biedelen.
translation.en: We often begged with a bloody fist during the war for a dry crust, we often dug with a rusty can for water, we do not see it as degrading at all today to ask for the help of the people from our towns and villages.

translation.lb: Mir fénken haut eng Souscriptio'nslëscht un, an der Hoffnong, op de' Mane'er e stabile Fong fir ons Zeidong ze schâfen, de' op ké Fall aus onsem öffentleche Liewe verschwannen därf well se helleg Rechter ze vertrieden an helleg Pflichten ze erföllen huet!
translation.en: Today we start a subscription list, in the hope of creating a stable fund for our newspaper, which under no circumstances may disappear from our public life because it has sacred rights to represent and sacred duties to fulfill!

translation.lb: d'Redaktio'n.
translation.en: The Editorial.

translation.lb: Eng Delegatio’n vun der Ligue gét op Nanzeg
translation.en: A delegation from the League goes to Nancy.

translation.lb: Op eng Invitation vun de Refractairen a Maquisarden vun Nanzeg huet eng Délégation vun der Ligue „Ons Jongen" un de Festivite'ten vun der „Libération de la Ville de Nancy" délgeholl.
translation.en: Upon an invitation from the Resisters and Maquisards of Nancy, a delegation from the League 'Our Boys' participated in the festivities of the 'Liberation of the City of Nancy'.

translation.lb: No der Asénung vun engem neie Fuendel von den F.F.I. huet d'Délégatio'n vun der Ligue e sche'ne Kranz niddergeluegt beim Kanal zu Nanzeg, wo' zwé Maquisarden bei der Libératio'n erschoss go'fen.
translation.en: After the raising of a new flag by the F.F.I., the delegation from the League laid a beautiful wreath by the canal in Nancy, where two Maquisards were shot during the liberation.

translation.lb: Nomëttes ass d'Délégatio'n an de' Bescher gefe'ert gin, wo' d'Refractairen de' Zeit am Maquis woren, enner anerem bei e Bauerenhaff, wo' 57 hierer Komeroden vun allen Nationalite'ten op engem Ko'p zesummegestallt a vun de Preisen mattenén exécute'ert go'fen.
translation.en: In the afternoon, the delegation was brought to the forests where the resisters were in the Maquis, including a farm where 57 of their comrades of all nationalities were gathered together and executed by the Germans.

translation.lb: De'f ergraff an an e'weger Dankbarkét stong d'Délégatio'n vun onse letzeburger Jongen fir un enger vun déne Plätzen, de' sech leider héfeg a ganz Europa virfannen.
translation.en: Deeply moved and in eternal gratitude, the delegation of our Luxembourgish boys stood at one of those places, which sadly are found often throughout Europe.

translation.lb: D'Délégatio'n vun ~ons Jongen" huet den Dag drop Nanzeg verlôss, matt de Gefiller, datt Frankreich, we' démols am Krich, och nach haut eng zwét Hémecht fir muncher Letzeburger Jong ass.
translation.en: The delegation of 'our boys' left Nancy the next day, with the feeling that France, as during the war, is still today a second home for many a Luxembourgish boy.

translation.lb: -À » m Num vum Central Comité soe mir alle Jongen a Leiden, dé beigedroen hun, drëtt Journée Ons Jongen zu engem vollen Erfolleg ze brengen, e gro'sse Merci.
translation.en: In the name of the Central Committee we offer a big thanks to all the young men and Leiden who contributed to make the third 'Our Boys Day' a full success.

translation.lb: Onse Prince Jean, dén den Haut Patronage von der Journée iverholl hât an d'Stâdt Letzeburg, di ons hir Auspicen gin hât, remercie'ere mir villmols an drecken d'Hoffnong aus, datt hir Sympathien fir Ons Jongen all Joer op desen Dag zum Ausdrock kommen.
translation.en: Our Prince Jean, who had taken the high patronage of the day and the city of Luxembourg, which gave us its auspices, we thank greatly and express the hope that their sympathies for 'Our Boys' will be expressed every year on this day.

translation.lb: E spezielle Merci un d'Servicen vun der Gemeng an un d'Administratio'nen an d'Museken, de' ons hir voll Hëllef zokomme geloss hun.
translation.en: A special thanks to the municipal services, administrations, and bands, which provided us with their full help.

translation.lb: Mir vergiéssen och net all eise Sectio'nen, de' trotz déne gre'sste materielle Schwieregkéten aus den entléensten Uertschaften vum Land erbeikomm woren, fir d'Undenken vun hire gefalene Kameroden ze e'eren.
translation.en: We also do not forget all our sections, which despite the greatest material difficulties came from the remotest villages of the country to honor the memory of their fallen comrades.

translation.lb: Den Organisatio'ncomité vun der 111. Journée Ons Jongen.
translation.en: The Organizing Committee of the 111th 'Our Boys Day.'

translation.lb: Mei lèschte Wonsch
translation.en: My last wish

translation.lb: A gin ech da begruewen, duer wo' meng Eltre lein, sollt dir net läng mech luewen mir gro'sseg Riéde weihn.
translation.en: And if I am buried there where my parents lie, you should not praise me long with grand speeches dedicated to me.

translation.lb: VVe' ro'eg ech heinidden als Mönsch geliéwt, geschâft, so' wöll ech och mei Fridden lim Kirfecht an dem Graft.
translation.en: Because I lived and worked quietly as a man here, so I also want my peace in the cemetery and the grave.

translation.lb: Vu klengen Dimensio'nen, so' wünschen ech mei Stên,
translation.en: Of small dimensions, that's how I want my stone,

translation.lb: keng Piérlekiiinz, keng Kro'nen keng Blummen, Palmen, nèn.
translation.en: no pearl wreaths, no crowns, no flowers, palms, no.

translation.lb: Keng Musek a keng Lidder, un d'Lued keng sölwer Réng;
translation.en: No music and no songs, at the funeral no silver rings;

translation.lb: op d'Grâf lêt mir blo'ss nidder e Kranz vu Wantergreng!
translation.en: just lay a wreath of winter greenery on the grave for me!

translation.lb: Leo Berchcm
translation.en: Leo Berchem

translation.lb: Kröschtnuecht 1943
translation.en: Christmas Night 1943

translation.lb: Zenter enger Woch leit de' siwent Panzerdivisio'n viru Shitomir.
translation.en: For a week, the seventh tank division has been positioned before Shitomir.

translation.lb: d'Russen haten d'Stat besät, d'Preisen hun se zrekerstirmt.
translation.en: The Russians had occupied the city, the Prussians retook it.

translation.lb: Kè Stèn ass op dém ane: bliwen.
translation.en: No stone remains on another one.

translation.lb: An de Ruinen laueren Zaldoten vun der Panzerdivisio'n, berèt de nächsten Ugröff ofzewéren.
translation.en: In the ruins, soldiers of the tank division lurk, ready to repel the next attack.

translation.lb: Ech si grad vun engem Spähtrupp eremkom, mir hu kè Feind gesin, dat bero'egt d'Gemitt.
translation.en: I have just returned from a patrol, we saw no enemy, which calms the mind.

translation.lb: Ech ze'e mech an de Bunker zreck mat dem Komerod, dé mat mir op Poste stong.
translation.en: I retreat into the bunker with the comrade who stood watch with me.

translation.lb: Dobaussen stirmt de Wand onhémlech schaureg a pikt we' mat Nolen.
translation.en: Outside, the wind rages eerily and stings like needles.

translation.lb: Mei Komerod, e Lothrenger, a Musspreiss we' ech, ze't e Bre'f aus der Täsch o, we' oft schon huet hien de' Wirder gelies an all Ke'er sin d'Tre'nen him d'Baken erafgelaf mè haut kann en sech guer net zwangen a mat engem Bleck voll de'fstem Mattgefill flüstert hien: Mon cher copain, c'est aujourd'hui la Nuit Sainte Noël an hien erzielt vu senger jonker Fra, de' dohèm un hien denkt, de' voller Hoffnung ass a mat bluddegem Hierz op hien wart, de' et net me' aushält vu Verlangeren an e liest am Bre'f... l'année prochaine nous fêterons Noël ensemble... dans la patrie... e we'middegt Lachen spillt em sei Mond... et toi mon ami, n'as-tu pas de souvenirs?
translation.en: My comrade, a man from Lorraine, and a despised speaker like me, takes a letter out of his pocket, as he has often read the words and each time tears have streamed down his cheeks but today he cannot hold back at all and with a look full of deepest emotion he whispers: My dear buddy, today is Holy Christmas Night and he speaks of his young wife, who thinks of him back home, who is full of hope and with a bleeding heart waits for him, who can no longer bear her longing and reads in the letter... next year we will celebrate Christmas together... in the homeland... a weary smile plays on his lips... and you my friend, have you no memories?

translation.lb: Du kann ech mech net me' halen, meng Gefiller bréchen sech Bun a meng Wirder zerreissen am Wand, dén stirmt an hault.
translation.en: Then I can no longer hold myself back, my feelings break free and my words are torn apart by the wind, which howls and storms.

translation.lb: Dohèm am Lichterglanz vum Krôschtbémchen bied eng Mamm fir hire Jong, dén a Russland verschloen.
translation.en: At home in the light of the Christmas tree, a mother prays for her son, lost in Russia.

translation.lb: Dohèm wart eng Mamm op dén Dag, dén hir Erle'song brengt vu Lèd a Suerg.
translation.en: At home a mother waits for the day that brings her salvation from sorrow and worry.

translation.lb: Wien zielt de' Tre'nen de' hir Baken durchfurcht, wien zielt de' schmierzvoll Nuechten, de' sie o'ni Schlof zo'bruecht...?
translation.en: Who counts the tears that furrow her cheeks, who counts the painful nights she spent without sleep...?

translation.lb: Am Bunker vu Shitomir drecke mir eis d'Hand, schwiere mir trei zesummen ze stoen a Gefor a No't...
translation.en: In the bunker of Shitomir we shake hands, swear to stand loyally together in danger and need...

translation.lb: et l'année prochaine nous fêterons Noël ensemble...
translation.en: and next year we will celebrate Christmas together...

translation.lb: Mir picken eng Kerz an de kale Buedem an decken de Schein mat eise verkrasche Gesichter.
translation.en: We stick a candle into the cold ground and cover its glow with our cracked faces.

translation.lb: Lues sänge mir Minuit Chrétiens... an d'Licht mecht eis warm a gött eis Fridd matzen an der Schluecht.
translation.en: Slowly we sing 'Minuit Chrétiens'... and the light makes us warm and gives us peace in the midst of battle.

translation.lb: De Wand summt eng Melodie vun Hèmwe' an d'Schne'flacken pesperen sölwereg dran...
translation.en: The wind hums a melody of homesickness and the snowflakes whisper silvery within...

translation.lb: Do wat ass lass Granate platzen, Kano'nen donneren eng Stömm jeizt an de Bunker: Mensch raus, nach vorne, Iwan greift an!
translation.en: Then suddenly grenades explode, cannons thunder and a voice screams in the bunker: Men out, forward, Ivan attacks!

translation.lb: Zesummegeduckt sti mir zwe'n am fischte Gruew.
translation.en: Stooped together we stand in the wet trench.

translation.lb: Dohèm bestirmt eng Mamm den Herrgott mat hirem Gebied an hrj stirmt de Jong, hire Jong, op Liewen an Do'd, dohèm de Fridd am Lichterglanz vum Kröschtbam an hei grinst den Do'd, mir spire sei kalen Hauch.
translation.en: At home, a mother beseeches God with her prayers and here her son storms, her son, between life and death, at home peace in the light of the Christmas tree and here death grins, we feel his cold breath.

translation.lb: D'Granaten kommen me' no, d'Panzerketten Schlaufen durcn de Sehne', de Sturem hault eng Do'demelodie.
translation.en: The grenades come closer, the tank tracks churn through the snow, the storm howls a death melody.

translation.lb: Kröschtdag am Hexekessel vu Shitomir et l'année prochaine nous....
translation.en: Christmas day in the cauldron of Shitomir and next year we....

translation.lb: E firchterleche Knall, d'MG zersplittert an dausend Stecker, ech greife no Arm a Bèn, de' voller Wonne sin, am Gruew haucht mei Komerod sei jonkt Liewen aus..
translation.en: A terrible bang, the MG shatters into a thousand pieces, I reach for arms and legs, which are full of wounds, in the trench my comrade breathes out his young life....

translation.lb: sei jonkt Liewen an der hellger Nuecht...
translation.en: his young life on the holy night...

translation.lb: dohèm wart seng Fra, de' voller Hoffnong ass...
translation.en: at home his wife waits, full of hope...

translation.lb: O, Herrgott ste' hir bei, der jonker Mamm, de' vergiewens wart, am Schützegruew bei Shitomir huet hien sei Liewe geloss an der Kröschtnuecht 1943...
translation.en: O Lord, stand by her, the young mother, who waits in vain, in the trench at Shitomir he lost his life on Christmas night 1943...

translation.lb: et l'année prochaine tu fêteras Noël dans la paix éternelle...
translation.en: and next year you will celebrate Christmas in eternal peace...

translation.lb: Aus der Ligue Hütt Dir èr Cotisatio'n scho bezuelt?
translation.en: From the League, have you already paid your contribution?

translation.lb: D'Cotisatio'n fir 1948 ass 30 Frang
translation.en: The contribution for 1948 is 30 francs.

translation.lb: De* Sectio'nen de' hir Cotisatio'nen nach net agezun hun, sollen se am Laf vum Mo'nt Abrel anze'en.
translation.en: The sections that have not yet collected their contributions should do so during the month of April.

translation.lb: We' ass deng nci Adresse?
translation.en: What is your new address?

translation.lb: All Jong, dén sei Wunnuert am Laf vun 1946-1947 gewiesselt huet, soll dem Central-Comité 9, avenue de la Porte-Neuve zu Letzeburg seng nei Adresse matdélen (Postkârt gét duer) so'datt hien un de' betreffend Sectio'n iwerwise ka gin.
translation.en: Any boy who changed his residence during 1946-1947 should inform the Central Committee at 9, Avenue de la Porte-Neuve in Luxembourg of his new address (a postcard is sufficient) so that he can be transferred to the relevant section.

translation.lb: All de' Jongen, de' u kenger Sectio'n ugeschloss sin, sollen de Beitrag vun 30 Frang un d'Sectio'n Letzeburg C. C. P. 21 171 abezuelen
translation.en: All the boys not affiliated with any section should pay the contribution of 30 francs to the Luxembourg section C. C. P. 21 171.

translation.lb: Helft uns sie suchen!
translation.en: Help us find them!

translation.lb: Anbei veröffentlichen wir weitere 2 Seiten unserer in die Wehrmacht gezwungenen Luxemburger, von denen wir bis heute ohne Nachricht sind.
translation.en: Attached we publish another 2 pages of our Luxembourg citizens forced into the Wehrmacht, from whom we have not heard until today.

translation.lb: Alle 14 Tage liegt in unserer Zeitschrift eine zweiseitige Beilage.
translation.en: Every 14 days, a two-page supplement is included in our magazine.

translation.lb: Dieselbe soll «ONS JONGEN» sowie allen früheren Wehrmachtsangehörigen ermöglichen unter diesen Bildern ein bekanntes Gesicht zu erkennen.
translation.en: This should allow «ONS JONGEN» and all former Wehrmacht members to recognize a familiar face among these pictures.

translation.lb: Etwaige Nachrichten über dieselben sollen sofort an das Commissariat au Rapatriement in Luxemburg weitergegeben werden.
translation.en: Any information about them should be immediately forwarded to the Commissariat au Rapatriement in Luxembourg.

translation.lb: Unter jedem Bilde ist der Name, Vorname, Geburtsort, Geburtsdatum und Wohnort zu lesen.
translation.en: Under each picture, the name, first name, place of birth, date of birth, and place of residence can be read.
